20107579|The bopyrid, Probopyrus pandalicola, infects grass shrimp, Palaemonetes pugio, and negatively affects shrimp respiration and metabolic activity, prevents reproductive output, and reduces shrimp activity. Our objective was to determine whether grass shrimp maintained tidal rhythmicity in the laboratory and whether the bopyrid parasite affected tide-related grass shrimp activity levels. Five bopyrid-parasitized and five unparasitized shrimp were selected, and examined for sex, length, and for number of trematode cysts (to exclude any effect of that parasite). The shrimp were randomly placed in individual static aquaria with sand substrate and filtered seawater, and tanks were separated by opaque dividers. Shrimp were maintained on an ambient photoperiod (14.5-h day) and observed for activity every three hours (corresponding with high, ebb, low, and flood water) for two tidal cycles. Tidal stage had a significant effect on shrimp activity with the maximum number of shrimp (71%) resting at flood and the minimum (16%) at ebb (n = 10 trials). There was a significant effect of light and tide-light interaction on shrimp activity with the greatest activity at night, particularly during nighttime-ebb. Because shrimp were most active during ebb, they may be more susceptible to predation by visual predators in the water column at that time. Bopyrid infection did not significantly influence shrimp activity, and thus was not the primary factor affecting shrimp activity in the first 30 h after collection. /// Le bopyre Probopyrus pandalicola infecte les crevettes Palaemonetes pugio; il agit ngativement sur la respiration et l'activit mtabolique des crevettes, ainsi que sur la capacit reproductrice et rduit leur activit. Notre objectif tait de dterminer si les crevettes maintenaient ou non au laboratoire, les rythmes lis  la mare et si le parasite bopyre affectait les niveaux d'activit des crevettes, lis  la mare. Cinq crevettes parasites avec le bopyre et cinq non parasites ont t choisies et examines pour dterminer leur sexe, leur longueur et le nombre de cystes de trmatodes (afin d'viter quelque effect de ce parasite). Chaque crevette a t place au hasard dans un aquarium individuel, avec un substrat de sable et de l'eau de mer filtre, et ces rcipients taient isols les un des autres par des cloisons opaques. Les crevettes ont t maintenues  la photopriode ambiante (14,5 heures par jour) et leur comportement observ toutes les trois heures (correspondant aux eaux hautes, descendantes, basses et montantes) sur deux cycles de mare. L'tat de la mare avait une influence significative sur l'activit des crevettes avec un nombre maximum de crevettes (71%) se reposant au flux et un minimum (16%) au jusant (n = 10 essais). Un effet significatif a t not de l'action de la lumire et de l'interaction lumire-mare sur l'activit des crevettes, la plus grande activit se situant la nuit, particulirement durant le jusant nocturne. Du fait que les crevettes taient plus actives pendant le jusant, il se pourrait qu'elles soient plus susceptibles de servir de proie pour des prdateurs visuels dans la colonne d'eau  ce moment l. L'infection par les bopyres ne semble pas influencer significativement l'activit des crevettes et donc n'est pas le facteur le plus important agissant sur leur activit dans les 30 heures suivant leur collecte.

23065217|Some aspects of the reproductive biology of females of the deep-water pink shrimp, Parapenaeus longirostris (Lucas, 1846) from the Montenegrin shelf (southern Adriatic Sea) were investigated. Sampling was performed on a monthly basis from November 2006 to October 2007. A total of 13 trawl hauls covered a depth range of 40 to 250 m. An estimate of the gonadosomatic index (GSI) showed permanent reproductive activity all year round with two maxima, one in late spring and the other in autumn. The minimum reproductive activity occurred in June. Females outnumbered males in shallow waters, while at greater depths (> 100 m) the proportion of the sexes was almost equal; the overall sex ratio was 0.7 females: males. The size at which 50% of the female population reached maturity was at a carapace length (CL) of 21.9 mm, and the smallest mature female in the samples had a carapace length of 16 mm. Quelques aspects de la biologie de la reproduction des femelles de la crevette rose profonde Parapenaeus longirostris (Lucas, 1846) provenant du plateau Montngrin (sud de la mer Adriatique) ont t examins. L'chantillonnage a t effectu mensuellement de novembre 2006  octobre 2007, avec un total de 13 traits de chalut couvrant une profondeur de 40 m  250 m. Une estimation de l'index gonadosomatique (GSI) a montr une activit de reproduction permanente toute l'anne avec deux maxima, un en fin de printemps et l'autre en automne. L'activit reproductrice minimale est en juin. Les femelles taient plus nombreuses que les males dans les eaux peu profondes, tandis que  de plus grandes profondeurs (> 100 m) la proportion des deux sexes tait presque gale: le sex ratio moyen a t de 0.7 femelles: mles. La taille pour laquelle 50% de la population femelle a atteint la maturit a t de 21,9 mm de longueur de la carapace (CL) et la plus petite femelle mture des chantillons avait 16 mm de longueur de la carapace.

20107674|The role of median intersomitic ridges during rapid swimming of calanoid copepods was examined with both morphological and theoretical techniques. The ridge between the maxillipeds and first pereiopods of 9 examined species was, with one exception (Metridia lucens Boeck, 1864), sufficiently large to allow roll stabilization when the copepods were moving at 100 body lengths per second. With much slower movement (10 body lengths per second), the major ridge in only two species (Euchaeta elongata Esterly, 1913 and Neocalanus cristatus (Kryer, 1848)) was large enough to produce roll stabilization. Although all of the ridges have several functions, we postulate that during rapid swimming, the large ridge helps to maintain orientation and enables a more coherent response whether in escape or prey capture. /// Le rle de la crte mdiane intersomite au cours de la nage rapide des coppodes calanodes a t examin  l'aide de techniques  la fois morphologiques et thoriques. La zone entre les maxillipdes et la premire paire de pattes des neuf espces examines est,  une exception prs (Metridia lucens Boeck, 1864), de taille suffisante pour permettre la stabilisation du roulis quand les coppodes se dplacent  la vitesse de 100 longueurs de corps par seconde. Lors d'un mouvement beaucoup plus lent (10 longueurs de corps par seconde), seulement deux espces (Euchaeta elongata Esterly, 1913 et Neocalanus cristatus (Kryer, 1848)) prsentent une telle zone de taille suffisante pour permettre la stabilisation. Bien que ces crtes aient plusieurs fonctions, nous suggrons que, au cours de la nage rapide, une crte de grande taille aide au maintien de l'orientation et permet une rponse plus efficace pour l'chappement ou la capture d'une proie.

An zwei Tieren, die veranlat wurden, eine Schneckenschale mit Beobachtungslchern anzunehmen, konnte festgestellt werden, da die Laute bei raschem Vor- und Zurckbewegen des Pleons durch Reibung der Uropoden an der Innenseite der Schale hervorgebracht werden. 20105045|The catch rate of legal-sized (85 mm carapace length and above) and sub-legal lobsters caught in traps was recorded for a single vessel over all its fishing grounds for seven years. From growth data the size distribution of the catch was used to estimate catch rates of pre-recruits and recruits to the fishery each year. Pre-recruit catch rates in the main summer fishery showed a general downward trend with time, until 1992 when the catch rate was the highest for four years. For recruits, catch rates in the summer fishery also showed a downward trend with time for males, but the trend was less obvious for females. Catch rates of recruits in the summer fishery are correlated with catch rates of pre-recruits in the fishery in the previous year, although there was some indication that the relationship was weak in the area where the highest catch rate of pre-recruits occurred and in the more offshore grounds. We conclude that there is scope for using pre-recruit catch rates in the summer fishery as an index of recruitment to the fishery 12 months later. /// Le taux de prise des homards de taille lgale (85 mm de longueur de carapace et plus) et sub-lgale, capturs dans des piges, a t tabli pour un seul bateau sur l'ensemble des fonds de pche pendant sept ans. Pour chaque anne, la distribution de taille de la prise a t utilise afin d'estimer les taux de prises des pr-recrues et recrues pour la pche  partir des donnes sur la croissance. Les taux de prises de pr-recrues au cours de la principale pche d't ont montr une tendance gnrale  la baisse avec le temps, jusqu'en 1992 o le taux de prise a t le plus lev sur 4 ans. Les taux de prises des recrues au cours de la pche d't ont montr galement une tendance  la baisse chez les mles, mais cette tendance tait moins nette chez les femelles. Les taux de prises des recrues au cours de la pche d't sont en corrlation avec les taux de prises des pr-recrues de l'anne prcdente sur la pcherie, bien qu'il y ait quelques indications que la relation tait faible dans la rgion o le taux de prise des pr-recrues tait le plus lev et sur les sites de pche situs le plus au large. Nous concluons qu'il est possible d'utiliser les taux de prises des pr-recrues au cours des pches d't comme indices de recrutement pour la pche de l'anne suivante.

20103372|Changes in the abundance and composition of crustacean populations in the plankton of the Severn Estuary (England) were followed for 25 consecutive months (1973-1975). The collections were made primarily near shore from the cooling intake of the Oldbury nuclear power station. Neomysis integer overwintered at comparatively low densities with all specimens measuring more than 5 mm in length. Inshore swarms of this species were detected early in the summer and most females carried either eggs or embryos. Praunus flexuosus invariably occurred less frequently than N. integer. During the summer, inshore aggregations of adults were probably formed and, although large numbers of berried females were observed at this time, the release of young possibly never occurred in the Oldbury region. Eurytemora affinis was observed only during periods of low salinity in winter with maximum reproductive activity taking place in December. The highest density of Eurydice pulchra occurred early in the summer due to the recruitment of young while, at other times, this species remained comparatively rare. The same pattern was observed in Gammarus salinus but since only a few females carried eggs at any one time reproduction must take place outside of the study area. Crangon crangon maintained greatest numbers during the summer and fall, being almost absent during part of the winter. The growth rate, size at maturity and period of reproductive activity of this species differed from earlier accounts on Severn populations.

Diogenidae) sont analyss par Spectrophotomtrie d'Absorption Atomique. Il n'xiste pas de diffrences sexuelles entre les taux de ces mtaux. L'hpatopancras prsente la concentration la plus leve de cuivre, suivi des branchies, des tissus nerveux et finalement du cur. La concentration de Zn est semblable dans l'hpatopancras et les branchies, mais plus basse dans les tissus nerveux et le cur. Les taux de zinc et de cuivre dans les branchies et l'hpatopancras prsentent une corrlation positive. Le taux de cuivre dans l'hpatopancras et le taux de zinc dans les branchies semblent en corrlation ngative avec le poids du corps. Les concentrations en zinc et en cuivre sont en corrlation ngative avec le poids sec des branchies. Dans l'hpatopancras le cuivre est en corrlation ngative avec le poids sec.

20105579|The aim of the present study was to contribute to the knowledge of the poorly studied peracaridan community in the Ria Formosa system. The Ria Formosa is the most important wet region at the southern coast of Portugal. Benthic macrofauna samples and some environmental parameters were collected fortnightly at three sampling sites, from November 1990 to December 1991, in the intertidal zone. At each site, samples were taken during low tide, at five equidistant levels between high and low water. Results of numerical analysis indicated that distinct peracaridan groupings were associated with different sites and levels. Cluster and ordination analysis of the three sites indicated similarities among the highest level samples. The lowest level samples revealed greater dissimilarity. Furthermore, the temporal and spatial distribution of the most abundant peracaridan species indicated the existence of biological relationships between these and their relationship to environmental factors. Thus, Cyathura carinata dominated the upper areas with the more stable food sources, related to finer sediments, all year around. During spring and summer the tanaid Apseudes latreillii was the dominant species, reaching high densities in the lower areas. /// O principal objectivo da presente investigao foi contribuir para o conhecimento da comunidade de peracardeos no sistema lagunar da Ria Formosa. A Ria Formosa  a zona hmida mais importante no Sul de Portugal. Neste sistema foi estabelecida uma estratgia de amostragem quinzenal em trs locais distintos da zona entre mars, de Novembro de 1990 a 1991. Em cada local, as amostras de bentos e de alguns parmetros ambientais foram recolhidas durante a baixa-mar, em cinco nveis equidistantes entre si. O resultado das anlises numricas efectuadas indicou que diferentes grupos de peracardeos se encontram associados em diferentes locais e nveis de amostragem. Os resultados da aplicao de tcnicas de anlise multivariada revelaram semelhanas entre os nveis A e alguma diferenciao entre os nveis E dos trs locais. A distribuio espacio temporal dos peracardeos mais abundantes indicou a existncia de relaes biolgicas entre as espcies e com alguns factores ambientais. Assim, o ispode Cyathura carinata dominou as zonas prximas do supralitoral, o que parece relacionado com os sedimentos mais finos e a disponibilidade de alimento. Durante a primavera e o vero o tanaidaceo Apseudes latreillii foi a espcie dominante, atingindo os valores mais elevados de densidade no limite superior do infralitoral.
20103842|Five species of Porcellanidae from the Caribbean Sea have been found to establish commensal relationships with other animals. In four of the described cases, comparable relationships were found to exist also in the Eastern Pacific. Therefore the origins of the discussed commensalisms are assumed to date prior to the final formation of the Central American land-bridge. In all cases the host provides protection to the commensal crab. In the species Minyocerus angustus (Dana), Polyonyx gibbesi Haig, and Porcellana sayana (Leach) the host serves as an auxiliary substrate which enables the porcellanid crab to colonize soft bottom habitats, normally not suitable for porcellanids. This interpretation is supported by P. sayana whose different hosts are not characterized by systematic relationship but by having the same habitat and by the requirements of the commensal as to the external structure and the habits of the host. The present observations show, that species which are found to live as obligate commensals in a definite geographical region, may be free-living elsewhere under different ecological conditions. As regulating factors, competition and predation are considered.
20696252|An experiment to induce maturation and spawning of Portunus trituberculatus by manipulating seawater temperature, photoperiod, and eyestalk ablation, and to study the effect these factors have on the variation of nucleic acid content in gonadal tissue, was conducted. Non-incubating adult females were divided among three temperature treatments (natural, 10C, and 20C) and two photoperiod treatments (15 h and 9 h daylight periods per day, respectively). Within each temperature-photoperiod combination, subjects were further divided into each of two groups, i.e., unilaterally eyestalk ablated and unablated. The gonadosomatic index, spawning rate, and nucleic acid variation were examined for each treatment at 3-week intervals. Holding ablated females at 20C and providing 15 h of light photoperiod had the most profound effect on the induction of ovarian maturation and spawning. Gonad maturation also occurred in the unablated, 20C, 15 h light group, although to a lower extent. Gonad maturation did not take place for groups exposed to lower temperatures, despite either ablation or photoperiod treatments. RNA to DNA ratios were strongly correlated to the state of gonad maturation, with the highest values obtained for the ablated groups held at temperatures under 20C for the 15 h light photoperiod. Under these conditions, increasing DNA concentration, reflecting gonad differentiation (small cell size and a large number of cells per unit of tissue), began three weeks earlier than for the other treatments. These results suggest that P. trituberculatus requires not only a raised temperature but also another stimulus, such as eyestalk ablation or a long photoperiod, to induce off-season maturation and spawning. Une exprimentation a t conduite pour induire la maturation et la ponte de Portunus trituberculatus en manipulant la temprature de l'eau de mer, la photopriode et l'ablation des pdoncules oculaires, et pour tudier les effets de ces facteurs sur la variation de la composition en acides nucliques du tissu gonadique. Des femelles adultes non incubatrices ont t divises dans trois tempratures (naturelle, 10C, et 20C) et deux photopriodes (15 h et 9 h de lumire par jour). A l'intrieur de chaque combinaison de temprature-photopriode les individus ont t re-diviss en deux groupes, avec pdoncules et unilatralement pdonculs. L'index gonadosomatique, le taux de ponte et les variations des acides nucliques ont t examins pour les trois traitements chaque trois semaines. L'effet le plus accentu sur l'induction de la maturation ovarienne et la ponte a t observ pour les femelles maintenues  20C avec 15 h de lumire. La maturation des gonades ne se ralise pas chez les groupes exposs aux plus faibles tempratures quel que soit leur traitement pour les pdoncules ou en photopriode. Les taux d'ARN et ADN ont t fortement corrls  l'tat de maturation de la gonade, avec les valeurs maximum obtenues pour les groupes pdonculs maintenus  des tempratures infrieures  20C avec 15 h de lumire. Dans ces conditions l'augmentation de la concentration en ADN, reflet de la diffrentiation de la gonade (petite taille cellulaire et un grand nombre de cellules par unit de tissus) dbute trois semaines plus tt que pour les autres traitements. Ces rsultats suggrent que P. trituberculatus ncessite pour induire une maturation et une ponte hors saison, non seulement une augmentation de temprature mais aussi un autre stimulus, comme l'ablation des pdoncules ou une photopriode longue.
20105955|The sex ratio of the painted ghost crab Ocypode gaudichaudii is 1:1. When sampled in different areas of the intertidal zone, the number of males and females varied according to differences in their spatial patterns of behaviour. Male crabs that remained in the burrow area, i.e., the upper third of the beach, at low tide outnumbered females 2: 1. Large sexually mature males were more abundant in the upper third of the beach in the burrow area than near the low-tide mark. Equal numbers of males and females foraged away from the burrow area at the waters edge. Twice as many females were captured away from the burrow area than in it. Previous reports of skewed sex ratios may have resulted from sampling bias introduced by the different behaviours of each sex. /// La sex-ratio du crabe Ocypode gaudichaudii est de 1: 1. Dans des chantillonnages en diffrents points de la zone intertidale, le nombre des mles et des femelles variait en fonction des diffrences dans leur mode spatial de comportement. Les mles qui,  mare basse, restaient dans le voisinage du terrier, c'est--dire dans le tiers suprieur de la plage, dpassaient les femelles en nombre dans le rapport 2: 1. Les grands mles  maturit taient plus abondants dans le tiers suprieur de la plage, dans la zone des terriers, que prs de la laisse de basse-mer. Mles et femelles fourrageaient en nombre gal de la zone des terriers jusqu'au niveau de l'eau. Deux fois plus de femelles ont t capturs loin de la zone des terriers que dans celle-ci. Les prcdents rapports sur des sex-ratio biaises ont pu rsulter de biais d'chantillonnages produits par les diffrences de comportement des deux sexes.
20105312|Two new species of the genus Parvulobathynella Schminke, 1973 (P. duodecima sp. n. and P. octacantha sp. n.) are described from South Africa, and two species (P. ypacaraiensis (Noodt, 1963) and P. riegelorum (Noodt, 1965)) are redescribed. The chaetotaxy of the labrum is identified as a new distinctive character of the genus and is also a distinguishing character between the four species. The genus Lamtobathynella Serban & Coineau, 1982 is synonymized with Parvulobathynella. A new aspect of the zoogeography of the genus is discussed. /// Zwei neue Arten der Gattung Parvulobathynella Schminke, 1973 (P. duodecima sp. n. und P. octacantha sp. n.) werden aus Sdafrika beschrieben und zwei schon bekannte (P. ypacaraiensis (Noodt, 1963) und P. riegelorum (Noodt, 1965)) werden nachbeschrieben. Die Beborstung des Labrums wird als neues konstitutives Merkmal der Gattung herausgestellt und kann auch als Merkmal fr die Artunterscheidung herangezogen werden. Die Gattung Lamtobathynella Serban & Coineau, 1982 wird mit Parvulobathynella synonymisiert. Es wird kurz auf die zoogeographische Bedeutung der neuen Funde eingegangen.
20107871|The high-frequency repetitive discharge of the lateral giant axons evoked in isolated abdominal nerve cord of the crayfish by a single short electrical pulse has been described forty years ago in two independent papers (Burmistrov, 1965; Kusano & Grundfest, 1965). This phenomenon never was commented, though it seems hardly compatible with recent evidence concerning the lateral giant circuitry underlying the tail-flip escape reaction in modern crayfish. This paper is an attempt to explain the repetitive discharge of the lateral giants in the light of recent data about their structure and functions. It is concluded that (1) long repetitive high-frequency discharge of the lateral giants obtained in the isolated ventral nerve cord can hardly occur under natural conditions; (2) nevertheless, this phenomenon, caused by "circulation" of nerve impulse in loops of the lateral giants resulting from their ladder-like structure, needs to be explained; (3) one may suggest that it is a remnant of the evolutionary past when the lateral giants had chemical connections with their output neurons (fast flexor and swimmeret motor neurons); (4) this easily reproduced phenomenon may be used for the experimental study of functional abilities of commissural junctions as well as for model studies of reverberatory processes in various structures. /// La dcharge rptitive  haute frquence des axones gants latraux, en rponse  une unique courte impulsion lectrique, connue dans la corde nerveuse abdominale isole de l'crevisse, a t dcrite il y a quarante ans dans deux articles indpendants (Burmistrov, 1965; Kusano & Grundfest, 1965). Ce phnomne n'avait jamais t comment, bien qu'il semble peu compatible avec la mise en vidence rcente des circuits gants latraux responsables de la raction d'chappement (coup de queue) chez les crevisses. Cet article est un essai d'explication de la dcharge rptitive des axones gants latraux  la lumire des donnes rcentes sur leur structure et leurs fonctions. La conclusion est que (1) la longue dcharge rptitive  haute frquence des axones gants latraux obtenus sur la corde ventrale nerveuse isole peut difficilement tre produite dans des conditions naturelles; (2) nanmoins, ce phnomne, caus par la "circulation" de l'influx nerveux dans des boucles fermes des gants latraux rsultant de leur structure "en chelle" doit tre expliqu; (3) on peut suggrer qu'il s'agit d'un reste du pass volutif quand les circuits gants latraux avaient des connexions chimiques avec leurs neurones effrents (neurones de flexion rapide et ceux de nage, c'est--dire, des plopodes); (4) ce phnomne facilement reproduit peut tre utilis pour l'tude exprimentale des capacits fonctionnelles des jonctions commissurales ainsi que les tudes de processus de rpercussion dans des structures varies.

20107509|Our current knowledge on the Anostraca of Turkey is rather limited, due to a lack of both local specialists and field sampling campaigns. Based on the old data available, mainly published in Italian and German, as well as on the results of recent samplings, we have summarized the present situation in order to update the information available for this branchiopod order in the Turkish fauna. Our purpose is to stress the need for extensive exploration of the territory, and to underline the importance of a proper conservation policy for temporary habitats, which are often overlooked, and hence particularly endangered, both as a result of human negligence, and due the their inherent ephemeral nature. /// Attualmente le conoscenze sulla fauna ad anostraci della Turchia sono alquanto scarse a causa sia della mancanza di specialisti locali, che di campagne di raccolta adeguate. Analizzando dati di letteratura piuttosto datati ma poco diffusi (prevalentemente in italiano ed in tedesco), nonch informazioni relative a raccolte recenti, abbiamo sintetizzato la situazione e presentiamo in questa nota il quadro attuale delle conoscenze circa questo gruppo di Branchiopodi. Oltre ad evidenziare la necessit di indagini ad ampio raggio, desideriamo sottolineare la necessit di valutare lo status delle specie presenti e l'importanza di una corretta politica di conservazione degli ambienti temporanei, che proprio in quanto tali, sono i pi minacciati dalle attivit umane.
20105255|Eubrachyurans are currently divided into two subsections based on the anatomical position of the seminal duct termini. Heterotremes have the seminal ducts passing through the pereiopod 5 coxae, emerging externally in the form of "penes" to contact the basal segments of the gonopods. Thoracotrematous crabs, on the other hand, have the "male openings" located on sternite 8 and the ejaculatory ducts never pass through the pereiopod 5 coxae. Some brachyurologists maintain in the literature that the heterotreme-thoracotreme distinction reflects the extremes of two evolutionary grades. According to this speculation, "advanced" thoracotrematous crabs probably arose from intermediate goneplacid forms which, in turn, originated out of the Heterotremata in response to selection pressures for improved locomotion. The cladistic hypothesis of De Saint Laurent (1980), in contrast, positions Heterotremata and Thoracotremata as sister groups. Indeed, the heterotreme-thoracotreme difference considered alone does support two discrete types as no truly intermediate seminal duct condition bridges the subsections. Nor is there any evidence to suggest that the heterotrematous state is the anatomical precursor of sternal openings for the seminal ducts. The fact that basal members of the Pinnotheroidea De Haan are thoracotremes whereas more derived forms have an heterotrematous morphology, refutes De Saint Laurent's hypothesis of a deep phylogenetic cleavage between the two subsections. In addition to this information, the 850+ species of freshwater crabs (many of which are semi-terrestrial) share an array of somatic apomorphies with thoracotremes and yet belong to the Heterotremata. And the cladistic hypothesis of De Saint Laurent (1980) is also falsified by previous parsimony analyses which place a monophyletic taxon Thoracotremata within a paraphyletic group Heterotremata. It is therefore possible that Heterotremata is synonomous with Eubrachyura, with Thoracotremata remaining as a distinct eubrachyuran subclade. One trenchant conclusion is that the functional explanation for the heterotreme-thoracotreme distinction lacks empirical support. /// Les Eubrachyura sont couramment diviss en deux sous-sections, sur la base de la position anatomique de l'extrmit des canaux sminaux. Les htrotrmes ont un canal sminal qui traverse la coxa du priopode 5, dbouchant  l'extrieur sous la forme d'un pnis au contact de l'article basal du gonopode. Les crabes thoracotrmes, d'autre part, ont les orifices sexuels mles situs sur le sternite 8, et le canal jaculateur ne passe jamais par la coxa du priopode 5. Certains carcinologistes maintiennent que la distinction htrotrme-thoracotrme reflte les extrmes de deux grades d'volution. Selon cette opinion, les crabes thoracotrmes "avancs" seraient probablement issus de formes gonplaciennes intermdiaires qui auraient leur origine dans les Heterotremata en rponse aux pressions de slection pour amliorer la locomotion dans des environnements semiterrestres. L'hypothse cladistique propose par De Saint-Laurent (1980), en revanche, considre les Heterotremata et les Thoracotremata comme groupes-frres. En effet, la diffrence htrotrme-thoracotrme considre seule supporte deux formes discrtes, tant donn qu'aucune condition intermdiaire du canal sminal ne relie les deux sous-sections. De mme, aucune vidence ne suggre que l'tat htrotrme est le prcurseur anatomique de l'ouverture sternale du canal sminal. Le fait que les membres basaux des Pinnotheroidea De Haan sont thoracotrmes, alors que des formes plus drives ont une morphologie htrotrme, rfute l'hypothse de De Saint-Laurent d'un clivage phylogntique profond entre les deux sous-sections. En outre, les plus de 850 espces de crabes d'eau douce (dont beaucoup sont semi-terrestres) partagent un ensemble d'apomorphies somatiques avec les thoracotrmes et, cependant, appartiennent aux Heterotremata. De plus, l'hypothse cladistique de De Saint-Laurent (1980) est galement falsifie par les analyses de parcimonie antrieures qui placent un taxon monophyltique Thoracotremata  l'intrieur d'un groupe paraphyltique Heterotremata. Il est alors possible que Heterotremata soit synonyme de Eubrachyura, les Thoracotremata restant un sous-clade eubrachyourien distinct. Une conclusion nette est que l'explication fonctionnelle pour la distinction htrotrme-thoracotrme manque d'un support empirique.
20102778|Description d'une nouvelle espce de Cladocres, Chydorus brehmi, de Dudu Talao, District Jaipur, Rajasthan (Inde).
20105481|The data presented in this note extend the known distribution of the anostracan Chirocephalus ruffoi Cottarelli & Mura, 1984, an endemic Italian species. The additional localities reported here had been sampled occasionally from the late 1940s to the early 1960s, but at that time the species was misidentified as C. diaphanus Prvost, 1803. Re-examination of the sampled material, including resting-egg morphology, during this study has demonstrated that in fact the misidentified specimens belong to C. ruffoi, a species known to occur at other sites in the Tuscan-Emilian Apennines. The usefulness of scanning electron microscopy for examining egg-shell morphology in order to aid, at least in certain cases, in a correct identification of species of Anostraca, is stressed. /// I dati presentati in questa nota ampliano la distribuzione della specie Chirocephanus ruffoi, Cottarelli & Mura, 1984, endemica per l'Italia. Le localit di raccolta citate in questo studio erano state campionate tra la fine degli anni '40 e l'inizio dei '60, ma gli anostraci ivi rinvenuti erano stati erroneamente ascritti alla specie C. diaphanus Prvost, 1803. L'attuale riesame del materiale prelevato, ivi compresa la morfologia delle uova resistenti, ha rivelato che si tratta invece di C. ruffoi, noto anche per altri siti dell'Appennino Tosco-Emiliano. Questo reperto sottolinea ulteriormente l'utilit, in molti casi comprovata, dell'uso della morfologia dell'involucro terziario delle uova resistenti come carattere con valore tassonomico.
20103323|Une nouvelle espce du genre Thor, T. marguitae, est dcrite et illustre. L'espce s'apparente de prs  T. amboinensis De Man, dont elle peut tre distingue par la morphologie du rostre, qui en gnral, a distalement une apparence trifide charactristique, et par la spinulation des mrus des preiopodes ambulatoires. Dix specimens ont t rcolts dans une seule colonie du corail Porites andrewsi Vaughan, d'un rcif  Heron Island, Queensland, Australie. La coloration de la crevette parat ressembler celle de l'hte.
20101810|Eine nach Geschlechtern aufgeteilte biometrische Studie wurde durchgefhrt an einer Population von Macrobrachium dayanum (Henderson, 1893) vom Dhakuria-See, Kalkutta. Bei den beiden Geschlechtern wurden keine signifikanten Variationen hinsichtlich der meristischen Charaktere (Rostralzhne) beobachtet. Eine multiple Regressionsanalyse hat den berzeugenden Nachweis erbracht, da zwischen beiden Geschlechtern morphometrische Unterschiede bestehen (Sexualdimorphismus). Getrennte Regressionskoeffizient-Studien ber Krper- und Beinmae haben signifikante Variationen zwischen Mnnchen und Weibchen ergeben und zwar in Bezug auf Carapax, Rostrum und erstem Cheliped, bezogen auf den Cephalothorax. Der zweite Cheliped zeigte eine hnliche proportionale Wachstumsrate in Bezug auf den Cephalothorax bei Mnnchen und Weibchen; da die Mnnchen insgesamt lnger werden als die Weibchen, erreicht auch deren zweiter Cheliped eine proportional grere Lnge. Whrend bei M. lamarrei (H. Milne Edwards, 1837) die Weibchen grer werden als die Mnnchen, ist das Umgekehrte der Fall bei M. dayanum (Henderson, 1893).
20102225|Durch den Fund von vier Exemplaren der Ssswassergarnele Macrobrachium rosenbergii in Palau erweitert sich das Verbreitungsgebiet dieser Art 600 Meilen nach Osten ber die Philippinische See hinweg und verbindet damit Palau faunistisch mit der Indopazifischen Region.
20111393|The morphometric characteristics and relative growth of the swimming crab, Portunus spinicarpus collected in the southern Gulf of Mexico were examined. A total of 248 specimens was measured on 13 external variables, including measurements of carapace, chelae, and abdomen. For both males and females, each body character was adjusted to a power equation taking the carapace width as the independent variable, and comparisons in the growth parameter (b) between sexes were made. Discriminant Analyses (DA) were also applied to identify measurements characterizing sexes. The results obtained show the males to be larger than the females. The smallest individuals (&lt28 mm carapace width) were only females, and the only two specimens larger than 60 mm were males. The size of the smallest specimen (13 mm) presumably indicates that individuals recruit to the adult population around this size. The DA showed that the sex discriminating power of the abdomen width was absolute (100% of specimens well classified) only in combination with the carapace depth. The DA and t-test of the b parameter showed that secondary sexual characters corresponded to the lengths of chelae and spines, being larger in males. The statistical analysis of paired characters within sexes indicated a mirror-symmetry in this species, which provides more stability and balance to individuals. Symmetrical traits and body measurements in P. spinicarpus probably explain its ecological success in the western Atlantic. /// Se examinaron las caractersticas morfomtricas y el crecimiento relativo del cangrejo nadador Portunus spinicarpus recolectado en el sur del Golfo de Mxico. Se midieron un total de 248 individuos en 13 variables externas, incluyendo medidas del caparazn, quelas y abdomen. Cada caracterstica corporal en machos y hembras se ajust a una ecuacin de tipo potencial tomando el ancho del caparazn como variable independiente, y se hicieron comparaciones entre sexos del parmetro de crecimiento (b). Se aplicaron tambin Anlisis Discriminantes (DA) para identificar las caractersticas morfomtricas de cada sexo. Los resultados mostraron que los machos son ms grandes que las hembras. Los individuos ms pequeos (&lt28 mm en ancho del caparazn) fueron hembras, mientras que los dos nicos especmenes mayores a 60 mm, fueron machos. La talla del espcimen ms pequeo (13 mm) indica que probablemente los individuos se reclutan a la poblacin adulta alrededor de esa talla. El DA mostr que el poder para discriminar sexos del ancho del abdomen es absoluto (100% de los especmenes bien clasificados) slo en combinacin con la profundidad del caparazn. El DA y la prueba de t sobre el parmetro b mostraron que las caractersticas sexuales secundarias corresponden a la longitud de quelas y espinas, siendo mayor en los machos. Los anlisis estadsticos aplicados a las caractersticas pareadas dentro de cada sexo indicaron que la especie presenta una simetra en espejo, la cual provee una mayor estabilidad y balance a los individuos. Los rasgos simtricos y caractersticas corporales en P. spinicarpus probablemente explican su xito ecolgico en el Atlntico occidental.
23065206|The effects of mechanical stress caused by trawling, handling, air exposure, and discarding during fishing processes can cause irreversible damage to many bycatch organisms. The objective of this work was to evaluate quali-quantitatively the physical damage (loss of limbs) and differential survival among the portunid swimming crabs Callinectes danae Smith, 1869, Callinectes ornatus Ordway, 1863, and Achelous spinimanus (Latreille, 1819) in the pink shrimp trawling fishery in Guanabara Bay, Brazil. Physical damage was quantified by the incidence of lesions for each species in the following categories: male and female; juvenile and adult; and moulting and non-moulting organisms. The percentage of survivors was obtained through a 24-hour experiment in three consecutive days. The most frequently damaged species was C. danae; 58.9% of this species was observed to be injured. C. ornatus and A. spinimanus presented similar injury frequencies with injuries observed, respectively, in 44.3% and 43.5% of individuals of these species. The Chi-square value for male vs. female; juvenile vs. adult; and moulting vs. non-moulting organisms of each species did not exhibit significant differences except for adults and juveniles of C. danae. The most common type of damage observed among the species was the loss of chelipeds and/or pereiopods. Variance analysis did not detect significant differences in the survival of the various species at the different times of the experiment. The three species presented high survival percentages in all treatments, and live individuals of all species likely show similar recovery rates from trawling stress when returned to the sea. Os efeitos do estresse mecnico causados pela pesca de arrasto como manipulao a bordo, exposio ao ar e descarte durante a pescaria podem causar danos irreversveis para muitos organismos capturados como fauna-acompanhante. O objetivo desse trabalho foi avaliar quali-quantitativamente os danos fsicos (perda de apndices) e a sobrevivncia dos siris Callinectes danae Smith, 1869, Callinectes ornatus Ordway, 1863 e Achelous spinimanus (Latreille, 1819) aps a pesca de arrasto do camaro-rosa na Baa de Guanabara, Brasil. Os danos fsicos foram quantificados atravs da incidncia de leses para cada espcie nas seguintes categorias: machos e fmeas; jovens e adultos; indivduos em processo de muda ou no. O percentual de sobreviventes foi obtido atravs de um experimento de 24 horas realizado em trs dias consecutivos. A espcie mais frequentemente danificada foi C. danae; 58,9% dessa espcie estava lesada. Achelous spinimanus apresentou as menores frequncias de injrias observadas em 43,5% dos indivduos dessa espcie. O valor do quiquadrado entre machos e fmeas; jovens e adultos; organismos em muda ou no de cada espcie; no exibiu diferena significativa exceto entre jovens e adultos de C. danae. O tipo mais comum de dano observado entre as espcies foi a perda dos quelpodos e ou pereipodos. A anlise de varincia no detectou diferenas significativas na sobrevivncia das diferentes espcies nos diferentes momentos do experimento e as trs espcies apresentaram percentuais de sobrevivncia elevados em todos os tratamentos. A sobrevivncia individual para todas elas apresentou taxas similares de recuperao do estresse mecnico quando devolvidas ao mar.
23065232|The objective of this study was to analyse the population growth of the Atlantic seabob shrimp, Xiphopenaeus kroyeri (Heller, 1862) and to establish its recruitment period in the northern part of the State of Rio de Janeiro, southeastern Brazil. Monthly samples of the species were collected over four years (2005-06, 2006-07, 2008-09, and 2009-10) through local artisanal fishery. The size of males and females varied from 25.0 to 134.0 mm and 33.0 to 146.0 mm in total length, 6.0 to 30.0 mm and 5.0 to 33.0 mm in carapace length, and 0.3 to 13.8 g and 0.2 to 17.4 g in weight, respectively. The total weight-length relationship was adjusted with the equations W = 0.000008TL 2.9038 (R = 0.9446) (males) and W = 0.000002TL 3.1719 (R = 0.9499) (females). The Von Bertalanffy growth function ${\mathrm{T}\mathrm{L}}_{\mathrm{t}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}=\text{\hspace{0.17em}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{T}\mathrm{L}}_{\mathrm{\infty }}(1-\text{\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{exp}}^{-\mathrm{k}(\mathrm{t}-{\mathrm{t}}_{0})})$ was applied to the data, and the average asymptotic lengths (TL  ) and growth rates (k) were 134.4  6.2 mm and 1.93  0.3 mm for males, and 148.8  3.6 mm and 1.65  0.05 mm for females. The species' average longevity was 2.5 years for males and 2.8 years for females. Males are considered mature when their reach a total length of 66.0 mm and a carapace length of 12.0 mm, while females mature with 109.0 mm total length and 22.0 mm carapace length. In general, the species' recruitment occurred from June to August and from January to May, which partially supports the current legislation to maintain this fishery resource in the region. O objetivo deste estudo foi analisar o crescimento populacional do camaro sete barbas, Xiphopenaeus kroyeri (Heller, 1862), capturado no norte do Rio de Janeiro, Brasil, e inferir sobre o perodo de recrutamento na regio. As amostras mensais da espcie foram obtidas durante quatro anos (2005-06, 2006-07, 2008-09 e 2009-10) atravs da pesca artesanal local. O porte de machos e fmeas variou de 25,0 a 134,0 mm e 33,0 a 146,0 mm em comprimento total, 6,0 a 30,0 mm e 5,0 a 33,0 mm em comprimento da carapaa e 0,3 a 13,8 g e 0,2 a 17,4 g em peso, respectivamente. A relao entre peso e comprimento total foi ajustada atravs das equaes P = 0,000008CT 2,9038 (R = 0,9446) (machos) e P = 0,000002CT 3,1719 (R = 0,9499) (fmeas). A funo de crescimento de Von Bertalanffy: ${\mathrm{C}\mathrm{T}}_{\mathrm{t}}\text{\hspace{0.17em}=\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{C}\mathrm{T}}_{\mathrm{\infty }}(1-\text{\hspace{0.17em}}{\mathrm{exp}}^{-\mathrm{k}(\mathrm{t}-{\mathrm{t}}_{0})})$ foi aplicada aos dados e a mdia do comprimento assinttico (CT  ) e da taxa de crescimento (k) no perodo de estudo foi 134,4  6,2 mm e 1,93  0,3 mm (machos) e 148,8  3,6 mm e 1,65  0,05 (fmeas). A longevidade mdia da espcie foi estimada em 2,5 anos para machos e 2,8 anos para fmeas. Os machos atingem a primeira maturao gonadal com 66,0 mm de comprimento total e 12,0 mm de comprimento da carapaa, enquanto as fmeas maturam com 109,0 mm e 22,0 mm, respectivamente. Em geral, o recrutamento da espcie ocorreu de junho a agosto e de janeiro a maio, e est em conformidade parcial com a atual legislao de proteo deste recurso pesqueiro na regio.
27743218|Underwater field observations were made by SCUBA divers to document the behaviour of scavengers gathering around food sources in the near-shore part of an Arctic fjord (Grnfjorden, Spitsbergen). The only species feeding on the baits were the spider crab, Hyas araneus and the whelk, Buccinum sp., although single individuals of the hermit crab, Eupagurus pubescens were seen moving towards the bait. Our data show that individuals of H. araneus distinguish between different types of potential competitors or predators appropriately modifying their behaviour. A gradual response of the crabs to a perceived threat was observed, from no reaction towards the presence of whelks, to aggressive display provoked by the divers. Overt acts of aggression among H. ananeus were absent, although smaller individuals were observed retreating from the bait earlier than the larger ones. /// Des observations sous-marines ont t ralises par des plongeurs afin d'apporter des informations sur le comportement des charognards prsents autour des sources de nourriture dans la partie ctire d'un fjord arctique (Grnfjorden, Spitzberg). Les seules espces se nourrissant sur les appts tait l'araigne de mer Hyas araneus et le buccin, Buccinum sp., bien que des individus isols du pagure Eupagurus pubescens aient t observs se dirigeant vers l'appt. Nos donnes montrent que les individus de H. araneus distinguent entre diffrents types de comptiteurs potentiels ou de prdateurs en modifiant leur comportement de faon approprie. Une graduation dans les rponses des crabes face  une menace a t obsere, de l'absence de raction  la prsence des buccins, jusqu' la manifestation d'agressivit provoque par les plongeurs. Des ractions d'agression caractrises chez H. araneus n'ont pas t observes, mme si des individus plus petits ont t vus quittant l'appt plus tt que plus grands.
27743343|A new species of the alpheid shrimp genus Salmoneus Holthuis, 1955, S. brucei sp. nov., is described and illustrated from Iriomote Island, southern Ryukyu Islands, Japan. The type series was obtained by yabby pump from burrows of the callianassid ghost shrimp, Lepidophthalmus tridentatus (Von Martens, 1868). The new species is unique within the genus in the lack of orbital teeth of the carapace, but the presence of numerous setae on the fingers of the chelipeds and the enlarged minor cheliped link it to S. seticheles Anker, 2003, known from the Northern Territory, Australia. /// Eine neue Art der alpheiden Gattung Salmoneus Holthuis, 1955, S. brucei sp. nov, wird von der Insel Iriomote, sdliche Ryukyu Inseln, Japan, beschrieben und illustriert. Die Typenserie wurde mit einer Saugpumpe aus Bauten des Maulwurfskrebses Lepidophthalmus tridentatus (Von Martens, 1868) erbeutet. Die neue Art ist einzigartig innerhalb der Gattung wegen des Fehlens orbitaler Zhne am Carapax. Das Vorhandensein zahlreicher Borsten auf den Fingern beider Scheren und die vergrerte kleine Schere stellen sie in die Nhe von S. seticheles Anker, 2003 aus dem Northern Territory Australiens.
20107521|A new species, Alona mediterranea is described and illustrated based on specimens from the western part of Mediterranean Anatolia (Turkey). The new species belongs to the verrucosa species-group of the genus Alona by the presence two semi-circles of lateral head pores. The diagnosis is based on 25 characters that are either newly described, or have been widely used in descriptions/diagnoses of the species group in previous studies. The characters presented also allow to discuss the position of the verrucosa-group and to describe affinities of the new species with its congeners outside the verrucosa-group. Alona mediterranea n. sp. is most similar to Alona alonopsiformis, and next also to Alona verrucosa. /// Une nouvelle espce, Alona mediterranea, est dcrite et illustre  partir de spcimens provenant de la partie occidentale de l'Anatolie mditerranenne (Turquie). La nouvelle espce appartient au groupe d'espces verrucosa du genre Alona par la prsence de deux demi-cercles de pores cphaliques latraux. La diagnose est fonde sur 25 caractres qui sont soit nouvellement dcrits, soit ont t largement utiliss dans les descriptions/diagnoses du groupe d'espces dans des tudes antrieures. Les caractres prsents permettent aussi de discuter la position du groupe verrucosa et de dcrire les affinits de la nouvelle espce avec ses congnres  l'extrieur du groupe verrucosa. Alona mediterranea n. sp. est le plus proche d'Alona alonopsiformis et proche aussi d'Alona verrucosa.
20107501|Sexual size dimorphism in the Chondracanthidae is very marked: we investigate whether it is a consequence of dwarfing of males or females becoming giants. Plotting male size against female size indicates that the relationship is allometric, i.e., showing a trend towards increasing sexual size dimorphism. This is supported by the results of an analysis of sexual size dimorphism against morphological distance, although not significant when phylogeny is controlled for. It appears that both sexes are driving the sexual size dimorphism, and chondracanthid females are probably selected for high fecundity leading to large body size, whereas males are probably selected for small size. /// Le dimorphisme sexuel concernant la taille chez les Chondracanthidae est trs marqu: nous avons recherch si ce dimorphisme s'expliquait par des mles devenant nains ou des femelles devenant gantes. La comparaison de la taille du mle par rapport  celle de la femelle indique que leur relation est allomtrique, montrant une tendance vers l'augmentation du dimorphisme sexuel de la taille. Ceci est soutenu par les rsultats de l'analyse du dimorphisme sexuel de la taille par rapport  la distance morphologique, bien que non significatifs quand on considre la phylognie. Il apparat que les deux sexes sont impliqus dans l'acquisition du dimorphisme sexuel relatif  la taille; la slection chez les Chondracanthidae femelles en vue d'une fcondit leve a abouti  une grande taille du corps, tandis que chez les mles, la slection a probablement conduit vers une petite taille.
20104528|Die vorliegende Arbeit zeigt eine Nachbeschreibung der Art Pseudidothea scutatas (Stephensen, 1947), die an einem gut erhaltenen Tier aus einem Magen von Notothenia gibberifrons erfolgte. Phylogenetisch wichtige Merkmale von Pseudidothea werden diskutiert. Es wird angenommen, da die Morphologie von Pseudidothea eine Anpassung an ihre mikrophage Ernhrungsweise darstellt. Auf der Evolutionslinie der Valviferen nimmt Pseudidothea eine Zwischenposition zwischen omnivoren und filtrierenden Valviferen ein.
20105333|The amphipod Epimeria reoproi n. sp., collected from the Antarctic Ocean, is described in detail. It has a smooth anterior pereon and a carina that begins on pereonite 5. This is similar to Epimeria vaderi Coleman, 1998 and to a specimen that has been described by Andres (1985). The carinal processes increase in size on the pleon in posterior direction. The head bears a strongly flexed rostrum. The coxa of pereiopod 4 is characteristically shaped, it is drawn out into a long, posteriorly flexed, acute apex. The posteroventral angles of the bases of pereiopods 5-6 are acutely produced. /// Die Flohkrebsart Epimeria reoproi n. sp. wurde im Antarktischen Ozean gesammelt und ist hier im Detail beschrieben. Sie hat ein glattes anteriores Peraeon und eine Carina, die auf Peraeonit 5 beginnt. Diese Merkmale hneln denen von Epimeria vaderi Coleman, 1998 und denen eines Amphipoden, welcher von Andres (1985) beschrieben wurde. Die Zacken nehmen auf dem Pleon posterior an Gre zu. Der Kopf besitzt ein stark gebogenes Rostrum. Die vierte Coxalplatte ist charakteristisch geformt, sie ist posterior ausgezogen und deutlich gebogen. Die posteroventralen Ecken der Basen von Peraeopoden 5-6 sind deutlich ausgeprgt.
20104937|The freshwater shrimps belonging to the atyid genus Caridina have a great potential as experimental biological material amongst decapod crustaceans due to the following features: 1. Easy availability throughout the year. 2. Occurrence in practically all kinds of inland and coastal water bodies. 3. Convenient size to handle and maintain in the laboratory. 4. Natural hardiness to salinity, temperature, low dissolved oxygen levels, and desiccation. 5. Omnivorous/scavenging feeding habits. 6. Early maturation. 7. Breeding throughout the year with rather short interbreeding periods. 8. Good fecundity. 9. Eggs fairly large, hardy, easily removable, and hatching in vitro. 10. Metamorphosis representing all types of larval developmental patterns. 11. Successful rearing of larvae in fresh to saline waters using a simple technique with almost 100% survival rate and scope for cross-breeding. All these properties of Caridina sufficiently merit their consideration as a suitable biological tool for studies in such diverse disciplines as ecology, physiology, photobiology, reproductive biology, embryology, genetical engineering, etc. /// Parmi les crustacs dcapodes, les crevettes d'eau douce du genre Caridina (Atyidae) prsentent un potentiel important comme matriel biologique exprimental grce aux caractres suivants: 1. Disponibilit tout au long de l'anne. 2. Prsence dans pratiquement tous les types d'eaux intrieures et ctires. 3. Taille qui les rend facile  manipuler et maintenir au laboratoire. 4. Rsistance naturelle  la salinit,  la temprature,  un faible taux d'oxygne dissous,  la dessiccation. 5. Rgime alimentaire omnivore/dtritivore. 6. Maturation prcoce. 7. Reproduction presque ininterrompue dans l'anne. 8. Bonne fcondit. 9. Oeufs de grande taille, rsistants, facilement transportables et closant in vitro. 10. Mtamorphose reprsentant tous les types de dveloppement larvaire. 11. Elevage ais des larves dans des eaux douces ou sales en utilisant une mthose simple avec presque 100% de taux de survie et possibilits d'hybridation. Toutes ces qualits propres aux Caridina justifient qu'on les considre comme un matriel biologique convenable pour des tudes dans diverses disciplines, comme l'cologie, la physiologie, la photobiologie, la biologie de la reproduction, l'embryologie, les manipulations gntiques, etc.
20102088|Eine neue Myside, Scolamblyops japonicus gen. nov., sp. nov., wird aus der Bucht von Suruga aus Wassertiefen von 570-660 m (nahe dem Meeresboden) beschrieben. 20105860|Scanning electron microscopy (SEM) was used to study the morphology of the integumental structures in the oral field of the copepods Eurytemora affinis and Acartia tonsa. Structures observed in these two copepods were different in type, number, and location. E. affinis presented only structures of a filiform type, distributed all over the oral field, whereas in A. tonsa three different types of structures were observed: filiform, papilliform, and conical, distributed according to a complex pattern. The results obtained on the chaetotaxy of the oral field demonstrate a strong morphological adaptation of each copepod to its trophic habits. The ecological implications of these results on the coexistence of populations of both species in the Baha Blanca estuary are discussed. /// Se estudi la morfologa de las estructuras tegumentarias del campo oral de los copepodos Eurytemora affinis y Acartia tonsa utilizando Microscopa Electrnica de Barrido. Las estructuras observadas en ambos copepodos difirieron en tipo, nmero y localizacin. E. affinis present un patrn morfolgico simple constitudo por estructuras de tipo filiforme distribudas en todo el campo oral, mientras en A. tonsa se observ un patrn morfolgico complejo con tres tipos de estructuras: filiforme, papiliforme y cnico distribudas en reas determinadas del campo oral. Los resultados obtenidos sobre la quetotaxia del campo oral, demuestran una fuerte adaptacin morfolgica en cada uno de los copepodos relacionada con sus hbitos trficos. Se discute la importancia ecolgica de estos resultados, con respecto al fenmeno de coexistencia de las poblaciones de ambas especies, en el estuario de Baha Blanca.
20102573|Les deux espces, Porcellanella triloba White et Porcellanella picta Stimpson, ne sont pas identiques, mais les auteurs prcdents ont relev entre elles des diffrences qui n'existent pas. L'auteur donne ici des diagnoses nouvelles.
20107882|Third instar eastern white river crayfish, Procambarus acutus acutus (10  0.04 mm TL), and red swamp crayfish, Procambarus clarkii (8  0.02 mm TL) were stocked separately (intraspecific treatment) or in combination (interspecific treatment) at a density of 76 crayfish/m in 15-l aquaria. Survival and growth were assessed at 30-day intervals over a 90-day experimental period, which followed a fall (26-10C), winter (10-10C), and spring (10-26C) temperature regime. A commercial crayfish feed (Zeigler 45-50% protein) was provided twice on five days a week. The survival of the two species was similar through the fall and winter temperature courses; however, survival of P. a. acutus was significantly greater than that of P. clarkii under the spring temperature regime. The survival of each species was also better in the intraspecific than in the interspecific treatment during the spring period. No significant difference was detected in the growth of both species through the fall and winter temperature regimes. Over the spring temperature course, Procambarus acutus acutus grew faster than Procambarus clarkii in both treatments. In contrast to P. a. acutus, P. clarkii grew faster in the interspecific treatment than in the intraspecific one. The overall growth of P. a. acutus was 14 to 21% higher than that of P. clarkii for the fall, winter, and spring temperature regime over the total of 90 days. /// Des troisimes stades d'crevisses blanches de rivires de l'Est, Procambarus acutus acutus (10  0,04 mm TL) et d'crevisses rouges de Louisiane, Procambarus clarkii (8  0,02 mm TL) ont t stockes sparment (traitement intraspcifique) ou en mlange (traitement interspcifique)  une densit de 76 crevisses/m dans des aquariums de 15 l. La survie et la croissance ont t mesures  des intervalles de 30 jours sur une priode d'exprimentation de 90 jours, en suivant un rgime de temprature d'automne (26-10C), puis d'hiver (10-10C) et de printemps (10-26C). Une nourriture du commerce pour crevisses (Zeigler 45-50% protine) a t fournie deux fois sur cinq jours par semaine. La survie des deux espces tait similaire dans les conditions de temprature d'automne et d'hiver; cependant, la survie de P. a. acutus tait significativement plus longue que celle de P. clarkii dans les conditions de temprature de printemps. La survie de chaque espce tait galement meilleure dans le traitement intraspcifique que dans le traitement interspcifique en conditions de printemps. Aucune diffrence significative n'a t dtecte dans la croissance des deux espces en conditions de temprature de l'automne et de l'hiver. En conditions de printemps, procambarus acutus acutus a grandi plus vite que Procambarus clarkii pour les deux traitements. Contrairement  P. a. acutus, P. clarkii a grandi plus vite en traitement interspcifique qu'en intraspcifique. L'augmentation totale de taille de P. a. acutus tait 14  21% plus leve que celle de P. clarkii en conditions de temprature d'automne, d'hiver et de printemps sur un total de 90 jours.
20105217|Tylos granulatus is an isopod living above the driftline on sandy shores, burrowing to depths of up to a metre or more. Burrowing has been investigated by analyzing video recordings and traces from isotonic and isometric transducers. In crawling, all seven pairs of pereiopods operate in a similar manner and display metachronal rhythm, while in burrowing pereiopods 1 to 3 do the digging, pairs 4 to 6 compact the excavated sand, and pair 7 pushes the bolus behind the animal. Movements of the head also play a significant role in burrowing. Clockwise or anticlockwise partial rotation occurs during burrowing, which takes place in a stepwise progression. With a Burrowing Rate Index of 3, the animal must be considered a powerful burrower, while the energy cost of burrowing is surprisingly low at some 0.3 J
20101640|Beschreibung einer neuen Art von Choniostomatiden Copepoden aus dem Marsupium der Ostracode Metavargula ampla.
20104040|The history of the various concepts of the status of Niphargus rhenorhodanensis Schellenberg is discussed. The species, which is known from Germany and France, was first briefly described by Schellenberg in 1937 as a subspecies of Niphargus longicaudatus Costa, 1856. A morphological redescription of the species is now provided, based on type material.
20105820|A new genus and new species of potamid freshwater crab from Burma (present Myanmar), Flabellamon pretzmanni, is described. Flabellamon differs from other potamid genera in having a flat, transverse carapace with well developed epibranchial teeth which are separated from the external orbital angles by deep V-shaped clefts, and a short and relatively stout G1 which has a well developed fold on the dorsal margin of the terminal segment. The taxonomic status of two supposedly allied species, Potamon turgidulum Alcock, 1909, and Potamon kuehnelti Pretzmann, 1963, is also discussed. /// Un nouveau genre, nouvelle espce, de crabe d'eau douce Potamide est dcrite de Birmanie (actuellement Myanmar), Flabellamon pretzmanni. Flabellamon diffre des autres genres de Potamides par sa carapace transverse, plate, avec des dents pibranchiales bien dveloppes et spares des angles orbitaires externes par une fissure en V, et par un premier gonopode court et relativement fort, qui prsente un pli bien dvelopp sur le bord dorsal du segment terminal. Le statut taxonomique de deux espces supposes apparentes, Potamon turgidulum Alcock, 1909, et P. kuehnelti Pretzmann, 1963, est aussi discut.
20102074|Die Anheftung der Seepocke Balanus balanoides wurde in einem Gezeitenpool studiert. Die Populationsdichte war auf exponierten Felsoberflchen hher als auf Flchen unterhalb des Gezeitenpool-Wasserstandes.
41038642|Information on mating behaviour is available for only very few species of Spinicaudata. Mating behaviour of Cyzicus grubei was investigated under controlled conditions using video recordings. Four types of general interactions between individuals were recognized. Males were very active, and often tried to grasp a female, whereas females usually made attempts to escape throughout the mating process. The male captured the female from the dorsal side, then moved to the ventral side and took up a position with its long axis perpendicular to that of the female, forming a sort of cross. The pair then started rotating around the long axis of the female, while the male pushed its postabdomen into the female's carapace. Mating behaviour lasted from 18 to 35 seconds. The results seem to indicate that not only visual and tactile cues may be important in confirming species identity and receptivity of the female, but that chemical signals may also be involved. Los estudios sobre el comportamiento reproductor en los Spinicaudata son muy escasos. En este trabajo se ha investigado el comportamiento reproductor de Cyzicus grubei en condiciones controladas utilizando grabaciones de video, habindose detectado cuatro tipos de interacciones. Los machos, ms activos que las hembras, intentan capturarlas, mientras que stas suelen evitar esta accin. Cuando lo consiguen las sujetan por la parte dorsal del caparazn, tras lo cual se desplazan lateralmente hasta quedar colocados perpendicularmente a la hembra. De este modo, la pareja inicia movimientos rotatorios mientras el macho intenta introducir la parte posterior de su abdomen en el espacio delimitado por las dos valvas de la hembra, proceso que dura entre 18 y 35 segundos. Los resultados parecen indicar que no solo estn involucrados estmulos visuales y tctiles en el reconocimiento de las hembras, ya que tambin podran intervenir estmulos qumicos.

P. bensoni n. sp. et quatre autres espces sont ici dcrites et compares afin de renforcer l'intgrit taxonomique de ce genre important et ancien. Une liste des espces comprend plus de 130 noms, dont 7 espces vivantes et 8 espces fossiles seulement sont indubitablement correctement classes.
20107592|Panulirus argus is herein reported from the Cape Verde Islands for the first time. In May 2002 and February 2005, local lobster fishermen captured two specimens at depths of 20-40 m. Other occurrences of this species during the last 15-20 years suggest that a permanent population of P. argus is established in the Cape Verde Archipelago. Two invasion theories (ship ballast mediation and dispersal during the larval phase) and two possible source populations (Brazil and the Caribbean) are proposed, and discussed in view of oceanic currents. /// A presena de Panulirus argus nas ilhas de Cabo Verde  referida pela primeira vez. Em Maio de 2002 e Fevereiro de 2005, dois exemplares foram capturados por pescadores locais, a profundidades de 20-40 metros. A ocorrncia desta espcie nos ltimos 15 a 20 anos sugere a existncia de uma populao permanente de P. argus no Arquiplago de Cabo Verde. So propostas duas teorias para explicar a ocorrncia desta populao (transporte de larvas na gua de lastro dos navios e por correntes ocenicas), e sugeridas duas possveis populaes de origem (Brasil e Carabas).

20105732|Several hours mating behaviour of the woodborer isopod, Sphaeroma terebrans were recorded using a video camera. S. terebrans, the only species in the genus to lack an appendix masculina, has a peculiar way of mating that is completely different from that in other Isopoda. Instead of introducing the sperm into the genital opening of the female, the male releases it into the water current created by the beating of the female pleopods. The origin of this adaptation is discussed. /// Il comportamento sessuale dell'isopode Sphaeroma terebrans,  stato filmato per diverse ore, attraverso una telecamera. S. terebrans, l'unica specie del genere ad essere sprovvista di una appendix masculina, ha un modo di accoppiarsi del tutto particolare che  completamente differente da quello degli altri isopodi. Il maschio invece di introdurre lo sperma nella apertura genitale femminile, lo rilascia nella corrente d'acqua creata dal battito dei pleopodi. L'origine di questo adattamento viene discussa.
20104838|The effects of starvation upon survival, growth and molting interval of newly hatched spiny lobster (Panulirus japonicus) larvae were examined. Newly hatched phyllosoma larvae were divided into five groups, which were starved for 2, 10, 24, 48 and 72 hours. The effects of starvation after hatching appeared to be restricted to lengthening of the first molting interval. First molting was delayed by a time proportional to the starvation period. This result indicates optional preparation of food organisms before phyllosoma larvae hatch out. /// Les effets de l'inanition sur la survie, la croissance et la mue de larves phyllosomes nouvellement closes de la langouste Panulirus japonicus ont t examins. Ces larves ont t divises en cinq groupes qui ont t privs de nourriture pendant 2, 10, 24, 48 et 72 heures aprs l'closion. Les effets de l'absence de nourriture jusqu' 72 heures aprs l'closion ont t limits  l'allongement de l'intervalle de la premire mue. La premire mue  t retarde d'un temps proportionnel  la priode de privation. Ce rsultat indique qu'il n'est pas ncessaire de prvoir la prparation de proies avant l'closion des larves phyllosomes.
20104840|99 species of Peracarid Crustaceans (2 Mysidacea, 52 Amphipoda, 28 Cumacea, 15 Isopoda, and 2 Tanaidacea) were identified during a sampling performed on the muddy bottoms of the deep slope in front of Barcelona (western Mediterranean). Ten deep-water samples were performed between 552-1808 m using a small plankton net attached to a bottom trawl. Fifteen species should be considered as Mediterranean endemics: Ampelisca cf. anophthalma, Ampelisca dalmatina, Carangoliopsis spinulosa, Urothoe corsica, Lilljeborgia psaltrica, Idunella pirata, Bathymedon banyulsensis, Oediceropsis pilosa, Pardaliscoides stebbingi, Syrrhoe angulipes, Janirella bonnieri, Fageapseudes retusifrons, Diastyloides carpinei, Diastylis jonesi, and Makrokylindrus stebbingi, while 9 other species were recorded for the first time in the Mediterranean: Epimeria parasitica, Rhachotropis gracilis, Andaniexis abyssi, Chelator insignis, Desmosoma lineare, Belonectes parvus, Munnopsurus atlanticus, Ilyarachna longicornis, and Janirella nanseni. On the upper middle slope amphipods were the dominant taxa both in terms of species richness and abundance. Cumaceans were progressively more abundant when depth increased, being the dominant taxa on the lower slope. All these trends were discussed in the light of the sampling method used and in function of the ecological factors characterizing the deep bathyal environment in the Catalan Sea.
20106393|Two new species of harpacticoid copepods from Everglades National Park, Florida, Elaphoidella marjoryae sp. nov. and Elaphoidella fluviusherbae sp. nov., are described. Whereas E. marjoryae was collected from both surface waters and groundwater, E. fluviusherbae was found only in groundwater. The new species differ from congeners mainly in details of setation and spination of the swimming legs, and the shape and setation of the caudal rami. The ecology and geographical distribution of the genus Elaphoidella in North America are presented and discussed. The find of the cyclopoid copepod Diacyclops nearcticus Kiefer in the Everglades extends the known distribution of this North American species considerably southward. We present supplementary observations on the morphology of the female, including some obtained by scanning electron microscopy, and we describe the male. Geographical distribution and known habitats of the species are also presented and discussed. /// Nel presente lavoro vengono descritte due nuove specie di copepodi arpacticoidi raccolti in Florida, Stati Uniti, Everglades National Park: Elaphoidella marjoryae sp. nov. e Elaphoidella fluviusherbae sp. nov. Mentre E. marjoryae  stata rinvenuta sia in acque superficiali che sotterranee, E. fluviusherbae  esclusiva di acque sotterranee. Le due nuove specie si differenziano dalle congeneri soprattutto per dettagli nell'ornamentazione dei pereiopodi, e per la forma e ornamentazione dei rami furcali. Nel presente lavoro, vengono presentate e discusse la distribuzione e l'ecologia del genere Elaphoidella in Nord America. Il ritrovamento del copepode ciclopoide Diacyclops nearcticus Kiefer nelle Everglades, estende considerevolmente verso sud la distribuzione di questa specie nordamericana. Vengono fornite osservazioni supplementari sulla morfologia della femmina, e la descrizione del maschio; parte delle descrizioni sono state ottenute utilizzando la microscopia elettronica a scansione. Un aggiornamento sulla distribuzione ed ecologia della specie conclude il lavoro.
20106102|In this study we examined the role of ecdysteroids in the differentiational moult and in sexual maturation of juvenile female Libinia emarginata, using eyestalk ablation and radioimmunoassay. In eyestalk intact control animals, the ecdysteroids increased significantly in the hemolymph, from 11.26 ng/ml at the beginning of the experiment to 89.68 ng/ml by 68 days (7 days before moulting). In eyestalk ablated animals the ecdysteroids rose to 148.30 ng/ml by 20 days under our rearing conditions and moulting occurred 30 days after the beginning of the experiment. Ecdysteroids accumulated in the fresh ovaries prior to moulting, increasing from 30.38 ng/g at day 1 to 296.01 ng/g in control animals by day 73 (2 days prior to moulting). In ablated females they increased in a similar manner reaching 321.2 ng/g 10 days prior to moulting. All ablated juvenile females moulted into juveniles, while all controls moulted into adults. Our results suggest that in addition to regulating moulting, ecdysteroids may play a role in the morphological changes involved with maturation since eyestalk ablated animals remained juvenile. /// En este estudio se examin el rol de los ecdisteroides en la muda de diferenciacin y la maduracin sexual de las hembras juveniles de Libinia emarginata utilizando ablacin peduncular y radioinmunoensayo. En animales peduncularmente intactos o controles los ecdisteroides incrementaron significativamente en la hemolinfa, de 11.26 ng/ml al principio del experimento a 89.68 ng/ml a los 68 das (7 das antes de mudar). En animales epedunculados los ecdisteroides alcanzaron 148.30 ng/ml tras 20 das de cultivo y mudaron a los 30 das desde el inicio del experimento. Los ecdisteroides acumulados en los ovarios de animales controles antes de mudar, incrementaron de 30.38 ng/g el primer da a 296.01 ng/g despus de 73 das de cultivo (2 das antes de mudar). En las hembras epedunculadas incrementaron de manera similar alcanzando 321.20 ng/g 10 das antes de mudar. Todas las hembras juveniles epedunculadas mudaron en juveniles, mientras que todas las controles mudaron en adultos. Nuestros resultados sugieren que adems de regular la muda, los ecdisteroides puden jugar un papel en los cambios morfolgicos relacionados con la maduracin ya que los animales epedunculados permanecieron juveniles.

20105479|The seasonal and interannual variability of sex ratios (SR) of the Barents Sea population of the euphausiid, Thysanoessa raschii has been studied. In the winter-spring population the males dominate (SR &gt 1), in summer and autumn the females prevail (SR &lt 1). A connection was found between the SR and the water temperature two years earlier (minimal in that year and average for May, during which period zygotes are maturing, and embryogenesis and larval development take place). As a result of the increasing temperature, the share of the males in the population is reduced. The seasonal dynamics of the SR of T. raschii are discussed in connection with a general view about life cycles in euphausiids. The evolutionary processes ensuring the formation of the proper sexual structure in euphausiid populations as a whole, are considered. /// La variabilit saisonnire et interannuelle des sex-ratios (SR) de la population d'Euphausiacs de Thysanoessa raschii de la mer de Barentz a t tudie. Dans la population d'hiver et de printemps, les mles sont dominants (SR &gt 1); en t et en automne, les femelles sont dominantes (SR &lt 1). Une relation a t tablie entre la SR et la temprature de l'eau, deux ans plus tt (minimale cette annel et moyenne en mai, lors de la maturation des zygotes, de l'embryogense et du dveloppement larvaire). Avec la baisse de la temprature, la proportion des mles dans la population a diminu. La dynamique saisonnire de la sex-ratio (SR) de T. raschii a t discute par rapport aux donnes gnrales concernant le cycle de vie des Euphausiacs. Des hypothses sont mises sur les processus volutifs responsables d'une rpartition particulire des sexes dans les populations d'Euphausiacs en gnral.
20107668|The Palinuridae arose in the Atlantic-European region during early Mesozoic at a period of high sea level in the vast, warm 'Super Tethys' Ocean. During the Tertiary, equator-ward movements of the African, South American, and Australian Plates have subdivided the Tethys, created and expanded the Southern Ocean, and thus produced a multitude of separated environmental habitats in all the major oceans of the world. The family diverged in the Jurassic into the Stridentes group, seven genera of which survive today in the low-latitude equatorial zone, and the Silentes group, three genera of which live today in the mid-latitude temperate zone of the Southern Ocean and one genus in the equatorial zone. The older extant genera in both groups generally live in relict habitats at the greatest depths and the younger genera have radiated into the many new shallow-water habitats. Two major lineages within the Stridentes genus, Panulirus, are recognized, the older lineage living in the clear, cooler, more stable subtropical zone and the younger living in the warmer, turbid, more rapidly evolving tropical zone. Two major lineages are also recognized in the Silentes genus, Jasus, one lineage living on the continental shelves of Africa, Australia, and New Zealand and the other living on the isolated volcanic islands and sea-mounts of the southern subantarctic zone. /// Les Palinurids sont apparus dans la rgion Atlantico-Europenne au cours du dbut du Msozoque  une priode ou le niveau du vaste et tide ocan "Super Tthys" tait lev. Durant le tertiaire les mouvements des plaques de l'Afrique, de l'Amrique du Sud et de l'Australie vers l'quateur ont subdivis Tthys, crant et dveloppant l'Ocan Mridional et produisant une multitude d'habitats environnementaux spars dans tous les grands ocans de la terre. La famille a diverg au Jurassique entre le groupe des Stridentes dont 7 genres survivent aujourd'hui dans les basses zones quatoriales et le groupe des Silentes dont 3 genres vivent de nos jours dans les latitudes moyennes de la zone tempre de l'Ocan Mridional et 1 genre dans la zone quatoriale. Le genre le plus ancien dans les 2 goupes habite en gnral dans des habitats reliques dans les plus grandes profondeurs et le genre le plus rcent a radi dans les nouveaux habitats de faible profondeur. Deux grandes lignes sont reconnues dans les Stridentes, Panulirus la plus ancestrale vivant dans les zones stables subtropicales, claires et fraches et une plus rcente vivant dans les zones tropicales tides et turbides. Deux grandes lignes sont aussi reconnues dans les Silentes, Jasus une ligne vivant sur le plateau continental de l'Afrique, l'Australie et la Nouvelle Zlande et l'autre vivant sur les les volcaniques isoles et les monts sous-marins de la zone subantarctique sud.
