20104920|Pandalus brevis Rathbun, 1906, based on an Hawaiian specimen and never rediscovered until now, was found in Madagascar and is redescribed. The reexamination of Rathbun's type reveals that this species belongs to the genus Bitias Fransen, 1990, which with Bitias stocki Fransen, 1990, includes now 2 species which are compared. /// Pandalus brevis Rathbun, 1906, dcrit des les Hawaii et qui n'avait jamais t retrouv, est dcouvert  Madagascar et redcrit. L'examen du type de Rathbun montre que cette espce appartient au genre Bitias Fransen, 1990, qui, avec B. stocki Fransen, 1990, comprend donc maintenant deux espces qui sont compares.
20105697|Description of a new stygobiont harpacticoid, Parastenocaris aberrans sp. n. from France (Atlantic part of the Pyrenees region). The new species belongs to the fontinalis group and is morphologically similar to Parastenocaris fontinalis and P. meridionalis. The new species differs from these two taxa by the structure of the endopod of P2-P4 and P5. /// Description d'un nouvel harpacticode stygobie, Parastenocaris aberrans sp. n., des eaux souterraines de France (Pyrnes Atlantiques). La nouvelle espce appartient au group fontinalis et, par sa morphologie, est trs proche des espces Parastenocaris fontinalis et P. meridionalis. La nouvelle espce s'en distingue par la structure des endopodites de P2-P4 et de P5.
20105798|The identities of two poorly known potamid species, Potamon (Potamon) lacunifer Rathbun, 1904, and Potamon (Potamon) laosensis Rathbun, 1904, are clarified. Potamon lacunifer had been incorrectly synonymised with P. laosensis by Bott (1970). Both species are very distinct from each other as well as all other potamid species, and two new monotypic genera are established for them. Potamon lacunifer is referred to Rathbunamon gen. nov. whilst P. laosensis is referred to Pilosamon gen. nov. /// Clarification des identits de deux espces mal connues de crabe d'eau douce, Potamon (Potamon) lacunifer Rathbun, 1904, et P. (P.) laosensis Rathbun, 1904. Potamon lacunifer a t incorrectment mis en synonymie avec P. laosensis par Bott (1970). Les deux espces sont tout  fait distinctes l'une de l'autre, aussi bien que de toutes les autres espces de Potamides, et deux nouveaux genres monotypiques sont tablis pour elles. Potamon lacunifer est rapport  Rathbunamon gen. nov., alors que P. laosensis l'est  Pilosamon gen. nov.
20105661|Caligus planktonis Pillai, 1979, a species of sea louse reported free in the plankton off India, was found parasitic on a largescale mullet, Liza macrolepis (Smith, 1846), caught in the Strait of Taiwan. The copepod is characteristic in having (1) the genital complex longer than the cephalothoracic shield; (2) a postmaxillary process in the oral region; (3) the inner coxal seta of leg 2 born on an oblong, spinulose lobe; and (4) the 1-segmented exopod on leg 4 with an armature formula of I,III. A brief review is given on the species of Caligus reported free in the plankton. /// Caligus planktonis Pillai, 1979, une espce de coppode parasite trouv libre dans le plancton au large de l'Inde, a t trouv parasitant un mulet  grandes cailles, Liza macrolepis (Smith, 1846), captur dans le Dtroit de Taiwan. Le coppode est caractristique par (1) le complexe gnital plus long que le cphalothorax; (2) un processus postmaxillaire dans la rgion orale; (3) la soie coxale interne de P2 porte par un lobe allong et orn de spinules; et (4) l'exopodite uni-segment de P4 avec une formule de I,III. Une courte revue des espces de Caligus observes libres dans le plancton est donne.
20105418|The minute squat lobster Munidopsis acutispina Benedict, 1902 is recorded for the first time from bathyal grounds in the Mediterranean Sea. It can easily be distinguished from the two species of Munidopsis previously known from the Mediterranean, for the surface of the carapace covered with squamous spiniform tubercles. As the available illustrations of M. acutispina are somehow inadequate, the species is briefly redescribed and illustrated based on the new material and compared with its closest relatives, that are found in the western Atlantic and eastern Pacific Oceans. /// L'espce Munidopsis acutispina Benedict, 1902 est signale pour la premire fois de l'tage bathyal de la Mditerrane. Elle se distingue facilement des deux autres espces de Munidopsis connues auparavant de Mditerrane par la surface de la carapace couverte de tubercules squameux spiniformes. Dans la mesure o les illustrations disponibles pour M. acutispina sont sommaires, l'espce est brivement redcrite et illustre d'aprs le nouveau matriel et compare avec les espces les plus proches de l'Atlantique occidental et du Pacifique oriental.
20102831|Die ersten zwei Zoea-Stadien von Parapagurus diogenes wurden im Laboratorium erbrtet und erstmals beschrieben. Sechs Zoea-Stadien einer verwandten Art, drei einer weiteren und einzelne Stadien von drei weiteren Arten werden an Hand von Plankton-material beschrieben. Bei zwei der Spezies aus dem Plankton handelt es sich wahrscheinlich um P. dimorphus und P. pilosimanus. Die anderen Arten wurden nicht bestimmt. Die Merkmale der bekannten Larven aus der Parapagurus-Gruppe werden zusammengestellt. Sie stimmen vorwiegend mit denen der Diogenidae berein, obgleich die erwachsenen Parapagurus im wesentlichen Charaktere der Paguridae aufweisen.
20105816|The settlement of the puerulus stage of the Red Spiny Lobster (Panulirus interruptus) was measured in Baha Tortugas, Baja California, using artificial collectors of the GuSi type. In the period 1993-1995 monthly sampling during the new moon phase was carried out. Catch rates per collector ranged from 1 to 10 pueruli. Mean catch per site ranged from 0 to 2.52 puerulus/collector/new moon phase. The general settlement pattern showed a conspicuous seasonal cycle where autumn was the dominant season, during spring there was a second minor peak. In both years September and October showed the highest catches, but September 1994 to February 1995 was a longer settlement period with maximum catches. The carapace length varied from 6.5 to 33.5 mm, 7.5 mm being the most frequent size. The season of maximum settlement seems to be related with a maximum sea temperature (20 to 21C) which in Baja California occurs during the autumn. /// L'tablissement du stade puerulus de la langouste rouge (Panulirus interruptus) a t mesur dans la Baie de Tortugas en Basse Californie en employant des collecteurs artificiels du type GuSi. Les observations ont t mensuelles, pendant chaque nouvelle lune, de 1993  1995. Les taux de capture par collecteur varient de 1  10 pueruli. Le taux moyen de capture par site a t de 0  2,52 puerulus/collecteur/phase nouvelle lune. Les modalits de l'tablissement ont montr un cycle saisonnier trs net avec comme saison dominante l'automne et l'existence pendant le printemps d'un deuxime pic moins lev. Pour les deux annes, on a enregistr les captures maximales en septembre et octobre; cependant de septembre 1994  fvrier 1995 il y a eu une priode plus longue d'tablissement avec des captures maximales. La longueur du cphalothorax dans les chantillons variait de 6,5  33,5 mm. La saison d'tablissement maximal parat tre en relation avec la temprature maximale de la mer (20  21C), ce qui arrive en automne dans la Basse Californie.
20104544|Une nouvelle espce du genre Cheiriphotis Walker est dcrite des eaux iraquiennes du golfe Arabique. Elle est compare  C. megacheles, qui est redcrite ici. C'est la premire fois que le genre est signal dans le golfe Arabique.
20105457|El Nio probably is the main oceanographic phenomenon in the California region. Yet, little has been investigated about changes in the epipelagic copepod communities related to El Nio conditions, particularly off the Baja California area. Thus, a survey is presented here that compares the structure of the local copepod winter community off Southern Baja California, during the 1982-83 El Nio (EN) and in a non-El Nio (NEN) period (1984). In the NEN survey, the community was dominated by Pleuromamma abdominalis, Euchaeta marina, and Paracalanus parvus, which together constituted 43% of overall copepod numbers. The proportion of tropical species was 87%. In contrast, during the EN period species of Subeucalanus were dominant, and the tropical species represented up to 95% of total species diversity. The effect of EN showed latitudinal variations that would depend largely on the reaches of the warm water intrusion to the north. As compared with the NEN period, El Nio conditions showed a higher overall density and a higher proportion of tropical species along the N-S gradient. The copepod community structure off the Baja California area seems to respond sharply to the conditions set by EN. Density, species richness, or diversity alone might be misleading in identifying EN-NEN changes in the Baja California copepod community. /// El Nio est probablement le phnomne ocanographique majeur dans la rgion californienne. Peu de recherches ont t menes sur les changements concernant les communauts piplagiques de coppodes en relation avec les conditions d'El Nio, en particulier au large de la rgion de la Basse Californie. Une tude est prsente ici, comparant la structure de la communaut coppodologique hivernale locale au large de la Basse Californie mridionale au cours d'El Nio (EN) 1982-83 et une priode sans El Nio (NEN) (1984). Dans l'tude sur NEN, la communaut tait domine par Pleuromamma abdominalis, Euchaeta marina et Paracalanus parvus, qui constituent ensemble 43% de la totalit des coppodes. La proportion d'espces tropicales tait de 87%. En revanche, au cours de la priode EN, les espces de Subeucalanus taient dominantes, et les espces tropicales reprsentaient jusqu' 95% de la diversit totale des espces. L'effet de EN montrait une variation latitudinale. Des changements ont montr des variations latitudinales dpendant largement des limites nord des remontes d'eau chaude. Compare avec la priode NEN, la priode avec El Nio a montr une densit totale suprieure et une proportion plus leve d'espces tropicales le long du gradient N-S. La structure de la communaut de coppodes au large de la Basse Californie semble ragir nettement aux conditions de EN. La densit, la richesse spcifique ou la diversit seule pourraient tre cause d'erreur lors de l'analyse des changements induits par la succession de priodes EN-NEN dans la communaut de coppodes de Basse Californie.
20101636|Forficatocaris n. gen., a second genus in the harpacticoid family Parastenocaridae, is described. All species belonging to this new genus (F. noodti n. sp., F. amazonensis (Noodt, 1963), F. tetracantha (Noodt, 1963), F. forficata (Noodt, 1963) and F. guarani (Noodt, 1963)) inhabit limnic sands in the Neotropics. Figures, tables, and a dichotomous key show the main morphological features of the highly modified forms, adapted to interstitial life.
27743236|A parasitic copepod, Amaterasia amanoiwatoi nov. gen., nov. sp. (Siphonostomatoida, Amaterasidae nov. fam.) is described together with its juveniles, including the copepodid stages, based on specimens recovered from galls formed on the fins of the fish, Xanthichthys lineopunctatus (Hollard, 1854), taken off Clarion Island, eastern Pacific, in 1957. This species resembles pandarid copepods, but is distinct in some characteristic features. It has gall-forming juveniles in its life cycle, which are referred to here as encysted copepodid stage. An advanced encysted copepodid 5 yielded an adult female developing inside it, on which the description of this new species is based. The encysted copepodid encysts and lodges inside a gall, with its caudal rami extending partly beyond the posterior orifice of the gall. All stages found probably are females. The encysted copepodid ingests exudates from the host through a ventral hole in the cyst wall. The encysted copepodid 1 is compared with caligid and pandarid copepodids. Some speculations are made on the possible life history of this species. /// Un coppode parasite, Amaterasia amanoiwatoi nov. gen., nov. sp. (Siphonostomatoida, Amaterasidae nov. fam.) est dcrit ainsi que ses stades de dveloppement, incluant les stades coppoditiques,  partir de spcimens obtenus de galles formes sur les nageoires du poisson Xanthichthys lineopunctatus (Hollard, 1854), pris en 1957 au large de l'le Clarion, Pacifique oriental. Cette espce ressemble aux coppodes pandarides, mais s'en distingue par certains traits caractristiques. Il prsente, au cours de son cycle de vie, des stades juvniles formant des galles, qui sont dsigns ici comme stade coppoditique enkyst. Un coppodite 5 enkyst avait produit,  l'intrieur du kyste, une femelle adulte  partir de laquelle est fonde la description de cette nouvelle espce. Le coppodite s'enkyste et loge  l'intrieur de la galle, avec ses rames furcales dpassant de l'orifice postrieur de la galle. Tous les stades trouvs sont probablement femelles. Le coppodite enkyst ingre les exsudats de l'hte  travers un "trou" ventral de la paroi du kyste. Le coppodite enkyst l est compar aux coppodites de caligides et de pandarides. Des hypothses sont proposes sur l'histoire possible de la vie de cette espce.

20102195|(1) Description of a new genus and new species of Diastylidae, Atlantistylis chauvini, from deep waters of the tropical Atlantic. This genus is characterized by having the telson shorter than the last somite, without lateral spines, whereas the inner ramus of the uropod of the male is twosegmented. The female has an exopod on the third maxilliped. (2)Description of a new species of Pseudodiastylis (Lampropidae), P. delamarei, characterized by the presence of ridges on the carapace.
20107707|A new species of spiny lobster, Palinurus barbarae, is described from catches made at Walters Shoals, a high-seas submerged seamount on the Madagascar Ridge, south-western Indian Ocean. Morphology and mitochondrial DNA analyses place the species closest to Palinurus delagoae, which is found in deep-shelf waters off South Africa and Mozambique. The carapace of P. barbarae is more spinose than that of P. delagoae, and the posterior carapace rim terminates in a smooth groove and raised angular lip (groove absent in P. delagoae). Spine counts on antennal peduncles and pleural edges of abdominal somites further differentiate between the two species. Our findings cast some doubt on the present taxonomic classification of Palinurus in the south-western Indian Ocean, particularly on the status of the Palinurus spp. from southern Madagascar, approximately 400 nautical miles north of Walters Shoals. /// Eine neue Langustenart, Palinurus barbarae, wird aus Fngen vom Walters Shoals, einem untermeerischen Seeberg des Madagaskar-Rckens, im sdwestlichen Indischen Ozean beschrieben. Nach Analysen des Krperbaus und der mitochondrialen DNA steht die neue Art Palinurus delagoae am nchsten, die in greren Tiefen auf dem Schelf vor Sdafrika und Mozambique vorkommt. Der Carapax von P. barbarae ist bestachelter als der von P. delagoae und sein Hinterrand endet in einer glatten Furche und einer erhobenen Lippe an der Ecke (Furche fehlt bei P. delagoae). Auerdem unterscheiden sich beide Arten in der Dornenzahl auf den Grundgliedern der Antennen und an den Pleuralrndern der Pleonsegmente. Durch unsere Befunde ergeben sich Zweifel an der gltigen taxonomischen Einordnung der Palinurus-Arten des sdwestlichen Indischen Ozeans. Insbesondere betrifft das den Status der Arten von Sdmadagaskar, das ungefhr 400 Seemeilen nrdlich von Walters Shoals gelegen ist.
20102896|Etude de l'effet des injections d'extraits des diffrentes parties du systme nerveux sur les chromatophores blancs d'Uca annulipes. Pour les extraits prpars  l'eau de mer, ceux de pdoncules oculaires, de ganglions optiques, de la glande du sinus et du ganglion supraoesophagien provoquaient la dispersion des pigments blancs; les extraits de pdoncules oculaires, de ganglions optiques, de connectifs circumoesophagiens, et,  un degr de beaucoup moindre, ceux du ganglion thoracique et du ganglion supraoesophagien, avaient un effet de concentration des pigments blancs. Dans les tissus nerveux prpars dans l'actone, deux hormones taient prsentes dans toutes les parties du systme nerveux. Les fractions solubles dans l'actone avaient une activit de concentration des pigments blancs, les fractions non-solubles une activit de dispersion.

20104183|La prsence des embryons dans les cavits du manteau de Balanus amphitrite et Balanus variegatus a t contrle pendant deux annes. Les saisons de reproduction de ces espces sont similaires; il n'y a qu'une faible activit reproductrice en automne, puis une augmentation graduelle pendant l'hiver, avec une pointe au printemps et en t. L'tablissement des deux espces se produit principalement dans l't. Les stades larvaires de B. amphitrite et B. variegatus sont dcrits d'aprs des larves leves en laboratoire. Trois stades larvaires (N II, N III, N VI) des deux espces sont semblabes. On peut sparer les stades naupliens N I, N IV et N V par des diffrences dans les soies larvaires. 20106265|The harpacticoid copepod Tigriopus californicus was introduced into culture dishes containing either mimics, extract, or fragments of two macroalgae commonly found in the copepod's supralittoral habitat: the tubular Enteromorpha compressa and the encrusting, Ralfsia-like alternate phase of Scytosiphon lomentaria in equal abundance. Natural and artificial food sources were offered equivalently with control substrata and the copepod's position relative to each surface was recorded on videotape over a 12-hour period. The copepods preferred experimental treatments to controls immediately after introduction (within 1 hour) but favored the controls after 12 hours. This suggests either (1) a more random orientation after an initial feeding to relieve starvation; or (2) over time, dissolved organic material more fully permeated the water in each dish. The copepods also preferred the extract of S. lomentaria crust to that of E. compressa, perhaps due to a higher content of dissolved organic matter in the former treatments. Extracts of both algae were preferred over their respective mimics, suggesting a chemical (non-visual) response to dissolved organic matter. /// Le coppode harpacticode Tigriopus californicus a t introduit dans des botes de culture contenant soit des imitations, soit un extrait, soit des fragments de deux macroalgues communment trouves dans l'habitat supralittoral du coppode: l'algue tubulaire Enteromorpha compressa et l'algue incrustante, dans sa phase ressemblant  Ralfsia, Scytosiphon lomentaria, en quantits gales. Les nourritures naturelles et artificielles taient offertes en quantits quivalentes avec un substrat tmoin et la position du coppode sur chaque surface tait enregistr sur bande vido sur une priode de 12 heures. Les coppodes ont prfr les traitements exprimentaux aux tmoins, ds leur introduction (pendant une heure), mais ont prfr les tmoins aprs 12 heures. Ceci suggre soit (1) une orientation plus au hasard, aprs une alimentation initiale pour couper le jene; ou (2) le temps coul, la matire organique dissoute s'est rpandue plus largement dans la bote. Les coppodes ont prfr aussi l'extrait de S. lomentaria  celui de E. compressa, peut-tre en raison du contenu plus lev en matire organique dissoute dans les premiers traitements. Les extraits des deux algues taient prfrs  leurs imitations, suggrant une rponse chimique (non visuelle)  la matire organique dissoute.
20102520|La relation entre la teneur en eau et la respiration des tissus du corps, avec rfrence au cycle de mue, a t dtermine pour Balanus balanoides. La teneur en eau et le quotient respiratoire prsentent un cycle en corrlation avec le cycle de mue, qui est analogue  celui dcrit pour beaucoup d'autres Crustacs. Une comparaison avec d'autres Crustacs montre un maximum plus lev dans la teneur en eau, ce qui est en relation avec l'absence d'un exosquelette calcifi, la rapidit de la mue et la faiblesse relative de l'accroissement de taille  la mue. Le cycle de respiration ressemble troitement  celui de palaemon serratus (de Naples), et d'autres analogies laissent supposer que les mcanismes de contrle puissent tre les mmes dans les deux cas. Le contrle hormonal de ces processus est discut.

20107724|In Dikerogammarus villosus and Gammarus p. pulex, a lock-on mechanism for amplexus was found. Large pores on the first and fifth female pereionites are involved, as well as the first pair of male gnathopods. On the anterior edge of pereionite 1 and the posterior edge of pereionite 5, specialized areas were found that allow penetration of the male's dactyli in the inter-segmental spaces of the female. Also, a guidance system for male attachment to the female was found using palmar spines of the first pair of gnathopods. The mechanism is described and discussed. Morphometric analysis of this lock-on system explains the strong size-relationship between partners. /// Chez Dikerogammarus villosus et Gammarus pulex, un mcanisme de verrouillage lors de la prcopulation a t mis en vidence. Des pores de grande taille situs sur les premiers et cinquimes prionites de la femelle sont impliqus, ainsi que la premire paire de gnathopodes mles. Sur le bord antrieur du premier prionite, et le bord postrieur du cinquime prionite, des aires spcialises ont t observes, qui permettent la pntration des dactyles du mle dans les espaces inter-segmentaires de la femelle. De mme, un systme de guidage pour l'attachement du mle  la femelle a t trouv, utilisant les pines palmaires de la premire paire de gnathopodes. Le mcanisme est dcrit et discut. L'analyse morphomtrique de ce systme de verrouillage explique la forte relation lie  la taille entre partenaires.
20102660|Among the Amphipoda, the genus Ingolfiella (suborder Ingolfiellidea) represents a type of extreme adaptation to the mesopsammal. The distribution of the 11 species hitherto known is discussed. They extend from the marine abyssal to the high mountain chain and thereby offer some good examples for the immigration of marine interstitial forms into the fresh groundwater. The possibility of the existence of such interstitial animals in the upper detritus layer of abyssal soft bottom is indicated. To the two hitherto known neotropic species, I. ruffoi and I. manni, a third species, I. uspallatae n. sp. from the Argentinian Andes, is added. It is described and figured. The species formerly described as Ingolfiella chilensis, on the contrary, does not belong to the Ingolfiellidea and is placed in a new genus: Pseudingolfiella n. gen. This genus has relationships with Bogidiella and thus belongs to the suborder Gammaridea. The external conformity of Ingolfiella and Pseudingolfiella n. gen. provides an impressive new example of convergent evolution of the "Lebensformtyp" Mesopsammon.
20104754|Cet article traite des trois espces suivantes de Laophontidae du meiobenthos de l'le d'Ischia (Naples, Italie): Afrolaophonte pori Masry, 1970: c'est la premire fois que l'espce est trouve hors de la localit type. Une redescription complte en est donne. La deuxime espce, Echinolaophonte armiger typica Lang, 1965, est nouvelle pour le benthos littoral d'Ischia. La dernire espce, E. veniliae n. sp., recueillie dans un environnement interstitiel, est dcrite en dtail et discute. Cette espce est principalement caractrise par l'arrangement des traits suivants: morphologie du processus dorsal du cphalothorax, maxillule sans endopodite, chtotaxie de P2-P4, endopodite de P4 () extrmement rduit. Enfin, les auteurs prsentent des remarques sur la taxonomie du genre Echinolaophonte et suggrent l'tablissement de deux groupes-espces.

20101876|Autumn and winter collections of decapod crustaceans in Chesapeake Bight suggest that the region may be divided into three zoogeographical zones: The Gulf Stream with its attendant tropical and southern fauna; the environmentally stable outer continental shelf and upper slope where C. irroratus, H. americanus, and M. iris are abundant; and the seasonally variable inner shelf which may support tropical or boreal species at certain seasons, but where the fauna is dominated by Virginian species such as C. irroratus and O. ocellatus. /// Les rcoltes d'automne et d'hiver de Crustacs Dcapodes au bord des ctes de la rgion de la Baie de Chesapeake suggrent que celle-ci peut-tre divise en trois zones zoogographiques: en premier lieu, le Gulf Stream, avec sa faune tropicale et du sud; ensuite, la bordure continentale extrieure et la pente suprieure, au milieu stable, o C.irroratus, H. americanus et M. iris sont abondants; et enfin la bordure intrieure variant avec les saisons et o on peut trouver des espces tropicales ou borales  certaines saisons, mais o la faune est domine par les espces de Virginie, telles que C. irroratus et O. ocellatus.

20105050|A new species of a blind terrestrial isopod, Haloniscus anophthalmus, from anchialine waters in a cave on the Isle of Pines, New Caledonia, is described. 20111464|The biochemical composition and the activity of five digestive enzymes of embryos were studied during embryonic development in the redclaw crayfish, Cherax quadricarinatus (Von Martens, 1868), in order to investigate the relationship between embryonic development and the utilization of yolk. Carbohydrates remained a minor constituent of the yolk as a whole. The contents of total proteins and total amino acids (TAA) were all observed to decrease. Among the essential amino acids (EAA), the contents of leucine and arginine were relatively high, while of the non-essential amino acids (NEAA), the most important components were glutamine and aspartic acid. The contents of total lipids (TL) decreased during embryonic development, and the predominant fatty acids of both neutral lipids (NL) and polar lipids (PL) were C16:0, C18:0, C18:19, and C18:33. The five digestive enzymes tested all showed changes in their activities. The specific activities of pepsin and trypsin gradually increased in the earlier stages of embryonic development, pepsin decreased rapidly in later stages, while trypsin still kept a high level of activity. The specific activity of amylase changed in a "V" shape and reached high values again in later stages. The specific activities of cellulase and lipase showed relatively low values. It is shown that carbohydrates may play an important role in synthesizing many specific compounds to participate in signal transmission and in forming the carapace. Proteins and lipids were the dominating construction and energy substances; proteins were primarily consumed in the early stages, as against lipids in later stages. Saturated fatty acids (SFA) (16:0 and 18:0) and monounsaturated fatty acids (MUFA) (16:17 and 18:19) were always used for energetic purposes and polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFA) (20:53 and 22:63) were important as structural components of cell membranes and in the development of the central nervous system. The activities of the digestive enzymes were controlled by their genes and expressed sequentially during embryonic development. They hydrolyse the yolk and provide construction substances and energy sources for the formation of tissues, organs, and various systems in general. /// La composition biochimique et l'activit de cinq enzymes digestives d'embryons ont t tudies au cours du dveloppement embryonnaire de l'crevisse  patte rouge, Cherax quadricarinatus (Von Martens, 1868), dans le but d'investiguer les inter-relations entre le dveloppement embryonnaire et l'utilisation du vitellus. Les glucides reprsentent un constituant mineur du vitellus. Les contenus en protines totales et en acides amins totaux (TAA) diminuent. Parmi les AA essentiels (EAA), les contenus en leucine et arginine ont t relativement levs, tandis que parmi les acides amins non-essentiels (NEAA), les composs les plus importants ont t la glutamine et l'acide aspartique. Les contenus en lipides totaux (TL) diminuent au cours du dveloppement embryonnaire, et les acides gras prdominants parmi,  la fois les lipides neutres (NL) et les lipides polaires (PL), taient C16:0, C18:0, C18:19, et C18:33. Les cinq enzymes digestives testes montrent toutes un changement dans leur activit. Les activits spcifiques de la pepsine et de la trypsine augmentent progressivement au cours des premiers stades du dveloppement embryonnaire, la pepsine dcrot rapidement dans les derniers stades, tandis que la trypsine conserve un degr d'activit lev. L'activit spcifique de l'amylase change selon une forme en V et atteint  nouveau un niveau lev dans les derniers stades. Les activits spcifiques de la cellulase et de la lipase montrent des valeurs relativement basses. Il est montr que les glucides pourraient jouer un rle important en synthtisant de nombreux composs spcifiques pour participer au signal de transmission et  la formation de la carapace. Les protines et les lipides ont t les substances dominantes pour la construction et l'nergie; les protines ont t prioritairement utilises dans les jeunes stades et les lipides dans les derniers stades. Les acides gras saturs (SFA) (16:0 et 18:0) et les acides gras mono-unsaturs (MUFA) (16:17 et 18:19) ont toujours t utiliss pour les besoins nergtiques, et les acides gras poly-unsaturs (PUFA) (20:53 et 22:63) ont t important comme composs structurels des membranes cellulaires et dans le dveloppement du systme nerveux. Les activits des enzymes digestives ont t contrles par leur gnes et exprims squentiellement au cours du dveloppement. Elles hydrolysent le vitellus et fournissent les substances de construction et la source d'nergie pour la formation des tissus, des organes et des diffrents systmes.
20105319|A taxonomical study was made of species of the genus Euchirella recently collected from the Flores Sea, Indonesia. Six species, E. bella Giesbrecht, 1888, E. curticauda Giesbrecht, 1888, E. galeata Giesbrecht, 1888, E. maxima Wolfenden, 1905, E. messinensis indica Vervoort, 1949, and E. pulchra (Lubbock, 1863), were recorded in the present samples. Descriptions, measurements, and figures are given for all these species, along with a review of their distribution over the world's oceans, with taxonomical remarks, ecological notes, and restricted synonymies. /// Une tude taxonomique a t ralise chez les espces du genre Euchirella rcemment collectes de la mer de Flores, Indonsie. Six espces d'Euchirella, E. bella Giesbrecht, 1888, E. curticauda Giesbrecht, 1888, E. galeata Giesbrecht, 1888, E. maxima Wolfenden, 1905, E. messinensis indica Vervoort, 1949, et E. pulchra (Lubbock, 1856) ont t identifies dans les chantillons. Les descriptions, les mesures et les figures sont donnes pour toutes ces espces, ainsi qu'une revue de leur rpartition dans les ocans du monde, avec des remarques taxonomiques, des notes sur leur cologie et des synonymies succinctes.

20696262|The present study describes two new species of the hitherto monotypic potamid genus Sinolapotamon Tai & Sung, 1975, from Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region, China. 27743321|Life-history trade-offs can be defined as the beneficial side-effects of a species' evolutionary reaction that has the purpose of solving problems caused by environmental constraints. In this study, the life-history trade-offs of the dominant cladoceran, Diaphanosoma brachyurum (Lievin, 1848) were studied in Lake Piaseczno (Poland). Size at maturity (SAM), the proportion of ovigerous females, brood size, and the depth-selection behaviour of D. brachyurum were determined. The contribution of D. brachyurum and of other cladocerans to the diet of fish was also quantified. The investigation showed that fecundity was low, and that the species did not perform diel vertical migrations. The results obtained further indicate that D. brachyurum, in contrast to other cladocerans recorded from the lake, was not affected by fish predation, as the fish appeared to ignore this species. Thus, although D. brachyurum did not exhibit any apparent life-history trade-offs, it must have profited from fish predation pressure reducing the density of competitive cladoceran populations, which might well be indicated by the fact that D. brachyurum densities rose in correlation with an increased predation pressure of fish in early summer, on (a significant part of) the remaining species of cladocerans. /// Les compromis de traits d'histoire de vie peuvent tre dfinis comme des effets secondaires bnfiques de la raction volutive d'une espce dont le but est de rsoudre les problmes poss par des contraintes environnementales. Dans cette tude les compromis de traits d'histoire de vie du Cladocre dominante Diaphanosoma brachyurum (Lievin, 1848) ont t tudis dans le lac Piaseczno (Pologne). La taille  la maturit (SAM), la proportion de femelles ovigres, la taille de la ponte et le comportement de slection de la profondeur de D. brachyurum ont t dtermins. La contribution de D. brachyurum et d'autres Cladocres au rgime alimentaire des poissons a aussi t quantifie. Les recherches montrent que la fcondit tait basse et que les espces n'effectuent pas de migrations verticales journalires. Les rsultats obtenus indiquent que D. brachyurum, contrairement aux autres Cladocres trouvs dans le lac, n'a pas t affect par la prdation par les poissons, car les poissons semblent ignorer cette espce. Ainsi, alors que D. brachyurum ne prsente aucun apparent compromis de traits d'histoire de vie, elle a d bnficier de la pression de prdation par les poissons rduisant la densit des populations des autres Cladocres en comptition; ce qui semble indiqu par le fait que les densits de D. brachyurum s'lvent en corrlation avec l'augmentation de la pression de prdation par les poissons en dbut d't sur (une partie significative) des autres espces de Cladocres.

20106042|The deep-water mud shrimp Solenocera melantho is one of the most dominant species in the benthic community of Kagoshima Bay, southern Japan, and is commercially important as the main target species for small-scale trawlers. The reproductive aspects such as ovarian maturation, size at sexual maturity, and spawning season were examined using a large number of female specimens collected from the central area of the bay. This species exhibits an asynchronous type of ovary that contains oocytes of various developmental stages. Ovarian maturity stages were divided into four categories based on the developmental stage of the most advanced oocytes in the ovary: quiescent, developing, early ripe, and ripe. The ripe ovaries contain permaturation-stage oocytes where cortical crypts are found in the peripheral part. Females with ripe ovaries were defined as mature females which would spawn within a few days. The size at sexual maturity of females was estimated to be 25.3 mm in carapace length (1-year old). The gonadosomatic index (GSI = 100  gonadal weight/body weight) was significantly increased with the progress of ovarian maturation, and most females with GSI  12 were mature. The spawning season was estimated to continue from June to December with its peak during October and November. In the early spawning season, only the 2- and 3-year old groups of females matured. Young females in the 1-year old group matured from July to December. /// La crevette d'eau profonde Solenocera melantho est l'une des espces les plus dominantes dans la communaut benthique de la baie de Kagoshima, Japon mridional. Elle est commercialement importante en tant qu'espce principale recherche par les petits chalutiers. Ses aspects reproductifs, comme maturation ovarienne, taille  la maturit sexuelle, et saison de ponte, ont t examins d'aprs un grand nombre de femelles rcoltes dans la zone centrale de la baie. Cette espce montre un type d'ovaire asynchrone contenant des oocytes  divers stades de dveloppement. Les stades de maturit ovarienne ont t diviss en quatre catgories d'aprs le stade des oocytes les plus avancs dans l'ovaire: quiescent, en dveloppement, presque mr et mrs. Les ovaires mrs contiennent des oocytes au stade de prmaturation, o l'on trouve des cryptes corticales  la priphrie. Les femelles  ovaires mrs ont t dfinies comme des femelles  maturit qui pondraient dans les quelques jours. La taille  la maturit sexuelle des femelles a t estime  25.3 mm de longueur de carapace (1 an d'ge). L'index gonadosomatique (GSI = 100  poids des gonades/poids du corps) s'accroissait de faon significative avec le progrs de la maturation ovarienne et la plupart des femelles  GSI  12 taient mres. La saison de ponte a t estime comme se poursuivant de juin  dcembre, avec un pic en octobre et novembre. Au dbut de la saison de ponte, seules arrivaient  maturit les femelles ages de 2 et 3 ans. Les jeunes femelles du groupe d'un an d'ge murissaient de juillet  dcembre.
20105261|No significant difference was observed in the size composition of the pairs of Uca lactea mating on the surface and those mating underground. Most crabs did not select their mates by size. The fact that the size of the tips of the male pleopods and that of the female gonopores does not increase after the crabs have reached a carapace width of 14 mm, makes it possible for crabs of different sizes to copulate. Wandering females that were enticed by waving males had a well-developed ovary. However, the ovary of females that mated on the surface could be in various stages of development. /// Aucune diffrence significative n'a t observe dans la composition en taille des couples de Uca lactea s'accouplant  la surface et celles s'accouplant sous terre. 20104905|The larvae of 29 species of Natantia (Decapoda) have been collected in Tigullio Gulf (Ligurian Sea). In addition, four different "types" of unidentified first zoeae of Pandalidae were recognized and discussed. Using the similitude index of Srensen (1948), it was possible to distinguish main groups of spring-summer and annual species and small groups of late-summer and autumn-winter ones. Comparison of the results obtained with data from other works on Mediterranean planktonic decapod larvae reveals some discrepancies regarding the number of collected species and their distribution throughout the year. These different results could be due to different collecting methods, environmental conditions, and geographical distribution of the adults. The work shows the importance of studying planktonic larvae for a better knowledge of larval development and life history of Crustacea Decapoda. /// In una serie di raccolte planctoniche condotte per un anno nel golfo del Tigullio (mar Ligure) sono state pescate ed identificate le larve di 29 specie di Natantia (Decapoda); inoltre  stata rilevata la presenza di zoee, del primo stadio, attibuite a 4 diversi "tipi" di Pandalidi, che vengono descritte e discusse. L'indice di similitudine di Srensen (1948) ha permesso di individuare gruppi principali di specie primaverili-estive ed annuali e gruppi minori di specie tardo estive ed autunnoinvernali. Confrontando i risultati ottenuti con quelli relativi ad altre aree mediterranee, si sono evidenziate alcune discrepanze riguardo al numero di specie raccolte ed alla presenza durante l'anno. Si ipotizza che ci sia legato ai diversi metodi di campionamento, alle zone di raccolta, alla distribuzione dell'adulto. Si sottolinea infine l'importanza dello studio delle larve planctoniche per una migliore conoscenza dello sviluppo e dei cicli vitali dei Decapodi.
20104133|Review of recent collections and older material in the U.S. National Museum of Natural History and the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia has confirmed the occurrence of six species of fiddler crabs on the island of Jamaica. The discovery of a colony of Uca major in Kingston Harbor has suggested that it was this species rather than the South American form, U. m. maracoani, that formed the basis of a disputed 18th-century identification by Sir Hans Sloane. At the same time another South American species, U. cumulanta, was found to be well represented on the mud flats around Kingston Harbor. The remaining four species are typical of the Caribbean. U. rapax and U. t. thayeri occur in muds associated with mangrove swamps, U. leptodactyla was found on sand, and U. burgersi occupied habitats on both sandy and muddy substrates ranging in salinity from brackish to seasonally hypersaline. U. v. vocator has yet to be reported from Jamaica although it is known from estuaries and mud flats on other islands of the Caribbean. Evidence of female reproductive activity was found in samples of all species, except U. rapax and U. burgersi, collected one to three days before new moon in late March, 1982. Past habitats of fiddler crabs in Kingston Harbor have been extensively modified by pollution, dredging, and filling. A growing body of literature has demonstrated the sensitivity of fiddler crabs to such environmental stresses and pointed to the usefulness of the animals as bioindicators of alterations of local intertidal habitats. /// L'examen de collections rcentes et de matriel plus ancien de l'U.S. National Museum of Natural History a confirm la prsence de six espces d'Uca sur l'le de la Jamaque. La dcouverte d'une colonie d'Uca major  Kingston Harbor laisse supposer que c'est cette espce, plutt que la forme sud-amricaine U. m. maracoani, qui est  la base d'une identification discute du 18me sicle, par Sir Hans Sloane. En mme temps une autre espce sud-americaine, U. cumulanta, a t trouve, bien reprsente, sur les platiers vaseux autour de Kingston Harbor. Les quatre autres espces sont typiques des Carabes. U. rapax et U. t. thayeri vivent dans les vases associes  la mangrove, U. leptodactyla sur le sable, alors qu'U. burgersi habite sur les substrats sableux et vaseux qui s'chelonnent en salinit du saumtre  l'hypersalin saisonnier. U. v. vocator n'a pas encore t signal de la Jamaque, bien qu'il soit connu des estuaires et des platiers vaseux sur les autres les des Carabes. Des manifestations de l'activit reproductrice de la femelle ont t trouves chez des chantillons de toutes les espces,  l'exception d'U. rapax et U. burgersi, recueillis de un  trois jours avant la nouvelle lune, fin mars 1982. Les habitats ancients d'Uca  Kingston Harbor ont t fortement modifis par la pollution, les dragages et remblayages. Un nombre croissant de publications ont montr la sensibilit des Uca  de tels stress et l'utilit de ces animaux comme bio-indicateurs des altrations des habitats intertidaux locaux.

20105677|This paper provides a literature review of the presence of the calanoid copepod Dussartius baeticus (Dussart, 1967) in Portuguese fresh waters. The information gathered shows that the known records of the species are restricted to the upper Tejo estuary, the Caniada reservoir belonging to the Cvado drainage basin, and four reservoirs belonging to the Mondego system (Aguieira, Raiva, Fronhas, and Lagoa Comprida). Thus, to increase our knowledge of the geographical distribution and the ecology of the species, a comprehensive survey would be appropriate to provide further data on the dispersal and colonization pattern of the species in Portugal. /// Neste artigo apresenta-se uma reviso bibliogrfica relativa  presena do coppode calanide Dussartius baeticus (Dussart, 1967) nas guas doces portuguesas. A informao recolhida mostra que a presena desta espcie em Portugal se restringe ao troo superior do esturio do rio Tejo,  albufeira da Caniada, localizada na bacia do rio Cvado, e a quatro albufeiras situadas na bacia hidrogrfica do rio Mondego (Aguieira, Raiva, Fronhas e Lagoa Comprida). Assim, visando aprofundar o nosso conhecimento sobre a distribuio geogrfica e a ecologia desta espcie, considera-se desejvel proceder  obteno de dados sobre o seu padro de disperso e colonizao no nosso Pas.

20107655|A new record of the leptostracan, Nebalia straus Risso, 1827 (Phyllocarida, Leptostraca) is reported from specimens collected at two sampling stations in Izmir Bay, Aegean Sea coast of Turkey between 2001 and 2002. The species is characterized by having a long antennular flagellum that bears up to 11-12 articles (in mature females), a long antennular scale 2.5 times as long as wide, a second maxilla with an exopod slightly longer than the first article of the endopod, and a stout distal spine on the fourth article of the antennule (two in ovigerous females). N. straus is recorded here for the first time from the eastern Mediterranean. /// Une nouvelle trouvaille du leptostrac Nebalia straus Risso, 1827 (Phyllocarida, Leptostraca) est rapporte  partir de spcimens collects dans deux stations d'chantillonnages de la baie d'Izmir, sur la cte turque de la mer Ege entre 2001 et 2002. Cette espce est caractrise par la prsence d'un long flagelle antennulaire qui porte jusqu' 11-12 articles (chez les femelles matures), une longue caille antennulaire 2,5 fois aussi longue que large, une seconde maxille avec un exopodite lgrement plus long que le premier article de l'endopodite, et une forte pine distale sur le quatrime article de l'antennule (deux chez les femelles ovigres). N. straus est signale ici pour la premire fois de la Mditerrane orientale.
20104385|Se indica la redescripcin completa y detallada de la especie Centropages ponticus Karavaev, 1895, perteneciente al "grupo hamatus". Se exponen y confirman las diferencias que la separan de las especies ms prximas, C. hamatus Lilljeborg y C. kryeri, con las que suele confudirse. As mismo, se citan y describen ciertas variaciones morfolgicas encontradas con ejemplares de otras localidades y se indican los primeros datos acerca de su distribucin y aspectos ecolgicos en la Baha de Cullera.
20103417|A large reproducing population of Cyathura polita occurs in the Saint John River estuary, New Brunswick, Canada. This is the first record from Canada and represents a 180 km northeastward extension of the known range for this species. A large portion of the Cyathura population occupies deep (20 m), mesohaline (0.1-20) water on bottoms of moderate silt-clay content. The population exhibits protogynic hermaphroditism, a phenomenon common to cyathurans. This occurrence, disjunct from the main center of Cyathura polita distribution to the south, may be a result of an earlier widespread distribution during the Hypsithermal Period with a subsequent fracturing of the range during recent cooler climatic conditions.
20107705|Until recently, the family Glypheidae (Decapoda, Reptantia) was known from fossils only, and consequently presumed extinct for 50 million years. However, in 1975 scientists of the Musum National d'Histoire Naturelle in Paris recognized a Recent specimen as belonging to this family. The specimen had been collected in the Phillippines in 1908 at approx. 200 m depth, and had remained unidentified in the collections of the Smithsonian Institution, Washington, D.C., since. That same year, the species was described as Neoglyphea inopinata Forest & de Saint Laurent, thus testifying the actual persistence of the group in today's marine fauna. Three expeditions in the same region, in 1976, 1980, and 1985, yielded another 20 specimens, all caught alive. The subsequent study of those specimens would indicate that the phylogenetic position assigned to the glypheids until then had, in fact, been erroneous. The same applied to the other mesozoic families included in the superfamily Glypheoidea. The glypheoids had usually been placed next to the Scyllaridae and Eryonidae in the infraorder Palinura, and been considered probable ancestors of part of the remaining Decapoda Reptantia. However, their similarities would come out to result rather from analogous resemblances than from actual morphological affinities. In fact, after comparison of the principal characters of the three groups, we have been able to confirm that the Glypheoidea did not exhibit any true relationship with the two others. In contrast, they proved to be closer to the Astacidae and could, eventually, be ranked with those in the same infraorder. A number of recent publications, largely by palaeontologists and based in part on cladistic as well as molecular analyses, have lately supported this point of view. They completely reject the inclusion of the glypheoids in the Palinura, corroborate their affinities with the Astacidea, and exclude the possibility that they would represent a primitive group from which other Reptantia could have evolved. The lineage of the Glypheoidea most probably appeared in the Permian-Triassic, prospered in the Jurassic, and subsequently declined from the Cretaceous to the Eocene. It is apparent that the group has not become extinct during that era, but has silently persisted, without leaving fossil traces, with at least two representatives in today's living world. Indeed, a second species of glypheid has recently been discovered in the southwestern Pacific. Though described under the name Neoglyphea neocaledonica, it shows such differences with N. inopinata that I have established a new genus for this species, Laurentaeglyphea, which is even closer to the glypheids known from the Mesozoic and the Eocene. /// Jusqu' une poque rcente, la famille des Glypheidae (Dcapodes, Reptantia) n'tait connue qu' l'tat fossile et prsume teinte depuis cinquante millions d'annes. Cependant, en 1975, des chercheurs du Musum national d'Histoire naturelle  Paris reconnaissaient comme appartenant  cette famille un spcimen captur en 1908 aux les Philippines, par 200 m environ de profondeur, et rest non identifi depuis lors dans les collections de la Smithsonian Institution,  Washington. L'espce tait dcrite la mme anne sous le nom de Neoglyphea inopinata Forest & de Saint Laurent, attestant ainsi la persistance du groupe dans la faune marine actuelle. Trois campagnes de prospection sur les mmes lieux, en 1976, 1980 et 1985, permettaient d'en recueillir, vivants, une vingtaine d'autres exemplaires. Leur tude allait montrer que la position phyltique jusqu'alors assigne aux Glypheidae et aux autres familles msozoques incluses dans la super-famille des Glypheoidea, tait errone. Les Glypheodes avaient t gnralement placs  cot des Scyllarides et des Eryonides dans un infra-ordre des Palinura, et considrs comme les anctres probables d'une partie des autres Dcapodes Reptantia. Cependant ces rapprochements rsultaient plutt d'analogies que de relles affinits morphologiques. En fait, aprs comparaison des principales caractristiques des trois groupes, nous avons confirm que celui des Glyphodes n'offrait aucune parent avec les deux autres, mais au contraire taient beaucoup plus proches des Astacides et pouvaient tre ventuellement rangs avec ceux-ci, dans un mme infra-ordre. Une srie de publications rcentes, manant surtout de palontologistes, en partie fondes sur des analyses cladistiques et molculaires, sont venues appuyer ce point de vue. Elles rejettent totalement l'inclusion des Glypheoidea parmi les Palinura, insistent sur leurs affinits avec les autres Astacidea et cartent la possibilit qu'ils reprsentent un groupe primitif dont seraient issus d'autres Reptantia. La ligne des Glypheoidea, vraisemblablement apparue au Permo-Trias, a prospr au Jurassique, puis dclin du Crtac  l'Eocne. Il apparat maintenant qu'elle ne s'est pas teinte  cette poque, mais s'est prolonge discrtement, sans laisser de traces fossiles, avec au moins deux reprsentants dans le monde vivant. En effet, une seconde espce de Glyphide a rcemment t dcouverte dans le Pacifique sud occidental. Dcrite sous le nom de Neoglyphea neocaledonica, elle prsente avec N. inopinata de telles diffrences que j'ai tabli pour elle le nouveau genre Laurentaeglyphea, beaucoup plus proche des Glyphides du Msozoque et de l'ocne.

20102060|During an investigation of the copepod parasites of invertebrates at Tular (Madagascar), many specimens of a large lichomolgid copepod were collected from Othilia purpurea Gray, a starfish rarely found in that region. These specimens differed in so many respects from other lichomolgid genera that the erection of a new genus seemed justified: Botulosoma nov. gen. for B. endoarrhenum nov. sp. Females live in an integumental cavity of the host while males are free-living in the general coelomic cavity. A hypothesis about the mechanism of host infestation is proposed by the author after histological studies. The thick body wall of Othilia is perforated by gill papules. They might provide to infesting stages of Botulosoma a way to reach the internal cavity. Effectively, traces of papules tissue were still present around the abdomen of adult females of Botulosoma. During infestation, females appear to stay in the papules, while males would cross them, thus reaching the internal cavity.
20102263|On a specimen of Amphiura capensis Ljungman from Lderitz Bay (S.W. Africa), a single female of a cyclopoid copepod, Cancerilla oblonga n. sp., was found. The body is elongate, the cephalosome slightly broader than long, the following metasomal segments are not concealed by the tergal complex. The copepod was attached with the second antenna in the fourth tentacle pores of the ophiuroid, the cephalosome directed towards the center of the disk.
20787202|A small collection of unidentified decapod crustaceans from the island Santa Cruz de las Galpagos ("Indefatigable"), Galapagos Archipelago, Ecuador, located in the holdings of the Royal Belgian Institute of Natural Sciences, Brussels (RBINS), Belgium, was examined. A total of 63 lots containing 21 species was found, all collected in January and February, 1964, near the Darwin Station. All species had previously been reported from the Galpagos Archipelago and represent about 9.3% of the marine, shallow-water decapod fauna reported for the islands. Une petite collection de crustacs dcapodes non identifis de l'le Santa Cruz de las Galpagos ("Indefatigable" Island), archipel des Galapagos, en quateur, localise  l'Institut Royal des Sciences Naturelles de Bruxelles (IRScNB), Belgique, a t examine. Un total de 63 lots, contenant 21 espces ont t trouvs, toutes rcoltes en janvier et fvrier 1964, prs de la station Darwin. Toutes les espces avaient dj t signales dans l'archipel des Galapagos et elles reprsentent environ 9,3% de la faune marine des dcapodes des eaux peu profondes signal pour ces les.
20103617|Se cultivaron las larvas de Paralomis granulosa (Jacquinot) en condiciones de laboratorio, desde la eclosin hasta el estadio de megalopa, a una temperatura media de 11,2C y en agua de salinidad de 31 partes por mil. Las larvas eclosionan en avanzado estado de desarrollo y la fase larvaria comprende dos estadios de zoea y uno de megalopa. Se describen las principales caractersticas morfolgicas de cada estadio, incluyendo sus apndices funcionales. En el cultivo en que se provey alimento, el 34% de las larvas iniciales alcanz al estadio de megalopa, mientras que cuando no fueron alimentadas, solo el 17% de las zoeas iniciales mud a este estadio. En ambos experimentos el estadio de megalopa se alcanz en un tiempo medio de 10 dias. Se sealan las caracteristicas morfolgicas que permiten diferenciar las larvas de esta especie de aquellas de Lithodes antarcticus.
20103828|La distribution intertidale de Chaetogammarus marinus (Leach), C. stoerensis (Reid), Gammarus oceanicus Segerstrle, G. salinus Spooner, G. duebenii Lilljeborg, G. locusta (L.) et G. zaddachi Sexton est dcrite de plusieurs points choisis du Fjord d'Oslo. La large distribution le long des ctes du fjord de C. stoerensis et de G. salinus spcialement est en relation avec les fluctuations de salinit. Le gel tue beaucoup d'Amphipodes pendant l'hiver. La densit maximale observe sur les radiales correspond  la basse mer prcdant l'chantillonnage, mais l'arrive d'eau douce peut masquer cette rponse rapide. La distribution diurne et nocturne tait semblable le long de la radiale prospecte. C. marinus et C. stoerensis habitent un niveau qui, dans le Fjord d'Oslo se situe plus bas qu'ailleurs, en raison des amplitudes limites de la mare. La rgulation physique de la distribution suprieure des Amphipodes et des migrations saisonnires de population le long des radiales est mise en vidence.

20107807|The Chilean Patagonian lakes are characterized by their oligotrophy, high endemism, significant predominance of calanoid copepods in comparison to daphnid cladocerans, and low species richness. These characteristics are in marked contrast to the situation in North American lakes. In the present study, published information of chlorophyll concentrations and species richness for Chilean Patagonian lakes was considered. The results denoted direct correlations between chlorophyll concentration and species richness, as well as an inverse correlation between latitude and species richness, whereas a relationship between lake surface and species richness was not observed. The results obtained would indicate that the oligotrophic status of the sites studied is the main cause of low species richness. Our conclusions most probably reveal the existence of different regulator mechanisms in comparison to North American lakes. Ecological and biogeographical topics are discussed. /// Los lagos de la Patagonia Chilena se caracterizan por su oligotrofa, alto endemismo, marcado predominio de los coppodos calanoideos en comparacin a los cladceros daphnidos y una baja diversidad de especies. Estas caractersticas son marcadamente opuestas a los lagos de Amrica del Norte. En el presente estudio se consider informacin publicada para lagos de la Patagonia Chilena. Los resultados indicaron que la riqueza de especies estuvo directamente relacionada con la concentracin de clorofila, inversamente relacionada con la latitud, y no estuvo relacionada con la superficie del lago. Los resultados obtenidos en el presente estudio indican que la oligotrofa sera la causa principal de la baja riqueza de especies, y que habra una diferencia marcada en los mecanismos reguladores observados para lagos norteamericanos. Se discutieron aspectos ecolgicos y biogeogrficos en el presente estudio.
20106202|The historical discovery and the successive stages in our knowledge of the family Stenasellidae Dudich, 1924, are described. Their morphological features; the diagnosis of the family, and an updated list of its genera with the respective numbers of their taxa and their main characteristics are given. Also, the biogeography and the ecology of the group and relations between burrowing behaviour and general adaptation to life in all types of continental underground waters, are discussed. Next, the putative evolutionary history of the family is presented, taking into account the active dispersal of these isopods and also the role of Quaternary events: the development of aridity in the northern tropical zone and the occurrence of glaciations in the temperate zones of the Northern Hemisphere. Their general biological adaptation to the absence of circadian stimuli is examined vis--vis the fact that biological rhythms are synchronized with the annual flooding events in the subterranean environment. /// Dcouverte historique et progrs successifs de la connaissance de la famille des Stenasellidae Dudich, 1924. Caractres morphologiques originaux; diagnose de la famille; liste mise  jour des genres, nombre de leurs taxons et principales caractristiques. Biogographie et cologie du groupe; relations entre le comportement fouisseur et l'adaptation  la vie dans tous les types de milieux des eaux souterraines continentales. Histoire volutive prsume de la famille, tenant compte de la capacit d'expansion active de ces Isopodes et du rle des vnements quaternaires: dveloppement du climat aride dans la zone nord-tropicale et intervention des glaciations dans les zones tempres de l'hmisphre nord. Adaptation gnrale des processus biologiques  l'absence de stimuli externes circadiens, ces processus tant rythms par la pulsation annuelle du flux des eaux dans l'environnement souterrain, qui joue le rle d'un stimulus circannien.
20104541|Previous studies of the endocrine organs and frontomedial ocelli of the Isopoda revealed that structural differences exist in the hitherto observed suborders. The Phreatoicidea, the oldest known suborder, are studied for the first time. A Bellonci organ was not discovered. The sinus gland has a globular form, it seems to be linked with the lateral cephalic nerve plexus. Similar sinus glands are known from the Oniscidea. The median ocelli are reduced to the number of 3, while other Isopoda may have 2 to maximally 5 ocelli.
20102359|Die Zucht von Rhizocephala-Larven unter Laboratoriumsbedingungen ist ziemlich schwierig weil die Larven innerhalb kurzer Zeit an der Seewasseroberflche anhaften und frher oder spter zugrundegehen. Dieses Anhaften kann -- ohne merkbaren Schaden fr die Larven -- vermieden werden durch an der Wasseroberflche schwimmendes Cetylalkoholpulver. Die Larven einiger anderer Crustaceen, wie z.B. die Epicarida-Larven von Bopyrus haben ebenfalls eine starke Tendenz der Seewasseroberflche anzuhaften. Auch in diesen Fllen kann Cetylalkohol mit Erfolg angewandt werden.

20103852|Six espces de bopyres parasites sur des crevettes carides sont signales comme nouvelles pour la faune australienne. Trois espces, dont l'une appartient  un genre nouveau, sont dcrites: Bopyrella essingtoni et Bopyrina lobata spp. nov., et Gareia arafurae gen. nov., sp. nov.
20105524|The known distribution of Mesocyclops aspericornis in the Americas included the central and northern areas of South America and the insular Caribbean. It had not been collected before in continental North America. The analysis of samples collected in a pond in the state of Sinaloa, on the Pacific coast of Mexico, yielded female individuals of this species. The Mexican individuals tended to be smaller than the African females (1.14-1.20 mm vs 1.3-1.5 mm), but the morphology of the Mexican specimens is identical in most characters to that described or depicted in previous works. This is the first morphological study of this species aided with SEM; it includes detailed data on several microstructures, some of which undescribed previously. It also is the first report of its effective occurrence in Mexico. All previous records of this species in the Americas are related to the Atlantic coasts. This record, in the Mexican Pacific area, suggests that this supposedly introduced Afro-Asian species had an alternative route of dispersion from the Pacific coast. This is also the second documented record of an introduced freshwater copepod in Mexico. /// La distribucin conocida de Mesocyclops aspericornis en el continente americano inclua las areas sur y central de Amrica del Sur y del Caribe insular. No haba sido recolectada antes en Amrica del Norte. El anlisis de muestras recolectadas en un estanque en el estado de Sinaloa, costa pacfica de Mxico, produjo la identificacin de hembras de esta especie. Las hembras recolectadas en Mxico tiended a ser de menor talla que las africanas (1.14-1.20 mm vs 1.3-1.5 mm); sin embargo, la morfologa de los especmenes mexicanos es idntica en prcticamente todos los caracteres a las descripciones previas. Este es, sin embargo, el primer estudio morfolgico auxiliado por microscopa electrnica de barrido (MEB); incluye datos detallados sobre varias microestructuras, algunas previamente indescritas. Este es el primer registro efectivo de la presencia de esta especie en Mxico; todos los registros anteriores estaban relacionados con las costas del Ocano Atlntico. Este registro en el rea del Pacfico Mexicano sugiere que esta especie Afro-asitica supuestamente introducida tuvo una va alternativa de dispersin a partir de la costa del Pacfico Tropical Oriental. Este es, adems, el segundo registro documentado de una especie de coppodo dulceacucola introducida en Mxico.
20105819|During the expedition ARK IX-2/3 with RV "Polarstern" to the Northeast Water Polynya (NEW-Polynya), off Greenland, a station in the Westwind Trough was revisited seven times. Successful samples were taken by means of a box corer seven times over 2 months (May-July 1993) and by an epibenthic sledge (EBS) five times over a period of six weeks. One-hundred-and-thirty-one species from 78 genera and 40 families comprising a total of 13 280 individuals were collected with the EBS. The most abundant taxon at this station were the Cumacea. Amphipoda were most diverse. A change in peracarid composition and abundance occurred between the stations sampled over the two months, especially in the box corer samples. For seven isopod species developmental stages were determined and compared. Although no clear difference in stage composition of the species investigated was observed between stations, within some species the number of immature, preparatory, and ovigerous females was high. This might indicate an active period of reproduction during early summer, during times of favourable food supply. High abundance of Peracarida was found shortly after a sedimentation event of chlorophyll (phytoplankton and ice algae), observed in the upper sediment layer, possibly reflecting a benthic response to productivity. /// Whrend der Expedition ARK IX-2/3 mit FS "Polarstern" in die Nordostwasser-Polynja (Grnland) wurde eine Station im Westwind Trog wiederholt aufgesucht. Probenmaterial wurde mit einem Kastengreifer sieben Mal erfolgreich ber einen Zeitraum von zwei Monaten (Mai bis Juli) und mit einem Epibenthosschlitten (EBS) fnf Mal ber einen Zeitraum von sechs Wochen gesammelt. Die 13 280 mit dem Epibenthosschlitten gesammelten Individuen connten 131 Arten aus 78 Gattungen und 40 Familien zugeordnet werden. Das hufigste Taxor, der Station waren die Cumacea, Amphipoda waren am diversesten. Eine Vernderung in der Zusammensetzung der Peracariden und in den Abundanzen konnte zwischen den Probennahmei an den Stationen nachgewiesen werden, besonders in den Grokastengreiferproben. Von sieben Isopodenarten wunden die Entwicklungsstadien der einzelnen Stationen bestimmt und verglichen. Obwohl keinen groen Unterschiede in der Zusammensetzung der Entwicklungsstadien der untersuchten Arten festgestellt werden konnten, waren innerhalb einiger Arten die Anzahlen der Juvenilen, unreifen und reifen Weibchen hoch. Dies knnte auf eine aktive Reproduktionsperiode in den frhen Sommermonaten hinweisen, in einer Zeit gnstiger Nahrungsversorgung. Eine besonders hohe Abundanz der Peracarida wurde kurz nach einem Sedimentationsereignis von Chlorophyll-quivalenten (Phytoplankton und Eisalgen) in der oberen Sedimentschicht beobachtet, mglicherweise eine benthische Reaktion auf die Produktivitt.
20106335|In older literature, it has been claimed that the West Indian shrimp Lysmata intermedia also exists at Faial Island, in the Azores. It is now demonstrated here that these Azorean records of L. intermedia are actually based on L. seticaudata. Previous confusion probably arose from the very close similarity between the two species. L. intermedia is here redescribed on the basis of topotypical specimens (Dry Tortugas, Florida). It is shown that L. seticaudata displays significant geographical variations, the Atlantic specimens and particularly those of the Azores being more robust than those from the Mediterranean Sea. In L. seticaudata, the number of segments on the accessory branch of the outer antennular flagellum also increases with total body size. A synonymy and a brief account on their geographical distribution and their ecology are given for both species. /// Dans la littrature ancienne, la crevette carabe Lysmata intermedia a t signale  l'le de Faial, dans l'archipel des Aores. Nous montrons ici que ces signalements sont errons et rsultent d'une confusion avec L. seticaudata. L'extrme similitude entre les deux espces explique aisment ces identifications antrieures incorrectes. L. intermedia est redcrite  partir de spcimens de la localit-type (Dry Tortugas, Florida). Il appert que L. seticaudata prsente certaines variations gographiques, les spcimens atlantiques, et tout spcialement ceux des Aores, tant plus robustes que ceux de la Mditerrane. Chez L. seticaudata, il ressort aussi que le nombre de segments de la branche accessoire du flagelle antennulaire externe augmente avec la taille de la crevette. Une synonymie est donne pour les deux espces, de mme qu'un rsum des informations disponibles sur leur distribution gographique et leur cologie.
20106037|The binomen Argulus purpureus (Risso, 1827) is a junior synonym of Argulus vittatus (Rafinesque-Schmaltz, 1814), and the generic name Diprosia is a junior synonym of Argulus Mller, respectively, as first pointed out by Lipke B. Holthuis in 1954. Continued usage of Argulus purpureus indicates that Argulus vittatus has been ignored. In addition, Argulus purpureus should be followed by "(Risso, 1827)" rather than "Risso, 1816" or "Risso, 1827" because the species was originally described under the generic names, Binoculus Geoffroy St.-Hilaire, 1762 (that was later suppressed) and Agenor Risso, 1827. /// Le binme Argulus purpureus (Risso, 1827) est un synonyme plus rcent d'Argulus vittatus (Rafinesque-Schmaltz, 1814), et le nom gnrique Diprosia est un synonyme plus rcent d'Argulus Mller, respectivement, comme indiqu pour la premire fois par Lipke B. Holthuis en 1954. L'usage continu d'Argulus purpureus indique qu'Argulus vittatus a t ignor jusqu' prsent. De plus, Argulus purpureus devrait tre suivi de "(Risso, 1827)" plutt que "Risso, 1816" ou "Risso, 1827" puisque l'espce a t dcrite  l'origine sous les noms gnriques Binoculus Geoffroy St.-Hilaire, 1762 (supprim plus tard) et Agenor Risso, 1827.

20107577|An extensive survey aimed at updating and increasing the knowledge on species richness and distribution of Cladocera (Branchiopoda) in Sicily has been carried out in the period 2000-2004. More than 250 water bodies, mainly temporary, have been sampled on the whole Sicilian territory and the circum-Sicilian islands. This sampling effort led to the discovery of several species new to the fauna of the island and, coupled with a careful bibliographic review, allowed the realization of an updated checklist that includes 57 species definitely present on the island (only 33 were formerly known), and two more, whose actual presence in Sicily is dubious and needs confirmation. The chorological spectrum of the Sicilian cladoceran fauna shows a predominance of taxa with a wide distribution, but several others with a strictly Mediterranean range are also present. A slightly major affinity of the Sicilian cladoceran fauna with the Tunisian one, rather than with that inhabiting the water bodies of the Italian mainland, was observed. Moreover, the lack of detailed information on cladoceran species richness and composition in Tunisia does not allow to determine a definitive outline of the affinities and origins of the fauna on the island. Nevertheless, the island, located in the middle of the Mediterranean basin, represents a pivotal point in this area, characterized by high biodiversity indices. /// Tra il 2000 ed il 2004  stata condotta una campagna di studi finalizzata ad aggiornare ed incrementare le conoscenze sulla ricchezza specifica e sulla diversit dei cladoceri (Branchiopoda) siciliani. Sono stati campionati pi di 250 bacini, dall'idroperiodo temporaneo o permanente, in Sicilia e nelle isole circumsiciliane. Questo sforzo di campionamento ha portato al rinvenimento di numerose entit nuove per l'isola e, affiancato ad una revisione accurata della bibliografia esistente, ha portato alla redazione di una checklist aggiornata che comprende 57 specie presenti con certezza in Sicilia (a fronte delle 33 conosciute in precedenza) e altre due la cui presenza attuale in Sicilia  dubbia e necessita di conferme. Lo spettro corologico della fauna a cladoceri siciliana mostra la predominanza di taxa dall'ampia distribuzione, ma sono presenti numerosi taxa ad areale strettamente mediterraneo. E'stata osservata una affinit leggermente maggiore della fauna a cladoceri siciliana con quella tunisina rispetto che con quella dell'Italia peninsulare. Purtroppo l'assenza di informazioni dettagliate riguardanti i cladoceri tunisini non permette di avere un quadro chiaro delle origini e delle affinit della fauna dell'isola. Ad ogni modo, la Sicilia, posta al centro del bacino del Mediterraneo, rappresenta un punto nodale in una area caratterizzata da elevati valori di biodiversit.

20105031|Spiny lobster tails stored on ice are, in majority, treated with an excessive amount of sulfite in an attempt to prevent the occurrence of "black spots". Prior to delivery to the processing plant, lobster tails are immersed in a sulfite solution overnight, after which they are stored either on ice or in brine. The amount of residual sulfur dioxide (SO) in the lobster muscle is drastically reduced to under 100 ppm which is the maximum limit permitted by most importing countries. It was clarified that a treatment with sodium metabisulfite provokes the formation of dimethylamine (DMA) and formaldehyde (FA) from trimethylamine oxide (TMAO). The FA contents measured in the muscle were proportional to the SO contents. However, the storage of tails on ice or in brine had the effect of reducing the rate by which these components are formed. /// La majorit des queues de langouste conserves dans la glace sont traites avec un excs de sulfite afin d'viter l'apparition de "taches noires". Avant qu'elles ne soient livres  l'usine de traitement, les queues de langouste sont immerges dans une solution de sulfite durant une nuit, aprs quoi elles sont stockes dans la glace ou la saumure. La quantit de dioxyde de soufre (SO) rsiduel dans le muscle de langouste diminue considrablement,  moins de 100 ppm, ce qui est la limite maximale autorise par la plupart des pays importateurs. Il a t tabli qu'un traitement au mtabisulfite de sodium provoque la formation de dimethylamine (DMA) et de formaldhyde (FA)  partir d'oxyde de trimethylamine (TMAO). Les concentrations en FA mesures dans le muscle sont proportionnelles aux concentrations en SO. Cependant, le stockage dans la glace ou dans la saumure des queues a pour effet de rduire les quantits de produits forms.

20787194|The benthic crustaceans in Chilean rivers and streams are characterized by their marked endemism and low species number. Ecological studies have indicated that some species may be used as indicators of water quality, considering the involvement of river basins in human agricultural, industrial, and urban activities. The aim of the present study was to study the abundance of benthic crustaceans in a small stream located inside Temuco town, and to determine correlations of their various abundances with pH, temperature, and dissolved oxygen. The species discussed here are Aegla rostrata, Hyalella araucana, and Parastacus pugnax. We report an inverse correlation between dissolved oxygen and A. rostrata abundance, as well as of temperature with H. araucana abundance, whereas P. pugnax showed no significant correlations. The ecological results are discussed. Los crustceos bentnicos en ros chilenos, se caracterizan por su baja riqueza de especies y marcado endemismo. Los estudios ecolgicos indican que algunas especies pueden ser utilizadas como indicadores de calidad de agua, considerando el uso de suelo de los ros, ya que sus cuencas presentan usos agrcolas, industriales y urbanos. El objetivo del presente estudio es analizar las abundancias de crustceos bentnicos en un pequeo rio urbano, localizado dentro de la ciudad de Temuco, y determinar las asociaciones de sus abundancias con pH, temperatura y oxgeno disuelto. Se reportaron las especies Aegla rostrata, Hyalella araucana y Parastacus pugnax. Se report una correlacin inversa significativa entre oxgeno disuelto y la abundancia de A. rostrata, mientras que se report una tendencia similar entre temperatura y abundancia de H. araucana, mientras que no hubo correlacin significativa con la abundancia de P. pugnax con los parmetros estudiados. Se discutieron tpicos ecolgicos en el presente trabajo.

20104910|The inland prawn genus Macrobrachium Bate, 1868, is supposed to have originated from marine ancestors sometime in the beginning of the Pleistocene and since then its members have invaded freshwaters to different degrees. As such, these prawns are found to occupy almost all types of aquatic bodies right from purely marine through estuarine, riverine to impounded waters. Consequently, they have evolved various types of developmental patterns. Based on information available on more than 40 species, three basic types of larval developmental patterns can abe recognized in this genus viz., Prolonged or Normal Type (with 8 to 20 stages), Partially Abbreviated Type (with 2 or 3 stages) and Completely Abbreviated Type (with only 1 stages). However, there are several species showing transitional developmental patterns. Thus, the process of freshwaterization seems to be still continuing in the genus. Incidentally, the above knowledge can be applied in prawn culture as a basis for selection of a suitable candidate for forage species. /// On suppose gnralement que le genre de crevette d'eau douce Macrobrachium Bate, 1868 a eu des anctres marins et serait apparu au dbut du Plstocne, ses reprsentants ayant ensuite colonis les eaux douces  diffrents degrs. Ainsi, ces crevettes occupent aujourd'hui presque toutes les habitats aquatiques, depuis la mer, les estuaires, les rivires jusqu'aux eaux closes. En consquence, elles ont dvelopp divers schmas de dveloppement. A partir des informations disponibles sur 40 espces, trois schmas de base ont t reconnus: type normal ou prolong (8  20 stades), type partiellement abrg (2 ou 3 stades) et type compltement abrg (un stade unique). Cependant, plusieurs espces prsentent des schmas intermdiaires. Ainsi, le processus d'adaptation  la vie en eau douce ("freshwaterization") apparat encore comme en cours dans le genre. Ces connaissances peuvent tre appliques  l'levage de ces crevettes comme base pour la slection des espces les mieux appropries.
