27743253|Several specimens of the mud crab, Scylla cf. tranquebarica (Fabricius, 1798), were examined for the presence of stalked barnacles on the gills. Eighty-five percent of the crabs, for the size group 50 to 108 mm carapace width, were found infested with stalked barnacles. In all crabs, the barnacles were found attached to the inner (hypobranchial) surface of the gill with the exception of a single crab in which the barnacles were also found attached to the outer (epibranchial) surface of the gill. The stalked barnacles were identified as Octolasmis cor (Aurivillius, 1892) and O. angulata (Aurivillius, 1894), and our size-frequency data support the view that they are indeed distinct species. Their distribution on various parts of the gills, i.e., proximal, medial, or distal, was noted. Most of the barnacles were found attached to the medial part of the gill (O. cor 55%; O. angulata 57%), followed by the proximal part (O. cor 31%; O. angulata 38%), and the distal part (O. cor 14%; O. angulata 5%). Gill number 7 bore the maximum number of O. cor (33%) found, whereas gill number 4 harboured the maximum number of O. angulata (30.2%). /// Divers spcimens du crabe Scylla cf. tranquebarica (Fabricius, 1798), ont t examins pour rechercher la prsence de bernacles pdonculs sur les branchies. Un total de 85% des crabes, pour le groupe de taille de 50  108 mm de largeur de carapace, ont t trouvs infests par des bernacles pdonculs. Dans tous les crabes, les bernacles ont t trouvs accrochs  la face interne de la branchie (hypobranchie)  l'exception d'un seul crabe chez lequel les bernacles ont t trouvs sur la surface externe (pibranchie) de la branchie. Les bernacles ont t identifis comme Octolasmis cor (Aurivillius, 1892) et O. angulata (Aurivillius, 1894) et nos observations sur la distribution des tailles soutiennent l'hypothse qu'elles sont vraiment des espces spares. Leur distribution sur les diffrentes parties des branchies, i.e., proximal, mdian ou distal ont t notes. La plus part des bernacles ont t trouvs accrochs dans la partie mdiane de la branchie (O. cor 55%; O. angulata 57%), suivie par la partie proximale (O. cor 31%; O. angulata 38%), et la partie distale (O. cor 14%; O. angulata 5%). La branchie 7 porte le nombre maximum de O. cor (33%) trouvs, alors que la branchie 4 accueille un maximum de O. angulata (30.2%).

27743204|Spatial and temporal influences on population dynamics of a branchiuran ectoparasite, Argulus sp. A, were investigated. There was a weak, positive correlation between mean Argulus sp. A intensity and size of fish host (Mozambique tilapia). Male hosts had significantly higher Argulus sp. A intensity and prevalence than female hosts. The species was highly aggregated on male and female hosts and its dispersion patterns fitted the negative binomial distribution. There were seasonal changes in prevalence and proportion of immature recruits on male and female tilapia hosts, from a peak during summer to low levels during winter months. Other than host size, differences in Argulus sp. A infection may be related to differences in host behaviour, for example, where segregation of the sexes in host fishes during the spawning season occurs. The species has low host-specificity and was found in fresh water on two other introduced fish species and five native fish species. /// Les influences spatiales et temporelles sur la dynamique des populations de l'ectoparasite branchioure Argulus sp. A ont t tudies. Il existe une faible corrlation positive entre l'intensit moyenne d'Argulus sp. A et la taille du poisson hte (Tilapia du Mozambique). Les htes males prsentent une intensit et une prvalence significativement plus leve que les htes femelles. L'espce est fortement agrge sur les htes mles et femelles et sa distribution est de type binomial ngatif. Des changements saisonniers dans la prvalence et la proportion des recruts immatures sur les tilapias htes, mles et femelles existent, depuis un pic pendant l't  des niveaux faibles pendant les mois d'hiver. Des diffrences dans l'infection par Argulus sp. A, autres que celle due  la taille de l'hte pourraient tre relies au comportement de l'hte par exemple, en effet il existe une sgrgation par le sexe dans les poissons htes durant la saison de ponte. L'espce a une faible spcificit pour l'hte et a t trouve en eau douce sur deux autres espces de poissons introduites et sur cinq espces de poissons indignes.
20107473|Macrobrachium lanchesteri is presumed to be one of the most common and widely distributed freshwater prawns inhabiting still or slow-moving waters in Myanmar. The reproductive biology of M. lanchesteri from the Zaw Gyi River and Taung Ta Man Lake in central Myanmar was studied based on the occurrence of ovigerous females and eggs in different developmental stages. The total numbers of specimens studied were 1307 from Zaw Gyi River and 757 from Taung Ta Man Lake. Ovigerous females were captured throughout the year. A higher percentage of ovigerous females was obtained from June to November. Carapace length of ovigerous females ranged from 6.3 to 12.5 mm and egg size (length) varied from 0.8 to 1.0 mm. Compared to other species, the eggs of M. lanchesteri are larger than those of M. olfersii (0.4-0.6 mm) and smaller than of M. lamarrei (1.1-1.5 mm). More than half of the eggs were still at an early stage of development for every month sampled. The incubation interval of the eggs was estimated to be less than one month, because of the presence or absence of eggs in the eyed stage during the period from February to March. /// Macrobrachium lanchesteri est suppose tre l'une des crevettes les plus communes et largement rparties dans les eaux calmes ou faiblement courantes du Myanmar. La biologie de la reproduction de M. lanchesteri de la rivire Zaw Gyi et du lac Taung Ta Man au Myanmar central a t tudie en se basant sur la prsence de femelles ovigres et d'ufs  diffrents stades de dveloppement. Le nombre total des spcimens tudis a t de 1307, provenant de la rivire Zaw Gyi, et de 757 du lac Taung Ta Man. Des femelles ovigres ont t captures tout au long de l'anne. Un plus fort pourcentage de femelles ovigres a t obtenu de juin  novembre. La longueur de la carapace des femelles ovigres tait de 6,3  12,5 mm et la taille des ufs (longueur) de 0,8  1,0 mm. Compars  d'autres espces, les ufs de M. lanchesten sont plus grands que ceux de M. olfersii (0,4-0,6 mm) et plus petits que ceux de M. lamarrei (1,1-1,5 mm). Plus de la moiti des ufs taient encore  un stade prcoce de dveloppement  chaque mois d'chantillonnage. La dure d'incubation des ufs a t estime  moins d'un mois, en raison de la prsence ou de l'absence d'ufs au stade oeill pendant la priode de fvrier  mars.
20103278|Of three species of fiddler crabs found in the salt marshes on Sapelo Island, Georgia, U.S.A., Teal (1958) has shown that Uca pugnax is the most widespread in distribution, and when paired with U. pugilator causes a reduction in the number of burrows dug. This field study examined burrow density in order to understand why burrow reduction occurs when U. pugnax is the interfering species. Populations of U. pugnax are seven times more dense than populations of U. pugilator, which appear to migrate periodically. In mixed populations of U. pugnax and U. pugilator the number of burrows dug by both species together is less than would be predicted by either alone. These data suggest that U. pugnax has a higher tolerance to crowding, and coupled with its widespread distribution and agonistic behavior, is better adapted to live under conditions unfavorable for other Uca species. U. pugilator exhibits greater behavioral variability which would have survival advantage since this species appears to migrate periodically to different environments once certain density levels are reached. /// Von den 3 Uca Arten der Salzmarschen auf der Sapelo Insel (Georgia, USA) ist nach Teal (1958) U. pugnax am weitesten verbreitet. Eine Kombination mit U. pugilator fhrt jedoch zu einer Verringerung der Grabgnge. Die vorliegende Feldstudie befat sich mit der Grabgangdichte. Sie hat zum Ziel, die Verringerung der Gnge in Gegenwart von U. pugnax zu interpretieren. Die Populationsdichte von U. pugnax ist sieben mal zo gro wie die von U. pugilator, welcher offenbar periodische Wanderungen durchfhrt. Zu gemischten U. pugnax -- U. pugilator Populationen ist die Anzahl der Gnge beider Arten zusammen geringer als dies bei jeder Art einzeln zu erwarten wre. Diese Daten lassen vermuten, da U. pugnax eine hhere Crowding-toleranz besitzt und -- gekoppelt mit weiter Verbreitung und agonistischem Verhalten -- besser an Bedingungen angepat ist, die fr andere Uca Arten ungnstig sind. U. pugilator, auf der anderen Seite, zeigt grere verhaltensphysiologische Variabilitt. Dies knnte deswegen einen berlebensvorteil bedeuten, weil U. pugilator periodisch zu wandern scheint, sobald bestimmte Populationsdichten erreicht worden sind.
20107590|The deep water rose shrimp, Parapenaeus longirostris, is a very important commercial species for trawl fleets that fish in the Mediterranean as well as in the Gulf of Cadiz and to the south of Portugal. Despite its importance, its life cycle has not been thoroughly studied and there are discrepancies as to certain aspects, depending on the area. Although spawning takes place throughout the year, two peak periods have been identified between late spring and early autumn. This species is characterized by a differential growth pattern, with females reaching a larger size, and has a life cycle of two to three years. Individuals reach sexual maturity at 8 to 10 months at varying sizes, depending on the area (cephalothorax length 20 to 28 mm in females) and have an average fecundity of 90,000 eggs. The species feeds on a great variety of prey, its main prey being annelid worms (polychaetes) and foraminiferans. The fishery involves a large number of boats, about 2,000 over the whole area here covered. It is basically directed at a single cohort and total catches can reach 10,000 tons a year. /// La gamba blanca, Parapenaeus longirostris, constituye una especie de elevado inters comercial para las flotas de arrastre que faenan tanto en el Mediterrneo como en el Golfo de Cdiz y sur de Portugal. A pesar de dicha importancia, su ciclo de vida no es del todo bien conocido existiendo discrepancia en determinado aspectos en funcin del rea. La puesta tiene lugar a lo largo de todo el ao, si bien presenta dos picos identificados entre final de primavera y principio de otoo. Esta especie presenta un crecimiento diferencial, alcanzando mayor tamao las hembras, con un ciclo de vida est entre dos y tres aos. Alcanzan la madurez sexual entre los 8 y 10 meses variando la talla en funcin del rea (entre 20 y 28 mm de Longitud de Cefalotrax en las hembras) y un valor medio de fecundidad de 90000 huevos. Se alimenta de una gran variedad de presas siendo los poliquetos (polychaetes) y foraminiferos los principales. En esta pesquera estn inmersas un elevado nmero de embarcaciones, superando los 2000 barcos en el rea tratada. Se desarrolla fundamentalmente sobre en una nica cohorte y con valores que pueden alcanzar las 10000 toneladas anuales.

20104897|Hermit crabs are the commonest intertidal anomuran crustaceans. Diogenes miles (Herbst) is an inhabitant of surf-beaten sandy shores along coasts of peninsular India. This species is outstanding among other diogenid hermit crabs in having, unlike others, an extremely flat and broad body well adapted for its occurrence in long, narrow-mouthed gastropod shells mostly of Oliva and to lesser extent Cypraea and Conus. During the present study it was observed that, contrary to what expected, D. miles does not breed throughout the year but appears to have its breeding season restricted to the summer months. This was indicated by the collection of ovigerous females of the species only during the summer months near Bombay, Ratnagiri and Karwar along the Indian west coast. Eggs are minute, bright crimson to scarlet when immature and are easily shed, even with slight disturbance. Larval development consists of 3 zoeal and a megalopa stages, described in the present paper, after speciments reared in the laboratory. Some of the salient features of the zoea larvae are: a long, pointed rostrum, smooth carapace, usual triangular telson with process formula 7 + 7 in the first zoea but complete reduction of the 4th process in the third zoea. The megalopa has the typical unequal chelipeds, the left being larger, only 3 pairs of pleopods, and the telson is rectangularly rounded. Though the deep curve of the carpus develops right from the megalopa stage, the inward right-angled bend of the cheliped, so charactristic of the adult, is not fully developed even in the 5 subsequent instars. /// Les pagures sont les crustacs anomoures intertidaux les plus communs. Diogenes miles (Herbst) est un habitant des plages sableuses et battues, le long des ctes indiennes. Cette espce est particulire parmi les pagures diogenids car elle possde, contrairement aux autres un corps largi, extrmement aplati, bien adapt pur occuper les conquilles de gastropodes du genre Oliva principalement et moins frAuemment Cypraea et Conus. Au cours de la prsente tude, il a t observ que D, miles prsente une priode de reproduction limite aux mois d't alors qu'on pourrait s'attendre  ce qu'elle s'tende sur toute l'anne. Ceci est mis en vidence par la rcolte de rassemblements de reproduction de cette espce seulement en t le long de la cte indienne ouest,  Bombay, Ratnagiri et Karwar. Les oeufs sont trs petits, pourpre vif  l'tat immature est se dtachent facilement, mme avec une lger contact. Le dveloppement larvaire, obtenu en laboratoire, comprend 3 stages zo et un stade mgalope, dcrits dans cet article. Les traits saillants des larves sont; rostre long et pointu, carapace lisse, telson triangulaire avec formule des processue 7 + 7 pour le premier stade zo, mais une rduction complte des quatrimes processus au troisime stade zo. La mgalope possde les chlipdes typiques ingaux, le gauche le plus grand; seulement trois paires de plopodes et le telson en tectangle arrondi. Bien que la courbe profonde du carpe so d veloppe  partir du stade mgalope,la courbure  angle droit vers l'intrieur du chlipde, caractristique de l'adaulte, n'est pas pleinement dveloppe dans le 5 stades suivants.
20102007|Bathynella stammeri Jakobi, 1954, lives in rhithrostygal interstitial biotopes of the Austrian "tztaler Alpen". A description of this species is given for a systematical revision of the genus Bathynella which is in preparation. Morphological, ecological and zoogeographical problems of the species are discussed; the history of the geographical distribution of Bathynella stammeri is explained in relation to that of several species inhabiting the same typical biocoenosis (Parastenocaris-Bathynella-biocoenosis).

20103359|Geographic variation in the dwarf crayfish, Cambarellus puer, was studied. Computations were based on ten morphologic measurements from 583 adult specimens representing 34 localities. Analyses were conducted using univariate and multivariate statistical techniques on scaled and non-scaled data for comparison of results. A matrix of correlation among nine scaled morphologic characters was computed and the first three principal components extracted; these accounted for 71.6% of the variation in the character set among males and 70.9% among females. Three-dimensional projections of localities onto principal components show that animals from southeastern Texas are longer and more narrow in proportion to cephalothorax length, while animals from southern Arkansas and northern Louisiana are proportionately shorter and wider. Populations occurring along the Mississippi River and west into southern Louisiana are intermediate in shape. The first three principal components extracted from the matrix of correlation among ten non-scaled characters accounted for 94.2% of the variation in males and 96.2% of the variation in females. Three-dimensional projections onto principal components of non-scaled characters indicate that animals from eastern populations are larger than animals from western populations. Projections on components I, II, and III of scaled data for males and females and on component I of non-scaled data for both sexes were analyzed with respect to 11 environmental variables. Evapotranspiration and longitude were significantly correlated with morphologic variation in C. puer. Net primary productivity appeared to influence body size in these animals.

Although both G. shokitai sp. nov. and G. minei sp. nov. are allied to G. candidiensis (type locality Taiwan), they differ from that species and from each other in the form of their carapaces, ambulatory leg proportions, and structure of their male first pleopods. /// Deux nouvelles espces de crabes d'eau douce potamides du genre Geothelphusa sont dcrites des les Ryukyu, au sud du Japon. Quoique l'une et l'autre, G. shokitai et G. minei spp. nov., soient allies  G. candidiensis (localit type Taiwan), elles diffrent de cette dernire et entre elles par la forme de la carapace, les proportions des pattes ambulatories et la structure du premier plopode mle.

29779483|Twelve specimens of the western Atlantic shrimp, Farfantepenaeus aztecus (Ives, 1891), were caught between December 2009 and June 2010 by bottom trawl off Serik in Antalya Bay, Turkey. The species has probably been introduced in the eastern Mediterranean with ballast water. This is the first record of F. aztecus, and the second of a western Atlantic shrimp in the Mediterranean Sea. Douze spcimens de la crevette de l'Atlantique ouest, Farfantepenaeus aztecus (Ives, 1891), ont t capturs entre Dcembre 2009 et Juin 2010 par chalutage au large de Serik dans la baie d'Antalya, Turquie. Cette espce a probablement t introduite dans l'est de la Mditerrane avec des eaux de ballast. Il s'agit de la premire signalisation de F. aztecus, et la seconde d'une espce de crevette atlantique en mer Mditerrane.
20105343|Ilyocryptus paranaensis Paggi, 1989 is found at four localities in the basin of the Usumacinta River, Tabasco, southern Mexico. A new subspecies I. paranaensis inarmatus subsp. nov. is established for Mexican populations of this species. Probably, this subspecies is an endemic with a distribution restricted to the Usumacinta basin. The differences between the new subspecies and the nominate form are discussed. /// Ilyocryptus paranaensis Paggi, 1989 a t trouv dans quatre localits de bassin de l'Usumacinta, Tabasco, au sud du Mexique. Une nouvelle sous-espce, I. paranaensis inarmatus subsp. nov. a t tablie pour les populations mexicaines de cette espce. Cette sous-espce est probablement endmique, avec une rpartition limite au bassin de l'Usumacinta. Les diffrences entre la nouvelle sous-espce et la forme nominale sont discutes.
20105161|Extracts of the crustacean eyestalk, and particularly of the sinus gland, produce an inhibition of the spontaneous firing rate of motor and sensitive neurons in two different bioassays. This activity can be ascribed to a molecule of low molecular weight, neutral, non-peptidic, soluble in water and methanol, thermostable, different from GABA but suppressed by picrotoxin. Its nature remains to be elucidated. /// Des extraits de pdoncule oculaire de Crustacs, et particulirement de la glande du sinus, produisent une inhibition du taux d'activation spontane des neurones moteurs et sensitifs dans deux bio-essais diffrents. Cette activit peut tre attribue  une molcule de faible poids molculaire, neutre, non peptidique, soluble dans l'eau et le mthanol, thermostable, diffrente du GABA, mais supprime par la picrotoxine. Sa nature reste  dterminer.
20103497|Les dtails des dactyles ambulatoires de Paranchistus ornatus Holthuis et de P. pycnodontae Bruce vus au microscope lectronique  balayage sont nots et compars  ceux de Anchistus miersi (De Man). Chaque espce possde des denticulations charactristiques de l'unguis. Celles de P. ornatus sont courtes, applaties et pointues; celles de P. pycnodontae sont minces, comprimes et pointues; chez les deux espces les denticules sont diriges distalement. Il y a une diffrence marque avec A. miersi, dont les denticules sont plutot courtes, mousses et rectes. Ces trois espces sont associes aux mollusques bivalves et il est sugger que ces dtails sont des adaptations spcifiques aux htes.
20101948|Description d'une nouvelle espce de Conchostrac recueillie dans un foss, le long d'une route,  Tuticorin. Cette forme, qui appartient au genre Eocyzicus, diffre de toutes les autres espces connues par un plus grand nombre de denticules et de soies plumeuses sur le telson et les griffes furcales (d'o le nom d'E.plumosus), par le plus grand nombre de lignes de croissance sur la carapace et par l'absence de poils ou de spinules sur les lignes de croissance.
20102747|Etude des Crustacs Dcapodes qui sont des commensaux obligs sur les parties vivantes des coraux rameux des familles Acroporidae et Pocilloporidae. Au total trente-six espces ont t trouves en six endroits dans le Queensland, en Australie. Deux espces sont retires de la synonymie et quatre nouvelles varits sont dcrites. La coloration des animaux vivants est donne pour chaque espce. La plupart des espces ont une prfrence distincte pour leur hte; il n'y en a qu'une que l'on trouve rgulirement sur les deux familles de coraux. On a not quelques diffrences dans les faunes commensales des trois genres, parmi les Pocilloporidae. En quatre endroits de la Grande Barrire d'Australie, les faunes collectes taient tout  fait uniformes. A l'Ile Wallis,  250 milles  l'est, la spcificit discute ci-dessus a galement t observe, malgr quelques diffrences dans la composition des espces. Dans la Baie de Moreton, au sud de la Barrire de rcifs, on n'a trouv que des Acropora; ici il s'agissait de quatre espces, trouves ailleurs sur les coraux Pocilloporides. L'auteur discute le fait que les commensaux des coraux sont parmi les quelques Dcapodes trouvs des deux ctes de la Barrire de l'Est-Pacifique.
20103007|Une tude de la littrature  fait apparatre de considrables divergences d'opinion  propos de la structure des organes gnitaux femelles de Lucifer. Le principal point de dsaccord portait sur la question de savoir si oviductes et spermathques taient unis intrieurement ou s'ils s'ouvraient sparment  l'extrieur. Une tude histologique de Lucifer typus H. Milne Edwards a donc t effectue, qui a donn les rsultats suivants. Il existe entre les bases des troisimes priopodes un orifice median, qui s'ouvre sur un canal menant  deux spermathques en culs-de-sac. Les deux ovaires se trouvent de chaque ct de l'intestin, dans l'abdomen et la partie postrieure du thorax. Chaque oviducte s'tend dorsalement  partir de la rgion antrieure de l'ovaire pour s'ouvrir sur la base du troisime priopode. Ainsi, il n'existe pas de connection interne entre oviductes et spermathques, et la fcondation chez Lucifer doit tre externe, comme chez les autres Dcapodes Natantia.
20105792|Diaptomus minutus Lilljeborg, 1889, and Cyclops scutifer Sars, 1863, detected the hydromechanical signals created by small moving spheres of sizes comparable to those of most crustacean zooplankters ( 1 mm). The number of escapes and escape distance were affected by the size, location, and direction of movement of the spheres. Ability to detected and flee from the moving spheres was not significantly affected by ambient turbulence. The herbivorous D. minutus escaped from all hydromechanical signals. The predaceous Cyclops scutifer showed higher escape probability from large signals and occasionally recognized small signals as prey. /// Diaptomus minutus Lilljeborg, 1889 et Cyclops scutifer Sars, 1863 ont dtect les signaux hydromcaniques crs par des petites sphres mobiles de tailes comparables  celles de la plupart des crustacs zooplanctoniques ( 1 mm). Le nombre d'chappes et la distance d'chappe taient affects par la taille, la localisation et la direction de mouvement des sphres. La capacit de dtecter et de fuir les sphres mouvantes n'tait pas affecte de faon sigificative par la turbulence ambiante. L'herbivore Diaptomus minutus fuyait tous les signaux hydromcaniques. Le prdateur Cyclops scutifer manifestait la plus haute probabilit d'chappe aux grands signaux et, occasionnellement, reconnaissait les petits signaux comme des proies.

Il y a une corrlation positive entre le taux de survivance et la longueur d'onde pour les animaux adapts  la lumire normale. Les diffrences entre les populations leves sous des longueurs d'onde diffrentes disparaissent aprs une semaine. L'effet de la longueur d'onde ne semble pas tre un effet d'intensit. Il y a un corrlation ngative entre l'intensit de la lumire,  l'exception des tnbres compltes, et la grandeur de la population. L'effet de la lumire polarise sur la grandeur de la population n'est pas sparable de l'effet d'intensit; cependant, la polarisation de la lumire rduit de faon significative la population des adultes. La production des ephippia a t augmente par les longueurs d'onde bleues. Tandis que de la lumire tait ncessaire pour la production des ephippia, son intensit et sa polarisation n'avaient pas d'effet significatif.

20105098|During benthic surveys in the northern Aegean Sea, 188 amphipod species were found; 39 among these comprise new records for the amphipod fauna of the eastern Mediterranean Sea, 41 are reported for the first time from the Aegean Sea and 62 are new for the fauna of the northern Aegean Sea. A checklist of the amphipods known from the Aegean Sea up to the present is given (239 species), along with their distribution in certain Mediterranean areas. For the most interesting species found, information on their distribution and their habitat is given. The amphipod fauna of the above areas is estimated, on the basis of the relevant literature. Finally, the affinities among these areas using the coefficient of Czekanowski, along with the number of species common to each pair of areas, are estimated. /// Pendant des recherches benthiques dans le nord de la mer Ege, 188 espces d'amphipodes ont t trouves, dont 39 n'avaient encore jamais t signales en Mditerrane orientale, alors que 41 l'taient pour la premire fois de la mer Ege, et que 62 taient nouvelles pour la faune du nord de cette mer. Une liste des amphipodes connus jusqu' prsent de la mer Eg (239 espces) est donne, en mme temps que leur distribution dans certaines rgions de la Mditerrane. Pour les espces les plus intressantres, des informations sont fournies  la fois sur leur distribution et sur leur habitat. La faune d'amphipodes des rgions mentionnes ci-dessus est value sur les bases de la littrature affrente. Enfin, les affinits entre elles, d'aprs le coefficient de Czekanowski, sont galement values, de mme que le nombre des espces communes  chaque couple de rgions.

Aber Embryonen werden mglicherweise niemals geringen Salinitten ausgesetzt sein, weil die Eier in der Mantelhhle adulter Tiere erbrtet werden und diese das Umgebungswasser in Salzgehalten unter 50% Meerwasser durch Operculumverschlu fernhalten. Eine von Barnes & Barnes berichtete Ausstoung von Mantelhhlenwasser wurde nicht beobachtet.

27743267|Reproductive biology and population dynamics of the freshwater shrimp, Atyaephyra desmarestii were studied in Tunisia. In the reserve dam lake of Sidi Salem (northern Tunisia), a total of 7200 specimens was collected in monthly sampling over two years, from August 1996 to July 1998. Each sample of shrimps was sorted in the laboratory and separated into juveniles, males, and females. The presence of ovigerous females during spring and summer indicated that reproduction of Atyaephyra desmarestii is seasonal, starting in March and ending in August, followed by a sexual rest of six months, from September to February. The peak of reproductive females occurred in April and undifferentiated juveniles were present over the year. Fecundity was positively correlated with the size of ovigerous females. The sex-ratio underwent seasonal and monthly fluctuations, related to the size of the shrimp. Females were less numerous than males between 15 and 20 mm, but dominated beyond 20 mm. Analysis of the size-frequency distribution allowed to identify ten cohorts, four in the first sample of August 1996, and the other six during the rest of the sampling period. Life span was estimated between 13 and 16 months, based on 2 cohorts per season, one in spring and the other in summer. Cohorts appearing in May of each year, quickly reached sexual maturity and became reproductive after three months at just 17-18 mm total length. /// La biologie de la reproduction et la structure de taille d'une population de la crevette d'eau douce Atyaephyra desmarestii font l'objet d'une tude mene en Tunisie. Dans la retenue du barrage Sidi Salem (nord de la Tunisie), un total de 7200 individus a t prlev au cours d'chantilonnages mensuels effectus pendant deux annes conscutives, d'aot 1996  juillet 1998. Chaque chantillon de crevettes, ramen au laboratoire, a t tri et les diffrentes catgories ont t spares en indiffrencis, mles et femelles. La prsence de femelles ovigres au printemps et en t indique que la reproduction de cette espce est saisonnire. Elle commence au mois de mars et se termine en aot. Elle est suivie d'une priode de repos sexuel de 6 mois, de septembre  fvrier. Le pic de prsence des femelles reproductrices a lieu en avril. Les jeunes indiffrencis sont prsents durant toute l'anne. La fcondit est corrle positivement avec la taille des femelles ovigres. Quant au sex-ratio, il prsente des fluctuations mensuelles et saisonnires en relation avec la taille totale de la crevette. En effet, les femelles sont moins nombreuses que les mles pour une taille comprise entre 15 et 20 mm, alors qu'elles dominent au-del de 20 mm. L'analyse des distributions des frquences de taille a permis la dtermination de dix cohortes dont quatre ont t identifies dans le premier chantillon d'aot 1996 et les six autres durant le reste de la priode d'tude. Le suivi d'une cohorte printanire et d'une cohorte estivale a permis d'estimer la dure de vie de cette espce qui varie entre 13 et 16 mois. Les cohortes qui apparaissent au mois de mai de chaque anne, atteignent trs vite leur maturit sexuelle et deviennent reproductrices au bout de trois mois  partir d'une taille moyenne comprise entre 17 et 18 mm.
20101660|Les stades larvaires de Macrobrachium australiense Holthuis, 1950 sont dcrits et compars  ceux d'autres espces de Palaemonidae. M. australiense a une vie larvaire abrge de trois stades, s'tendant sur environ six jours avant que la mtamorphose au premier stade post-larvaire n'ait lieu. En ce qui concerne le dveloppement larvaire, M. australiense appartiendrait  la deuxime classe de Sollaud (1923) qui comprend les Palaemonidae d'eau douce  courte vie larvaire. Pourtant M. australiense produit un nombre relativement grand de petits oeufs, ce qui caractrise plutt les espces marines. Il est possible que ces observations indiquent que M. australiense n'est venu de l'estuaire  l'eau douce qu' une poque relativement rcente.
20103267|The larval development of P. gibber includes 6 nauplius stages and 6 copepodid stages, the last stage being the adult. The copepodid 2 is the infesting stage. Sexual dimorphism of the copepodids appears at the fifth stage. External morphology of each stage (from the first nauplius to the adult copepodid) is described. Comparison of the development of P. gibber with that of other Notodelphyidae is presented. The importance of characteristic moults is pointed out. This is the first time that a sixth nauplius is described for a notodelphyid. In its first naupliar instar, P. gibber cannot be distinguished from the other 5 genera and 8 species of Notodelphyidae of which the post-embryonal development is known; for naupliar stage II to VI, however, P. gibber is characterized by the absence of the aesthete at the basis of the large apical seta on the terminal segment of the anterior antenna. Furcal hooks are present from copepodid 3 onward. Sexual dimorphism is apparent from copepodid stage 5 onward. The species is furthermore characterized by the disappearance of the setae along the internal and apical margins of the distal exopodal segment of P2 and P3 in copepodid stage 4. These setae reappear in the adults, normal in the males but somewhat coalescent in the females. The rudimentary P6, persistent in the adult female, has not been described earlier for P. gibber. It is the only notodelphyid for which this phenomenon is now known. However, since so far P6 in this species has escaped attention, obviously because of its minute size, one may question whether the same might not also be the case in other species.
20104553|La croissance relative chez les Crustacs est communment value par l'tablissement de rgressions allomtriques de diverses mensurations corporelles, avec la largeur de la carapace comme dimension de rfrence. Pour les rgressions des mesures transformes en logarithmes un cart statistiquement significatif  partir du seuil de 1, la valeur isomtrique, dnote une allomtrie positive ou ngative. Il est montr que la vrification statistique des niveaux allomtriques, tels qu'on les prsente dans la littrature courante, marque un divorce avec la ralit biologique. Une interprtation plus attentive de la signification fonctionnelle de la croissance allomtrique d'aprs ces mthodologies est ncessaire, spcialement parcequ' elles sont altres par l'usage de petites sries de donnes et par une slection inapproprie de la srie de donnes. La variation morphologique de la taille chez Cleistostoma kuwaitense, un crabe ocypode des vasires du Kuwait, est utilise pour illustrer ces problmes.
20106366|The hairy hermit crab Pagurus hirsutiusculus was sampled from the low intertidal at two sites in Auke Bay, southeastern Alaska (5822N 13440W) to examine the prevalence of rhizocephalan parasitism. One site was exposed to wave activity while the other was sheltered. Two species of rhizocephalan, Peltogaster paguri and Peltogasterella gracilis, were found. Peltogaster paguri parasitized 12.6% of the crabs at the sheltered site and 13.4% at the exposed site. Rhizocephalan parasitism was not correlated with crab size at either site. One crab from the sample was infected with the rhizocephalan Peltogasterella gracilis. Also found was a bopyrid isopod, Liriopsis pygmaea, that hyperparasitized 36% of the Peltogaster paguri. This is the first report of Peltogaster paguri and Peltogasterella gracilis parasitizing Pagurus hirsutiusculus and the first record of both rhizocephalans from southeastern Alaska. The bopyrid isopod Liriopsis pygmaea is also reported from southeast Alaska, previously having been reported from Puget Sound. The incidence of infection of Peltogaster paguri in Alaska was higher than previously reported from other areas. /// Le pagure Pagurus hirsutiusculus a t chantillonn  mare basse sur deux sites  Auke Bay, sud de l'Alaska (5822N 13440W) pour examiner la prvalence du parasitisme par des rhizocphales. Un des sites tait expos  l'action des vagues, tandis que l'autre tait abrit. Deux espces de rhizocphales, Peltogaster paguri et Peltogasterella gracilis ont t identifies. Peltogaster paguri parasitait 12,6% des pagures sur le site abrit et 13,4% sur le site expos. Le parasitisme des rhizocphales n'est corrl  la taille des pagures sur aucun des sites. Un seul pagure tait infect par Peltogasterella gracilis. Un isopode bopyrien, Liriopsis pygmaea, a t galement trouv, hyperparasitant 36% des Peltogaster paguri. Ceci constitue la premire observation de Peltogaster paguri et Peltogasterella gracilis parasitant Pagurus hirsutiusculus et la premire observation de ces deux rhizocphales pour le sud de l'Alaska. L'isopode bopyre, Liriopsis pygmaea, dj connu de Puget Sound, est aussi signal du sud-est de l'Alaska. L'incidence d'infection de Peltogaster paguri en Alaska est suprieure  celle d'autres rgions.
20102466|Die Bedeutung der Augen fr die Hintergrundanpassung wurde studiert an dem marinen Isopoden Idotea japonica Richardson, und zwar mittels partieller oder totaler Bedeckung der Augen mit "Magic Ink". Das Pigment in den Chromatophoren dehnt sich sehr schnell aus nach totaler Bedeckung beider Augen, aber verhltnismssig langsam nach berfhrung der Versuchstiere in eine Dunkelkammer. Einseitige Bedeckung verursacht nur geringfgige Vernderungen. Das Licht scheint die Farbzellen nicht direkt zu beeinflussen (Experiment XI). Aus diesen und anderen Ergebnissen wird gefolgert, dass die Hintergrundanpassung von Idotea japonica abhngig ist von der Gesamtlichtintensitt.
20105674|A detailed morphological study was performed on adult males and females of seven sexual populations of the brine shrimp, Artemia from China. Five populations were collected from the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, three of which were recorded and investigated for the first time. The measurements of 12 biometrical parameters for males and 13 parameters for females were taken from individuals of each population, raised under standardized culture conditions from nauplii to the adult stage. They were analysed through discriminant analysis and hierarchical cluster analysis, in order to establish relationships among the different populations, as well as to have a tool to assign new sets of data for unknown populations to one of the groups analysed here. The overall percentage of correctly classified cases of females was 87.32%, a little higher than that of males, which was 84.79%. Our study showed that the Artemia from the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau belong to the "large" types. The results revealed also that the seven populations can clearly be separated into two groups, i.e., high altitude populations and low altitude populations, the former populations belonging to the subspecies Artemia sinica tibetiana Abatzopoulos, Zhang & Sorgeloos, 1998, the latter belonging to the subspecies Artemia sinica sinica Cai, 1988. /// Une tude morphologique dtaille a t mene sur des adultes mles et femelles de sept populations sexues d'Artemia en Chine. Cinq populations ont t collectes de Qinghai-Plateau du Tibet, trois d'entre elles ayant t trouves et tudies pour la premire fois. Les mesures de 12 paramtres biomtriques pour les mles et 13 pour les femelles ont t prises sur les individus de chaque population, levs dans des conditions standards, des nauplies au stade adulte. Elles ont t analyses en analyse discrimante et en analyse hirarchique, afin d'tablir les relations entre les diffrentes populations, ainsi que pour avoir un outil pour attribuer de nouveaux ensembles de donnes de populations inconnues  l'un des groupes analyss ici. Le pourcentage total des cas de femelles correctement classs tait de 87,32%, un peu plus lev que celui des mles, qui tait de 84,79%. Notre tude a montr que l'Artemia de Qinghai-Plateau du Tibet appartient au type "grand". Les rsultats ont rvl aussi que les sept populations peuvent tre clairement spares en deux groupes, c'est--dire, les populations de haute altitude et les populations de basse altitude, les premires appartenant  la sous-espce Artemia sinica tibetiana Abatzopoulos, Zhang & Sorgeloos, 1998, les dernires appartenant  la sous-espce Artemia sinica sinica Cai, 1988.
20104939|Light and electron microscopic and microbiological examination of the infected haemolymph of wild Saduria entomon (Linnaeus, 1758) revealed the presence of the yeast Cryptococcus laurentii (Kufferath) Skinner, 1947. Phagocytosis of C. laurentii by granulocytes was observed. This is the first report about the infection of isopods with yeasts. /// La microscopie photonique et lectronique, et l'examen microbiologique de l'haemolymphe infecte de Saduria entomon (Linn, 1758) ont rvl la prsence du champignon Cryptococcus laurentii (Kufferath) Skinner, 1947. La phagocytose de C. laurentii par les granulocytes a t observe. C'est le premier cas signal d'une infection d'Isopodes par des champignons.
20107685|Cave animals show various adaptations to survival in their unusual environment, involving their physiology, behaviour, life history, and morphology. The morphological adaptations include enlargement of the sensory and ambulatory appendages, reduction or lack of pigment in the integument, and reduction or loss of eyes. In general, the eyes of cave animals show only non-constructive adaptations: however, we have found setae on the corneal surfaces in three different genera of cave decapods (Potamalpheops, Macrobrachium, and Procambarus) where setae are normally never present. We suggest that this constitutes the development of a new function for the obsolescent eyes, either tactile or chemosensory. This obviously underscores the general hypertrophy of non-visual sensory systems in cave organisms. /// Los animales caverncolas muestran singulares adaptaciones para sobrevivir en sus ambientes, involucrando principalmente caractersticas de su fisiologa, comportamiento, historia de vida. Las adaptaciones morfolgicas frecuentemente comprenden el alargamiento de los apndices sensoriales y ambulatorios, reduccin o carencia total de pigmentos en el integumento, as como una disminucin o prdida total de los ojos. En general los ojos de los animales caverncolas solo tienen adaptaciones no constructivas; sin embargo, nosotros hemos encontrado setas sobre las superficies de la cornea en tres gneros diferentes de decpodos caverncolas (Potamalpheops, Macrobrachium, y Procambarus) donde las setas normalmente nunca estn presentes sobre la cornea. Sugerimos que esto constituye el desarrollo de una nueva funcin para los ojos obsoletos, ya sea tctil o quimio-receptora. Esto obviamente subraya la hipertrofia general de los sistemas sensoriales no visuales en los organismos de cueva.
20104979|To investigate the behaviour of Scyllarides latus we built a 3000 1 tank with one glass side for observations, setup with ambient, unfiltered, running seawater and a natural assemblage of organisms. Half of the bottom was covered with a substrate made up of large biogenic rocks resembling the rocky reefs where the lobsters are abundant, the other half was covered with bare sand. Eight lobsters, 3 males and 5 females, were tagged and placed in the tanks. Lobsters initially spent significantly more time on the rock substrate, however, after two months they ceased to show a preference. After five months we added two large and two small concrete shelters, placed against the glass for observation. Lobsters preferred to reside together in the large rock shelter. In aggressive displays, usually in competition for food, the slipper lobsters displayed some distinctive behaviour patterns all centered around dislodging the opponent from its grip on the substrate. A dominance matrix made from tallying these aggressive encounters revealed a fairly linear dominance hierarchy amongst lobsters in the tank with the largest female in the dominant position. /// Afin d'tudier le comportement de Scyllarides latus, nous avons construit un bac de 3000 l comportant une face en verre pour les observations, aliment en eau de mer courante,  temprature ambiante, non filtre et contenant une association naturelle de divers organismes. La moiti du fond a t recouverte d'un subtrat constitu de gros rochers en matire biognique ressemblant aux rochers de rcifs naturels o l'on trouve les langoustes en abondance, l'autre moiti a t recouverte de sable nu. Huit scyllares, 3 mles et 5 femelles, ont t marqus et placs dans les bacs. Au dbut, les animaux ont pass significativement plus de temps sur le substrat rocheux; cependant aprs deux mois, ils ont cess de montrer une prfrence. Aprs cinq mois, nous avons ajout deux grands et deux petits abris en ciment, placs contre la vitre pour l'observation. Les scyllares ont prfr demeurer ensemble dans le grand abri. Lors de manifestations agressives, habituellement en comptition pour la nourriture, les scyllares ont prsent des modles de comportement diffrents, mais tous dans le but de dloger l'adversaire de sa prise sur le substrat. Une matrice de dominance ralise en pointant ces rencontres aggressives a rvl une hirarchie de dominance pratiquement linaire chez les animaux du bac, avec la plus grande femelle en position dominante.
20105170|The identity of Cancer armadillus Herbst, 1790, a name not used since it was first established, is clarified. It is shown to be a species of Demania Laurie, 1906 (Brachyura, Xanthidae), a genus of poisonous Indo-West Pacific crabs. Herbst's species is regarded as conspecific with Demania bangladeshensis Ng, Huda & Banu, 1987, and the holotype of D. bangladeshensis is here designated as the neotype of Cancer armadillus. Demania indiana Deb, 1987, is also here regarded as a junior synonym of Demania armadillus. /// L'identit de Cancer armadillus Herbst, 1790, un nom qui n'a pas t utilis depuis qu'il a t tabli pour la premire fois, est claircie. Il est dmontr qu'il s'agit d'une espce de Demania Laurie, 1906 (Brachyura, Xanthidae), un genre de crabes indo-ouest pacifiques toxiques. L'espce de Herbst est considre comme identique  D. bangladeshensis Ng, Huda & Banu, 1987, dont l'holotype est dsign ici comme le notype de Cancer armadillus. Demania indiana Deb, 1987, est regard ici comme un synonyme plus rcent de D. armadillus.

20104820|The spiny lobster Panulirus homarus (Linnaeus, 1758) was reared with the sexes together and separately to study the influence of sex on growth and reproduction. Mixed sexes had higher reproductive activity and lower growth output than either sex grown separately. Males grew faster than females when held separately. Males also grew faster than females when held together, namely at a similar rate as females grown separately. Variations in the sex ratios in nature may cause different reproductive success and growth. /// La langouste Panulirus homarus a t leve, sexes ensemble et sexes spars, afin d'tudier l'influence du sexe sur la croissance et sur la reproduction. Les sexes runis ont une activit reproductrice plus leve et une croissance plus faible que si l'un ou l'autre a t tenu spar. Les mles ont une croissance plus rapide que les femelles quand ils sont spars. Ils ont aussi une croissance plus rapide que les femelles quand ils sont levs ensemble, mais a un taux similaire  celui des femelles qui ont grandi seules. Les variations de sex-ratio dans la nature peuvent tre la cause de diffrences dans le succs reproductif et dans la croissance.

Le rle de l'hormone androgne dans ces processus est discut. /// Masculinization of females of the shrimp Palaemonetes varians was brought on by the implantation of one or two androgenic glands. The masculinization manifested itself after the 5th postoperative moult. Observation, by scanning microscope, of the appendix masculina of the operated females showed that in different individuals it carries a variable number of setae of different types. The role of the androgenic hormone in this process is discussed.

20107642|A study was made of the land crab, Johngarthia lagostoma (H. Milne Edwards, 1837) on Ascension Island in the central South Atlantic: aspects of its distribution, population structure, and reproduction are described. On Ascension it is normally limited to altitudes &gt200 m, the only parts of the island with substantial vegetation. The population comprised predominantly pale colour morphs, and few immature specimens were sampled. The significance of both factors is examined. The breeding migration to the shore was observed. Migrations occurred in February to April, varied in intensity between years, and were dominated by females. Migrants had to cross the bare arid lowlands, resulting in mortality. There are no recent records of the return of the juvenile crabs after the planktonic larval phase. /// Une tude a t mene chez le crabe terrestre Johngarthia lagostoma (H. Les migrateurs ont  traverser les parties basses, dnudes et arides, qui sont cause de mortalit. Il n'y a pas de donnes rcentes sur le retour des crabes juvniles aprs la phase larvaire planctonique.

27743255|In the mouthparts of the crayfish, we find the flagellar exopods of the symmetrical 1st, 2nd, and 3rd maxillipeds, which do not participate in food processing but occasionally generate water currents by their repetitive beating. Earlier, we have observed and filmed the flagellar movements in freely behaving Procambarus cubensis reared in the laboratory, and suggested that these movements were an overt expression of the excited state of the crayfish. Recently, we used a high-speed scan camera (100-240 fps) to observe and document the flagellar movements in the tethered crayfish. Beating of all six flagella occurs with the same frequency (8.3-8.4 Hz). There is, however, an obvious phase shift between various ipsilateral and bilaterally symmetrical flagella. All right and left flagella can beat simultaneously, or only one side can be active. Each flagellum can stop for a short time, which, however, has no influence on the beating of the other flagella. Flagellar movements seen in slowly displayed video-movies are complex and variable in their trajectories, and each flagellum is moving in its own manner. It is suggested that each flagellum has its own central pattern generator, and that activation of all ipsilateral flagella concurrently is established by common higher commands. /// Dans la zone buccale de l'crevisse se trouvent, en symtrie, les exopodites flagelliformes des maxillipdes 1, 2 et 3, qui ne participent pas  l'alimentation, mais de temps en temps crent un courant d'eau par leur battement rpt. Nous avons dj observ et film leurs mouvements chez des Procambarus cubensis maintenues librement en levage au laboratoire et suggr que ces mouvements sont l'expression de l'tat d'excitation de l'crevisse. Rcemment, nous avons utilis une camra ultra-sensible (100-240 fps) pour observer et prciser les mouvements chez des crevisses entraves. Le battement des six flagelles se fait avec la mme frquence (8,3-8,4 Hz). Il y a cependant, une phase vidente de changement entre divers flagelles symtriques homolatraux et bilatraux. Tous les flagelles droits et gauches peuvent battre simultanment ou un seul ct peut tre actif. Chaque flagelle peut s'arrter pendant un petit moment, sans que cela ait une influence sur le battement des autres. Les mouvements flagellaires observs au ralenti sont complexes et variables dans leur trajectoire, et chaque flagelle bouge de sa propre faon. Il est suggr que chaque flagelle a son propre centre de dtermination, et que l'activation de tous les flagelles du mme ct est tablie par une commande suprieure commune.
20107868|Limnomysis benedeni (Czerniavsky, 1882) (Mysidacea) was recorded for the first time in Croatia in the summer of 2004. Five specimens were found in samples from macrophyte stands of Myriophyllum spicatum (L.) and Ceratophyllum demersum (L.) with associated invertebrates, in Lake Sakada in the Kopaki rit floodplain. From environmental monitoring data of Kopaki rit, no important effect from the presence of this species has been recorded yet. However, according to its biological attributes, especially a short life span and generation time, protection of its juveniles, non-specific food preference, and suspension feeding, L. benedeni is characterized as a successful Ponto-Caspian invader, so monitoring of this species in Croatian inland waters is important. /// Limnomysis benedeni (Czerniavsky, 1882) (Mysidacea) a t recontre pour la premire fois en Croatie en t 2004. Cinq spcimens ont t trouvs dans des chantillons provenant de macrophytes Myriophyllum spicatum (L.) et Ceratophyllum demersum (L.) du Lac Sakada dans la plaine d'inondation de Kopaki rit.  partir des donnes environnementales du suivi men dans Kopaki rit, aucun effet notable de la prsence de cette espce n'a t signal. Cependant, en raison de ses caractristiques biologiques, en particulier un court temps de vie et de gnration, la protection de ses jeunes, l'absence de prfrence alimentaire et la nutrition par filtration, L. benedeni est typiquement une espce invasive ponto-caspienne, et la surveillance de cette espce dans les eaux intrieures de Croatie est donc importante.
20104999|The paired, plurilobate testes that make up the male reproductive system of the Leptestheriidae lie on either side of the intestine, occupy most of the haemocoel and extend outwards through two short deferents located at the eleventh pair of limbs. The ample lumen within the gonads, which are wedged into the somatic muscular bundle, is full of a muco-polysaccharide fluid matrix exhibiting a few, widely scattered germinal elements. The wall consists of a simple epithelium containing somatic and germinal cells mixed together. The sperms mature in the lumen and collect in the ampulla in front of the deferents; the wall of the deferents is formed by an epithelium of vacuolated cells surrounded by a muscular bundle and their lumen is usually collapsed. The sperm is expelled along with the polysaccharide matrix by contraction of the somatic muscular bundle and of the deferents, which swell out to become ducts. The matrix condenses on the outside in a sticky, fibrous structure that coats the germinal elements so as to form a spermatophore. A functional interpretation of the male genital apparatus is discussed. /// Il sistema riproducttore maschile dei Leptestheriidae  costituito da due testicoli pari sacciformi lobati, posti ai lati dell'intestino e occupanti la gran parte dell'emocele. Essi sboccano all'esterno, attraverso due corti deferenti, a livello dell'undicesimo paio di arti. All'interno delle gonadi, che si incuneano tra la muscolatura somatica, l'ampio lume  pieno di un fluido a matrice mucopolisaccaridica in cui si evidenziano pochi e sparsi elementi germinali. La parete  constituita da un semplice epitelio in cui sono frammiste cellule somatiche e germinali. Gli spermi maturano nel lume e si raccolgono in ampolle, che precedono i deferenti. Questi hanno una parete formata da un epitelio di cellule vacuolate circondato da uno strato muscolare; il loro lume  normalmente collassato. Gli spermi vengono espulsi, insieme alla matrice mucopolisaccaridica, in seguito alle contrazioni della muscolatura somatica e dei deferenti che divengono pertanto pervi. All'esterno la matrice si condensa, in una struttura fibrosa che invischia gli elementi germinali formando le spermatofore. Viene discussa l'interpretazione funzionale dell'apparato genitale maschile.
20107740|In males and females of Dikerogammarus villosus, a depression in the integument was found at each side of the cephalon. These depressions have a specialized and, apparently, elastic cuticular lining. We assume that the depressions function as statocysts because of their backward location on the cephalon, just in front of the first pereionite, and also because of the remarkable resemblance with statocysts described from palinurid decapods, where such depressions form the outside expression of the statocysts present in the peduncles of the antennulae. /// Chez les mles et les femelles de Dikerogammarus villosus, une dpression dans le tgument a t observe de chaque ct du cphalon. Ces dpressions sont bordes par une ride cuticulaire spcialise et apparemment lastique. Nous supposons que ces dpressions fonctionnent comme des statocystes en raison de leur situation, en arrire sur le cphalon, juste devant le premier prionite, et aussi par la ressemblance remarquable de ces structures avec les statocystes dcrits chez les dcapodes Palinuridae, chez lesquels de telles dpressions constituent l'expression externe des statocystes prsents dans les pdoncules antennulaires.

Ces mouvements ont t excuts seulement par les futurs perdants des assauts antagoniques. Quoique, dans l'ensemble, l'agitation des antennes fut la mme aux diffrents niveaux de lumire, dans l'obscurit l'crevisse agitait ses antennes moins frquemment mais pendant de plus longues priodes, et davantage de mouvements taient ainsi raliss. Dans l'obscurit les antagonistes maintenaient leurs pinces en contact plus longtemps et les perdants excutaient des mouvements d'alimentation et de toilette, et pendant plus longtemps, que lorsqu'ils taient clairs. La plus grande dure des assauts antennaires dans l'obscurit laisse supposer que la vision joue un rle d'information et permet normalement une dcision plus efficace dans les rencontres antagoniques.

20104841|La distribuzione stagionale di Artemia salina e Branchinella spinosa (Anostraca)  stata studiata in una pozza temporanea salmastra della costa occidentale della Sardegna. Artemia  presente da sola a salinit superiori al 70%, mentre per valori inferiori  presente anche Branchinella. Uno studio dettagliato della fluttuazioni annuali dei parametri chimicofisici ha dimostrato che il ciclo vitale di quest'ultima specie  assai pi limitato in confronto a quello di Artemia. La biologia delle due specie  stata studiata in termini di schiusa, velocit di crescita, maturazione sessuale e riproduzione. Entrambe coesistono allo stadio di adulto per un lasso di tempo strettamente dipendente dagli eventi climatici. La breve sovrapposizionne dei cicli osservata ha inoltre sollevato la questione di una possibile competizione, o di eventuali meccanismi per evitarla. Comunque le significative differenze rilevate per quanto concerne i tratti fondamentali del ciclo, e le differenze di dimensioni delle due specie in esame fanno ritenere che esista una separazione di nicchia. I risultati ottenuti vengono discussi e confrontati con altri casi segnalati in letteratura.

20103618|Ce travail comporte une estimation de la croissance, de l'ge en fonction de la taille, et de la taille  la maturit sexuelle chez le crabe Chionoecetes bairdi, d'aprs les modes observs dans la distribution des frquences de tailles et la mesure de croissance  la mue. Les femelles effectuent une mue terminale  la maturit,  une taille moyenne de 83 mm de largeur de carapace. La croissance est moindre, de faon significative, pour les femelles,  leur mue de maturit que pour les mles de mme taille ( = 0,05). Cette tude a montr qu'il n'y avait pas de diffrences significatives dans la croissance par mue ( = 0,025) d'une anne  l'autre. La relation croissance-ge propose indiquerait que les femelles ont leur mue de maturit vers l'ge de cinq ans, tandis que les mles atteignent la maturit vers six ans. Les pcheries portent seulement sur les mles qui ont de 6  8 ans au moins. Les plus grands mles pchs commercialement n'ont probablement gure plus de 12  15 ans.

41038618|The seasonal composition of the diet of the infralittoral portunid crab, Portwnnus latipes was determined, based on an analysis of 92 individuals collected from Imeros beach (northern Aegean Sea) during the four consecutive seasons of 2004. P. latipes seems to be an omnivorous species, mainly feeding on macroinvertebrates while macroalgae also participated in its diet. In winter, spring, and autumn, the dominant prey categories were Crustacea followed by Polychaeta and macroalgae, while in summer the order was Polychaeta followed by Crustacea and macroalgae. The observed seasonal differences in the composition of the diet of this species seem to reflect corresponding seasonal population changes of its preys. P. latipes seems to have a diet similar to its midlittoral congeneric, Portumnus lysianassa, since when wave action is reduced, P. latipes ascends to the midlittoral zone in order to feed. Stomach fullness percentages indicated a higher feeding activity of this species in winter and spring than in summer and autumn. This is probably due to the necessity of accumulating energy resources for the spawning period, which begins in winter. La composition saisonnire du rgime alimentaire du crabe infra-littoral portunid Portumnus latipes a t dtermine  partir de l'analyse de 92 individus collects sur la plage de Imeros (nord de la Mer Ege) durant les quatre saisons conscutives de 2004. P. latipes semble tre une espce omnivore, se nourrissant surtout de macro-invertbrs bien que des macro-algues participent aussi  son rgime. En hiver, printemps et automne, les catgories dominantes de proies ont t les Crustaces, suivis par les Polychtes et les macro-algues, tandis qu'en t l'ordre a t les Polychtes suivis par les Crustacs et les macro-algues. Les diffrences saisonnieres observes dans le rgime de cette espce semblent reflter les changements correspondants saisonniers dans les populations de ses proies. P. latipes semble avoir un regime semblable  celui du mme genre mid-littoral Portumnus lysianassa, en effet quand les vagues sont rduites, P latipes accde  la zone mid-littorale pour se nourrir. Les pourcentages de remplissage stomacal ont montr une plus grande activit d'alimentation de cette espce en hiver qu'en t et automne. Ceci est probablement du  la ncessit d'accumuler des ressources nergtiques pour la priode de ponte, qui commence en hiver.
27822629|The mud crab, Rhithropanopeus harrisii has been found in 10 freshwater impoundments in Texas. Breeding populations were confirmed in eight of these reservoirs by the presence of gravid females, juvenile crabs, and zoeae in the plankton. Salinities varied from a low of 0.5 at Tradinghouse Creek Reservoir to a high of 3.0 at Lake Colorado City. A salinity of 0.5 is considerably below that reported previously for larval survival. Crabs were induced to breed in the lab at a salinity of 1.9 and hatching occurred at salinities as low as 0.5. DNA sequencing of the mitochondrial cytochrome c oxidase I (COI) gene for four reservoir populations revealed the presence of genetic structure and differences in levels of genetic diversity between reservoirs. Potential mechanisms of introduction are addressed. Le crabe Rhithropanopeus harrisii a t trouv dans 10 bassins de rtention au Texas. Des populations en reproduction ont t confirmes dans 8 de ces rservoirs par la prsence de femelles gravides, de crabes juvniles et de zos dans le plancton. Les salinits varient d'un minimum de 0,5 au Tradinghouse Creek Reservoir  un maximum de 3,0 au lac Colorado City. La salinit 0,5 est considrablement en dessous de celle reporte pour la survie larvaire. La reproduction des crabes a t induite au laboratoire  une salinit de 1,9 et l'closion se ralise  des salinits aussi basses que 0,5. La squence DNA du gne mitochondrial de la cytochrome c oxydase I (COI) pour 4 populations de rservoirs diffrents rvle la prsence de diffrences dans la structure gntique et dans les niveaux de diversit gntique entre les rservoirs. Les mcanismes potentiels d'introduction sont discuts.
20103941|The development of the size distribution curve in Macrobrachium rosenbergii postlarval (PL) populations, reared under various stocking densities was examined. It was found that newly metamorphosed PL demonstrate a log-normal size distribution which with time becomes positively skewed. Individuals within the "leading tail" - jumpers, exhibit a higher growth rate than the bulk of the population. The appearance of the leading tail is enhanced under low initial stocking densities, as demonstrated by the negative correlation between the average weight and skewness on one hand, and the initial stocking density on the other. It is suggested that the appearance of jumpers is not a result of competition alone, but also of intrinsic factors associated with the population development, such as genetic or social in nature.
27822646|Juvenile instars II, IV, and V of the anchialine halocyprid ostracod Danielopolina kornickeri Danielopol, Baltanas & Humphreys, 2000 (Thaumatocyprididae) are described and illustrated. In addition, a supplementary description of the adult male is presented. Specimens had been collected in Bundera Sinkhole, the type locality of the species in Western Australia. Also, juvenile instars I and II of the deep-sea species Thaumatoconcha radiata Kornicker & Sohn, 1976, which is in the same family as members of the genus Danielopolina, are described and illustrated. It is tentatively concluded that during its ontogeny, D. kornickeri has 6 growth stages; morphological characters useful in identifying the stage and sex of juveniles of D. kornickeri are presented. Finally, the hypothesis is proposed for an anchialine cave ancestor to the present-day planktonic Halocyprididae, now widely spread in the oceans. Les stades juvniles II, IV et V de l'ostracode anchihalin de la famille des Halocyprididae, Danielopolina kornickeri Danielopol, Baltanas & Humphreys, 2000 sont dcrits et illustrs. Une description complmentaire du mle adulte est galement prsente. Les spcimens ont t collects  Bundera Sinkhole, la localit-type de l'espce en Australie occidentale. De mme, les stades juvniles I et II de l'espce d'eaux profondes Thaumatoconcha radiata Kornicker & Sohn, 1976, taxon attribu  la mme famille comme membres du genre Danielopolina sont dcrits et illustrs. La conclusion provisoire est que, au cours de son ontognie, D. kornickeri montre 6 stades de croissance; les caractres morphologiques utiles pour l'identification du stade et du sexe des stades juvniles de D. kornickeri sont prsents. Enfin, l'hypothse d'un anctre vivant dans des grottes anchihalines est propose pour les Halocyprididae, aujourd'hui planctoniques et largement rpandus dans les ocans.
20106365|The occurrence of sandhoppers (Talitrus saltator) was studied on a scale of meters, hundreds of meters, and kilometres along the 30 km long Hel Peninsula in Poland. The animals occurred in patches of several meters in diameter which were separated by kilometres of uninhabited sand. Seasonal movements occurred; animals were found in spring and early summer close to the water line and in late summer and autumn farther up on the shore. A few juveniles, apparently from the wintering population, were observed in April, although the main breeding took place in late July. Two generations a year are produced and the life span is 4-5 months for the spring generation and 8 months for the winter one. The juveniles tend to be more widely dispersed in comparison with the adults. /// La prsence de Talitrus saltator a t tudi sur une chelle en mtres, en centaines de mtres et en kilomtres sur 30 km le long de la pninsule de Hel en Pologne. Les animaux taient disposs en groupes de plusieurs mtres de diamtre, spars par des kilomtres de sable inhabit. Des mouvements saisonniers ont t observs; les animaux ont t trouvs au printemps et au debut de l't prs de la ligne d'eau et  la fin de l't et en automne, beaucoup plus haut sur la grve. Quelques juvniles, apparemment de la population d'hiver, ont t trouvs en avril, cependant, la reproduction se situait principalement fin juillet. Deux gnrations sont produites par an et la dure de vie est de 4-5 mois pour la gnration de printemps et de 8 mois pour la gnration d'hiver. Les juvniles tendent  tre plus largement disperss par rapport aux adultes.
20105220|For the great majority of the amphipods and isopods a biased sex ratio is attributed to photoperiod or to micro-organisms present in the cytoplasm of the oocytes. Since monogenous pairs are found in orders and species phylogenetically very far from each other, in order to try and clarify this phenomenon, two geographical populations of Asellus aquaticus (Isopoda) were collected in the Netherlands and in Italy, where the duration of the cold season and the photoperiods are very different. From these parental (P) populations, 200 females and 200 males per population were randomly subsampled and bred under standard conditions of temperature and nutrition. One half of each P generation was subjected to 18 hours light per day, the other to 14 hours light per day. New-born of each pair (laboratory F1) were grown up to differentiation of external sexual characters under the same photoperiod experienced by the parents. Also, hybrid F1 generation, born from mating between the two populations, was conceived in both photoperiods, but, after birth, one half of the new-born was maintained in the same photoperiod in which they were conceived, the other half was grown under the other photoperiod. No significant difference between the sex ratios was found in the two photoperiods, neither between Italian nor between Dutch Asellus. The sex ratio of Dutch F1 is female biased, while it is male biased in Italian Asellus. The female- or male-biased sex ratio can be ascribed to the high proportion of monogenous pairs in which offspring sex ratio is significantly biased towards females (in the Dutch population) and/or in which offspring sex ratio is significantly biased towards males (in the Italian population). On the basis of these results we can rule out the influence of photoperiod in sex determination for this species. The results shown by the hybrids suggest some form of maternal inheritance. In fact, the hybrids' sex ratio as indeed the frequency of pairs breeding one sex alone, was skewed towards the same sex for which the maternal population showed a bias. We therefore consider the possibility of sex determination associated with a cytoplasmic factor (a mitochondrial DNA?), which would inactivate only one of the two sets of genes governing sex determination. /// Certaines populations de crustacs (amphipodes et isopodes) ont la sex ratio dvie de 50%. Ce phnomne est attribu  la photopriode ou  des bactries endocellulaires. Etant donn que des couples monognes sont prsents parmi des ordres et des espces phylogniquement loigns, nous avons tudi ce phnomne en utilisant deux populations d'Asellus aquaticus prleves en Hollande (Utrecht) et en Italie (Naples), pays o la photopriode et la dure de la saison froide sont fort diffrentes. Par population, 200 femelles et 200 mles ont t levs avec une nourriture standardise, une temprature constante, avant, pendant et aprs la copulation. Cent couples par population, ont t exposs  18 heures de lumire/jour, 100 autres couples (par population) ont t exposs  14 heures de lumire par jour. Les nouveau-ns de chaque couple (la F1 de laboratoire) ont t elevs dans les mmes conditions que leurs parents. Les hybrides de la F1 de laboratoire, ns de couples entre les deux populations, ont galement t conus dans les deux photopriodes, mais la moiti des nouveau-ns sont rests dans la photopriode dans laquelle ils ont t conus, l'autre moiti tant elevs sous l'autre photopriode. Il n'y a eu aucune diffrence dans les sex ratios des F1 de la mme population eleve dans les deux photopriodes: la sex ratio de la F1 hollandaise est  fort taux de femelles, celle de la F1 italienne  fort taux de mles. La diffrence est attribue  la prsence de couples monognes, o la sex ratio des descendants est dvie au profit de femelles (parmi les couples hollandais), o au profit des mles (parmi les couples italiens). Cela nous a permis d'liminer l'influence de la photopriode sur la dtermination du sexe de l'Asellus. Les rsultats obtenus avec les hybrides suggrent la possibilit d'un hritage maternel. La frquence (et le type) des couples monognes est la mme que celle de la population maternelle. De mme, la sex ratio au niveau de la population est dvie vers le sexe prpondrant dans la population maternelle. De ce fait nous avons considr que la dtermination du sexe pouvait tre due  un facteur cytoplasmique (un DNA mitochondrial?) qui inactive, de faon alatoire, un seul des deux gnes responsables de la dtermination du sexe.
20104893|In this paper the biometric relationships between the different body parts of decapods are described, allowing the reconstruction of size and biomass (weight) of each sample from its hard parts (chelae and cephalothorax). The usefulness of this study lies in the interpretation of the feeding habits of demersal fish which feed on decapod crustaceans, since the slow digestion of hard skeletons of Decapods gives rise to the appearance of numerous hard parts in fish stomach contents. /// En este estudio se describen las relaciones biomtricas entre las distintas partes del cuerpo de los crustceos decpodos, lo que permite la reconstruccin de la talla y biomasa (peso) de cada ejemplar a partir de sus partes duras (quela y cefalotorax). La utilidad de este trabajo radica en la interpretacin de los hbitos alimenticios de los peces demersales que se alimentan de crustceos decpodos, ya que la lenta digestin del exoesqueleto de los crustceos permite la aparicin de numerosas partes duras en los contenidos estomacales.
20106055|Two new ancorabolid species, Ceratonotus magellanicus sp. n. and Ceratonotus antarcticus sp. n., are described from the Straits of Magellan (Chile) and from Halley Bay (Weddell Sea, Antarctica), respectively. This is the first record of the genus from the Southern Hemisphere extending its range to the extreme south of the globe. Both new species are clearly distinct, each characterized by several unique features. They share a few characters which are absent in the two known species from the Northern Hemisphere. It is, however, not clear yet whether this indicates that they represent a subgroup distinct from the northern species within the genus. /// Die beiden Arten Ceratonotus magellanicus sp. n. und Ceratonotus antarcticus sp. n. aus der Magellanstrae (Chile) beziehungsweise von Halley Bay (Weddell-See, Antarktis) werden beschrieben. Dies ist der erste Nachweis der Gattung fr die Sdhemisphre, womit ihr Verbreitungsgebiet bis in den uersten Sden der Erde reicht. Beide Arten sind eindeutig durch spezielle Merkmale gekennzeichnet und weisen bereinstimmungen auf, von denen noch nicht klar ist, ob sie die beiden Arten als eigene Untergruppe innerhalb der Gattung ausweisen.
20107884|Species composition, distribution, and spatio-temporal dynamics of hyperbenthic Mysidae Haworth, 1825 (Peracarida, Mysida) were studied on the continental shelf of the northern Adriatic Sea. A total of seven species was collected: Anchialina agilis, Erythrops elegans, Haplostylus lobatus, Leptomysis gracilis, Mysidopsis angusta, Mysidopsis gibbosa, and Paraleptomysis banyulensis. The hyperbenthic mysid assemblage was dominated by A. agilis, E. elegans, and L. gracilis, in terms of frequency of occurrence, abundance, and biomass. Notable seasonal fluctuations in the abundance of the catches were observed, with a minimum reached in the period July-September, probably due to the species' life cycles as well as to environmental factors, such as the presence of mucilaginous aggregates close to the bottom. /// Se estudiaron la composicin en especies, la distribucin y la dinmica espacio-temporal de los crustaceos suprabentonicos de la familia Mysidae Haworth, 1825 (Peracarida, Mysida), en un area de la plataforma continental del Mar Adriatico del Norte. Siete especies fueron capturadas: Anchialina agilis, Erythrops elegans, Haplostylus lobatus, Leptomysis gracilis, Mysidopsis angusta, Mysidopsis gibbosa, Paraleptomysis banyulensis. A. agilis, E. elegans y L. gracilis dominaron las capturas, por lo que concierne la frecuencia de captura, los valores de abundancia y biomasa. Las capturas mostraron amplias fluctuaciones temporales, con un mnimo en Julio-Septiembre, probablemente debido tanto a las caracteristicas del ciclo biolgico de las especies como a factores ambientales, en este caso a la presencia de agregados mucilaginosos cerca del fondo.
20104934|Since the first finding in 1853 (Frivaldszky, 1865), 27 Amphipoda have been reported from Hungary, half of them being Niphargus species. The other amphipod species belong to the genera Gammarus, Dikerogammarus, Echinogammarus, Corophium, Synurella, Orchestia, and Talitrus. The most detailed data are available from Lake Balaton where altogether 8 species were found in different habitats, only a few species occurring together. In the 1930s Corophium curvispinum invaded Lake Balaton. This species was reported from Hungary for the first time in 1916 (from the Danube). In the 1950s Dikerogammarus species replaced Gammarus roeselii in the lake. We investigated the ecology of the Amphipoda fauna in Lake Balaton from 1983 to 1987. Both on the submerged macrophytes and in the stony littoral zone of Lake Balaton Corophium curvispinum, Dikerogammarus haemobaphes, and Dikerogammarus villosus occur, with dominancy of Corophium curvispinum. C. curvispinum and D. haemobaphes, living on the submerged macrophyte Myriophyllum spicatum near Tihany peninsula, reproduce in late spring, summer, and early autumn. They produce two generations a year. The biomass of C. curvispinum and D. haemobaphes was roughly 11 and 0.1 g animal dry wt.
20105041|This study looks at the changes in nominal fishing effort and fishing power that occurred between 1971-72 and 1991-92. It examined the trends in the use of various components of fishing power (e.g., radar, colour echo sounder, global positioning system, pot type) and their effect on catch rates, using a two stage ANOVA/regression approach. This information is then used to standardise the time series of nominal fishing effort to reflect changes in fishing power. The changes in fishing power with respect to months and depth of fishing, and fishing regions, are discussed. The standardised fishing effort is then used in modeling the effect of exploitation on the breeding stock. /// Cette tude envisage l'effort nominal de pche et la capacit qui ont t observs entre 1971-72 et 1991-92 [pour la langouste Panulirus cygnus]. Elle examine les tendances dans l'usage des diverses composantes des moyens de pche (par ex., radar, cho-sondeur, systme global de positionnement, type de casier) et leur effet sur les taux de capture, utilisant une approache ANOVA/rgression  deux stades. Cette information est alors employe en vue de standardiser les sries temporelles d'effort nominal de pche pour reflter les changements dans les moyens de pche. Ces changements, en fonction des mois, des profondeurs et des rgions de pche, sont discuts. L'effort de pche standardis est alors utilis en modlisant l'effet d'exploitation sur le stock de reproduction.
