23065237|The routine metabolic rate (QO in mg O g DW h) was measured in juveniles of the brown shrimp, Farfantepenaeus aztecus (Ives, 1891) at salinity and temperature ranges prevailing during the cold and warm seasons at the coastal lagoon of Tamiahua, Veracruz, Mexico. A semiclosed respirometer was employed, with eight 4-L experimental chambers, each containing two shrimp of similar size and sex. The shrimp were fasting and in the intermoult stage, and acclimated to the chambers for 12 h prior to determining oxygen consumption. Oxygen measurements were taken every two hours with a partial replacement of water and aeration of one hour between readings. In a 24 h cycle, 6 to 8 measurements were made. Relations between QO and DW, for the different salinity and temperature conditions tested, were calculated and adjusted to the equation: QO = DW  . Two-way ANOVA was applied to analyse the effect of salinity, temperature, time of day, and body weight on F. aztecus QO. Salinity had no significant (p > 0.05) effect upon the shrimp's routine metabolic rate at intervals of 26 to 34 psu and 22 to 36 psu, typical of the cold and warm seasons, respectively. However, seasonal temperature variation did significantly affect the shrimp's QO, thus suggesting the existence of a different "pattern of acclimatization" in the energy requirements of the individuals from both seasons. The results indicate that the population of F. aztecus from this area of the Gulf of Mexico may represent a "cline", the physiological response of the components of which differs from that of other brown shrimp populations distributed over a wide geographical range in the western tropical Atlantic. Se midi la tasa metablica de rutina (QO: mg O g PS h) en camarones juveniles de la especie Farfantepenaeus aztecus (Ives, 1891), en regmenes de salinidad  temperatura tpicos de las fluctuaciones de estos factores en las pocas clida y fra del ciclo anual de la laguna de Tamiahua, Veracruz, Mxico. Se emple un respirmetro semi  cerrado, con ocho cmaras experimentales de 4L de capacidad, conteniendo dos camarones de talla y sexo similar. Los camarones se aclimataron 12 h en las cmaras, previo a la fase experimental, se encontraban en ayunas y en estado de intermuda. Las mediciones se tomaron cada dos horas con un recambio parcial de agua y aireacin de una hora entre lecturas. Se realizaron de 6 a 8 mediciones durante un ciclo de 24 h. Se calcularon las relaciones QO-PS, de las distintas condiciones de salinidad-temperature ensayadas, la ecuacin es del tipo: QO = PS  . Se analiz por ANOVA el efecto de la salinidad, temperatura, hora del da y peso corporal, sobre el QO de F. aztecus en los diversos ciclos medidos. La salinidad no afect significativamente la tasa metablica de rutina de los camarones, en los intervalos de 26-34 ups y 22-36 ups, tpicos de la estacin fra y clida del ao. La variacin de temperatura estacional, influy significativamente el QO de los camarones, indicando un "patrn de acllimatizacin" distinto, en los requerimientos energticos de los camarones de ambas pocas. Los resultados indican que la poblacin de F. aztecus de esta regin del Golfo de Mxico, debera considerarse como un "cline", debido a su desempeo fisiolgico distinto de otras poblaciones de la misma especie, dentro de su amplio rango de distribucin latitudinal.
20102983|Es wird die vollstndige Beschreibung von Sphaeronellopsis hebe (Bowman & Kornicker, 1967) gegeben. Von diesem choniostomatiden Copepoden sind nur 2 Copepoditen bekannt, die in einem Ostracoden, Pseudophilomedes ferulanus Kornicker, 1959, vor der Kste von North Carolina in 130 m Tiefe gefunden wurden. Die Unterbringung dieses Choniostomatiden in das Genus Sphaeronellopsis und nicht in Sphaeronella, geschieht nur auf Grund des Wirtes.
20101643|Es wird eine neue Gattung und Art der Familie Nephropidae, Nephropides caribaeus, beschrieben, und die Unterschiede mit anderen Gattungen dieser Familie werden erwhnt. Zugleich wird ein Schlssel zu allen bekannten amerikanischen Nephropiden-Arten gegeben.
20102482|Dr. J. H. Stock collected, in the tidal region of the coast of Brittany, France, some cyclopoid copepods which are commensals of the following Polychaeta: Nereis diversicolor, Sabellaria alveolata, Halosydna gelatinosa and Harmothoe sp. Three new species (Cyclopina tuberculata, Halicyclops stocki and Halicyclops incognitus) are described and figured, as also are Cyclopina kieferi Schfer and Halicyclops rotundipes Kiefer.
27743220|A survey of chromosome studies among cyclopoid copepods is provided on the basis of new findings and data from the literature. Standard karyotypes of the Cyclopoida reveal substantial diversity in karyotypes. In some genera there are major karyotypic differences between species, whereas other groups appear to be highly conservative. Acanthocyclops americanus has the lowest known chromosome number, 2n = 10, and Megacyclops viridis the highest, 2n = 24, among cyclopoid copepods. Chromosome morphology has not successfully been employed in phylogenetic studies yet, since karyotypes are known only for about 4% of the copepod families and 8% of cyclopoid families. It is difficult to homologize copepod chromosomes, as chromosome shape provides only limited information and chromosome number is arbitrary, since fissions and fusions seem likely to occur independently. However, cytogenetic information may provide a useful evolutionary tool, particularly in the discovery of sibling or cryptic taxa, and for the clarification of generic boundaries. /// Es wird eine bersicht zu Chromosomenstudien an cyclopoiden Copepoden gegeben auf der Grundlage eigener Untersuchungen und Daten aus der Literatur. Karyotypen der Cyclopoida zeigen eine erhebliche Diversitt. Bei einigen Gattungen bestehen Artunterschiede whrend andere Taxa eher konservative Merkmalsausprgungen aufweisen. Unter den Cyclopoida weist Acanthocyclops americanus die niedrigste bekannte Chromosomenanzahl von 2n = 10 auf, und Megacyclops viridis die hchste von 2n = 24. Die Chromosomenmorphologie ist noch nicht erfolgreich in phylogenetischen Studien genutzt worden, da Karyotypen von nur etwa 4% der Copepodenfamilien und von 8% der Cyclopidenfamilien bekannt sind. Es ist schwierig die Chromosomen der Cyclopoida und der Copepoda im allgemeinen zu homologisieren, da ihre Struktur nur eingeschrnkt brauchbare Informationen bereitstellt. Die Nutzung der Chromosomenanzahl ist problematisch, da Ploidien und Verschmelzungen verbreitet sind und unabhngig voneinender entstehen knnen. Demgegenber stellen cytogenetische Infomationen ein brauchbares Instrumentarium zur Verfgung fr das Erkennen von kryptischen Arten oder Geschwisterarten und fr die Abgrenzung von Gattungen.
20104135|Von der im Brackwasser der Aestuarien, Fjorde und Buchten weit verbreiteten Copepoden-art Eurytemora affinis wurden von Mrz bis Mai im Elbe-Aestuar viele geschlechtsreife Individuen in der Swasserregion festgestellt, wohin sie aus der Brackwasserregion eingewandert sein mssen. Hierfr spricht auch der dichte Bewuchs mit der als Brackwasser-Bewohner bekannten Ciliaten-Art Myoschiston centropagidarum. Nach der Ei-Entwicklung driften die Nauplien mit der Ebbstrmung seewrts in die Brackwasserregion. Die heranwachsenden Copepoditen knnen wahrscheinlich noch im gleichen Jahr wieder den Strom aufwrts migrieren. Solche Laichwanderungen hren erst im Herbst auf, wenn die Temperatur zu niedrig wird. Die berwinterung findet also in der Brackwasserzone statt, wo der Bewuchs mit M. centropagidarum erfolgt. Eine solche anadrome Frhjahrs-Laichwanderung in das Swasser ist fr Crustaceen ungewhnlich. Auch die Beobachtungen in anderen Kstengewssern Europas und Nordamerikas sprechen dafr, da die anadromen Laichwanderungen eine verhaltensspezifische Adaptation darstellen, um der Verdriftung in das Meer zu entgehen.

27743387|Fourteen species of Paguristes were collected in the Philippines during the expeditions MUSORSTOM 1 (1976), 2 (1980), 3 (1985), and PANGLAO (2004). Among the species collected, two are recognized as new, Paguristes aulacis n. sp., characterized by a longitudinal sulcus on the lateral surface of the carpi of the chelipeds, and P. macrops n. sp., easily distinguished from other members of the genus that have an unarmed telson and unequal chelipeds, by the long ocular peduncles that are always longer than the shield. Only one of 12 known species, Paguristes alcocki McLaughlin & Rahayu, has been recorded previously in the Philippines. The species that have a wide distribution in the Indo-West Pacific (P. calvus Alcock, P. palythophilus Ortmann, P. puniceus Henderson) and the species known only from the type locality (P. brachyrostris Rahayu, P. runyanae Haig & Ball, P. versus Komai) are also here recorded. P. lewinsohni McLaughlin & Rahayu, previously known only from the Red Sea and the Indian Ocean, shows its distribution to extend to the Philippines. P. gonagrus H. Milne Edwards is redescribed. Another three species (P. antennarius Rahayu, P. arostratus Rahayu, and P. albimaculatus Komai) were previously reported only from Indonesia and Japan. /// Quatorze espces de Paguristes ont t recueillies aux Philippines au cours des campagnes MUSORSTOM 1 (1976), 2 (1980), 3 (1985) et PANGLAO (2004). Deux espces ont t reconnues comme nouvelles: Paguristes aulacis n. sp., caractris par un sillon longitudinal sur la surface latrale du carpe des chlipdes, et P. macrops n. sp., facilement distingu des autres membres du genre dots d'un telson inerme et de chlipdes gaux, par les longs pdoncules oculaires, toujours plus longs que l'cusson. Une seule des 12 epces dj connues, Paguristes alcocki McLaughlin & Rahayu, avait t prcdemment signale des Philippines. Des espces qui ont une large distribution dans l'Indo-Ouest Pacifique (P. calvus Alcock, P. palythophilus Ortmann, P. puniceus Henderson) et celles qui n'taient connues que de la localit-type (P. brachyrostris Rahayu, P. runyanae Haig & Ball, P. versus Komai) sont signales. P. lewinsohni McLaughlin & Rahayu, prcdemment connu de la mer Rouge et de l'ocan Indien seulement a montr que sa distribution s'tendait aux Philippines. P. gonagrus H. Milne Edwards est redcrit. Trois autres espces (P. antennarius Rahayu, P. arostratus Rahayu et P. albimaculatus Komai) n'avaient encore t signales que d'Indonsie et du Japon.
20105097|Eight-hundred-and-twenty-five individuals of Penaeus kerathurus were obtained from the landings of shrimp trawlers in a programme from February 1991 to February 1992. These samples consisted of 479 females and 346 males. In each sample the smallest sized specimen was a male and the biggest a female. The mean size Lc (= carapace length) of females (38.8 mm) is significantly greater than the mean size of males (Lc = 32.5 mm). Allometric equations show that the increases in size of, e.g., telson, rostrum, height, total size or weight in relation to the carapace length (reference size) is nearly equal for the two sexes and is expressed for all characters (except height and weight) in both sexes by a negative allometry. Application of the equality test of the regression slope for male and female shows that the parallelism hypothesis is accepted for all the regressions established, except that of weight in relation to the total length where the difference is highly significant. /// Huit-cent vingt-cinq individus de Penaeus kerathurus, constitus de 479 femelles et 346 mles, ont t prlevs mensuellement sur les dbarquements des chalutiers crevettiers de fvrier 1991  fvrier 1992. Dans chaque chantillon mensuel le plus grand individu s'est montr une femelle et le plus petit un mle. La taille moyenne des femelles (38,8 mm de Lc) est significativement plus grande que celle des mles (32,5 mm). Des quations morphomtriques montrent que la croissance relative des organes tels que le telson, le rostre, la hauteur, la taille totale ou le poids par rapport  celle du cphalothorax (taille de rfrence) est trs proche chez les deux sexes et exprime, pour tous les caractres  l'exception de la hauteur et du poids, par une allomtrie ngative pour les deux sexes. L'application du test d'galit des coefficients de regression des mles et des femelles montre que l'hypothse du paralllisme des droites, correspondant aux mles et aux femelles, est accepte pour les diffrentes relations ralises, except celle du poids en fonction de la taille totale de l'animal o la diffrence est hautement significative.

20111468|Investigations on reproductive aspects of the ridgetail prawn, Exopalaemon carinicauda were made in the Hampyong Bay of Korea from January 2003 to December 2004. Males and females comprised 31.6% and 68.4% of the total sample, respectively. There was a predominance of females in the sex ratio. Females progressively dominated the larger size classes. Female maturity was determined by the size of ovigerous females and of females with maturing ovary. The size at which 50% of females are mature is estimated as 14.97  4.63 mm CL. The main breeding season, from June to August, coincided with higher gonadosomatic indices. A significant difference in ovarian weight between females with non-eyed and with eyed egg stages was found. In this season, ovaries rematured during embryonic development, indicating a potential for multiple ovulations. Based on the incubation time of the embryos, females seemed to have at least two broods per year. Brood size showed a positive allometry to female body size with no apparent egg loss during incubation. The egg volume increased by 91% from 0.78  0.17 $\text{mm}^{3}$ at non-eyed eggs to 1.50  0.34 $\text{mm}^{3}$ at eyed eggs. Based on dry weight, an egg batch averaged 14% of female weight, indicating an investment in egg production similar to that in other marine shrimps, but lower than that of freshwater shrimps. /// Des recherches sur la reproduction de la crevette Exopalaemon carinicauda ont t menes dans la baie de Hampyong en Core de janvier 2003  dcembre 2004. Des mles et des femelles composaient l'chantillon total,  respectivement 31,6% et 68,4%, avec une prdominance de femelles dans la sex-ratio. Les femelles ont progressivement domin les plus grandes classes de taille. La maturit des femelles tait dtermine par la taille des femelles ovigres et des femelles avec un ovaire en cours de maturation. La taille  laquelle 50% des femelles sont matures est estime  14,97  4,63 mm CL. La principale saison de ponte, de juin  aot, concide avec des indices gonado-somatiques plus levs. Une diffrence significative dans le poids de l'ovaire entre femelles ayant des stades ufs avec yeux et ayant des ufs sans yeux a t trouve. Au cours de cette saison, les ovaires ont eu une deuxime maturation au cours du dveloppement embryonnaire, indiquant un potentiel pour des ovulations multiples. En considrant le temps d'incubation des embryons, les femelles semblaient avoir au moins deux pontes par an. La taille des pontes montrait une allomtrie positive par rapport  la taille du corps de la femelle sans perte apparente d'ufs au cours de l'incubation. Le volume de l'uf augmentait de 91% de 0,78  0,17 $\text{mm}^{3}$ chez les ufs sans yeux  1,50  0,34 $\text{mm}^{3}$ chez les ufs avec yeux.  partir du poids sec, l'ensemble des ufs reprsentait en moyenne 14% du poids de la femelle, indiquant un investissement dans la production des oeufs analogue  celui des autres crevettes marines, mais infrieur  celui des crevettes d'eau douce.
20107856|The brachyuran (Decapoda) taxocoenosis of a shallow meadow of Zostera marina was studied in a coastal area of the Snop Peninsula (southern Black Sea, Turkey). Specimens were collected monthly between February 2002 and January 2003 with a beam trawl at depths of 5-20 m during benthic surveys carried out off the Snop coast. A total of 3206 individuals belonging to 9 species was collected. The structure of the taxocoenosis along the year is dominated by portunid crabs; among these, Liocarcinus vernalis (Risso, 1816) is the most dominant species (36.87%). The largest Brachyura community in the Zostera marina beds was recorded in the summer months (June and July). /// La taxocnose de crabes (Decapoda) d'un herbier peu profond  Zostera marina a t tudie dans une rgion ctire de la pninsule de Snop (mer Noire mridionale, Turquie). Les spcimens ont t collectes chaque mois, entre fvrier 2002 et janvier 2003  l'aide d'un chalut  perche  des profondeurs de 5  20 m au cours des campagnes benthiques menes au large de la cte de Snop. Un total de 3206 individus appartenant  9 espces a t collect. La structure de la taxocnose tout au long de l'anne est domine par les crabes Portunidae; parmi ceux-ci, Liocarcinus vernalis (Risso, 1816) est l'espce dominante (36,87%). La communaut de brachyoures la plus dense dans les lits de Zostera marina a t observe au cours des mois d't (juin et juillet).

20104338|The larval development of Diaptomus (Aglaodiaptomus) leptopus S. A. Forbes, 1882, has been illustrated from specimens of a single population taken in September 1979 from a small acidic lake located north to Montreal, Quebec in the downhill of the Canadian precambrian shield. For each nauplius instar, the following features were illustrated: body form, antennules, antennae, mandibles, maxillules, maxillae, maxillipeds and the first two swimming legs. The body form and the length of instars change from a small, rounded NI (0,177 mm) through a pear-shaped form in NVI (0,359 mm). Comparative analyses of nauplius instar development of Diaptomus spp. from North America were carried out in an attempt to provide useful taxonomic characteristics to identify immature diaptomids.

Pour deux de ces groupes, des coquilles d'huitres broyes (Crassostrea virginica) ont t ajoutes dans les bacs afin de dterminer si ces coquilles joueraient un rle dans le durcissement de l'exosquelette aprs la mue. Les rsultats ont montr que le groupe de contrle (nourri avec le rgime standart utilis  la Station de recherche et d'levage pour le homard du Massachussetts) se dveloppait conformment aux donnes dj acquises. Les deux groupes nourris pour moiti le rgime de contrle, avec un supplment constitu par divers types d'algues, croissait aussi bien que le groupe de contrle et ne montrait pas,  cet gard, de diffrences statistiquement significatives. Les deux groupes nourris d'algues  100% avait une croissance mdiocre. La plupart ne muaient pas et perdaient du poids. La prsence de coquilles d'huitres ne jouaient apparemment aucun rle dans le croissance ou la survie, et n'offrait pas d'advantages dans le durcissement du test.
20104331|Un nouvel examen des spcimens de "Pylopagurus liochele" a montr que Barnard (1947) a inexactement attribu l'espce au genre Pylopagurus. Les premiers plopodes pairs manquent chez les femelles. Par consquent cette espce est transfre au genre Pagurus. 20103489|Compared to other amphipods, the brain of Gammarus setosus resembles closely that of the freshwater Gammarus pulex. Major differences between these two gammarids are found in the location, number, and degree of differentiation of the neuropiles, with some modification in the extent and location of the cellular glomeruli overlying the surface of the brain. G. setosus has well developed sensory facilities manifested in the antennal I and II neuropiles, the presence of large, well differentiated olfactory and optic lobes, neuropiles, and tracts, as well as smaller but distinct paraolfactory and accessory lobes. Centers of nervous integration, such as the central body and medulla terminalis, are also prominent.
20105169|Heptacarpus pictus (Stimpson, 1871) has been thought to be distinct from H. sitchensis (Brandt, 1851) based on the epipods: the former having epipods on the third maxillipeds and first and second pereopods, the latter having epipods on the third maxillipeds and first pereopods but not the second pereopods. The relative lengths of the antennular and antennal peduncles and the third maxillipeds to each other have been mentioned to be different in the two species. However, the description by Stimpson states that epipods of H. pictus were present on the first pereopods, not the second; the existing syntype of the species does not have epipods on the second pereopods. Study of over 280 specimens from British Columbia, Canada; California, U.S.A. and Baja California, Mexico, shows that individuals with epipods on the third maxillipeds and first pereopods occur throughout the range and that specimens also with epipods on the second pereopods occur in Monterey Bay and south of Point Conception, California. One individual was found with epipods on the third maxillipeds and first pereopods on both sides and an epipod on the second pereopod on the right side only. No other consistent differences in habitat, color or morphology were found between the specimens. We conclude that H. pictus is a junior synonym of H. sitchensis, and that shrimp with epipods on the second pereopods as well as the third maxillipeds and first pereopods constitute a morph of H. sitchensis. /// Los camarones litorales H. pictus (Stimpson, 1871) y H. sitchensis (Brandt, 1851) se reportaron resemblarse en la forma del cuerpo y rostro. H. pictus tena epipoditos en el tercer maxilpedo y el primero y segundo par de pereipodos: H. sitchensis tambin tena epipoditos en el tercer maxilpedo y en el primero par, pero no el segundo par, de pereipodos. Varios autores reportaron que haba diferencias en la largura de los partes del las antenas y el tercer maxilpedo. Sin embargo, la descripcin de Stimpson no mencion epipoditos en los segundos pereipodos y no hay en un espcimen sintpico. Examinamos ms de 280 especmenes de British Columbia, Canada; California, U.S.A. y Baja California, Mxico, y no encontramos diferencias constantes entre los camarones. Animales con epipoditos hasta los primeros pereipodos viven por todas partes de la costa; los con epipoditos en los segundos viven en Monterey Bay y sur de Point Conception, California. Deducimos que H. pictus (Stimpson) es sinnimo de H. sitchensis (Brandt) y que animales con epipoditos en los segundos pereipodos son una forma de H. sitchensis.

20104503|A revision of all specimens of the six species of Salmoneus extant in the Museum of Natural History of Paris has shown that there is always an appendix masculina on the second pleopod. The presence of such a character, even in ovigerous specimens, suggests the possibility of it being a characteristic of genus Salmoneus. This case is compared to that of Automate, where males lack the appendix masculina.
20105969|The yield as well as the occurrence of various diseases in commercial, semi-intensive, closed-system shrimp cultivation ponds in Wanning County, Hainan Province, P. R. China, has been correlated with a large number of pond, water quality, food, and water addition (fertilizer) parameters. It appears that reduced yields and the occurrence of diseases are closely associated with the age of a pond, the substrate, and the water quality (especially low salinities, low pH values, relatively low nitrate concentrations, and high ammonia-N and phosphate concentrations). To cure the diseases, the use of chemicals, various inorganic salts, and various kinds of antibiotics, appeared to be ineffective. /// Le rendement ainsi que la prsence de diverses maladies dans des bassins d'levage commercial, semi-intensif, en circuit ferm, de crevettes, dans le dpartement de Wanning, province de Hainan, R. P. de Chine, ont t mis en corrlation avec des paramtres relatifs au bassin, aux substances nutritives,  la qualit de l'eau et de la nourriture et  l'addition des fertilisants, dans un grand nombre de bassins. Il apparat que des rendements rduits et la prsence de maladies sont troitement associs  l'ge d'un bassin, au substrat et  la qualit de l'eau (spcialement basses salinits, pH faibles, concentrations en nitrates relativement basses, et hautes concentrations en ammonium-N et phosphate). Pour soigner les maladies, l'usage de produits chimiques, de divers sels inorganiques, et de diverses sortes d'antibiotique, semble tre sans effet.
20102107|La famille des Calanidae appartenant aux Calanodes est redfinie et ses espces sont groupes en cinq genres existants, qui sont redfinis eux aussi, et en deux genres nouveaux. Les genres redfinis sont: Calanus Leach, 1816 (= Nannocalanus Sars, 1925); Calanoides Brady, 1883; Canthocalanus A. Scott, 1909; Undinula A. Scott, 1909; Neocalanus Sars, 1925. L'un des deux nouveaux genres est tabli pour inclure Undina darwini Lubbock, 1860 et Calanus caroli Giesbrecht. 1888; l'autre doit inclure Calanus tenuicornis Dana, 1849 et Calanus lighti Bowman, 1955.
20107752|The freshwater shrimp, Atyaephyra desmarestii (Millet, 1831) is redescribed on the basis of a topotypical population (Toulouse). Its original description by Millet (1831) is very short and inadequate. Concerning populations from the same area, no further descriptive information has been actually given. Specimens studied from a Belgian population (Ombret) did not show any important differences from the French ones. /// La crevette d'eau douce Atyaephyra desmarestii (Millet, 1831) est re-dcrite sur la base d'une population topotypique (Toulouse). 20103830|The carcinological fauna of the Gironde estuary (south-western France) includes eight species of Decapoda Natantia belonging to three different faunistic categories. Palaemon longirostris is a typically estuarine prawn, the range of which extends over some 130 kilometres from Pointe de Grave to Cadillac (Garonne River). The main morphological characters of this species are described: rostral shape, structure of antennae 1 and mandibular palp, relative length of the segments of pereiopod 2. In the estuarine area, the diet of the adults consists of local Mysidacea: Neomysis integer upstream, and Mesopodopsis slabberi downstream. In the estuary, mysis larvae are found from late June to late July; their density is higher downstream near the banks than upstream. During metamorphosis, the larval stages migrate upstream, favoured by the existence of residual bottom currents in the same direction.

20107431|Eodiaptomus phuvongi n. sp. is described from 85 localities in Ubon Ratchathani Province, northeast Thailand and 17 localities in Savannakhet and Khammouane Provinces, central Laos. It belongs to the lumholtzi-group, and is most closely similar to E. phuphanensis Sanoamuang, 2001 and E. sanoamuangae Reddy & Dumont, 1998. The new species occurs only in temporary waters in Thailand, but also in permanent waters in Laos. It is the fourth species of Eodiaptomus recorded from Thailand and the first for Laos. /// Eodiaptomus phuvongi n. sp. est dcrite de 85 localits de la province de Ubon Ratchathani au nord-est de la Thalande et de 17 localits des provinces de Savannakhet et Khammouane au Laos central. Elle appartient au groupe lumholtzi et est trs proche de E. phuphanensis Sanoamuang, 2001 et de E. sanoamuangae Reddy & Dumont, 1998. Cette nouvelle espce vit en eaux temporaires, en Thalande, mais aussi en eaux permanentes au Laos. C'est la quatrime espce d'Eodiaptomus trouve en Thalande et la premire au Laos.
27822628|We report a two-fold suppression in activation energy for water loss in adult Uca minax males compared to co-occurring species, U. pugilator and U. pugnax, that overlap in salt marsh/estuary habitats, implying a water-tight cuticular modification that is unique to U. minax. This is further reflected by a drop in Arrhenius frequency (steric) factor A as an integrated measure of cuticular effectiveness. U. minax is also distinguished by an enlarged body size (approximately 5 as large as the other two species) and an enhanced capacity for water retention by a pronounced 4-5 fold decrease in net transpiration rate, presumably as a result of surface area to volume properties and the reduction in cuticular permeability. High net transpiration rates correspond to high activation energies in U. pugilator and U. pugnax, suggesting that they are more porous; the values for U. pugnax were the highest indicating that this species is the most prone to water stress. Features that these crab species have in common are a 67% body water content, twice the amount of water as their dry mass (size), and absence of a critical transition temperature (CTT) that safeguards them against an abrupt, lethal water loss. Lack of a CTT agrees with previous descriptions of crabs having no water-proofing epicuticular lipids and matches their rapid water loss rates and limitation to wet habitats. The ability by U. minax to conserve water by restricting water loss, however, makes them less dependent on a moisture-rich habitat, and this parallels field data that account for the differential capacity of U. minax to thrive in terrestrial inland locations by resisting desiccation and to survive in fresh water by being less porous to water entry. Results are consistent with the view that placing a priority on investigating what crabs are actually doing in the field (they operate on a smaller scale; i.e., microhabitat) is more important to application of net transpiration rate than as a general indicator of moisture-requirements for a species. Une diminution de 2 fois de l'nergie d'activation pour la perte d'eau chez les adultes d'Uca minax compars aux deux espces U. pugilator et U. pugnax, qui coexistent dans les habitats lagunaires et estuariens a t observe, impliquant des modifications cuticulaires pour empcher l'entre d'eau. Ceci est aussi reflt par une chute du facteur A de la frquence d'Arrhenius, en tant que mesure intgre de l'efficacit de la cuticule. U. minax se distingue aussi par, une taille plus grande (approximativement 5 par rapport aux deux autres espces) et une capacit plus grande pour retenir l'eau grce  une diminution par 4-5 du taux net de transpiration, probablement une consquence de la proportion surface volume et d'une rduction de la permabilit cuticulaire. Des taux levs de transpiration correspondent  une nergie d'activation leve chez U. pugilator et U. pugnax, suggrant que ces espces sont plus permables; les valeurs pour U. pugnax taient les plus leves, indiquant que cette espce est la plus sensible au stress aqueux. Les caractristiques que ces espces de crabes ont en commun sont 67% de contenu en eau corporelle, deux fois plus d'eau que leur poids sec (taille) et l'absence de temprature critique de transition (CTT), ce qui les protge contre une perte d'eau brutale et ltale. L'absence de CTT est en accord avec des descriptions prcdentes de crabes ne possdant pas de lipides cuticulaires impermabilisants, leur taux rapide de perte d'eau et leur restriction  des habitats humides. La capacit de U. minax  conserver l'eau en restreignant les pertes, le rend cependant moins dpendant d'un habitat riche en humidit, et ceci rejoint les donnes de terrain qui indiquent une capacit diffrente de U. minax  prosprer  l'intrieur des terres en rsistant  la dessiccation et  survivre en eau douce en tant moins permable  l'entre d'eau. Les rsultats sont en accord avec l'opinion que, placer la priorit sur les observations de terrain (micro-habitats) est plus important que l'application du taux net de transpiration en tant qu'indicateur gnral des exigences d'humidit pour une espce.
20696267|The hitherto unknown female sex of the genus Paraxantharus (Copepoda, Calonoida) is described from the South Atlantic, based on the female of a new species of the genus that is described herein. The specimen was collected from abyssal depths close to the sea bed during the German expedition ANDEEP II in 2002. Paraxantharus victorbergeri sp. nov. differs from its only congener in details of the setation of the oral parts; by the oblique shape of the four teeth of the gnathobase of the mandible; by the poorly sclerotized, worm-like sensory seta of the distal praecoxal endite of the synocoxa of the maxilliped; and by the lateral spine on segment 2 of the P1 exopod, which is the shortest when compared with the lateral spines of exopodal segments 1 and 3. This new species of Paraxantharus as described below, brings the number of species in the genus to two. The present collection of P. victorbergeri constitutes only the second, and also the most northern record of the genus that is so far only known from the southern hemisphere. La femelle jusqu'ici inconnue du genre Paraxantharus (Copepoda, Calanoida) est dcrite de l'Atlantique Sud,  partir de la femelle d'une nouvelle espce du genre, dcrite ici. 27743315|Since 1935, the freshwater discharge from the Colorado River into the Gulf of California has decreased drastically, affecting the biological cycles of endemic species and other endangered species. In this study, a relationship was determined between the Colorado River freshwater discharge, the abundance of blue shrimp, Litopenaeus stylirostris (Stimpson, 1874) postlarvae, and the density of adult shrimp in the Upper Gulf of California (UGC). Data on Colorado River flow from 1904 to 2002, blue shrimp postlarvae from 1993 to 1997, and records of daily catches from pangas (small boats) of the commercial fleet operating in UGC from 1995 to 2002, were analysed. Catch per unit effort (CPUE) was used as a measure of the average daily density of adult shrimp. Two groups of CPUE and postlarvae abundance were found, with significant differences between them. The highest population density was observed in the years when the river flow was greater than 80 m3s1. The lowest density was found for periods when the river flow was lower than 80 m3s1. We conclude that the response of the shrimp population is non-linear and that postlarvae abundance and commercial fleet CPUE increased during the years in which freshwater discharge was highest, possibly because the habitat volume increased, consequently resulting in increased food availability for the shrimp. /// A partir del ao de 1935, las descargas de agua dulce del Ro Colorado al Golfo de California han disminuido drsticamente, afectando el ciclo biolgico de especies endmicas y otras en peligro de extincin. En este estudio, se determin una relacin entre la descarga de agua dulce del Ro Colorado, la abundancia de postlarva de camarn azul Litopenaeus stylirostris (Stimpson, 1874) y la densidad de adultos de camarn en el Alto Golfo de California (AGC). Se utiliz informacin del flujo del Ro Colorado de 1904 a 2002, de postlarva de camarn azul de 1993-1997 y los registros de captura diaria de las pangas de la flota comercial que oper en el AGC de 1995 a 2002. Como medida de densidad promedio diario de los adultos se utiliz la captura por unidad de esfuerzo (CPUE). Se encontraron dos grupos de abundancia de postlarva y CPUE, con diferencias significativas entre ellos. El valor superior se presenta en los aos cuando el flujo del ro fue mayor que 80 m3s1. El grupo del valor inferior se present cuando el flujo del ro estaba a menos de 80 m3s1. Se concluy que la respuesta de la poblacin de camarn no es lineal y que la abundancia de postlarva y la CPUE de la flota comercial aumentaron en aos cuando la descarga de agua dulce era mayor, posiblemente porque se expandi el volumen del hbitat y con esto hubo una mayor disponibilidad de alimento.

20105540|Population parameters in crustaceans are not easily obtained due to a lack of satisfactory methods for establishing the age of individuals. In this study, the problem is approached by the use of length-frequency data. A statistical computer program, MIX, was used to interpret the mixture of distributions based on length-frequency data (analysis of modality). The modal length groups were assumed to be equivalent with age groups. One group of males and three groups of females were observed. The carapace length (CL) ranged from 7.6 to 14.9 mm in males and was 7.9-23.4 mm in females. The smallest individuals of males and females, the first age groups, were probably lost due to the sampling technique. The proportion of ovigerous females (20.0-24.0 mm CL) showed an increase from 25% to 75%, and 45.5% of all females within this size range were ovigerous. 23065235|Five new Indonesian records of species of the genus Pontella Dana, 1849 and one species of the genus Ivellopsis Claus, 1893, i.e., Pontella diagonalis C. B. Wilson, 1950, Pontella forficula A. Scott, 1909, Pontella sewelli Heinrich, 1987, Pontella spinipes Giesbrecht, 1889, Pontella surrecta C. B. Wilson, 1950, and Ivellopsis elephas (Brady, 1883) are reported herein. All species are redescribed and figured from specimens collected from eight small islands and off Bojonegara in Indonesian waters. Descriptions of the males of P. diagonalis, P. forficula, and P. spinipes have been published previously by Mulyadi (2000). Subsequently, a misidentification, which resulted in wrong species identity, was discovered in P. forficula: A. Scott's P. forficula, which was only described from male specimens, is recognized to represent the male of I. elephas. Descriptions, measurements, and figures of those species are given, along with a review of their distribution over Indo-Pacific waters, and together with taxonomic remarks and restricted synonymies. Scott, 1909, Pontella sewelli Heinrich, 1987, Pontella spinipes Giesbrecht, 1889, Pontella surrecta C. B. Wilson, 1950, et Ivellopsis elephas (Brady, 1883) sont rapports ici. Toutes ces espces sont redcrites et figures  partir de spcimens collects de huit petites les et au large de Bojonegara dans les eaux indonsiennes. 20103494|The effect of diet and temperature on the development rate of Mesocyclops leuckarti (Claus) was studied experimentally. M. leuckarti developed successfully from copepodid stage I to adult with diets of Protozoa, Euglena gracilis and calanoid nauplii. Very few copepodids were reared successfully on diets of larger prey species (small Cerodaphnia dubia, copepodid stages I-III of Calamoecia lucasi). With mixed diets (Protozoa and calanoid nauplii, E. gracilis and C. dubia) the time spent in copepodid stage V was shorter than with either of the diets singly. It is suggested that prey items larger than nauplii are not an important food source until copepodid stage V. The relation between the time taken from copepodid stage I to VI and temperature is described by an exponential function. The development times from copepodid stage I to adult were considerably shorter than those reported in other studies.

20105694|The red crab or "langostilla", Pleuroncodes planipes, is abundant in the Pacific coast upwelling system of Baja California. It feeds both on plankton in the pelagic realm and on detritus in the benthic habitat. Previous studies of stomach contents suggested variations with latitude and depth, and potential differences in productivity. The aim of this study was to use the lipid and astaxanthin contents as well as the fatty acid composition of the red crab as a measure of its nutritional condition and thus of the quality of their feeding areas. Crabs were collected in September 1991 using a shrimp trawl at 6 stations on the continental shelf off the west coast of Baja California between 26 and 24N. All samples were sun-dried and homogenized by grinding, prior to the extraction of total lipids. Astaxanthin content was also measured at each location. The methyl esters of the total fatty acids were analysed by capillary gas chromatography with flame ionization detection (FID). Lipids and astaxanthin contents varied significantly from shallow to deeper locations, and both organic compounds were significantly correlated (p &lt 0.05). The C16:0, C16:1, C18:0, C18:1, C18:2n-6, C18:3n-3, C20:4n-6, C20:5n-3, and C22:6n-3 fatty acids were identified and quantified. The most abundant fatty acid was C20:5n-3, ranging from 8.3 to 21.06 g/100 g TL, followed by C16:0 (3.4-14.10 g/100 g TL) and the C20:4n-6 (1.42-7.43). Fatty acids with the least statistical variation between locations were C18:3n-3 and C20:5n-3. Fatty acids from the different locations were found to be grouped into a latitudinal cline, suggesting red crabs are good indicators of areas with distinct food quality. /// La langostilla o cangrejo rojo pelgico, Pleuroncodes planipes, es un abundante crustceo decpodo del sistema de surgencias de la costa del Pacfico de Baja California. Se alimenta tanto en el hbitat pelgico (de plankton) como en el bentnico donde consume principalmente detritus. Estudios previos de contenidos estomacales mostraron una variacin con la latitud y la profundidad, sugiriendo reas de distinta productividad. El objetivo de este estudio fue usar el contenido de lpidos, astaxantina y composicin de cidos grasos de la langostilla como reflejo de su condicin nutricional y de la potencial existencia de areas alimentacin especificas. El crustceo fue colectado en septiembre 1991 usando una red camaronera sobre 6 sitios de la plataforma continental afuera de la Pennsula de Baja California entre los paralelos 26 y 24N. Todas las muestras fueron secadas al sol y homogenizadas con molino antes de la extraccin de lpidos. El contenido de astaxantina se midi tambin en cada localidad. Los esteres metlicos del total de cidos grasos fueron obtenidos y analizados por cromatografa de gases con deteccin por ionizanon de flama. El contenido de lpidos y astaxantina vari significativamente de menor a mayor profundidad y ambos componentes mostraron correlaciones significativas (p &lt 0.05). Los cidos grasos C16:0, C16:1, C18:0, C18:1, C18:2n-6, C18:3n-3, C20:4n-6, C20:5n-3 y C22:6n-3 fueron identificados y cuantificados. El cido graso ms abundante fue C20:5n-3 que vari de 8.3 a 21.06 g/100 g de los lpidos totales, seguido de C16:0 (3.4-14.1 g/100 g LT) y el C20:4n-6 (1.42-7.43). Los cidos grasos con la menor variacin estadstica entre localidades fueron C18:3n-3 y C20:5n-3. Los cidos grasos de las distintas local-idades se agruparon en una estructura de clinal latitudinal, sugiriendo que la langostilla es un buen indicador de la existencia de reas de distinta productividad y calidad de alimento.
20107507|The terrestrial isopod, Porcellionides pruinosus (Brandt, 1833) is commonly viewed as one of the most widespread species of woodlice, mainly because of its synanthropic nature. Recent investigations have, however, suggested that some populations, although morphologically closely similar, may consist in fact of separate species. In this study, six populations from distant localities were examined in a taxonomic perspective. Laboratory crossings first confirmed the reproductive isolation between two groups of populations. Behavioural tests then revealed a pre-zygotic reproductive isolating mechanism in the absence of sexual recognition between males and females from the two groups. These results, together with previously found molecular data, gave congruent evidence for the existence of two well-defined species. yet, morphological investigations failed to detect any meristic characters that would allow a strict discrimination between P. pruinosus and the other species. From the literature, it was impossible to assign the herein recognized sibling species to any previously described taxa. This study gives new insights in the P. pruinosus complex but also highlights the difficulties to identify and name species in the absence of revised and updated diagnoses of the genus Porcellionides. /// L'isopode terrestre Porcellionides pruinosus (Brandt, 1833) est considr comme l'une des espces de cloportes les plus rpandues de par le monde, principalement en raison de son caractre synanthropique. Des tudes rcentes ont cependant suggr que certaines populations, bien que morphologiquement trs proches, pourraient en fait correspondre  des espces diffrentes. Dans cette tude, six populations gographiquement loignes ont t examines dans une perspective taxonomique. Des sries de croisements en laboratoire ont tout d'abord confirm l'isolement reproductif entre deux groupes de populations. Par la suite, des tests de comportement ont mis en vidence une barrire d'isolement pr-zygotique, en l'absence de reconnaissance sexuelle entre mles et femelles de ces deux groupes. Ces rsultats, ainsi que ceux issus d'analyses molculaires pralables, apportent des preuves convergentes de l'existence de deux espces spares. L'examen morphologique n'a pas permis de dceler de caractres mristiques autorisant une discrimination stricte entre Porcellionides pruinosus et l'autre espce. A partir de la littrature existante, il n'a pas t possible d'assigner l'espce jumelle  aucun des taxons dj dcrits. Cette tude apporte une lumire nouvelle sur le complexe P. pruinosus, mais rvle aussi la difficult  identifier et nommer les espces en l'absence de diagnoses rvises et actualises du genre Porcellionides.

Un modle commun de dveloppement pour les pattes 1-4 a t identifi chez 31 genres appartenant  17 familles ranges dans 5 des 9 ordres. L'apparition et le dveloppement des pattes post-maxillipdiennes des coppodes suggrent des similarits avec les structures homotiques des autres Arthropodes. La prise en compte des convergences de dveloppement et de rduction dans un modle homotique peut compliquer l'usage des squences des nombres d'articles des rames en tant que sries de transformation dans les analyses phylogntiques.

Es ermglicht die Arten und Geschlechter in frhem Stadium voneinander zu trennen.
20106364|The nervous system of Synisoma nadejda comprises the brain, the suboesophageal mass, and the ventral nerve cord. The brain is composed of the protocerebrum, laterally prolonged into the optic nerves; the deutocerebrum, which is the origin of the antennular nerves; and the tritocerebrum, which innervate the antennae. The suboesophageal mass provides the nerves for the mouthparts. The thoracic nerve cord ensures the innervation of thoracic appendages and internal organs. The abdominal nerve cord innervates pleopods and uropods. Associated with the brain are the Y organ or ecdysial gland, the antennal gland, the Bellonci organ, and the sinus gland. /// Le systme nerveux chez Synisoma nadejda est form par: le cerveau, la masse sous-sophagienne et la chane ganglionnaire ventrale. Le cerveau comprend le protocrbron qui se prolonge latralement par les nerfs optiques, le deutocrbron est  l'origine des nerfs antennulaires et le tritocrbron innerve les antennes. La masse sous-sophagienne porte latralement les nerfs des pices buccales. La chane nerveuse thoracique assure l'innervation des appendices et des organes internes. La chane nerveuse abdominale innerve les plopodes et les uropodes. Les diffrents organes associs au cerveau sont: l'organe Y ou glande de mue, la glande antennaire, l'organe de Bellonci et la glande du sinus.
20102391|Phyllodicola petiti (Delamare and Laubier, 1960), belonging to the family Phyllodicolidae Delamare and Laubier, 1960, is a very curious parasitic copepod occurring on polychaete annelids of the family Phyllodocidae. Only three specimens of this new species are known: an adult female with egg-stalks, a young female and a very young stage just at the end of its free-swimming life. The main features of this form are: body completely external to its host, attached by a strong chitinous ring on which are borne two long rhizoids which extend into the coelom of the annelid. There are three pairs of appendages: the antennule, unsegmented with fourteen setae; the antenna, two-segmented with a special apparatus for the young stage's attachment; and the two-segmented maxillipeds. The antenna and maxillipeds bear respectively two and three strong terminal hooks; the genital apparatus consists of an unpaired gonopore, and two little holes fitted with teeth ("spinnerets"). The egg-stalks are very atypical: the eggs are not held in the usual ovisacs, but are individually attached to a common axis by short and thin peduncles. To our knowledge, this special structure is unique in copepods. The morphological description of these three stages of Phyllodicola petiti is followed by a brief account of its life-history and the nauplii are briefly described.

Le nouveau genre est trs proche des autres genres associs aux coraux, Fennera Holthuis et Metapontonia Bruce, desquels il peut tre distingu par l'absence d'exopodite sur le troisime maxillipde. Les caractres saillants de la nouvelle espce sont la forme du telson et les pinces des seconds preiopodes; ces caractres diffrent compltement de ceux observs chez les autres membres de la sous-famille des Pontoniinae.

Les stratgies de la reproduction, telles que le nombre et le dpart des saisons de ponte, sont variables et sont ici discutes en relation avec la temprature.

20104958|Preliminary observations via SCUBA found juvenile Panulirus japonicus using small holes as a daytime refuge in the rock surface of shallow reefs (2-3 m below Chart Datum) adjacent to the Banda Marine Laboratory of Tokyo University of Fisheries. Monthly samples of juvenile P. japonicus and regular observations along a vertical rock face (area 53.2 m) were carried out between April 1991 and December 1992, in order to detail the growth rate, density on the reef face, morphology of holes occupied and period of retention of juveniles in individual holes. Peak settlement of pueruli occurred in September with pueruli and first stage juveniles using holes of a mean diameter of approximately 124 mm. Initially pholad holes, predominantly of the species Lithophaga curta, were used by juveniles at Banda, however with growth the availability of suitably sized pholad holes diminished and holes of various morphologies were used. At the observation site, pueruli and first stage specimens were followed over several consecutive molts. Mean intermolt period increased with juveniles size and molting from the first through to the sixth molt stage required approximately 2.5 months (78.52.2 days). The maximum number of individuals on the rock face occurred immediately after peak settlement in autumn (0.21 and 0.32 inds.
20103940|Cryptogaster cumacei n. sp., n. gen., is the first record of a rhizocephalan parasite on Cumacea. The adult and its cypris larva are described. The systematic affinities of this new species are discussed.
20103960|In a rearing project of Sea Bass, Dicentrarchus labrax (L., 1758), in Diana pond, Corsica, France, a haematophagous isopod parasite, Nerocila orbignyi Gurin-Mneville, caused high mortalities among the fish. This parasite enters the pond from the sea with mullets, which until now were considered its strictly specific host. In the pond the isopods also infest the Sea Bass in rearing. In the present study the ecology of the parasites, both that of the wild populations and that in the rearing pond, is studied.

20105467|A survey of the development of Synisoma nadejda allowed to establish that at birth the juveniles of this species measure about 3 mm in length. They undergo successive moults, to eventually acquire their pereiopods VII and external sexual characters. Setation, the number of aesthetascs, and the number of segments of the antennal flagellum increase in the course of the moulting sequence. Sexual differentiation of S. nadejda is characterized by the appearance of the genital apophyses, the copulatory stylets in the male, and the genital openings and incubation pouch in the female. Males are precocious as compared to females of the same age, who tend to differentiate later. /// L'tude du dveloppement de Synisoma nadejda nous a permis de constater qu' la naissance les jeunes de S. nadejda mesurent en moyenne 3 mm. Ils subissent des mues successives qui leur permettent d'acqurir les priopodes VII et les caractres sexuels externes. La station, le nombre d'aesthtes ainsi que le nombre d'articles du fouet antennaire augmentent au cours des mues. La diffrenciation sexuelle des S. nadejda se caractrise par l'apparition des apophyses gnitales, des stylets copulateurs chez le mle et des orifices gnitaux et de la poche incubatrice chez la femelle. Les mles sont prcoces par rapport aux femelles de mme ge, qui se diffrencient ultrieurement.
20107842|Afrocypris barnardi G. O. Sars, 1924, a giant temporary pool ostracode from South Africa, is here redescribed, based on new material. It is only the second time that this species has been found. The present morphological analyses show that the copulatory appendages of both sexes have unusual characteristics. In the female, at least three paired appendage-like structures (R-appendages) are associated with the Female Reproductive Organ (FRO). This is the second time that such structures are described from non-marine ostracodes, Liocypris grandis (G. O. Sars, 1924) having six pairs of such structures. The male copulatory organs have a Penile Attachment uniting the proximal sides of both hemipenes, and in Afrocypris barnardi an asymmetrical, finger-like structure is associated with this PA. The discovery of female R-appendages in a second species strengthen the interpretation of these structures as (part of) true appendages, and reinforces the hypothesis that the FRO is homologous to more than one ancestral somite. However, it remains unclear how many body segments are involved in the origin of the FRO, and three, five, or even six somites are all possible. In addition, these R-appendages can be ancestral, atavistic, or even apomorphic. The position of the two taxa with such appendages in a phylogeny of the Cyprididae as a whole will constitute a test to discriminate between these three possibilities. /// Basierend auf neuen Funden wird Afrocypris barnardi G. O. Sars, 1924, eine Gro-Ostracodenart aus ephemeren Kleingewssern Sdafrikas, hier wiederbeschrieben. Die Funde stellen erst den zweiten Nachweis dieser Art dar. Die neue morphologische Untersuchung zeigt, da die Kopulationsorgane beider Geschlechter ungewhnliche Merkmale aufweisen. Dem externen weiblichen Kopulationsapparat (FRO) sind mindestens drei paarige, extremittenartige Anhnge (R-Appendages) zugeordnet. Erst zum zweiten Mal werden solche Strukturen fr eine Swasserostracodenart nachgewiesen: Liocypris grandis (G. O. Sars, 1924) besitzt sechs solcher Anhnge. Das Kopulationsorgan des Mnnchens besitzt einen Anhang (PA), welcher die proximalen Bereiche der beiden Hemipenes verbindet. Auf diesem Anhang inseriert bei Afrocypris barnardi zudem eine asymmetrische fingerfrmige Struktur. Die Entdeckung von zustzlichen extremittenartigen Anhnge des weiblichen Kopulationsapparates in einer zweiten Ostracodenart verstrkt ihre Interpretation als (Teile von) echte(n) Extremitten und untersttzt die Hypothese, da der weibliche Kopulationsapparat mehr als einem ursprnglichen Segment homolog ist. Allerdings bleibt unklar, wieviele Krpersegmente in die Bildung des Kopulationsapparates involviert sind; drei, fnf oder sogar sechs Segmente wren denkbar. Zudem knnen diese zustzlichen Anhnge sowohl ancestrale, als auch atavistische oder apomorphe Merkmale darstellen. Erst die Positionierung der beiden Taxa mit solchen Anhngen in einer Phylogenie der Cyprididae wird eine Entscheidung ermglichen.

20105851|The hindgut epithelium of Saduria entomon infected with Cryptococcus laurentii undergoes structural changes. In cells the apical and basal infoldings disappear. The number of mitochondria drops markedly and those that are left are swollen. Instead, there appear very numerous secondary lysosomes containing cell organelles and myelin-like structures. The presence of C. laurentii cells in the lumen of the hindgut and the intima of the epithelium justifies the assumption that in S. entomon the infection occurs via the hindgut. /// L'pithlium de l'intestin postrieur de Saduria entomon infest par Cryptococcus laurentii subit des changements structuraux. Dans les cellules, les replis apicaux et basaux disparaissent. Le nombre des mitochondries chute fortement et celles qui restent sont enfles. A la place, apparaissent de trs nombreux lysosomes secondaires contenant des organelles cellulaires et des structures ayant l'aspect de myline. La prsence de cellules de C. laurentii dans la lumire de l'intestin postrieur et dans l'intima de l'pithlium permet de supposer que l'infection de S. entomon survient via l'intestin postrieur.

20105399|Tridentella rosemariae sp. nov., the third species of Tridentella recorded from the vicinity of New Zealand, is described and figured. Tridentella rosemariae can be identified by the cruciform frontal lamina, acute posteroventral points on pereonite 1 and coxae 2-4, the deeply serrate uropods and pleotelson margins and the pleotelson having two sub-medial longitudinal ridges with a depression between these in which lies a median longitudinal ridge giving the appearance of three ridges on the pleotelson. The only specimen was taken in deep water (550-1484 m) in the South Fiji Basin. 20103300|Cell division frequency in the carapace epidermis of D. magna declines with increasing animal size. Cell division is not necessarily one of the activities of premolt. During any particular intermolt the dividing cells are larger than those that do not divide but their size is also related to animal size, the cells in small animals dividing at a smaller average size than in larger individuals. Cell abundance following mitosis and prior to ecdysis consequently is not fixed but depends on animal size. The synthesis of an ephippium appears to be accompanied by cell division frequencies much higher than those occurring contemporaneously in other regions of the carapace.
20104984|This paper reviews advances in the population dynamics and stock assessment of lobsters since 1980. A great advance has been recognizing the direct effects of the varying physical environment on lobster abundance and developing testable hypotheses to explain them. Another advance has been in the use of manipulative field experiments to test hypotheses about juvenile population biology, and our understanding of juvenile ecology has also increased greatly. Many new relations among abundance, growth, survival, maturity, and fecundity have also been documented for older lobsters. For some species, biologists have identified the major influences determining abundance, but no obvious generalizations apply across all species. Stock assessments for lobsters must deal with the great complexity that is now documented for particular lobster populations. Yield-per-recruit and egg-per-recruit approaches are now heavily used, but probably do not address the necessary range of real population responses. Stock-production approaches continue to be used where appropriate data are available; great care is required. The role of stock assessment is shifting from identifying over-fishing toward predictive analysis of a range of management actions for each situation. /// Cet article fait le point sur les progrs rAliss en dynamique de populations et dans l'valuation des stocks de langoustes depuis 1980. Une grande avance a t la reconnaissance des effets directes de la variation de l'environnement physique sur l'abondance des langoustes et de dvelopper des hypothses vrifiables pour les expliquer. Un autre progrs a t l'utilisation d'exprimentations sur le terrain pour tester les hypothses sur la biologie des populations de juvniles, et notre comprhension de l'cologie des juvniles a galement fortement progress. De nombreuses relations nouvelles en ce qui concerne l'abondance, la croissance, la survie, la maturit et la fcondit ont aussi t releves pour les langoustes plus ges. Chez certaines espces, les biologistes ont identifi les principaux facteurs dterminant l'abondance, mais aucune gnralisation claire ne peut s'appliquer  l'ensemble des espces. Les valuations de stocks de langoustes doivent prendre en compte la grande complexit maintenant connue chez certaines populations. Les approches de production et fcondit par recrutement sont maintenant largement utilises, mais n'apportent probablement pas la gamme ncessaire des rponses relles de la population. Les approches de production de stock continuent  tre utilises lorsque les donnes appropries sont disponibles; une grande attention est ncessaire. Le rle d'valuation de stock est dplac de la mise en vidence de la sur-pche vers une analyse prvisionelle des possibilits de gestion pour chaque situation.
20111389|In this article, I map the currently known brachyuran fossil record on a recent cladogram of Brachyura, the true crabs. The hypothesis of brachyuran phylogenetic relationships is based on a cladistic analysis of brachyuran foregut characters. With this approach, the following scenario of the evolution of Brachyura is proposed. The representatives of Brachyura that occur earliest in the fossil record (Dromioidea) take the most basal position in the cladogram, followed by Homolidae. These taxa reach their highest species diversity during the Cretaceous, together with Raninidae and Cymonomidae sensu lato. The analysis reveals that the majority of the "higher" crabs (Xanthoidea, Portunidae, Cancridae, and Oxystomata sensu lato) as well as their common ancestor existed already by the end of the Cretaceous. In particular, a constant increase of brachyuran species diversity has been registered from the Eocene to the Miocene. Most taxa of the Brachyura (with the exception of the Carcineretidae) remained unaffected by the events at the Cretaceous-Tertiary-boundary. Hence, the data suggest the events at the K/T-boundary have had a weaker influence on the species diversity of the Brachyura and of the Decapoda in general, than originally presumed: i.e., there was no mass-extinction of crabs. /// Die vorgestellte Hypothese, resultierend aus der kladistischen Analyse von Merkmalen der Vorderdarm-Morphologie, wurde mit dem gegenwrtig bekannten Fossilbericht verglichen. Basierend auf diesem Ansatz wird folgendes evolutives Szenario fr die Stammesgeschichte der Brachyura vorgeschlagen. Die Vertreter der Brachyura mit den frhesten bekannten fossilen Vorkommen (Dromioidea) nehmen auch in der kladistischen Analyse die basale Position ein, gefolgt von den Homolidae. Diese Taxa zeigen zusammen mit den Raninidae und den Cymonomidae ihre grte Artenvielfalt whrend der Kreidezeit. Es ist ebenfalls anzunehmen, da die Mehrheit der "hheren Krabben" (Vertreter der Xanthoidea, Portunidae, der Cancridae und der Oxystomata) ebenso ihr gemeinsamer Vorfahre schon am Ende der Kreidezeit existierten. Besonders vom Eozn zum Miozn ist ein Anstieg der Artenvielfalt zu verzeichnen. Innerhalb der neu vorgeschlagenen Neobrachyura sind neben den traditionellen Thoracotremata zustzliche Taxa mit kontrovers diskutierten phylogenetischen Verwandschaftsbeziehungen zusammengefat. Fr die ursprnglich beschriebenen Thoracotremata (Ocypodidae, Mictyridae, Gecarcinidae und Grapsidae) kann basierend auf Merkmalen der Gonoporen in beiden Geschlechtern von einem monophyletischen Ursprung ausgegangen werden. Nach Vorlage der verfgbaren Daten wird ein Event an der Kreide-Tertirgrenze angenommen, welches einen kleineren Einflu auf die Artenvielfalt der Brachyura, bzw. der Decapoda hatte, als ursprnglich angenommen. Vergleiche von rezenten und fossilen Taxa zeigen, da die meisten Taxa der Brachyura (mit Ausnahme der Carcineretidae) auf Familien- und Gattungsniveau vom Kreide-Tertir-Event unbeeinflusst blieben.
20103523|The relations between sex, body size, dissolved O, temperature and the oxygen consumption of the conchostracan, Cyzicus californicus, were studied. Salinity tolerance was also determined. Little effect of weight on metabolic rate is shown within the sexually mature size range.
20696254|For several groups of Crustacea (especially Remipedia, Malacostraca, and Ostracoda) it has been repeatedly suggested that the antennula (first antenna) is serially homologous with the post-antennular limbs, particularly with regard to the existence of an endopodite and an exopodite. This opinion is critically reviewed and, based on arguments derived from comparative morphology, developmental biology, and phylogeny of various groups belonging to the Arthropoda, ultimately refuted. Available evidence indicates that crustacean antennules are primitively single axis limbs and the use of a terminology derived from a biramous limb, as used in some publications, is both unjustified and potentially misleading. Pour plusieurs groupes de Crustacs (en particulier les Rmipdes, les Malacostracs et les Ostracodes), il a t suggr  plusieurs reprises que l'antennule (premire antenne) est homologue srielle des appendices post-antennulaires, en particulier par rapport  l'existence d'un endopodite et d'un exopodite. Cette opinion est analyse de faon critique  partir d'arguments provenant de la morphologie comparative, de la biologie du dveloppement et de la phylognie de divers groupes d'Arthropodes, et est finalement rfute. Les lments disponibles indiquent avec vidence que les antennules de crustacs sont primitivement des appendices  axe simple et l'usage d'une terminologie drive d'un appendice biram, observ dans certaines publications, est  la fois injustifi et peut potentiellement induire des erreurs.
20103814|D'avril 1978  avril 1979 une tude de la crevette d'eau douce Macrobrachium ohione a t effectue dans la basse rivire Pascagoula (Mississippi, U.S.A.) sur des crevettes adultes et sur des larves captures dans le plancton. 20106178|A recent extensive survey of Mona Island, an unihabited island between Puerto Rico and Hispaniola, has revealed the presence of four inland crustacean species previously unreported from the island, a new genus and species of terrestrial amphipod, Cariborchestia xerophila, a clam shrimp in the genus Eulimnadia, a terrestrial isopod, Venezillo culebrae, and a subterranean shrimp, Macrobrachium faustinum var. A few of these species are briefly discussed with respect to their systematics and their habitats. The three taxa other than the new amphipod are taxonomically poorly understood. The habitats all species occur in are small, isolated, and ephemeral to varying degrees and very susceptable to alteration. Such habitats are now rare or have been destroyed in larger developed islands of the region. Protection of these remaining habitats is neccessary to allow study of inhabitants and their role in the ecology of limestone islands. /// Une tude extensive rcente de Mona Island, une le inhabite entre Puerto Rico et Hispaniola, a rvle la prsence de quatre espces auparavant non signales des eaux intrieures de cette le, un genre et une espce nouveaux d'amphipode terrestre, Cariborchestia xerophila, un branchiopode Spinicaudata du genre Eulimnadia, un isopode terrestre, Venezillo culebrae, et une crevette souterraine, Macrobrachium faustinum var. 20104853|The population composition of the most abundant pelagic calanoids: Paracalanus parvus (Claus, 1863), Clausocalanus spp., Centropages typicus Kryer, 1849, Temora stylifera (Dana, 1849), Acartia clausi Giesbrecht, 1889, Pleuromamma gracilis Claus, 1863, and Calanus helgolandicus (Claus, 1863), was studied from the upper 50 m in the northwestern Mediterranean (Golfe du Lion). The adult sex ratios were studied for these species and for three additional, less abundant, migrating species: Euchaeta marina Prestandrea, 1833, E. acuta Giesbrecht, 1892, and Candacia armata Boeck, 1872, from two different, partly overlapping water layers: the upper 50 m and the upper 200 m. In general the samples were composed of late copepodid stages, females and males in decreasing percentages. Maximum population densities were observed during different sampling periods for the different species. In most species the male-to-female ratio was highest during the periods of lowest female abundance. A pronounced dominance of females over males (&gt80%) was found throughout the year in the potentially herbivorous species Clausocalanus spp., P. parvus, A. clausi and C. helgolandicus. In the potentially and obligate carnivorous copepods P. gracilis, E. acuta, E. marina and C. armata female dominance was less striking, but seasonal variability was high. In the mixed feeders T. stylifera and C. typicus sexes were about equally represented throughout the year. Some species showed deeper male distributions during different periods. In the potentially herbivorous species the low male-to-female ratio is suggested to be related to swarming behaviour, which increases the encounter probability, facilitates the mating process, and serves as an adaptation to a limited food supply (leaving females a greater share). The migrating carnivorous species, which are not known to perform swarming behaviour, showed higher male proportions. /// La composition de la population des calanodes plagiques les plus abondants: Paracalanus parvus (Claus, 1863), Clausocalanus spp., Centropages typicus Kryer, 1849, Temora stylifera (Dana, 1849), Acartia clausi Giesbrecht, 1889, Pleuromamma gracilis Claus, 1863, et Calanus helgolandicus (Claus, 1863) a t tudie sur les cinquante premiers mtres de profondeur en Mditerrane nordoccidentale (Golfe du Lion). Les sex-ratios (adultes) ont t tudies chez ces espces ainsi que chez trois autres espces migrantes, moins abondantes: Euchaeta marina Prestandrea, 1833, E. acuta Giesbrecht, 1892, et Candacia armata Boeck, 1872, sur deux profondeurs diffrentes, se recouvrant partiellement: les premiers 50 m et les premiers 200 m. En gnral, les chantillons taient composs de stades coppodites avancs, de femelles et de mles en pourcentages dcroissants. Les densits de population maximales ont t observes  diffrentes priodes d'chantillonnnage pour les diffrentes espces. Chez la plupart des espces, le rapport mle/femelle tait le plus lev pendant les priodes de plus faible abondance des femelles. Une dominance prononce des femelles sur les mles (&gt80%) a t observe tout au long de l'anne chez les espces potentiellement herbivores: Clausocalanus spp., P. parvus, A. clausi et C. helgolandicus. Chez les coppodes carnivores, potentiels ou obligatoires, P. gracilis, E. acuta, E. marina et C. armata, la dominance femelle tait moins frappante, mais la variabilit saisonnire tait leve. Chez les consommateurs mixtes T. stylifera et C. typicus, les sexes taient  peu prs galement reprsents tout au long de l'anne. Quelques espces ont montr des rpartitions plus profondes des mles  diffrentes priodes. Chez les espces potentiellement herbivores, le faible rapport mle/femelle pourrait tre en relation avec le comportement de formation d'essaims, qui accrot la probabilit de rencontre, facilite le processus d'accouplement et constitue une adaptation  l'apport limit de nourriture (laissant aux femelles une plus grande part). Les espces migrantes carnivores, qui ne sont pas connues pour avoir un comportement d'essaim, ont montr des pourcentages de mles plus levs.
20105468|A new species of porcellanid crab, Petrolisthes sanmartini is described. This new species and a second one, currently being described elsewhere, are additional members of the Petrolisthes galathinus complex (Werding, 1983), which is now represented by six species in the southern Caribbean Sea. The new species is distinguished morphologically from all other comparable species by an exceptionally slender shape of the walking legs and the presence of five movable spines on the dactylus of the walking legs, and can be distinguished in the field by its colouration as well. The identity of Petrolisthes galathinus (Bosc) is discussed in relation to the new findings. /// Eine neue Porcellanidenart, Petrolisthes sanmartini wird beschrieben. Die neue Art und eine weitere, die zur Zeit zur Verffentlichung vorbereitet wird, sind zustzliche Mitglieder des Petrolisthes galathinus Artenkomplexes (Werding, 1983), der nun mit sechs Arten im sdlichen karibischen Meer vertreten ist. Die neue Art ist morphologisch von allen anderen vergleichbaren Arten durch eine auergewhnlich schlanke Gestalt der Laufbeine und die Anwesenheit fnf beweglichen Stacheln am Dactylus der Laufbeine zu unterscheiden und kann im Feld durch ihre Frbung von verwandten Arten unterschieden werden. Die Identitt von Petrolisthes galathinus (Bosc) wird im Zusammenhang mit den neuen Funden diskutiert.
20105049|Descriptions of some decapod crustacean larvae of a plankton collection from the Gulf of Aqaba deal with Thalassinidea (Laomediidae, Upogebiidae, and Callianassidae) and Anomura (Galatheidae and Diogenidae). Discussion on generic larval characters is made particularly in Callianassidae and Diogenidae. Comparison of Laomediidae and Galatheidae larvae is summarized in tables I and II. The different arrangement of spines on some abdominal somites in Upogebiidae larvae is not a generic character but can be used, viz., in the form of distinctive larval species features. Because of confusion among the adult callianassid genera and the lack of knowledge in larval development, a definite generic identification is not possible. A key to the identification of Coenobitoidea larvae is provided. Larvae of the Coenobitidae and Calcinus are distinguished. /// La description de quelques larves de crustacs dcapodes d'une collection de plancton du Golfe d'Aqaba, est donne, concernant plus particulirement des Thalassinidea (Laomediidae, Upogebiidae and Callianassidae) et des Anomura (Galatheidae et Diogenidae). Les caractres larvaires au niveau gnrique sont discuts, en particulier chez les Callianassidae et les Diogenidae. La comparaison des larves de Laomediides et de Galatheides est rsume dans les tableaux I et II. L'arrangement diffrent des pines sur les somites abdominaux des larves d'Upogebiides n'est pas un caractre gnrique mais peut tre utilis comme un caractre distinctif des espces de larves. En raison de la confusion existant parmi les genres de Callianassides adultes et le manque de connaissances sur leur dveloppement larvaire, une identification gnrique dfinitive n'est pas possible. Une cl d'identification des larves de Coenobitoidae est fournie. Les larves de Coenobitidae et de Calcinus sont distingues.

20107678|Eucalanus inermis Giesbrecht, 1893 is an abundant species of the Humboldt Current and recognized as one of the large-sized herbivorous copepods in the pelagic realm of the eastern South Pacific. However, lack of information on morphological and taxonomic characters of early stages of this species is a major shortcoming to identify them from field samples, and therefore it limits the possibility of studying its populations and assessing its ecological role in the pelagic food web of the Humboldt Current.
