20107554|The prevalence, fecundity, and size distribution of the isopod, Elthusa alvaradoensis, parasitizing the inshore lizardfish, Synodus foetens on the continental shelf off central Veracruz, Mexico, were studied. A total sample of 136 fish with a 46.3% prevalence of E. alvaradoensis was obtained during a survey cruise in February, 1996. The isopods were preferentially located on the second and third branchial arches; the lesions ranged from a slight abrasion of the branchial filaments to their complete removal. Mean host size did not vary significantly between the parasitized and unparasitized fractions. Maximum total length for male parasites was 12 mm, while female size ranged from 14.5 to 26.3 mm. Parasite fecundity varied from 100 to 2280 eggs and was unrelated to female size (p &lt 0.05). Male parasites exhibit a positive allometric growth, while this is negative for females. /// Se estudi la prevalencia, fecundidad y distribucin de tallas del ispodo Elthusa alvaradoensis parasitando el lagarto mximo, Synodus foetens, en la plataforma central de Veracruz, Mxico. De la muestra total de 136 peces obtenida de un crucero de estudio en febrero de 1996, la prevalencia de E. alvaradoensis fue del 46.3%. Los ispodos fueron localizados preferentemente en el segundo y tercer arco branquial; las lesiones observadas fueron desde la abrasin de los filamentos branquiales hasta la remocin completa de los mismos. La talla promedio del hospedero no vari significativamente entre la fraccin parasitada y la no parasitada. La longitud total mxima de las machos parsitos fue de 12 mm, mientras la talla de las hembras vari de 14.5 a 26.3 mm. La fecundidad del parsito oscil de 100 a 2280 huevos y no se relacion con la talla de la hembra (p &lt 0.05). Los machos parsitos exhiben crecimiento alomtrico positivo y negativo en las hembras.

Es wird Stellung genommen zu den vorhandenen Berichten ber die Larven von P. tarda Kryer und Parapasipha sulcatifrons S. I. Smith. Die Entwicklung bei diesen vier Arten ist stark verkrzt und weicht in mehreren Punkten von der Entwicklung bei Leptochela ab, dem einzigen anderen pasiphaeiden Genus mit bekannten Larven.
20104145|Nous avons examin l'effet de la salinit (0, 6, 12, 18, 24 ou 30) sur les limites thermiques suprieures (28 et 30C) de survie et de mtamorphose durant le dveloppement larvaire de la crevette d'eau douce Macrobrachium amazonicum. Les deux paramtres affectent fortement le dveloppement; nous avons observ la mtamorphose  des salinits de 6  30 aux deux tempratures, bien que de faibles taux de survie au stade postlarvaire et un temps de dveloppement plus long fussent vidents  la plus haute temprature. La salinit optimale pour lever les larves de M. amazonicum semble tre entre 12 et 18  28C, quand on relve aprs 29-30 jours, 75% de mtamorphose. Les rsultats suggrent que M. amazonicum peut tre lev rapidement et avec succs  des tempratures voisines de sa limite ltale; l'espce semble convenir  des programmes d'aquaculture extensive dans le nord du Brsil et dans les rgions no-tropicales.
20105460|A population of Loxopagurus loxochelis was studied in terms of seasonal abundance, size frequency distribution, sex ratio, and reproductive period (percentage of ovigerous females). Specimens were collected monthly over a period of two years (from September 1995 to August 1997) in the non-consolidated areas of the Ubatuba, Mar Virado, and Ubatumirim bays (northern coast of So Paulo State, Brazil) with a double-rig trawl net. A total of 1,084 individuals were analysed. Animal size (minimum, maximum, and mean  SD shield length) was 2.8, 9.1, and 6.88  1.13 mm for 625 males; 2.8, 8.2, and 5.78  0.98 mm for 236 non-ovigerous females; and 4.6, 8.0, and 6.24  0.68 mm for 223 ovigerous females, respectively. Sexual dimorphism was recorded by the presence of males in the largest size classes. The sex ratio was 1.4: 1 in favour of males. The highest incidence of ovigerous females occurred during winter and spring (June to October), with a low percentage in summer and fall (November to May), indicating continuity in the reproductive cycle. This strategy of reproduction is related to temperature. The occurrence of L. loxochelis in the Ubatuba region represents the final point of northern distribution of this species as a function of water mass influence, and could be its real limit on the Atlantic coast of South America. /// Uma populao do ermito Loxopagurus loxochelis foi estudada com relao  sua abundncia sazonal, distribuio de freqncia de tamanho, razo sexual e perodo reprodutivo (porcentagem de fmeas ovgeras). Os espcimens foram coletados mensalmente, por um perodo de 2 anos (Setembro 1995 a Agosto 1997) em reas de substrato no-consolidado das Enseadas de Ubatuba, Mar Virado e Ubatumirim (costa norte do Estado de So Paulo, Brasil) com uma rede do tipo "double-rig". Um total de 1.084 indivduos foram analisados. Os tamanhos dos exemplares (mnimo, mximo e mdia  SD do comprimento do escudo cefalotorcico) foram 2,8, 9,1 e 6,88  1,13 mm para 625 machos; 2,8, 8,2 e 5,78  0,98 mm para 236 fmeas no ovgeras; e 4,6, 8,0 e 6,24  0,68 mm para 223 fmeas ovgeras, respectivamente. O dimorfismo sexual foi registrado pela presena de machos nas maiores classes de tamanho. A razo sexual foi de 1,4: 1 em favor dos machos. A maior incidncia de fmeas ovgeras ocorreu no inverno e na primavera (Junho a Outubro), com uma baixa porcentagem no vero e no outono (Novembro a Maio), indicando continuidade no ciclo reprodutivo. Tal estratgia na reproduo est relacionada  temperatura. A ocorrncia de L. loxochelis na regio de Ubatuba representa o limite da distribuio setentrional desta espcie em funo da influncia das massas de gua e pode ser seu limite real na costa Atlntica da Amrica do Sul.
20103469|The neurosecretory system of Simocephalus vetulus Schdler was studied with the light microscope. On the basis of size, shape, distribution, and staining affinity four types of neurosecretory cells were described in the brain and two types of neurons were also described in the suboesophageal ganglion and circumoesophageal connectives. A minority of neurons in the brain respond to the paraldehyde fuchsin staining technique (PAF) but they differ from each other with respect to the degree of their staining affinity. PAF-positive neurons were not observed in the suboesophageal ganglion and circumoesophageal connectives. Furthermore, no neurohaemal organ was observed in the brain.
20101870|To the author's knowledge, this is the first time that an orbital model is presented to coordinate the structural trends of the endopod of the fourth leg () in the parastenocarids. The model is based on more than 100 described species. This method allows to distinguish three natural principles that govern the evolution within this family: (1) a tendency toward reduction and elimination on the 4th endopod; (2) a differentiation developing the haptic potential; (3) maintenance of relatively original and primitive types in the orbits 4 to 6. The Parastenocaridae inhabit interstitial limnic habitats and reveal 12 series of trends, distributed in the Palaearctic, Nearctic, Oriental, Ethiopic and Neotropic regions. They are classified into 26 genera, of which 24 are new to science.

P. japonicus larvae were fed on newly hatched Artemia nauplii while Thenus sp. larvae were fed on three-day cultured Artemia nauplii and chopped frozen mussel gonad. During the experiments, P. japonicus and Thenus sp. larvae developed to the fifth and fourth instar, respectively. Results showed that longer periods of time-to-first-feeding (TFF) effectively lengthened the intermoult period of the first instar, but did not affect the duration of later intermoult periods or growth in size. 20102115|Pendant la formation du spermatophore de Penaeus kerathurus, deux couches, I et II, entourent la masse des spermatozodes dans un seul conduit de la portion ascendante du canal dfrent. Elles forment un corps cylindrique principal, alors que deux autres couches, III et IV, simultanment dposes dans un conduit annexe, constituent l'aile accessoire. Une connexion prliminaire a lieu entre ces deux parties par la couche V, qui est dpose  l'origine autour de l'aile, mais qui, ensuite, entoure incompltement le corps du spermatophore.

20105584|A protist-bryozoan-crustacean hyperepibiosis was observed on specimens of the brachyuran decapod Goneplax rhomboides collected on the NW Mediterranean coast. The primary epibionts were ctenostomate bryozoans of the species Triticella flava. The secondary epibionts were ciliate protists (Zoothamnium, Cothurnia, and Corynophrya). The bryozoans were located on the following areas of the crab: ocular orbits, maxillae, maxillipeds, chelipeds, pereiopods, dorsal carapace, ventral cephalothorax, abdomen, and carapace areas between the pereiopods. Ciliate protists were attached indistinctly to any of the surfaces of the bryozoans. The maximum number of bryozoans per crab was 943, and of ciliates per crab, 1,466. Data regarding the number of bryozoans and ciliates on each surface area of the crab are presented. Statistical analysis was carried out in order to relate the various anatomical units of the crab with the epibionts present. There was a significant correlation between the size (i.e., width) of the crab and the number of bryozoan epibionts. There also was a significant correlation between the number of bryozoans and the number of ciliates per crab. The data obtained were compared with those corresponding to other specimens of Goneplax rhomboides previously sampled in the same geographical area that showed the same ciliates, but in that case adhering directly to the surface of the crab. There was a significant correlation between specimens of G. rhomboides with and without bryozoan epibionts with respect to the number of individuals of Cothurnia on each anatomical unit of the crab. In addition, there also was a significant difference between crabs with and without bryozoans epibionts as to the number of protist epibionts on each surface area of the crustacean. /// Una hiperepibiosis protista-briozoo-crustceo fue observada en especmenes del decpodo braquiuro Goneplax rhomboides recolectados en la costa NW del Mediterrneo. Los epibiontes primarios fueron briozoos ctenostomados de la especie Triticella flava. Los epibiontes secundarios fueron protistas ciliados (Zoothamnium, Cothurnia y Corynophrya). Los briozoos estaban localizados en las siguientes reas del cangrejo: rbitas oculares, maxilas, maxilpedos, quelpedos, pereipodos, caparazn dorsal, cefalotrax ventral, abdomen, y reas del caparazn entre los pereipodos. Los protistas ciliados estaban adheridos indistintamente a cualquier superficie de los briozoos. El mximo nmero de briozoos por cangrejo fu de 943, y el de ciliados por cangrejo, 1,466. Se muestran datos relativos al nmero de briozoos y ciliados en cada rea superficial del cangrejo. Se ha realizado un anlisis estadstico para relacionar las diversas unidades anatmicas del cangrejo y los epibiontes presentes. Hay una correlacin significativa entre el tamao (p.ej. la anchura) del cangrejo y el nmero de briozoos epibiontes. Tambin hay una correlacin significativa entre el nmero de briozoos y el nmero de ciliados por cangrejo. Los datos obtenidos se compararon con los correspondientes a otros ejemplares de Goneplax rhomboides recolectados previamente en la misma rea geogrfica, que mostraron los mismos ciliados, aunque en este caso adheridos directamente a la superficie del cangrejo. Hay una correlacin significativa entre especmenes de G. rhomboides con y sin briozoos epibiontes respecto al nmero de individuos de Cothurnia en cada unidad anatmica del cangrejo. Adems, hay una diferencia significativa entre cangrejos con y sin briozoos epibiontes respecto al nmero de protistas epibiontes en cada rea de la superficie del crustceo.
20101920|A sample yielding for the first time representatives of all of the three families of the order Bathynellacea has been taken in interstitial groundwaters of the Serra do Mar of So Paulo (Brazil). Full descriptions are given of Nannobathynella marcusi Noodt, 1969 and Leptobathynella richerti brasiliensis n.spp. One species of Leptobathynella and one of Parabathynella remain undescribed for lack of material. There is an additional record of Nannobathynella marcusi from the southern part of So Paulo State. The zoogeographical aspects of these findings are referred to briefly. Further details concerning the morphology of the type specimens of Leptobathynella ypacaraiensis (Noodt, 1963) from Paraguay are added.
20107899|In this study, the seasonal variation of natural levels of infection in Cyclops vicinus Uljanin, 1875 with procercoids of cestodes was examined in Lake Hazar, Turkey from November 2005 to October 2006. The prevalence of infected C. vicinus was found to increase with water temperature (p &lt 0.01); a peak occurred in September, while relatively low levels were recorded between November and March. No statistically significant relation was determined between infection and pH values (p &gt 0.05). However, a statistically significant, negative correlation was found between infection and dissolved O level (p &lt 0.05). Each infected Cyclops carried only one procercoid. /// Dans cette tude, la variation saisonnire des niveaux naturels d'infection chez Cyclops vicinus Uljanin, 1875 par les procercodes de cestodes a t examine au lac Hazar, Turquie, de novembre 2005  octobre 2006. La prvalence de C. vicinus infects augmentait avec la temprature de l'eau (p &lt 0.01); un pic s'est produit en septembre, alors que des taux relativement bas ont t relevs entre novembre et mars. Aucune relation statistiquement significative n'a t dtermine entre l'infection et les valeurs du pH (p &gt 0.05). Cependant, une corrlation ngative statistiquement significative a t constate entre l'infection et le niveau d'O dissous (p &lt 0.05). Chaque Cyclops infect portait un seul procercode.

23065210|Latreutes fucorum (Fabricius, 1798) has a distribution that includes the American Atlantic coast from Canada to Brazil and part of the Antilles, as well as the Azores Islands and Cape Verde in the eastern Atlantic; however, there is little published information on the reproduction of this species. The aim of this study is to provide data on some reproductive characteristics of L. fucorum as fecundity, egg volume, sex ratio, and size at sexual maturity (CL). The shrimps were collected on Thalassia testudinum Banks & Solander ex Knig meadows in Baha de la Ascensin, Quintana Roo, Mexico during May 2002 by means of a Coleman-Seagrove sledge net with 800 m mesh opening. We analysed 1097 specimens, from which was obtained a sex ratio of 1.59 males per female. The size interval of ovigerous females was 1.80 to 3.88 mm cephalothoracic length (CL), and we estimated a size at sexual maturity in the population of 2.55  0.79 mm CL. Average fecundity was 96.25  53.16, with 25 eggs as minimum and a maximum of 323, with a correlation coefficient of 0.72 between cephalothorax length and fecundity. Average egg volume varied from 0.013 mm in the first stage of development to 0.025 mm in embryos near hatching, which represents an increase of 92.3%. This is the first study about reproductive characteristics of L. fucorum for the Atlantic coast of Mexico. Latreutes fucorum (Fabricius, 1798) tiene una distribucin que incluye las costas del Atlntico americano desde Canad a Brasil y parte de las Antillas, as como las Islas Azores y Cabo Verde, en el Atlntico oriental; sin embargo, hay poca informacin publicada sobre la reproduccin de esta especie. El propsito de este estudio es proporcionar datos sobre algunas caractersticas reproductivas de L. fucorum como fecundidad, volumen del huevo, proporcin sexual, y talla de madurez sexual (CL). Los especimenes fueron recolectados en praderas de Thalassia testudinum Banks & Solander ex Knig durante mayo de 2002 en Baha de la Ascensin, Quintana Roo, Mxico, con una red de patn tipo Colman-Seagrove y abertura de malla de 800 m. Se analizaron 1097 especimenes de los que se obtuvo una proporcin sexual de 1,59 machos por hembra. El intervalo de tallas de hembras ovgeras fue de 1,80 a 3,88 mm de longitud de cefalotrax (LC), y se estim la talla de madurez sexual de la muestra en 2,55  0.79 mm de LC. La fecundidad promedio fue de 96,25  53,16 huevos, con 25 unidades como mnimo y 323 como mximo; el coeficiente de correlacin entre la longitud del cefalotrax y la fecundidad fue de 0,72. El volumen de los huevos vari de 0,013 mm en el primer estadio de desarrollo a 0,025 mm en embriones cercanos a la eclosin, lo cual represent un incremento de 92,3%. Este es el primer estudio sobre la reproduccin de L. fucorum para la costa Atlntica de Mxico.

20103499|Rhinediaptomus mahanandiensis n. sp., described from Mahanandi, a pilgrim centre in South India, differs from the only species of the genus Rhinediaptomus viz., R. indicus Kiefer, in the larger body size; in possessing a two-segmented endopodite equalling the length of the first exopodite-segment in the female fifth pair of legs; in the shape of the second exopodite-segment of the male right fifth leg; in the lateral spine arising from the middle of the said segment and having no basal chitinous structure; and in the nature of the end claw of the same leg.

20105549|Growth, longevity, and reproduction of Tanymastigites perrieri (Daday, 1910) have been studied under standardized laboratory conditions at six different temperature regimes: 10, 20, 25, 30, 35, and 40C. The development D of the shrimps as a function of the temperature T is expressed as K = D(T-C). The temperature at which development stopped is C = 4.32C, while K is a thermal constant, the number of degrees-days above threshold, or the physiological time (K = 719 degrees-days). The highest growth rate occurred at 25C. The greatest body size, however, was attained in animals reared at 10C (22 mm). Longevity decreased with increasing temperatures (from 41 days to 4 days). Maturation time was inversely related to temperature (from 20 days to 4 days; at 40C no larvae survived). Offspring per individual varies with temperature (maximum 447 eggs at 20C); while the innate capacity for increase, r, fluctuates between 0.07 and 0.34. /// La croissance, la longvit et la reproduction de Tanymastigites perrieri (Daday, 1910) ont t tudis sous des conditions standardises au laboratoire et sous 6 diffrentes tempratures: 10, 20, 25, 30, 35, et 40C. Le dveloppement D de l'espce en fonction de la temprature est exprim par K = D(T-C). La temprature sous laquelle le dveloppement s'achve est C = 4,32C, et K = 719 degrs-jours, reprsentant la constante thermale, le degr au-dessus du seuil ou le temps physiologique. Le taux de croissance le plus lev est observ  25C tandis que la plus grande taille est obtenue chez les individus cultivs  10C (22 mm). La longvit dcrot avec l'accroissement de la temprature (de 41 jours  4 jours). Le temps de maturation est inversement proportionnel  la temprature (de 20 jours  4 jours;  40C aucun nauplius n'a survie). La descendance par individu varie avec la temprature (maximum 447 cystes  20C), alors que le taux d'accroissement momentan, r, fluctue entre 0,07 et 0,34.
23065216|In this study, the interrelationships between various morphometric characters, viz., carapace width and length and chelar propodus length and height in males, as well as carapace width and length and abdominal width and length in females, were estimated using a total of 980 crabs, Portunus pelagicus. The carapace width/length  weight relationship was studied in both sexes on a total of 1188 crabs using the allometric growth equation of Von Bertalanffy. The allometric relationships between the characters of this set suggest that most relationships are positive and highly significant. The 'b' values for carapace width-weight in males and females were 3.607 and 3.293, respectively, and for carapace length-weight they were 3.049 and 2.774, respectively. The results show a significant deviation from an isometric growth pattern. An analysis of covariance indicates that there is a significant difference between sexes with respect to the carapace width-weight relationship. Dans cette tude, les interrelations entre divers caractres morphomtriques, viz., largeur et longueur de la carapace et longueur et hauteur du propodite de la pince chez les mles, ainsi que la largeur et longueur de la carapace et largeur et longueur de l'abdomen chez les femelles, ont t estims en mesurant un total de 980 crabes Portunus pelagicus. La relation taille de la carapace (largeur/longueur) versus poids a t tudie dans les deux sexes sur un total de 1188 crabes en utilisant la courbe de croissance de Von Bertalanffy. Les relations allomtriques entre ces caractres suggrent que la plupart des interrelations sont positives et hautement significatives. Les valeurs de  b  pour la relation largeur de la carapace/poids chez les mles et les femelles sont respectivement de 3,607 and 3,293, et pour la relation longueur de la carapace/poids de 3,049 et 2,774, respectivement. Les rsultats montrent une dviation significative du modle de croissance isomtrique. Une analyse de covariance montre qu'il existe une diffrence significative entre les sexes au niveau de la relation largeur de la carapace/poids.
20104203|Une nouvelle espce de crabe d'eau douce, Phricotelphusa hockpingi sp. nov. est dcrite de Maxwell Hill, Perak, Malaisie occidentale. Cette espce est la premire du genre Phricotelphusa Alcock, 1909, comme de la famille Gecarcinucidae en Malaisie occidentale. Les affinits entre les genres Phricotelphusa et Irmengardia Bott, 1969, et la validit des familles reconnues par Bott (1969, 1970) dans sa superfamille Gecarcinucoidea sont galement discutes.
20104943|The hitherto existing subspecies Cyclops vicinus kikuchii Smirnov, 1932 was originally described by materials from Japan; later it was found in Russia, Poland, and Czechoslovakia. Compared with Cyclops vicinus Uljanin, 1875 the subspecies is characterized mainly by the short inner furcal seta (no. 1) in proportion to furcal and body length. According to Wierzbicka (1934) both types could interbreed to produce fertile offspring. Materials collected in an old reservoir, the "Neuweiher" near Meersburg (Lake Constance), and further in Lake Seeg and in the "Schwaltenweiher" (southern Bavaria), allowed morphological and morphometrical studies (fig. 1, tab. I), completed by comparative chromatin diminution and enzyme electrophoresis. The morphological studies (tab. I) confirmed the differences in length of the inner furcal seta compared with C. vicinus. The only five specimens from Lake Seeg at least indicate the probability of a seasonal variation. The course of chromatin diminution (fig. 2) appears identical in qualitative aspects for both cyclopids. In the enzyme electrophoresis remarkable differences were found in GOT (glutamate oxaloacetate transferase), APK (arginine phosphokinase) and PGM (phosphoglucomutase) (fig. 3). Together with the morphological details and the sympatric occurrence with C. vicinus in Lake Seeg and in the "Schwaltenweiher", these results confirm the separate status of the species Cyclops kikuchii Smirnov, 1932. This species passes its diapause during summer in the fifth copepodid instar, while C. vicinus aestivates in the fourth instar. /// Die bisherige Unterart Cyclops vicinus kikuchii Smirnov, 1932 hat sich aufgrund morphologischer und morphometrischer Untersuchungen sowie durch den Vergleich der Enzym-Elektrophorese als eigene, gegenber Cyclops vicinus Uljanin, 1875 eindeutig abgrenzbare Art erwiesen. Unter den morphologischen Merkmalen fallen besonders die relativ kurze innere Furkalendborste sowie der im Verhltnis zum inneren relativ lange uere Apikaldorn am Endglied des Endopoditen P4 auf. Die Chromatin-Diminution ist fr beide Arten im Ablauf (zumindest qualitativ) identisch, bei den Enzymen weist vor allem GOT auf starke genetische Unterschiede zwischen Cyclops vicinus und Cyclops kikuchii hin. Das sympatrische Vorkommen beider Arten in den sdbayerischen Seen betont die taxonomische Eigenstndigkeit von C. kikuchii, der zudem im Unterschied zu C. vicinus (wo diese Ruhephase im vierten Stadium eintritt) die sommerliche Diapause im fnften Copepodidstadium durchluft.
41038654|Two annual immigration cycles (1969-1970 cycle I; and 1981-1982 cycle II) of postlarvae (Pis.) of the white shrimp Litopenaeus vannamei (Boone, 1931) recorded at the same recruiting inlet and employing comparable sampling procedures, were analysed to examine interannual variability. The annual and monthly density values of both cycles were tested to infer a predictable immigration model that can be applied to assess the abundance and availability of shrimp Pis. at recruiting sites. A sustainable Pls. extraction programme must rely on a sound knowledge of the variability patterns of these parameters. Significant differences were noted in the annual density of Pls. between cycles. In cycle I, the annual mean density of postlarvae ( d /yr /Pls.) was 3.1, while in cycle II it was 1.3. Successful reproduction and spawning of the offshore shrimp stock and coastal circulation conditions are invoked as possible sources of variability between cycles. The parameter  d/yr/Pls. is recognized as a good estimator for assessing yearly immigration success of Pls. among cycles and localities. This parameter becomes statistically more robust, minimizing the above differences, when the numbers of days of Pls. absence detected in the two cycles are incorporated in the calculations. The monthly mean density of Pis. ( d/month/Pls.) underwent significant interannual fluctuations (Mann-Whitney U-test, p = 0.001). While in cycle I there were three monthly abundance peaks, in cycle II only one peak was recognized. The correlation coefficient of this parameter in both cycles was low and inverse (r =  -0.203). Nonetheless, both cycles exhibited similar values of maximum monthly mean Pls. density. The penaeid immigration process is a complex phenomenon, governed by physical factors and interspecific variability, that is further augmented when assorted sampling methodologies are applied in its study. The results here presented indicate the convenience of implementing long-term Pls. assessment in shrimp recruiting sites, and employing standardized methodologies in order to achieve a sustainable exploitation of this valuable resource. Se analiza la variabilidad interannual de las postlarvas (Pls.) del camarn blanco Litopenaeus vannamei (Boone, 1931) en dos ciclos anuales de inmigracin (1969-1970 ciclo I; y 1981-1982 ciclo II) en una misma boca litoral empleando procedimientos comparables para la obtencin de las muestras. Los valores de densidad anual y mensual de ambos ciclos fueron evaluados para inferir un modelo predecible de inmigracin aplicable para estimar la abundancia y la disponibilidad de Pls. de camarn en sitios de reclutamiento. Un programa de extraccin sostenible de Pls. debe fundamentarse en un buen conocimiento de los patrones de variabilidad de dichos parmetros. Se registraron diferencias significativas en la densidad anual de las Pls. entre ciclos. En el ciclo I el promedio anual de la densidad postlarval ( d/yr/Pls.) fue 3.1, mientras que en el ciclo II fue de 1.3. Se invocan como posibles fuentes de variabilidad entre los ciclos, el xito reproductivo, el desove del stock marino y las condiciones de circulacin costera. El parmetro  d/yr/Pls. representa un buen estimador para evaluar el xito de la inmigracin anual de Pls. entre ciclos y localidades. Estadsticamente este parmetro es ms robusto pues minimiza las diferencias citadas al incorporar en los clculos los das de ausencia de Pls. detectados en los dos ciclos. El promedio de la densidad mensual de Pls. ( d/month/Pls.) mostr fluctuaciones significativas (Mann-Whitney U test p = 0.001). Mientras que en el ciclo I hubo tres picos mensuales de abundancia, en el ciclo II solo se reconoci uno. El coeficiente de correlacin de este parmetro en ambos ciclos fue bajo e inverso (r =  0.203). Sin embargo, ambos ciclos exhiben valores similares en el promedio de la densidad mensual mxima. El proceso de inmigracin de los peneidos es un fenmeno complejo gobernado por factores fsicos y por la variabilidad interespecfica; dicha variabilidad se incrementa cuando se aplican para su estudio diversas metodologas. Los resultados aqu presentados indican la conveniencia de establecer programas de evaluacin de Pls. de largo plazo en sitios de reclutamiento, empleando mtodos estandarizados para alcanzar la explotacin sustentable de este valioso recurso.
20107658|The feeding habits of Palaemonetes zariquieyi (n = 262) were studied by examining the stomach contents of specimens from an Iberian river throughout the summer (June to September). The diet was characterized using the Index of Relative Importance (IRI). P. zariquieyi is omnivorous, feeding largely on members of benthic communities. The bulk of the stomach content was formed by chironomids (IRI = 21.69), oligochaetes (IRI = 19.53), and a variety of organisms, ranging from insect larvae to algae. /// Se ha estudiado la dieta da Palaemonetes zariquieyi (n = 262) mediante el anlisis de los contenidos estomacales de individuos capturados en los meses de verano (de junio a septiembre) en un ro ibrico. La dieta se ha caracterizado mediante la aplicacin del ndice de importancia relativa (IRI). La mayor parte de los contenidos estomacales estn constituidos por quironmidos (IRI = 21,69), oligoquetos (IRI = 19,53) y una gran variedad de presas que oscilan desde larvas de insectos hasta algas.
20107622|Seasonal variations in length of the copepods in Keban Dam Lake were compared and the relative influence of temperature, chlorophyll concentration, salinity, and total hardness examined. Temperature seems to be the primary factor influencing copepod body length in the Keban Dam Lake, but the various species differ markedly in their response. Calanoid copepods (Arctodiaptomus osmanus and Acanthodiaptomus denticornis) showed a more definite trend of size variation with temperature than the cyclopoid copepod, Cyclops vicinus. Differences in metabolic rate, longevity, and specialization of calanoid and cyclopoid copepods could explain their different responses to temperature. /// Les variations saisonnires de taille des coppodes du lac de barrage de Keban ont t compares et l'influence relative de la temprature, de la concentration en chlorophylle, de la salinit et de la duret totale a t examine. La temprature semble tre le premier facteur influenant la longueur du corps des coppodes dans le lac de Keban, mais les diffrentes espces varient dans leur rponse de faon marque. Les coppodes calanodes (Arctodiaptomus osmanus et Acanthodiaptomus denticornis) ont montr une tendance plus marque de la variation de taille en fonction de la temprature que le coppode cyclopode Cyclops vicinus. Des diffrences dans les taux de mtabolisme, la longvit et la spcialisation des coppodes calanodes et cyclopodes pourraient expliquer leurs rponses diffrentes  la temprature.

Les deux genres Dinopontius et Stenopontius constituent la famille nouvelle des Dinopontiidae. Le comportement de S. humesi au laboratoire est brivement discut.
20105385|The identity of the poorly known rubble swimming crab, Coelocarcinus foliatus Edmondson, 1930, is clarified and the species is redescribed and figured in detail. The species is also reported from Guam for the first time. Notes on its habitat and behaviour are provided. Specimens from Madagascar previously referred to this taxon are here shown to represent a new species, C. marindicus. /// L'identit du crabe nageur peu connu, Coelocarcinus foliatus Edmondson, 1930, est clarifie et l'espce est redcrite et figure en dtail. Des spcimens de Madagascar auparavant attribus  ce taxon sont ici montrs comme appartenant  une espce nouvelle, C. marindicus.
20105507|The population biology of Uca thayeri was studied in a subtropical mangrove in Ubatuba, State of So Paulo, Brazil. Two sampling techniques were used: transect sampling and catch-per-unit-effort. Size frequency distribution, sex-ratio, and reproductive period were analysed. For juvenile crabs (CW &lt 4.6 mm), the transect procedure was most efficient, while ovigerous females were most collected during the capture effort. Males were most numerous in the transect technique, while in the catch-per-unit-effort there was no difference sexes. The species showed a different size frequency distribution for each sampling procedure. The reproduction of U. thayeri is seasonal, being more pronounced in the warmer months of the year. However, juveniles occurred all over the year, although more numerous in the colder months. The success of the species in reproductive activity and the constant colonization of the area can be attributed to the availability of food resources and differential occupation of the habitat by ovigerous females. /// Se ha estudiado la biologa poblacional de Uca thayeri en un manglar subtropical de Ubatuba, Estado de So Paulo, Brasil. Se emplearon dos mtodos de muestreo: transectos y capturas por unidad de esfuerzo. Se analiz la distribucin de frecuencias de tallas, proporcin de sexos y periodo reproductivo. Para los ejemplares juveniles y machos adultos (CW &lt 4,6 mm) el mtodo de transectos fue el procedimiento ms eficaz, mientras que las hembras ovgeras fueron evaluadas ms eficazmente mediante capturas por unidad de esfuerzo. La especie mostr diferentes distribuciones de frecuencias de tallas segn el mtodo de muestreo. La reproduccin de U. thayeri es estacional, siendo ms importante en los meses clidos. Sin embargo, los juveniles aparecieron durante todo el ao, aunque siendo ms numerosos en los meses fros. El xito en la actividad reproductiva y la colonizacin constante en el rea puede ser atribuida a la disponibilidad del alimento y a la diferente ocupacin del hbitat por las hembras ovgeras.
27743336|Alvinocaris alexander sp. nov. (Alvinocarididae) and Lebbeus wera sp. nov. (Hippolytidae) are described from hydrothermal vents on the southern Kermade Ridge, northern New Zealand. Alvinocaris alexander most closely resembles A. williamsi Shank & Martin, 2003 from the Mid Atlantic Ridge, differing in rostral, antennular, and abdominal features. Alvinocaris alexander is apparently sympatric with A. niwa Webber, 2004, and comprises part of the part of the type series of the latter. Lebbeus wera is the first species of the genus to be recorded from New Zealand waters and is most similar to other deep-water Lebbeus species including Lebbeus washingtonianus (Rathbun, 1902) and L. polycanthus Komai, Hayashi & Kohtsuka, 2004, but is distinctive in its five dorsal postrostral teeth. The first records of the alvinocaridid, Nautilocaris saintlaurenta Komai & Segonzac, 2004, from Brothers Seamount, New Zealand, are reported, being previously known only from the North Fiji and Lau basins. Three genera and five species of caridean shrimp are now known from New Zealand hydrothermal vents. /// Alvinocaris alexander sp. nov. (Alvinocarididae) und Lebbeus wera sp. nov. (Hippolytidae) werden im Folgenden von hydrothermalen Quellen des sdlichen Kermadec Rckens, Nord-Neuseeland, beschrieben. Alvinocaris alexander hnelt A. williamsi Shank & Martin, 2003 vom Mittelatlantischen Rcken, unterscheidet sich aber in Merkmalen des Rostrums, der Antennen und des Abdomens. Alvinocaris alexander ist scheinbar sympatrisch mit A. niwa Webber, 2004, und stellt einen Teli dessen Typenserie dar. Lebbeus wera ist die erste Art dieser Gattung aus neuseelndischen Gewssern und hnelt anderen Tiefseearten der Gattung Lebbeus wie Lebbeus washingtonianus (Rathbun, 1902) und L. polyacanthus Komai, Hayashi & Kohtsuka, 2004, unterscheidet sich von diesen allerdings durch seine fnf dorsalen postrolstalen Zhne. Erstmals wird hier die alvinocaridide Nautilocaris saintlaurentae Komai & Sevonzac, 2004, von dem Brothers Seamount, Neuseeland, gemeldet. Bisher war diese Art nur vom Nord-Fidschi-Becken und dem Lau Becken bekannt. Damit sind drei Gattungen und fnf Arten carideaner Garnele von neuseelndischen Hydrothermalquellen bekannt.
20103498|Description of a new, unpigmented and blind Asellid, belonging to the genus Proasellus. P. rouchi n. sp. is an interstitial form found in the underflow of Var River (Alpes-Maritimes, France). This Asellid shows morphological characters perfectly adapted to this biotope: very minute size, thin and elongated body, reduced chaetotaxy. The structure of the copulatory pleopods points out the fact that this hypogean Asellid takes place among the species of the cavaticus group. We give a check-list of the 8 species belonging to this phyletic line of Proasellus, a key to identify them and the distribution of each one. The biogeographical data permit to presume that these Asellids have an alpine origin and we propose a diagram showing their evolution from an hypothetical ancestral form.
20101694|Eine neue Art der Gattung Ixa wird vom Arabischen Meer beschrieben und verglichen mit der nahverwandten Ixa monodi.
20104963|This review focuses on the larval, postlarval, and early benthic life of Homarus and Nephrops, the two best studied, and commercially most important, genera of the Nephropidae. Processes acting during this time of the life cycle may be critical of the fate of a cohort. In the past decade, significant advances have been made in understanding events before and after settlement. Nephrops and Homarus are very similar with respect to the processes affecting the distribution of the pelagic larvae and postlarvae: wind, currents and larval behavior play a significant role. Duration of the pelagic phase is determined by temperature, timing of settlement, and perhaps nutrition. Both genera probably are quite selective of substratum during settlement, but this has been investigated only in Homarus, where substratum type, odor, and predator presence affect choice of habitat. The two genera contrast, however, with respect to some of the processes occurring during and after postlarval settlement. Although both are cryptic, newly settled Homarus are found in shallow, rocky habitats, while settled Nephrops are found in deep water, in burrows they construct in cohesive mud. Homarus undergoes a developmental change in behavior within the first few years of benthic life that causes an increasingly wide range of movement; sexually mature H. americanus can move hundreds of kilometers in a year. Nephrops emerges more as it grows, but appears to be far more sedentary than Homarus. Thus in contrast to Homarus, a number of distinct populations of Nephrops exist within the species range that are clearly defined by habitat boundaries. New techniques now permit routine census and tagging of early benthic phase Homarus, making it possible to follow year classes from the time of settlement. It is the years immediately after settlement that a cohort may be subject to density-dependent controls, a key issue facing workers on both groups. /// Cette revue porte sur la vie des larves, des post-larves et des premiers stades benthiques de Homarus et Nephrops, les deux genres de Nephropidae les mieux tudis et commercialement les plus importants. Les processus intervenant au cours de cette priode du cycle de vie peuvent tre dcisifs pour le sort d' une cohorte. Au cours de la dernire dcennie, des progrs significatifs ont t faits dans la comprhension des vnements intervenant avant et aprs sdentarisation. Nephrops et Homarus sont trs comparables en ce qui concerne les processus affectant la rpartition des larves plagiques et des postlarves: vent, courants et comportement larvaire jouent un rle significatif. La dure de la phase plagique est dtermine par la temprature, le moment de la sdentarisation et peut-tre la nutrition. Les deux genres sont probablement trs slectifs quant au substrat pour leur sdentarisation, mais cela n'a t tudi que chez Homarus chez lequel le type de substrat, l'odeur et la prsence de prdateurs influe sur le choix de l'habitat. Les deux genres s'opposent, cependant, en ce qui concerne certains des processus intervenant pendant et aprs la sdentarisation post-larvaire. Bien que ces derniers soient cryptiques, les Homarus nouvellement fixs sont trouvs dans des habitats rocheux et peu profonds tandis les Nephrops nouvellement sdentariss sont trouvs en eau profonde, dans des terriers qu'ils construisent en vase compacte. Homarus manifeste un changement de comportement pendant les premiers jours de sa vie benthique, avec un large accroissement de ses mouvements. H. americanus,  sa maturit sexuelle, peut parcourir des centaines de kilomtres dans l'anne. Nephrops sort davantage en grandissant, mais semble tre de loin plus sdentaire que Homarus. Ainsi,  l'inverse de ce que l'on observe chez Homarus, il existe plusieurs populations distinctes de Nephrops  l'intrieur de l'aire de distribution de l'espce, populations clairement dfinies par les limites de l'habitat. De nouvelles techniques permettent maintenant le recensement et le marquage des premiers stades benthiques de Homarus, donnant la possibilit de suivre les classes de l'anne  partir de la sdentarisation. C'est dans les premires annes suivant la sdentarisation qu'une cohorte peut tre soumise  des contrles dpendants de la densit, un problme cl pos aux chercheurs travaillant sur les deux groupes.

20103150|Cyclops vernalis Fischer   wurden von der letzten Hutung an bis zu ihren Lebensende beobachtet bei Temperaturen von 15, 21, 26 und 31 C. Fr jedes Individuum wurde die Dauer des Erwachsenestadiums und die Anzahl der entwickelten Eier festgestellt. Bei 31 C lebt das Endstadium durchschnittlich 26 Tage und bei 14 C 74 Tage. Auch die Zeit bis zum ersten Gelege und die Intervalle dazwischen waren bei niedrigen Temperaturen lnger. Bei 21 C war die Eiproduktion optimal. Die Entwicklungszeit ging von 28 std. bei 31 C bis zu 13 Tagen bei 5 C. Auf die Lebensfhigkeit der Eier hatte die Temperatur keinen Einfluss.

20103964|Schellenberg's types of Lysianopsis subantarctica and Paralysianopsis odhneri are redescribed. Lysianopsis subantarctica is shown to be closely related to L. holmesi (J. L. Barnard). The genus Paralysianopsis is rediagnosed and placed in the family Lysianassidae sensu stricto.
20105938|The pea crab, Pinnotheres tsingtaoensis, symbiotic with the bivalve mollusk, Sanguinolaria acuta, was collected in the estuary of Bazhan Stream on the west coast of Taiwan from May, 1992 to November, 1993. More than 90% of the bivalves were infested and most infested specimens (90-97%) hosted one crab. Two cohorts, i.e., year classes, of the bivalves were observed in May, but only one was seen between July and November; the life span of the crab is less than 2 years at the site. Recruitment of both the bivalves and the crabs apparently occurred between November and May next year. Positive size correlation between hosts and symbionts was found in larger sized females, but was not consistent in smaller sized males. All females had a soft carapace whereas most males had a hard carapace; females were less likely to leave the hosts than males upon collection of the host bivalves. Females accompanied by males were more likely to carry eggs. Mating probably took place inside the hosts where female crabs remained stationary, with males visiting different bivalves and spending much time outside the bivalves. /// Le crabe Pinnotheres tsingtaoensis, symbiote avec le mollusque bivalve Sanguinolaria acuta, a t recueilli dans l'estuaire de la rivire Bazhan, sur la cte ouest de Taiwan, de mai 1992  novembre 1993. Plus de 90% des mollusques taient infests et la plupart des spcimens infests (90-97%) hbergeaient un crabe. Deux cohortes (classes d'ge) de bivalves ont t observes en mai, mais une seulement a t vue entre juillet et novembre. La dure de vie du crabe est infrieure  deux ans sur le site. Le recrutement,  la fois des bivalves et des crabes, se produit apparemment entre novembre et mai de l'anne suivante. Une corrlation positive entre htes et symbiontes a t trouve chez les femelles les plus grandes, mais n'tait pas concordante chez les mles les plus petits. La carapace tait molle chez toutes les femelles, alors qu'elle tait dure chez la plupart des mles; les femelles avaient moins tendance que les mles  quitter leurs htes au moment de la collecte de ceux-ci. Les femelles accompagnes de mles portaient plus souvent des oeufs. L'accouplement se produisait probablement  l'intrieur des htes o les femelles sjournaient, avec les mles visitant diffrents bivalves et passant beaucoup de temps en dehors de ceux-ci.
41038655|Caecidotea xochimilca n. sp. is described from specimens found in the roots of the water hyacinth in Lake Xochimilco, Mexico City. There are two other epigean Mexican species: Caecidotea xochimilca n. sp. differs from C. williamsi Escobar-Briones & Alcocer, 2002 by the shape of the palmar processes on male pereopod 1, and the aesthetasc formula and number of flagellar articles in antenna 2. Caecidotea puebla Cole & Minkley, 1968 differs from the new species by the body proportions, the number of flagellar articles in antenna 1 and antenna 2, the flagellum of antenna 1 reaching to the distal border of the peduncle of antenna 2 when reflected, a lateral sinuosity in the exopod of pleopod 2 of the female, the number of setae in pleopods 4 and 5, and uropodal characters. A key for the Mexican species of the genus is given. Caecidotea xochimilca n. sp. es descrita de especmenes encontrados en la raz de lirio acutico del Lago de Xochimilco, Ciudad de Mxico. Hay otras dos especies Mexicanas epigeas. Caecidotea xochimilca n. sp. difiere de C. williamsi Escobar-Briones & Alcocer, 2002 por tener diferente la forma del proceso palmar del perepodo 1 del macho, la formula de aestetascos y el nmero de artejos flagelares en la antena 2. Caecidotea puebla Cole & Minkley, 1968 difiere de la especie nueva por la proporcin del cuerpo, el nmero de artejos flagelares en la antena 1 y antena 2, el flagelo de la antena 1 cuando est extendido alcanza el borde distal del pednculo de la antena 2, la sinuosidad lateral en el expodo del plepodo 2 de la hembra, nmero de setas en los plepodos 4 y 5 y las caractersticas del urpodo. Se proporciona una clave para especies mexicanas del gnero.
20103922|Trapezia tigrina Eydoux & Souleyet, 1842, wurde nach Material aus Hawaii beschrieben. Die Art geriet in Vergessenheit und spteres Material von ihr wurde mit anderen Arten der Gattung identifiziert, hauptschich mit T. rufopunctata (Herbst, 1799) und T. maculata (Macleay, 1838). Serne (1970) beschrieb die Art als neu unter dem Namen T. wardi. Zu den genannten Irrtmern fhrten hauptschlich zwei Grunde: Die ungengende Originalbeschreibung der Art und die Verlegung des Typusexemplares von T. tigrina in die Schachtel des Typusexemplares von T. flavopunctata Eydoux & Souleyet und umgekehrt. Die Art wird hier neu beschrieben und die verschiedenen Synonyme diskutiert.
20107700|Nucleotide sequence analysis of the mitochondrial COI gene was performed to identify mid-to final stage phyllosoma larvae of spiny lobsters of the genus Panulirus caught in the south of the Ryukyu Archipelago (northwest Pacific). The identified larvae were subjected to morphological investigation. All 92 larvae caught in May 2003 were late to final stage phyllosomas of P. japonicus, while 174 larvae in November 2004 comprised four species of phyllosoma group 1 (P. femoristriga (n = 1), P. japonicus (4), P. longipes bispinosus (110), and P. l. longipes (7)), one of group 2 (P. penicillatus (43)), and two of group 4 (P. ornatus (8) and P. versicolor (1)). Photo images of representative phyllosoma larvae, substantiated by molecular identification, are presented. Morphological investigation indicated that the ratio between the widths of cephalon and thorax (CT ratio) of the P. japonicus phyllosomas was the smallest, and discrimination of P. japonicus larvae from the other species of the "P. japonicus group" may be possible using the CT ratio combined with the smaller body size. Intraspecific variation was observed in the arrangement of subexopodal spines of P. ornatus and P. versicolor phyllosomas, indicating this character is not diagnostic to separate these two species. /// L'analyse de la squence nuclotidique du gne mitochondrial COI a t ralise afin d'identifier les larves phyllosomes de langoustes du genre Panulirus, aux stades larvaires allant du milieu  la fin du dveloppement, collectes au sud de l'archipel des Ryukyu (Pacifique nord-occidental). Les larves identifies, ont t soumises  un examen morphologique. Les 92 larves collectes en mai 2003 taient des phyllosomes du dernier stade de P. japonicus, tandis que les 174 larves de novembre 2004 comprenaient quatre espces de phyllosomes de groupe 1 (P. femoristriga (n = 1), P. japonicus (4), P. longipes bispinosus (110) et P. l. longipes (7)), une du groupe 2 (P. penicillatus (43)) et deux du groupe 4 (P. ornatus (8) et P. versicolor (1)). Des images photo des larves phyllosomes reprsentatives, corrobores par l'identification molculaire, sont prsentes. L'analyse morphologique a montr que le rapport entre les largeurs du cephalon et du thorax (rapport CT) des phyllosomes de P. japonicus tait le plus bas, et la sparation des larves de P. japonicus des autres espces du "groupe P. japonicus" peut tre faite en utilisant le rapport CT combin avec la taille plus petite du corps. Une variation intraspcifique a t observe dans l'arrangement des pines subexopodiales des phyllosomes de P. ornatus et de P. versicolor, ce qui indique que ce caractre n'est pas diagnostique pour sparer ces deux espces.
20140988|La prsente note donne la description d une nouvelle espce du genre Heterosaccus, H dollfusi, parasite de Charybdis (Goniohellenus) hoplites (Wood Mason) du Golfe de Suez Les organes mles diffrent de ceux des autres espces du genre en aboutissant dans un sac commun, globuleux, na laissant pas apercevoir  l tat adulte sa double origine.
20106381|The population structure of the bopyrid isopod Probopyrus floridensis infesting the freshwater shrimp Macrobrachium potiuna from the Perequ River was monthly analysed from January 1996 to October 1996. The parasites, taken from preserved shrimps, were measured and sexed. A total of 645 isopod parasites was obtained from 197 shrimps. The following developmental stages and sexes were recognized within the parasite population: cryptoniscus, bopyridium, immature males, immature females, mature males, mature females, and ovigerous females. The parasitic density fluctuated between 1 (January and May) and 33 (June) parasites per host. The parasitic incidence varied from 1.1% (April) to 97.6% (September). Ovigerous females were observed only in October. The cryptoniscus infestation occurred mainly in June (early winter) and continued for three months. By July (winter), the majority of the parasite population was still composed of juvenile or immature parasites, but from August to October (spring), the adult stages predominated. Probopyrus floridensis reproduces only once a year. Its life cycle is discussed in more detail. /// La structure de la population de l'isopode bopyre Probopyrus floridensis infestant la crevette d'eau douce Macrobrachium potiuna de la rivire Perequ a t analyse chaque mois de janvier  octobre 1996. Les parasites, prlevs sur les crevettes fixes, ont t mesurs et leur sexe dtermin. Un total de 645 isopodes parasites ont t obtenus  partir de 197 crevettes. Les stades de dveloppement suivants et les sexes ont t identifis dans la population de parasites: cryptoniscien, bopyridium, mles immatures, femelles immatures, mles matures, femelles matures et femelles ovigres. La densit des parasites fluctuait entre 1 (janvier et mai) et 33 (juin) parasites par hte. L'incidence parasitaire variait de 1,1% (avril)  97,6% (septembre). Des femelles ovigres ont t observes seulement en octobre. L'infestation cryptoniscienne s'est produite principalement en juin (dbut de l'hiver) et s'est poursuivie pendant trois mois. En juillet (hiver), la majorit de la population de parasites tait encore compose de juvniles ou d'immatures, mais d'aot  octobre (printemps), les stades adultes prdominent. Probopyrus floridensis se reproduit seulement une fois dans l'anne. Son cycle de vie est discut plus en dtail.
20104869|The blood of Ocypode platytarsis contains a single fraction of tyrosine hydroxylase (E.C.1.14.16.2), which is capable of converting the monophenol into O-diphenol and 3 fractions of phenoloxidase (E.C.1.14.18.1), which convert O-diphenol into quinone. The phenoloxidases do not show any monophenoloxidase activity. The phenoloxidase fractions exist as proenzyme and can be activated by sodium dodecyl sulphate. Tyrosine hydroxylase may be involved in the synthesis of O-diphenol. The stored O-diphenol may be oxidised into melanin during immunological response, after the activation of prophenoloxidase. Thin layer chromatographic analysis reveals that there is an accumulation of dopa methyl ester in the reaction medium containing the enzyme sample, tyrosine methyl ester and phenylthiourea (PTU), a specific inhibitor of phenoloxidase. In the absence of PTU, the reaction medium becomes brown and there is no accumulation of O-diphenol. /// Le sang d'Ocypode platytarsis contient une fraction unique d'hydroxylase tyrosine (E.C.1.14.16.2), qui est capable de convertir le monophnol en O-diphnol et 3 fractions de phnoloxydase (E.C.1.14.18.1), lesquelles convertissent le O-diphnol en quinone. Les phnoloxydases ne manifestent aucune activit de monophnoloxydase. Les fractions phnoloxydase existent comme proenzyme et sont capables d'tre actives par le sulfate dodcylique de sodium. L'hydroxylase tyrosine peut tre implique dans la synthse du O-diphnol stock peut tre oxyd en mlanine au cours de la rponse immunologique, aprs activation de la prophnoloxydase. L'analyse chromatographique en couches minces rvle qu'il y a une accumulation de dopa mthyl ester dans le milieu de raction contenant l'chantillon d'enzyme, le mthyl ester tyrosine et le phnylthiourea (PTU), un inhibiteur spcifique de la phnoloxydase. En l'absence de PTU, le milieu de raction devient brun et il n'y a pas accumulation de O-diphnol.
27743237|The occurrence of two pairs of newly hatched conjoined twins is reported in an oviposition of a female-phase, intersex specimen of the burrowing parastacid Virilastacus rucapihuelensis, caught in the peatlands of Rucapihuel, southern Chile. These conjoined twins were found among 49 normal, stage 1 juveniles and constitute the third reported case of Siamese juveniles in freshwater astacids. Their external morphological traits are described, as well as the type and extent of their fusion; a morphological comparison is made between them and previous cases of conjoined twins in Astacoidea. The stage of embryonic development when they would have formed, and the probable causes of their origin, are also analysed. /// Se reporta el hallazgo de dos parejas de gemelos siameses, recientemente eclosionados, en una ovipostura de un espcimen intersexo en fase hembra del parastcido excavador. Virilastacus rucapihuelensis, capturado en los humedales de la localidad de Rucapihuel en el sur de Chile. Estos siameses se encontraron con otros 49 juveniles en estado 1 normales y constituyen el tercer caso reportado de juveniles siameses en astcidos de agua dulce. En ellos se describen sus rasgos morfolgicos externos, como as mismo el tipo y extensin de su fusin, se establece una comparacin morfolgica entre ellos y con aquellos casos previos de siameses en Astacoidea. Tambin se analiza el momento del desarrollo embrionario en que ellos se habran formado y las probables causas de su origen.
20101970|Ein neuer calanoide Copepode, Pontella karachiensis, wird beschrieben aus Kstengewssern von Karachi. Die Art hnelt sehr P. mimocerami Fleminger, 1957.
20104976|Since the late 19th century homarid lobsters have been cultured under hatchery conditions, and hatchery-reared Homarus americanus and H. gammarus have been released into the wild on many occasions in North America and Europe, respectively. The success of such re-stocking programmes could not be evaluated, however, due to lack of a suitable tagging method to discriminate between hatchery-reared lobsters and natural stock. This paper reviews the early attempts at re-stocking, and then describes in some detail more recent experiments that make use of coded microwire tags. The recent results show that hatchery-reared animals can survive to recruit to a fishery, but despite this initial success, there remain important biological questions on whether re-stocking programmes are likely to provide sustainable benefits to fisheries and whether released animals actually enhance or simply displace natural stocks. The success of future re-stocking programmes will be easier to evaluate if biological and economic objectives are more tightly defined at the planning stage. /// Depuis la fin du 19me sicle, les homards ont t levs en aquaculture. Des Homarus americanus et H. gammarus ainsi levs ont t relchs dans la nature  diverses reprises en Amrique du Nord et en Europe, respectivement. Cependant, le succs de tels programmes de repeuplement ne pouvait pas tre valu, faut d'une mthode de marquage satisfaisante permettant de distinguer les homards provenant d'un levage et ceux du stock naturel. Ce travail passe en revue les premires tentatives de repeuplement, puis dcrit en dtail les exprimentations plus rcentes utilisant des marques mtalliques codes. Les rsultats rcents montrent que les animaux d'levage sont capables de survivre jusqu' ce qu'ils soient pchs mais, malgr ce premier succs, des questions biologiques importantes restent poses,  savoir si les programmes de repeuplement sont susceptibles de fournir des bnfices suffisants aux pcheries et si les animaux relchs augmentent rellement ou simplement remplacent les stocks naturels. Le succs des futures programmes de repeuplement sera plus facile  valuer si les objectifs biologiques et conomiques sont plus strictement dfinis dans le plan d'action.
20107627|The morphology and the systematic affinities of a unique juvenile specimen (post embryonic stage 1) of the ostracode, Danielopolina (family Thaumatocyprididae) are described. It was found in an anchialine cave of Christmas Island, an isolated seamount, and this is the second record of a Danielopolina species in the Indian Ocean. A comparative study of this individual with those belonging to the other 11 Danielopolina species suggests closer morphological affinities to the Australian species, D. kornickeri. In addition, our study allows the separation of the species of Danielopolina into the two new subgenera, Danielopolina and Humphreysella. Tabular keys are provided for the identification of the species belonging to these subgenera. /// La morphologie et les affinits systmatiques d'un spcimen juvnile unique (1er stade post-embryonnaire) d'un ostracode appartenant au genre Danielopolina (famille des Thaumatocyprididae) sont dcrites. Cet ostracode a t trouv dans une grotte anchialine de l'le Christmas, un mont sous-marin isol, et c'est la seconde espce de Danielopolina rencontre dans l'ocan Indien. Une tude compare de cet exemplaire et des 11 espces du genre Danielopolina suggre des affinits morphologiques plus troites avec l'espce australienne D. kornickeri. De plus, notre tude a permis de sparer les espces de ce genre en deux sous-genres nouveaux, Danielopolina et Humphreysella. Des cls d'identification des espces de ces sous-genres sont prsentes.

Die Garnelen leben paarweise in selbstgeschaffenen Wohnhhlen, die dicht unter der Oberflche der Korallenstcke angelegt werden. Die Tiere knnen ihre Hhle nicht verlassen, die einzige Verbindung mit der Auenwelt besteht in Form von porenartigen ffnungen im Hhlendach. Die Lebensweise von A. schmitti wird mit derjenigen von A. saxidomus Holthuis verglichen. Dieser ostpazifische Alpheide ist die einzige Alpheidenart, von der bisher eine gesteinsbohrende Ttigkeit bekannt war. Beobachtungen an der westatlantischen Schwesterart von A. saxidomus, A. simus Gurin-Mneville, legen die Vermutung nahe, da auch diese Art Wohnhhlen in Korallenskeletten bohrt.
20107621|A new species of the genus Macrobrachium, M. thuylami, was discovered in the highlands of South Vietnam. 20107867|The effect of stocking density on the growth and survival of Astacus leptodactylus juveniles was evaluated. Newly hatched third instars of A. leptodactylus with an average total length of 11.4 mm (TL) and an average weight of 22.4 mg were stocked in 0.14 m tanks in a recirculation system at 50, 100, and 200 specimens/m and reared for 120 days at 22.8C. Crayfish growth was inversely correlated with density. The mean final weights for the crayfish were 1.26, 1.16, and 0.91 g for crayfish densities of 50, 100, and 200/m, respectively. Survival of the crayfish was also affected by stocking density; it decreased as initial stocking density increased. The proportion of lost chelipeds was also found to be dependent on the stocking density and increased with increasing stocking density. The differences in the proportion of crayfish with cheliped injuries among animals stocked at 50/m, 100/m, and 200/m were found to be 7.1%, 16%, and 29%, respectively. The yield was directly related to density (P &lt 0,05, R = 0.95). No evidence was found for feed conversion ratio (FCR) being affected by density. Astacus leptodactylus had a normal length distribution of 11-12 mm at the beginning of the experiment. However, at the end of the experiment, the length distribution varied among animals in the three density treatments. At the densities of 100/m and 200/m, animals had a final length range of 16-40 mm TL, showing a distinct peak at 21-25 mm TL; however, at the density of 50/m, the animals had a final length range of 16-41 mm TL with a distinct peak at 26-30 mm TL. In addition, the implications of the above findings for optimal intensive culture conditions for juvenile Astacus leptodactylus are discussed. /// L'effet de la densit de stockage sur la croissance et la survie des juvniles d'Astacus leptodactylus a t valu. Des troisimes stades nouvellement clos d'A. leptodactylus d'une longueur totale moyenne de 11,4 mm (TL) et d'un poids moyen de 22,4 mg ont t stocks dans des bacs de 0,14 m pourvus d'un systme de recirculation,  des densits de 50, 100 et 200 spcimens/m et levs pendant 120 jours  22,8C. La croissance des crevisses tait inversement corrle  la densit. Les poids moyens finaux des crevisses taient de 1,26, 1,16 et 0,91 g  des densits de 50, 100 et 200/m, respectivement. La survie tait galement affecte par la densit de stockage; elle diminuait avec l'augmentation de la densit initiale de stockage. La proportion de chlipdes perdus dpendait galement de la densit de stockage et augmentait en mme temps que la densit de stockage. La diffrence dans la proportion d'crevisses ayant des blessures aux chlipdes par rapport aux animaux stocks  50/m, 100/m et 200/m tait de 7,1%, 16% et 29%, respectivement. Le rendement tait en relation directe avec la densit (P &lt 0,05, R = 0,95). Il n'a pas t mis en vidence que le rapport de conversion de la nourriture (FCR) soit affect par la densit. Au dbut de l'exprimentation, Astacus leptodactylus prsentait une distribution de longueur normale de 11-12 mm. Cependant,  la fin de l'exprimentation, la distribution de longueur variait dans les trois densits testes. Aux densits de 100/m et 200/m, les animaux avaient,  la fin de l'exprimentation, une longueur de 16-40 mm TL, avec un pic net  21-25 mm TL; mais,  la densit de 50/m, leur longueur finale tait de 16-41 mm TL, avec un pic net  26-30 mm TL. Les implications de ces rsultats pour dterminer les conditions optimales de culture intensive des juvniles d'Astacus leptodactylus sont discutes.

20102426|Das Verhltnis der Geschlechter verndert sich bei Copepoda mit zunehmender Wassertiefe zu Gunsten des weiblichen Geschlechtes. Bei knappen Futterverhltnissen erhht diese Erscheinung die Fruchtbarkeit der Art.
20103338|A new calanoid copepod, Archidiaptomus aroorus n. g., n. sp., is being described from India. Though placed in the family Pseudodiaptomidae, the new genus shares many features with the family Diaptomidae. The remarkable intermediate position of Archidiaptomus between these two families is being discussed in morphological as well as in historical sense.
27743209|A new species of the genus Allocyclopina KIefer, 1954 (Copepoda, Cyclopoida) is described from the brackish hyporheic zone of the River Godavari at Kotipalli, a small coastal village near Ramachandrapuram town in the East Godavari District of Andhra Pradesh State, India. This littleknown genus, belonging to the large family Cyclopinidae, was hitherto represented by only three interstitial species: A. madagassica Kiefer, 1954, from Madagascar, A. ambigua Kiefer, 1960, from Reunion Island, and A. australiensis Karanovic, 2008, from South Australia. Allocyclopina inopinata new species, is the fourth representative of the genus and the first Asian representative of the genus. The specimens of A. inopinata n. sp., show a unique combination of both plesiomorphic and apomorphic character states in the female: first pedigerous somite free; antennule ten-segmented; antenna with an exopodal seta and a single inner seta on coxobasis; mandibular bais with one inner seta; maxillulary endopodite with seven setae, without coxal endite; legs 14 three-segmented, with last exopodite spine formula 3.4.4.3; second endopodal segment of leg 1 with a single seta, in both sexes; intercoxal plate of leg 5 reduced; leg 6 with two elements; genital double-somite showing two lateral copulatory pores, corresponding to two seminal receptacles, near its anterior margin; furcal rami with six setae each. The generic deagnosis of Allocyclopina is emended, and some morphological affinities with other genera in the family "Cyclopinidae" sensu lato are discussed. The states of A. australiensis is briefly discussed. /// Une nouvelle espce du genre Allocyclopina Kiefer, 1954 (Copepoda, Cyclopoida) est dcrite du milieu hyporhique saumtre du fleuve Godavari  Kotipalli, un petit village ctier prs de Ramachandrapuram dans le district de Godavari Est, Etat de l'Andhra Pradesh, Inde. Ce genre peu connu, appartenant  la grande famille des Cyclopinidae tait reprsent jusqu' prsent par seulement trois espces interstitielles: A. madagassica Kiefer, 1954, de Madagascar, A. ambigua Kiefer, 1960, de l'le de la Runion, et A. australiensis, d'Australie du sud. Allocyclopina inopinata n. sp. est la troisime espce du genre et la premire dcouverte en Asie. ALes spcimens de A. inopinata n. sp. prsentent une combinaison unique d'tats de caractres plsiomorphes et apomorphes chez la femelle: premier somite thoracique libre; antennule  10 segments; coxobasis de l'antenne avec une soie exopodale et une seule soie interne; basis de la mandibule avec une soie interne; endopodite de la maxillule portant sept soies, sans endite coxale; rames de P1-P4  trois segments et  formule des pines du troisime segment de l'endopodite 3.4.4.3; second segment de l'endopodite de P1 avec une seule soie (dans les deux sexes); plaque intercoxale de P5 trs rduite; P6 comprenent deux lments; double somite gnital avec, dans sa partie antrieure ventrale, deux pores copulateurs correspondant deux rceptacles sminaux; branches furcales portant six soies. La diagnose du genre Allocyclopina est mende et certaines affinits morphologiques avec d'autres genres de la famille des "Cyclopinidae" sensu lato sont discutes. Le statut de A. australiensis est brivement discut.
20105990|Inventories of Crustacea and more generally aquatic invertebrates in the Camargue (Rhne Delta) have mainly involved Copepoda, Ostracoda, and Cladocera. Data on Decapoda have most often been collected in general faunal surveys and remain fragmentary, and this group has not been the subject of any special study. Over the period 1988-96, eleven species of Decapoda were recorded from fresh and brackish water in the eastern part of the Camargue. For two of these: Penaeus kerathurus (Forskl, 1775) and Palaemonetes varians (Leach, 1814) this study is the first published record for the region. The temporal trends and the habitat distribution of the various species, together with factors influencing this distribution, the migrations within the Camargue hydrosystem, and the arrival of introduced species are discussed. /// Les inventaires de crustacs et plus gnralement d'invertbrs aquatiques en Camargue (Rhne) ont concern principalement les coppodes, ostracodes et cladocres. Les donnes sur les dcapodes, le plus souvent recueillies dans des faunes gnrales restent fragmentaires et ce groupe n'a pas fait l'objet d'tude spcifique. Sur la priode 1988-96, nous avons recens onze espces de dcapodes dans les eaux douces et saumtres dans la partie est de la Camargue. Pour certaines d'entre elles: Penaeus kerathurus (Forskl, 1775) et Palaemonetes varians (Leach, 1814) cette tude constitue la premire mention pour la rgion, dans la littrature. En conclusion sont discuts l'volution temporelle de la rpartition des espces par milieu, les facteurs influenant cette distribution, les migrations dans l'hydrosystme camarguais et l'arrive d'espces introduites.
20103376|The isopod Hemilepistus reaumurii is the most important herbivore in many desert areas in the Middle East. During the winter low temperatures prevent its above-ground activity. In this study it was found that at a temperature of 10 C inside the burrow, survival of Hemilepistus reaumurii without food was the longest. Above and below this temperature survival was considerably lower. Enough H. reaumurii individuals survived to account for the establishment of the breeding population in the following spring. Survival was independent of initial weight.
20102226|The M/T curves of G. pulex and G. fossarum demonstrate the existence of specific physiological differences between these two species. The respiratory metabolism of G. pulex is largely influenced by certain factors studied, i.e. temperature, stream velocity and substrate. This species seems to be adapted to variable biotopes, especially at temperatures above 15 C. At these temperatures it disposes of greater energetic reserves than does G. fossarum. The respiratory metabolism of G. fossarum shows a certain stability. It is not influenced by stream velocity and is only slightly influenced by temperature and substrate. This species seems to be adapted to specialized biotopes with running water and low temperatures, in which it has a competitive advantage over G. pulex. These physiological characters appear to be correlated with the ecological and geographical distribution of both species.
20101821|Schwierigkeiten bei der Art-Bestimmung von Tisbe werden errtert. Zahlreiche Beobachtungen haben gezeigt, dass die intraspezifische Variabilitt bei Tisbe weit geringer ist, als von den frheren Autoren gemeinhin angenommen wurde, und dass Geschwisterarten (sibling species) und sogar Gruppen hnlicher Arten in dieser Gattung hufig zu sein scheinen, was die Systematik der Tisbe sehr erschwert. Kreuzungsversuche sind oft das einzig sichere Kriterium bei der Bestimmung. Es wird ferner klargestellt, dass die Art T. helgolandica Uhlig & Noodt von Helgoland keine Berechtigung hat und identisch ist mit T. holothuriae Humes, ebenso wie die Populationen von Chioggia, Gargano und Plymouth, die von den Autoren Battaglia, Corkett, Lazzaretto und Parise irrtmlicherweise der Art T. furcata zugeschrieben wurden.

Ses affinits avec les autres espces du genre sont dcrites, et la position systmatique du genre Typton, que nous redfinissons, est aussi discute.

27743301|A new species of the genus Habrobathynella Schminke, 1973 is described from India as Habrobathynella plenituda sp. n. Including this new species, six species are now known in the genus, two from Madacascar and four from India. There appear to be only slight morphological differences between the Indian and the Madagascan species, despite the long isolation of both landmasses since their separation on their drift north. The new species occur together in the sample with Habrobathynella schminkel Ranga Reddy, 2004. The possibility for the co-occurence of two congeneric species in this case may be their difference in body size, H. schminkei reaching only 55% of the size of H. plenituda sp. n. This difference in size is supposed to facilitate coexistence in mixed substrata, with different sizes of the interstitial spaces. /// Eine neue Art der Gattung Habrobathynella, H. plenituda sp. n. wird aus Indien beschrieben. Zusammen mit ihr sind jetzt 6 Arten den Gattung bekannt, zwei von Madagaskar und vier aus Indien. Trotz der langen Isolation beider Landmassen seit ihrer Trennung auf dem Weg nach Norden sind die morphologischen Unterschiede zwischen den indischen und madegassischen Arten nur geringfgig. Die neue Art kommt zusammen mit Habrobathynella schminkei Ranga Reddy, 2004 vor. Die Koexistenz zweier Arten derselben Gattung drfte in diesem Fall mit der Krpergre zusammenhngen, da H. schminkei nur 55% der Krpergre von H. plenituda sp. n. erreicht. Diese Unterschiede knnten die Koexistenz in Mischsubstraten mit unterschiedlich groen Interstitialrumen erlauben.

20102543|L'auteur rcapitule l'histoire des espces europennes appartenant au genre Chthamalus et montre que le C. stellatus var. depressus dcrit par Darwin est identique au C. depressus (Poli). La distribution gographique connue de la forme depressus comprend la plupart des ctes septentrionales de la Mditerrane et de la Mer Noire, o on la rencontre d'ordinaire dans la zone supralittorale, au dessus de la forme stellatus. Les C. stellatus var. depressus Darwin signals d'Afrique occidentale appartiennent en ralit  une autre espce. En raison de diffrences dans leur comportement, leur reproduction et leur morphologie, il apparat qu'il existe deux espces valides en Europe. L'une, C. stellatus (Poli), a une large distribution, mais ses caractres varient peu d'une extrmit  l'autre de son aire de dispersion. La seconde, C. depressus (Poli), n'est connue avec certitude que de la rgion mditerranenne; c'est peut-tre une espce qui a volu sous l'influence des conditions locales, sur des ctes sans mare,  moins qu'elle ne reprsente l'avant-poste d'une espce non reconnue, dont la distribution serait tropicale.
20105727|The calanoid copepod, Boeckella poopoensis Marsh, 1906 inhabits shallow saline ponds located in the Andes mountains in Argentina, Bolivia, Chile, and Peru, as well as in the plains of southern Argentina. The species is halophilic and can tolerate salinity levels of 1 to 90 ppt. This paper describes the relative abundance of the species in shallow mountain ponds in northern Chile from 23 to 27S. A direct correlation was observed between salinity and the relative abundance of B. poopoensis (r = 0.4139), and between 45 and 90 ppt S the species was found to be dominant in zooplankton assemblages. Crustacean species richness at the sites studied showed a significant, inverse trend with salinity (r = 0.7329), and this trend became even stronger (r = 0.7681) when data previously published for the Bolivian Andean plateau were included. Ecological and biogeographical issues related with these results are discussed. /// El coppodo calanoideo Boeckella poopoensis Marsh, 1906 vive en lagunas salinas poco profundas localizadas en el altiplano Andino de Argentina, Bolivia, Chile y Per, y en el sur de Argentina. Esta especie es marcadamente haloflica, y tolera salinidades entre 1 y 90 g/l, estos hbitats tienen una pobre riqueza especfica de crustceos zooplanctnicos. Este estudio describe la abundancia relativa de esta especie en lagunas poco profundas de montaa en el norte de Chile, entre los 23 y 27 grados sur de latitud. Se observ una relacin directa notoria entre la salinidad y la abundancia relativa de B. poopoensis (r = 0.4139), encontrndose prcticamente esta especie como habitante exclusivo a salinidades superiores entre 45 g/l y 90 g/l, lo que coincide con las descripciones de la literatura. La riqueza especfica de especies de crustceos present una relacin inversa notoria con la salinidad en los sitios estudiados (r = 0.7329), lo cual fue ms robusto al incorporar informacin publicada para el Altiplano de Bolivia (r = 0.7681). En este estudio se discutieron implicancias ecolgicas y biogeogrficas relacionadas con los resultados observados.
