20106283|Abbreviated larval development is a characteristic of several species of palaemonid shrimps. There are at least 29 species of freshwater palaemonids in South America with such development, but none has been described from Mexico. In the present work, the partially abbreviated larval development of a freshwater prawn from Perla de Acapulco, Chiapas, Mexico, located at about 250 km from the coast, is described and illustrated in detail. The larvae pass through three zoeal stages before becoming postlarvae. Each females carries an average of 25 large eggs, which vary in size from 2.0 to 2.8 mm . The larval development is compared with that of some related South American species that are known to possess abbreviated larval life. /// Algunas especies de langostinos presentan un desarrollo larval abreviado. En America del Sur existen alrededor de 29 especies de langostinos de agua dulce que presentan un desarrollo larval abreviado o semiabreviado. En el presente trabajo se describe el desarrollo semiabreviado de una posible nueva especie de langostino originaria de la comunidad de Perla de Acapulco, Chiapas, Mxico, localizada a 250 km lejos de la costa. Las larvas pasan a traves de tres estados larvarios antes de convertirse en postlarvas. Las hembras tienen en promedio 25 huevos con un tamao que va de 2.0 a 2.8 mm . El desarrollo larval es comparado con el de otras especies sudamericanas que presentan un desarrollo larval abreviado.

20102953|Whrend des Studium der externen (Universitt zu Liverpool) und der internen (Freie Universitt, Amsterdam) Faktoren, welche auf die Zwischenhutungsperiode von Palaemonetes varians (Leach) einwirken, wurden die Fortpflanzungseigenschaften dieser Art nher untersucht, beschrieben und verglichen mit denen von Palaemon elegans Rathke (cf. Hglund, 1943, als Leander squilla), die einzige andere Garnele, die in dieser Hinsicht ausfhrlich untersucht wurde. Die Resultate dieses Vergleiches zeigen deutlich, da das Brutkleid von Palaemonetes varians dem von Palaemon elegans in hohem Mae hnlich ist mit Ausnahme der folgenden Unterschiede: 1, zustzliche Setae an der Innenseite der abdominalen Epimera von Plaemonetes varians; 2, whrend der Brutperiode erhlt Palaemonetes varians ein zustzliches Chromatophorenmuster; 3, die Vergrerung der Abdominalpleuriten erweist sich als permanentes sekundres weibliches Geschlechtsmerkmal von Palaemonetes varians und unterliegt nicht wie bei Palaemon elegans einer periodischen Vergrerung whrend der Brutperiode. Ferner ergab sich aus den individuellen Hutungsprotokollen einer Anzahl Palaemonetes varians whrend der Fortpflanzungszeit, da die Brutzwischenhutungsperiode reichlich zweimal so lang ist wie die normale Zwischenhutungsperiode. 27743384|Relative growth can be understood as a morphometric relationship of body parts with the body as a whole, described by a mathematic equation. This study provides information on the patterns of relative growth of Mithrax tortugae from Vitria Island, southeastern Brazilian coast (234404S 450135W). Crabs were obtained from monthly collections by hand during SCUBA diving, between January 2004 and February 2007. A total of 168 crabs was obtained, 64 males and 104 females. Regression analysis was performed among carapace width (CW), as the independent variable, and carapace length (CL), abdomen width (AW), height high and length of the propodus (PH and PL), and gonopod length (GL) as dependent variables, using the power function y = axb. Young males showed positive allometry with regard to gonopod growth. Abdomen growth of juvenile females was also positively allometric. The growth patterns recorded for M. tortugae are associated with the species reproductive strategy, i.e., preparation of body parts involved in gamete transfer and egg clutch storage, like the male gonopods and the female abdomen. According to the results obtained, morphological maturity is attained at 12.95 mm CW for males and at 22.40 mm CW for females. The general patterns shown by M. tortugae are similar to the model adopted for Brachyura in general. /// Crescimento relativo pode ser entendido como a anlise das relaes entre dimenses de partes do corpo em funo do corpo como um todo, descrita por uma equao matemtica. Este estudo fornece informaes sobre os padres de crescimento relativo do Mithrax tortugae, de uma populao da Ilha da Vitria, sudeste do litoral brasileiro (234404S 450135W). Os caranguejos foram obtidos manualmente, a partir de coletas mensais, por meio de mergulho autnomo, entre janeiro de 2004 e fevereiro de 2007. Um total de 168 caranguejos foi obtido, 64 machos e 104 fmeas. Foram executadas regresses entre a largura da carapaa (LC), varivel independente e o comprimento da carapaa (CC), largura do abdmen (LA) e altura e comprimento do prpodo quelar (APQ e CPQ), como variveis dependentes, aplicando a funo potncia y = axb. Os machos jovens apresentaram alometria positiva para o crescimento do gonopdio. Enquanto que para nas fmeas jovens foi registrado um padro alomtrico positivo para o crescimento do abdmen. Os padres de crescimento registrados para M. tortugae esto associados com a estratgia reprodutiva da espcie, ou seja, a preparao das partes do corpo envolvidas com a transferncia de gametas e a incubao dos ovos, como os gonopdios para os machos e o abdmen para as fmeas. De acordo com os resultados obtidos, a maturidade morfolgica  atingida em 12,95 mm LC para os machos e em 22,40 mm LC para as fmeas. Os padres gerais demonstrados por M. tortugae seguem o modelo geral descrito para os Brachyura.

20105120|Oxygen consumption (O mg/g/h) of Penaeus chinensis (Osbeck, 1765) juveniles (0.078  0.011 g) appeared to increase with increase of salinity over the range of 15, 20, 25 and 30 ppt, while ammonia-N excretion (mg/g/h) displayed an inverse relationship with salinity. Both oxygen consumption and ammonia-N excretion of prawns in 25 and 30 ppt was relatively stable. However, prawns at low salinity (15 and 20 ppt) consumed less oxygen and excreted more ammonia-N. It is suggested that catabolism of amino acid is required to reduce the internal osmolality of prawns which utilize amino acid as fuel to provide the necessary energy for hypo-regulation of P. chinensis. /// La consommation d'oxygne (O mg/g/h) de juvniles de Penaeus chinensis (Osbeck, 1765) (0.078  0,011 g) apparat comme croissant en mme temps que la salinit, dans l'chelonnement de 15, 20, 25 et 30 ppt, tandis que l'excrtion ammoniac-N (mg/g/h) montre une relation inverse avec la salinit. La consommation d'oxygne et l'excrtion ammoniac-N des crevettes  25 et 30 ppt taient l'une et l'autre relativement stables. Cependant,  basse salinit (15 et 20 ppt), les crevettes consommaient moins d'oxygne et excrtaient plus d'ammoniac-N. Il est suggr que le catabolisme des aminoacides est ncessaire pour rduire l'osmolalit interne des crevettes utilisant les aminoacides comme combustibles pour fournir l'nergie ncessite par l'hyporgulation, comme le fait P. chinensis.
20105675|Bilistra gen. nov., B. millari n. sp., type species, B. mollicopulans n. sp. and B. cavernicola n. sp. are described from karst areas in the northwest of South Island, New Zealand. 27822636|Males with female genital apertures (fga) have been collected in wild populations of woodlice harbouring Wolbachia bacteria. Sexual traits of these functional males indicated they underwent a postponed sexual differentiation. Previously considered as females masculinized by an autosomal, masculinizing M gene (Rigaud & Juchault, 1993), we demonstrated for the first time that, in fact, three large DNA insertions of Wolbachia origin were integrated in their genome and consequently impaired the expression of genes responsible for male differentiation. The seventeen genes (more than 15.8 kb) inserted, induced genomic diversity and we noted that identified transposase coding genes had totally disappeared from these insertions. We discuss the putative roles of these unprecedented insertions in woodlice and make the inference that some woodlouse phenotypes are organisms that have been genetically modified in nature, and by natural causes. Des mles avec des ouvertures gnitales femelles (fga) ont t rcolts dans des populations sauvages de cloportes hbergeant la bactrie Wolbachia. Les caractres sexuels de ces mles fonctionnels indiquent qu'ils ont subi un retard dans la diffrenciation de ces caractres. Considrs au dpart comme des femelles masculinises par un gne M autosomal (Rigaud & Juchault, 1993), nous avons dmontr pour la premire fois que, en fait, trois grandes insertions d'ADN originaires de Wolbachia ont intgr leur gnome et ont perturb les gnes responsables de la diffrenciation mle. Les dix sept gnes insrs (plus que 15,8 kb) induisent une diversit gnomique et nous avons not que la transposase identifie comme codant ces gnes a compltement disparu de ces insertions. Nous discutons les rles putatifs de ces insertions non dcrites auparavant chez les cloportes et dduisons que beaucoup de phnotypes de cloportes sont des organismes gntiquement modifis dans la nature par des causes naturelles.
20102093|Fnf Isopodenarten der Familie Bopyridae vom sdlichen Afrika werden beschrieben. Sie wurden in den Kiemenkammern von Dekapoden gefunden. Die beschriebene Arten schliessen zwei neue Gattungen und drei neue Arten ein.
23065205|Autotomy of limbs has been observed for a variety of organisms and in some taxa has been shown to be an effective strategy for escaping predation. We investigated differences in the use of cheliped autotomy by small and large male fiddler crabs during predation events, and also assessed if autotomy of the major cheliped allowed male fiddler crabs to escape predation more often than females. The blue crab Callinectes sapidus was presented with 5 small and 5 large male mud fiddler crabs Uca pugnax (n = 60), and in a second experiment, 5 male and 5 female U. pugnax were presented to C. sapidus (n = 60). Large U. pugnax autotomized their major cheliped more often and survived compared to small U. pugnax (n = 22 pools, S = 96.5, p < 0.0001), although this difference was not significant when adjusted for the total number of attacks on each size (n = 22 pools, S = 45, p = 0.1467). There was no significant difference (n = 29 pools, S = 30.5, p = 0.4988) between the total number of unsuccessful attacks on male versus female U. pugnax. At least half of the males autotomized their major cheliped in unsuccessful attacks during the first (69%) and second (53%) experiments. The major cheliped of male U. pugnax is a prominent visual stimulus that may have initially attracted C. sapidus to this prey; however, autotomization potentially enabled male fiddler crabs to escape predation in over half of all unsuccessful attacks. L'autotomie des pattes a t observe pour divers organismes et dans certains taxa a t montr comme tant une stratgie effective pour chapper aux prdateurs. Nous avons recherch les diffrences dans l'utilisation de l'autotomie par des crabes violonistes petits et grands au cours d'un vnement de prdation, et aussi valu si l'autotomie du chlipde principal permet aux mles des crabes violonistes d'chapper  la prdation plus souvent que les femelles. Le crabe bleu Callinectes sapidus a t mis en prsence de 5 petits et 5 grands mles du crabe violoniste Uca pugnax (n = 60), et dans une deuxime exprience, 5 mles et 5 femelles ont t prsents  C. sapidus (n = 60). Les grands U. pugnax autotomisent leur principal chlipde plus souvent que les petits U. pugnax (n = 22, S = 96,5, p < 0,0001) et survivent, bien que cette diffrence ne soit pas significative si elle est ajuste au nombre total d'attaques pour chaque taille (n = 22, S = 45, p = 0,1467). Il n'y a eu aucune diffrence significative (n = 29, S = 30,5, p = 0,4988) entre le nombre d'attaques infructueuses sur les U. pugnax mles versus femelles. Au moins la moiti des mles autotomisent leur chlipde principal dans des attaques infructueuses au cours des premires (69%) et secondes (53%) expriences. Le chlipde principal du mle U. pugnax est un stimulus visuel marquant qui a pu attirer initialement C. sapidus vers sa proie; cependant l'autotomie potentielle permet aux mles du crabe violoniste d'chapper  la prdation dans plus de la moiti des attaques infructueuses.
20105209|The swimming behaviour of the larvae and postlarvae of Metapenaeus ensis was studied using a videotape analysis technique. Nauplii alternate between periods of rapid swimming and rest. Protozoeae swim continuously in a smooth and rather slow gliding motion. The swimming behaviour of mysis I and II consists of smooth gliding movement broken periodically by jumps and spiral rolls. Mysis III tends to swim for a short period and then sinks passively through the water column. Sinking behaviour persists as the young shrimp begins to spend more time near the bottom and becomes a bottom dweller after 4 or 5 days of postlarval development. The ability to swim in a backward direction was first observed in mysis III. Ventral flexion of the abdomen is used to provide backward darts in postlarvae. Larvae and postlarvae of M. ensis have the ability to modify their swimming behaviour in response to changes in food conditions. Swimming speed of mysis III and postlarvae was lower in animals fed with algae than in animals fed with both algae and Artemia nauplii. Most developmental stages exhibited faster swimming when starved. /// Le comportement de nage des larves et postlarves de Metapenaeus ensis a t tudi en utilisant une technique d'analyse par enregistrement video. Les nauplii alternent les priodes de nage rapide et de repos. Les protozos nagent de faon continue dans un mouvement de glissement rgulier et assez lent. Le comportement natatoire des mysis I et II consiste en un glissement rgulier interrompu priodiquement par des sauts et des enroulements en spirale. Les mysis III ont tendance  nager pendant une courte priode, puis se laissent couler passivement dans la colonne d'eau. Ce dernier comportement persiste quand la jeune crevette commence  passer davantage de temps au voisinage du fond et devient un habitant de ce fond aprs 4 ou 5 jours de dveloppement postlarvaire. La capacit de nager vers l'arrire a t d'abord observe chez les mysis III. La flexion ventrale de l'abdomen est utilise pour fournir un lan vers l'arrire chez les postlarves. Larves et postlarves de M. ensis ont la capacit de modifier leur comportement natatoire en rponse  un changement alimentaire. La vitesse de nage des mysis III et des postlarves tait plus lente chez les animaux nourris d'algues que chez ceux nourris  la fois d'algues et de nauplii d'Artemia. La plupart des stades de dveloppement ont manifest une nage plus rapide quand ils taient privs de nourriture.
20102354|Les Caridea identifis par Boone (1930: 135, pl. 46) comme Systellaspis debilis (A. Milne Edwards) n'appartiennent pas  cette espce et mme pas  la famille des Oplophoridae, mais constituent une nouvelle espce de Merhippolyte (fam. Hippolytidae), dont la description est donne ici. Les deux spcimens dcrits et figurs par Boone avaient t recueillis  7 milles devant Alligator Reef, Floride,  une profondeur de 150 brasses. Le Musum National des tats Unis possde quatre spcimens de cette espce pris par l' "Albatross" devant la cte atlantique de la Caroline du Nord et dans la dtroit de Yucatan,  107 et 130 brasses de profondeur. C'est la premire fois que le genre Merhippolyte est signal des eaux amricaines. La nouvelle espce se distingue des autres espces du genre par le nombre des preiopodes qui portent un pipode, par le nombre des dents dorsales du rostre et par la forme de l'angle ptrygostomien de la carapace.
20102702|The author describes the morphological alterations in Porcellio scaber Latr. and Oniscus asellus L. before and during the molting. The alterations are most marked in the first four thoracic segments and in the cuticle. Histological examinations showed that the new epicuticula is formed over the whole body during the preparation for the molting (proecdysis stages D-D). The exocuticula, on the other hand, is formed in the corresponding half of the body some time before the respective molting phase (proecdysis D-D and stage E, or stages D-D and stage E, respectively). The author tries to explain the complicated redistribution of calcium during the molting by the application of histological methods. Gland cells of a new kind, called "double cells", are described and their secretory cycle is correlated with the stages in the intermoult cycle.

Les sites de capture au Koweit consistent en eaux peu profondes (moins de 5 m),  haute salinit (36-44), sur des substrats meubles vaseux ou argileux. En Iraq, les salinits aux sites de capture taient soit de 34, soit infrieures  1. La plupart des spcimens ont t capturs de novembre  mai. 93% des 209 spcimens iraquiens taient soit des mles, soit des femelles non ovigres; au contraire, 51,6% des 60 spcimens du Koweit taient des femelles ovigres, ceci indiquant que les premiers stades du dveloppement ncessitent de hautes salinits. La biologie d'E. styliferus dans le nord du golfe Arabe parat similaire  celle des populations de la cte orientale de l'Inde et de la cte du Bangladesh.
20107564|Lynceus brachyurus (Branchiopoda, Laevicaudata, Lynceidae) has been found in France for the first time. This species lives in various types of temporary ponds that depend on the ground water level. We provide some ecological, biogeographical, and morphological information about Lynceus brachyurus and indicate the occurrence of remarkable sympatric organisms, such as the endemic fairy shrimp Chirocephalus spinicaudatus (Branchiopoda, Anostraca). Those species confined to a restricted area are considered as seriously threatened because of the severe degradation of their biotope. /// Lynceus brachyurus (Branchiopoda, Laevicaudata, Lynceidae) a t signal pour la premire fois en France. Cette espce est prsente dans diffrentes mares temporaires dpendant du niveau d'eau souterrain. Ces espces restreintes  une zone limite sont srieusement menaces en raison d'une rapide dgradation du biotope.

20106378|RAPD was used for analysing three (sub-)species of mitten crabs (Eriocheir sinensis, E. japonicus, and E. japonicus hepuensis) and three populations of E. sinensis. The results show that their relationships on DNA level are similar to the classical taxonomic hypotheses (Dai, 1991). No diagnostic RAPD marker could be found, but there were statistically significant genetic differences among these taxa (P &lt 0.001) or populations (P &lt 0.001). That is, the intraspecific similarities were larger than the interspecific similarities; the intrasubspecific similarities were larger than the intraspecific similarities; and the intrapopulational similarities were larger than the interpopulational similarities. In AFLP analysis, no significant genetic difference has been found between E. sinensis and E. japonicus, but AFLP markers among four species of Macrobrachium (M. rosenbergii, M. nipponense, M. hainanense, and M. asperulum) were found. The DNA similarities among these four species of Macrobrachium are in accordance with morphological similarities. /// RAPD a t utilis pour analyser trois (sous-)espces de crabes du genre Eriocheir (E. sinensis, E. japonicus et E. japonicus hepuensis) et trois populations de E. sinensis. Les rsultats montrent que leurs relations au niveau du DNA correspondent aux hypothses taxonomiques classiques (Dai, 1991). Aucun marqueur diagnostique RAPD n'a pu tre trouv, mais il y avait des diffrences gntiques statistiquement significatives parmi les taxons (P &lt 0,001) ou les populations (P &lt 0,001). Ainsi, les similarits intraspcifiques taient plus grandes que les similarits interspcifiques; les similarits intrasubspcifiques taient plus grandes que les similarits intersubspcifiques et les similarits intrapopulations taient plus grandes que les similarits interpopulations. Dans l'analyse AFLP, aucune diffrence gnetique significative n'a t trouve entre E. sinensis et E. japonicus, mais des marqueurs AFLP sur quatre espces de Macrobrachium (M. rosenbergii, M. nipponense, M. hainanense, et M. asperulum) ont t trouvs. Les similarits du DNA entre les quatre espces de Macrobrachium sont en accord avec les similarits morphologiques.

20107500|The diet composition of adult and juvenile individuals of the penaeid shrimp, Melicertus kerathurus was determined, based on the analysis of 145 and 48 specimens, respectively, collected off and inside Pinios estuary (N.W. Aegean Sea). The adult individuals displayed a diversified diet, mainly based on Mollusca, Crustacea, and Polychaeta. The diet of the juvenile individuals is also diverse, with Crustacea being the most dominant prey category. Feeding activity of the juvenile M. kerathurus, which are also active predators, seems to be higher than that of the adults. Multidimensional analyses demonstrated that the diets of the juvenile and adult individuals were significantly different. This should probably be attributed to corresponding differences in the composition of the benthic assemblages of the open sea (adult individuals) and inside Pinios estuary (juveniles), as well as to developmental differences between the adults and the juveniles that affect their feeding behaviour. /// Le rgime alimentaire des adultes et des juvniles de la crevette pnide Melicertus kerathurus a t tabli  partir de 145 et 48 spcimens provenant, respectivement, du large et de l'intrieur de l'estuaire de Pinios (partie nord-ouest de la mer Ege). Les adultes ont montr un rgime alimentaire diversifi, contenant principalement des mollusques, des crustacs et des polychtes. Le rgime alimentaire des juvniles est galement diversifi, les crustacs tant la catgorie dominante de proies. L'activit de nutrition des juvniles de M. kerathurus, qui sont aussi des prdateurs actifs, semble tre plus leve que celle des adultes. Des analyses multidimensionnelles ont dmontr que les rgimes alimentaires des individus juvniles et adultes diffraient significativement. Elles pourraient tre attribues  des diffrences correspondantes dans la composition des assemblages benthiques de pleine mer (adultes) et dans l'estuaire de Pinios (juvniles) ainsi qu' des diffrences lies au dveloppement entre stades juvniles et adultes, qui influencent leur comportement de nutrition.

20107893|We report new records of copepods of the genus Mesocyclops from Cuba. In the tropics, several species of Mesocyclops have shown promise as biological control agents for the larvae of disease-bearing mosquitoes. Mesocyclops aspericornis is considered pan-tropical, but has not previously been recorded here. Mesocyclops reidae, now found in a new locality, was previously reported from Cuba under the name M. ellipticus. We briefly review pertinent aspects of the taxonomic history, geographical distribution, and biology of these two species and of the two other members of the genus that are currently known to inhabit Cuba. /// Reportamos nuevos registros de coppodos del gnero Mesocyclops en Cuba. En los trpicos, algunas especies de Mesocyclops se han mostrado como agentes prometedores para el control biolgico de larvas de mosquitos transmisores de enfermedades. Mesocyclops aspericornis es considerado una especie pan-tropical, pero no ha sido previamente reportada aqu. Mesocyclops reidae, ahora encontrado en una nueva localidad, fue previamente reportado para Cuba bajo el nombre de M. ellipticus. Revisamos brevemente aspectos de la historia taxonmica, distribucin geogrfica y biologa de estas dos especies y otros dos miembros del gnero, que actualmente habitan en Cuba.
27822622|A new species of Cyclopidae (Copepoda, Cyclopoida) is described from Ayyalon Cave, Israel, as Metacyclops longimaxillis n. sp. The description is based on specimens collected in a small, brackish, warm and sulfidic water pool, recently described from this cave that belongs to the Yarqon-Tanninim aquifer. The new taxon is distinguished by specific morphological traits, but in particular by the remarkable maxillae, the large size of which may be related to the specific environmental conditions in which these crustaceans are living. Its closest similar congener is M. stammeri Kiefer, 1938, with which it mainly shares the terminal seta and spine on endopodal segment 2 of P4 in both male and female, the armature of two setae and the strong exopodal seta on the basipodite of the antenna, the spine formula of the exopodites of the swimming legs (3.4.4.3), the general shape and setation of the furca with the inner median seta enlarged at its base; the 11-segmented female antennule, and the segmentation pattern of the antennule. They principally differ by their body size, the shape of the seminal receptacle, the setation of the antenna, the structure of the male antennule, the ornamentation of the intercoxal plates of the swimming legs, and the structure of the male P6. Some information and a description of the only other cyclopid found at this site, attributed to Metacyclops subdolus Kiefer, 1938, is given in addition. Une espce nouvelle de Cyclopidae (Copepoda, Cyclopoida) est dcrite de la grotte d'Ayyalon, Israel, Metacyclops longimaxillis n. sp.,  partir de spcimens collects dans une petite mare d'eau saline chaude, riche en sulfites, rcemment dcouverte dans cette grotte appartenant au rseau aquifre Yarqon-Tanninim. La nouvelle espce se distingue par des caractres morphologiques spcifiques, mais surtout par sa maxille, remarquable, dont la grande taille pourrait tre en rapport avec les conditions environnementales particulires dans lesquelles vivent ces crustacs. L'espce la plus proche est M. stammeri Kiefer, 1938 avec laquelle elle partage la soie et l'pine terminales de l'endopodite 2 de P4, prsentes dans les deux sexes, l'armature du basipodite de l'antenne compose de deux soies et d'une forte soie exopodale, la formula des pines des exopodites des pattes natatoires (3.4.4.3), la forme gnrale de la furca, avec la soie furcale interne largie  sa base, le modle de segmentation de l'antennule  11 segments de la femelle. Elles diffrent principalement par leur taille, la forme du rceptacle sminal, la structure de l'antennule mle, l'ornementation des plaques intercoxales des pattes natatoires et la structure de la P6 mle. Une nouvelle description ainsi que des informations complmentaires sont galement donnes sur l'autre espce de cyclopide prsent dans le site, Metacyclops subdolus Kiefer, 1938.
20104854|The total number of marine and brackish planktonic species of copepods is evaluated at about 1950, belonging to 9 of the 10 sub-classes of Copepoda. Only the Gellelyoida, which are fresh-water and underground forms are not considered. These species are distributed over 59 families and 253 genera. According to the genera number distribution in families, 2 families yield the largest generic radiation: the Aetideidae and the Scolecitrichidae, with a dominance of mesopelagic and bathypelagic species. 63% of families have a restricted number of genera (1 to 3), some belonging to orders having their full expansion in the benthos. The families with epipelagic forms and those with herbivorous and omnivorous characters are weakly diversified in contrast to carnivorous forms. Sex-ratio analyses based on the number of individuals in samples indicate a strong dominance of females; one has to take into account, however, that both males and females are described for 67% of the total number of species, 28% is exclusively based on females and 5% on males. /// La bilan actuel du nombre total des espces marines et saumtres de coppodes planctoniques est proche de 1950, appartenant  neuf des dix ordres de la sous-classe des Coppodes. Seuls les Gelyelloida dont les formes sont dulaquicoles et souterraines ne sont pas reprsents. Ces espces se rpartissent dans 59 familles et 253 genres. La distribution du nombre de genres par famille montre que deux familles prsentent la plus grande radiation gnrique: les Aetideidae et les Scolecitrichidae qui renferment des formes essentiellement msoplagiques et bathyplagiques. Soixante trois pour cent des familles ont un nombre limit de genres de 1  3 et appartiennent  des ordres dont les formes ont connu leur pleine expansion sur le benthos. Les familles  formes piplagiques,  caractres herbivore et omnivore, n'ont connu qu'une faible diversification au contraire des formes carnivores. Si l'analyse du sex-ratio ralise  partir des comptages dans les pches montre gnralement une trs forte dominance des femelles, on observe que les mles et les femelles sont dcrits pour 67% des espces, les femelles seules pour 28% et 5% de mles.
20105968|A description of the life cycle of Gammarus leopoliensis based on monthly samples from the Strwia River (Black Sea basin, Polish Eastern Carpathians) is presented. The species is shown to be multivoltine iteroparous, with one breeding period per female's life-span. It lives in submontane streams and rivers at altitudes up to c. 800 m. Steepness and stream velocity seem to play a vital role in limiting the species' altitude range extension. /// Description du cycle biologique de Gammarus leopoliensis fonde sur des chantillonnages mensuels dans la rivire Strwia (bassin de la Mer Noire, Carpathes polonaises orientales). Il est montr que l'espce est itropare, avec une seule priode de reproduction au cours de la vie de la femelle. Elle vit dans les ruisseaux et rivires submontagnards jusqu' l'altitude de 800 mtres environ. La rapidit du courant semble jouer un rle vital dans l'extension de l'espce en altitude.
20107683|Eupolymniphilus orientalis is described as a new species discovered in intertidal invertebrate burrows in Korea. In addition to the type species, E. finmarchicus (T. Scott, 1903), also Scambicornus armoricanus (Bocquet, Stock & Kleeton, 1963) and S. tenuicaudis (G. O. Sars, 1918) are recognized as members of the genus Eupolymniphilus. The new species is distinguished from its three congeners by the presence of an outer scale on the mandible, short caudal rami, and a specialized proximal caudal seta. A key to distinguish the four species of the genus is provided. /// Eupolymniphilus orientalis est dcrite comme une nouvelle espce dcouverte dans les terriers d'Invertbrs intertidaux en Core. En supplment de l'espce type E. finmarchicus (T. Scott, 1903), Scambicornus armoricanus (Bocquet, Stock & Kleeton, 1963) et S. tenuicaudis (G. O. Sars, 1918) sont aussi reconnues comme membres du genre Eupolymniphilus. La nouvelle espce se distingue de ses trois congnres par la prsence d'une caille externe sur la mandibule, une courte rame caudale et une soie caudale proximale spcialise. Une cl de dtermination pour les quatre espces est propose.
20107694|European green crabs, Carcinus maenas, infected with trypanorhynch plerocercoids, Dollfusiella martini were studied to determine whether larval cestodiasis had an effect on the digestive enzyme activity of the green crab host. We collected 28 green crabs from Swan Bay, Victoria, removed their digestive glands, counted the plerocercoids and assayed the digestive gland for three enzymes: trypsin, lipase, and -glucosidase. Regression analysis showed a significant negative relationship between levels of infection and the specific activity of trypsin (r = 0.17, d.f. = 1,22, p &lt 0.05, y = -3.91E-06 x + 1.683E-04) and lipase (r = 0.40, d.f. = 1,23, p &lt 0.001, y = -2.89E-05 x + 1.615E-03), i.e., the higher the level of infection, the lower the trypsin and lipase activity. No relationship was found for -glucosidase activity. We also found a positive correlation (r = 0.41, d.f. = 27, p &lt 0.05) between intensity of infection and host size, a common host/parasite phenomenon. We conclude that infection by plerocercoids of the trypanorhynch, Dollfusiella martini, adversely affects digestive gland function of green crabs by reducing the specific activity of the digestive enzymes trypsin and lipase. This reduction in enzyme activity may be attributed to the destruction of enzyme producing F-cells resulting from plerocercoid infection of the digestive gland. /// Des crabes verts europens, Carcinus maenas, infects par des plrocercodes Dollfusiella martini, ont t tudis afin de dterminer si les cestodoses larvaires avaient un effet sur l'activit des enzymes digestives de l'hte crabe vert. Nous avons collect 28 crabes  Swan Bay, Victoria, prlev leurs glandes digestives, compt les plrocercodes et test la glande digestive pour trois enzymes: la trypsine, la lipase et l'-glucosidase. L'analyse de rgression a montr une relation ngative significative entre les niveaux d'infection et l'activit spcifique de la trypsine (r = 0,17; d.f. = 1,22; p &lt 0,05; y = -3,91E-06 x + 1,683E-04) et de la lipase (r = 0,40; d.f. = 1,23; p &lt 0,001; y = -2,89E-05 x + 1,615E-03); plus le niveau d'infection est lev, plus l'activit de la trypsine et celle de la lipase sont faibles. Aucune relation n'a t trouve concernant l'activit de l'-glucosidase. Nous avons trouv une corrlation positive (r = 0,41, d.f. = 27, p &lt 0,05) entre l'intensit de l'infection et la taille de l'hte, un phnomne commun de la relation hte/parasite. Nous concluons que l'infection par les plrocercodes du trypanorhynque Dollfusiella martini, affecte la fonction de la glande digestive des crabes verts en rduisant l'activit spcifique des enzymes digestives, trypsine et lipase. Cette rduction de l'activit enzymatique peut tre attribue  la destruction des cellules F secrtant les enzymes, rsultat de l'infection de la glande digestive par les plrocercodes.
20103228|Die paarigen Urkeimdrsenzellgruppen der terrestrischen Isopoden Armadillidium vulgare und Porcellionides pruinosus entstehen aus der ventralen Keimblase der Maxillengegend und des zweiten bis sechsten Thoraxabschnittes. Nach der dorsalen Verlagerung nehmen die Keimdrsen ihre endgltige Position in der dorsalen Thoraxhhle der Abschnitte eins bis sechs ein. Jede Keimdrsenzellgruppe des dritten Abschnitts wird von einer Mesodermzellschicht bedeckt, welche den undifferenzierten Ansatz der adulten Keimdrse darstellt. Die gepaarten Eierstcke des Weibchens werden durch einen langgezogenen Keimdrsenansatz geformt, bis sie ihren Platz in der dorsalen Thoraxhhle der Abschnitte zwei bis sechs einnehmen. Der Eileiter, im vierten Thoraxabschnitt, wchst vom Eierstock ausgehend bis er eine ventrale Ektodermeinstlpung im fnften Abschnitt trifft. Alle Zellgruppen der Urkeimdrsen, ausser denen im vierten und fnften Abschnitt, degenerieren bevor Erwachsenenstadium erreicht ist. Keine dieser Zellen trgt zur Bildung des Eierstocks oder des Eileiters bei. Die Androgendrsen entstehen aus undifferenzierten Mesenchymzellen, die sich ausserhalbs der Keimdrse, im zweiten Thoraxabschnitt, befinden. Die vorderen Ausstlpungen der gepaarten Ansatze der Samenblase im dritten Thoraxabschnitt bilden die Testes, whrend die hinteren Ausstlpungen die Samenleiter und die Penisse bilden. Wie beim Weibchen sind keine der Urkeimdrsenzellen bei der Bildung der adulten Keimdrse beteiligt; sie degenerieren bevor das Erwachsenenstadium erreicht ist.
20104764|La survie et la croissance de la crevette Palaemon elegans Rathke, 1837, ont t tudies sous des conditions constantes (20C; 24; 12/12 JN). Deux nourritures ont t utilises: muscle de l'abdomen de Nephrops et boulettes de crevettes commerciales, avec deux frquences d'alimentation: quotidiennement et tous les cinq jours. La survie tait meilleure avec les boulettes, ceci tant attribu  leurs effets sur la qualit de l'eau plutt qu' leur valeur nutritionelle. Avec l'alimentation quotidienne, la croissance tait similaire sous les deux rgimes, en dpit de larges diffrences dans la composition protiniques et les autres composants. Avec l'alimentation tous les cinq jours, la priode d'intermue tait plus longue et le pourcentage d'accroissement  la mue plus faible, en comparaison avec l'alimentation journalire. Les effets taient plus grands avec le rgime Nephrops qu'avec le rgime boulettes.

20103432|Over 1300 marine snakes were examined for epifaunal organisms. Thirteen species were found with the obligate epizoite barnacle, Octolasmis grayii. The sea snake Lapemis hardwickii had one of the higher rates of infestation and the distribution of O. grayii was examined in more detail for this species. In L. hardwickii estimates of infestation rates varied from 29% to 75%. The number of barnacles per snake varied (0-62) but of those snakes bearing barnacles most had only a few (1-3). The distribution of barnacles over the body of the snakes is not random. Many more barnacles are found on the posterior quarter of the body (s-v) and tail, and the barnacles show a definite tendency to clump locally. O. grayii grows to about 14.0 mm total length and becomes reproductively active at about 3.3 mm. Several stages of its life cycle are illustrated. Among them are: the attachment of the cyprid larva and the subsequent rotation to the adult position; a sub-adult, or recently metamorphosed form; and a gravid adult. At the time of attachment to the snake scale the larvae show a definite (93%, n = 100) anterior-posterior orientation parallel to the anterior-posterior axis of the snake and facing anteriorly. The cement pad secreted by the barnacle has an intimate relationship to the scale surface and its micro-ornamentation but apparently does not permeate its surface.

C'est le premier signalement de cet intressant stomatopode cryptique  Taiwan et c'est galement la premire fois que l'on mentionne de cette le la prsence de cette famille.

20104151|Une nouvelle espce d'amphipode, Parhyale basrensis est dcrite du systme fluvial de Shatt el-Arab (Iraq). La nouvelle espce semble d'tre troitement apparente  P. hawaiensis (Dana).
20105018|Interpretations by Claus and Giesbrecht of the identity of the distal segments of the maxilla 2 and maxilliped in copepods are reviewed. The developmental pattern of setal additions to these appendages suggests that the distal segments of maxilla 2 are exopodal, while those of the maxilliped are endopodal; these data are consistent with the interpretation of Claus. Information about the genetic regulation of development of a fruitfly, and a reinterpretation of a fossil arthropod also support Claus. A general hypothesis identifies a compartment with a contralateral pair of uniramal limbs as the basic division of the body of an ancestral arthropod. Somites, crustacean biramal appendages, and insect uniramal appendages are derived. The general hypothesis is used to explain the structure of a copepod including maxilla 2 and maxilliped. /// Les interprtations par Claus et Giesbrecht de l'identit des segments distaux de la 2me maxille et du maxillipde chez les Coppodes sont revues. Le mode de dveloppement des additions de soies sur ces appendices suggre que les segments distaux sont exopodial sur la 2me maxille et endopodial sur le maxillipde. Les donnes sur la rgulation gntique du dveloppement d'une drosophile et une rinterprtation d'un arthropode fossile appuient aussi l'interprtation de Claus. Une hypothse gnrale identifie un compartiment avec une paire d'appendices unirams comme la division basale du corps d'un arthropode ancestral. Somites, appendices birams des crustacs, et appendices unirams des insectes sont drivs. L'hypothse gnrale est utilise pour expliquer la structure d'un coppode incluant la 2me maxille et le maxillipde.
20106147|Acasta newmani n. sp. from the Gulf of California, Mexico is described. This is the first report of Acasta from the eastern Pacific. Hypotheses are discussed concerning the correlation of cirral morphology with feeding methods and host specificity. The similarities between A. newmani and Acasta cyathus Darwin, 1854 indicate that they are examples of the common pattern of trans-isthmian sibling taxa in the Caribbean and eastern tropical Pacific. A key to the seven sponge-inhabiting barnacle species of the Americas is presented with citations noting their host sponge species and known ranges in the Americas. The range of Membranobalanus nebrias (Zullo & Beach, 1973) is extended from the Galapagos Islands to the Gulf of California. /// Se describe Acasta newmani n. sp. del Golfo de California. Esta es la primera cita de Acasta en el Pacfico oriental. Se discuten las hiptesis sobre la correlacin entre morfologa cirral y los mtodos de alimentacin y especificidad de huspedes. Las similitudes, entre A. newmani y A. cyathus Darwin, 1854 indican que son un ejemplo del patrn comn entre especies hermanas a ambos lados del istmo de Panam, en el Caribe y Pacfico oriental tropical. Se incluye una clave de las siete especies americanas de cirrpedos que viven en esponjas, indicando la especie huesped y sus distribuciones. El rango de distribucin de Membranobalanus nebrias (Zullo & Beach, 1973) se extiende desde las islas Galpagos hasta el Golfo de California.

20103086|Es wird eine mathematische Methode vorgelegt, die geeignet erscheint, die hnlichkeit und Identitt der Strukturen und Funktionen zweier sich stark hnelnder Organe zu prfen. Die Ergebnisse weisen darauf hin, da PL-Werte der Druckscheren sowohl bei rechts- als auch bei linkshndigen adulten Krabben weitgehend identisch sind. Dieser Sachverhalt zeigt, da -- bezogen auf die Gruppe -- kein Funktionswechsel entsteht nach einer Scheren-Umkehr, da heit, wenn die ursprngliche rechtsseitige Druckschere autotomiert wird und sich die Schneideschere in eine linksseitige Druckschere umwandelt. Offenbar ist der Grenbereich fr die maximale berlebenschance der Population festgelegt und selektioniert, unabhngig von Links- und Rechtshndern. Auf der anderen Seite weisen die PL-Werte regenerierter Schneidescheren bei Linkshndern erhebliche Variationen auf; sie sind im allgemeinen kleiner; das deutet darauf hin, da sie ihrer ursprnglichen Funktion weniger gerecht werden, welche offenbar weniger wichtig ist als die der Druckscheren. Der Mechanismus, welcher die Druckscheren-Umkehr kontrolliert, wird errtert. Die genetische Selektivitt in Richtung von greren Scheren sollte im Lichte der berlebenseinschrnkung gesehen werden.

20103473|A new species, Mesacturoides raymondi, is described from the northern Arabian Sea. It is closely related to M. fimbriatus and M. brevisquamatus but differs mainly in the number and arrangement of the denticles on the telson and the smaller size of the proximal spine of the basal prolongation of the uropod. Diagnostic features, colour and remarks on its first larva are given.
20106165|A stock of rock shrimp Sicyonia penicillata was assessed in a fishery recently opened at Baha Kino, Sonora, Mexico. An age-structured model with stochastic recruitment was developed, which considers growth rate, natural mortality, and fishing mortality by age. Age groups were followed year by year with a stock-recruitment Ricker function where the seasonal recruitment pattern was defined as well. Simulations might be interpreted as showing a stable population with four-year cycles, reflecting a density-dependent process. In 1996, fishing intensity had an apparent compensatory effect on the stock, decreasing the amplitude of natural oscillations and maintaining the stock at a biomass level similar to the size observed in a condition of no exploitation. The stock was found currently underexploited. As a result of the seasonal accessibility and the age of first-catch fishing (adult shrimp), the stock might be capable to withstand high fishing pressure without being overexploited. /// Se evalu una poblacin de camarn de roca Sicyonia penicillata, de una pesquera recientemente abierta en Baha Kino, Sonora, Mxico. Se desarroll un modelo basado en la estructura por edades que considera reclutamiento estocstico, tasa de crecimiento, mortalidad natural y mortalidad por pesca por grupo de edad. Estos grupos de edad fueron determinados ao tras ao mediante la funcin de reclutamiento de Ricker, en los que tambin se defini el patrn estacional de reclutamiento. Las simulaciones muestran una poblacin estable con ciclos de cuatro aos, que indican un proceso de densodependencia. En 1996, la intensidad de pesca tuvo un efecto compensatorio sobre la poblacin, reduciendo la amplitud de las oscilaciones naturales y manteniendo al stock en un nivel de biomasa similar al observado en la condicin sin explotacin. Se encontr que el recurso est subexplotado. Como resultado de la accesibilidad estacional y de que la edad de primera captura corresponde a camarn adulto, el recurso soporta alta presin de pesca sin dar evidencias de sobreexplotacin.

20105817|The spiny lobster catch from Baha de la Ascensin, a large bay on the central coast of the Mexican Caribbean, is composed mainly of young adults and large juveniles of Panulirus argus. The fishery in this bay is based on artificial shelters called "casitas". A substantial part of the lobsters found beneath the casitas is of sublegal size (minimum size limit  74 mm carapace length, CL). The possibility of ongrowing sublegal juveniles in portable sea enclosures to maximize the harvestable biomass was explored. The enclosures (3  3  1 m) were installed in shallow depths in the bay. Juveniles taken from nearby casitas were introduced in the enclosures and kept for different periods. Lobsters were fed with live molluscs and fish remains and were provided with suitable shelters. Experiments were conducted in two stages, in 1992 and 1993. Growth in size (CL) and in harvestable biomass (weight of legal-size lobsters) was examined. Maximum growth rates, lower percentages of mortality, and higher increases in harvestable biomass of lobsters were obtained after about 45 days. Confinement periods longer than 45 days resulted in reduced growth and higher mortality. Observations on lobster behaviour showed an increase in aggressive encounters and dominance displays from the third week of captivity onwards, which could be the main cause for the increase in mortality. The alternative of ongrowing sublegal juveniles for short periods (45 days), in conjunction with the casita system, could help increase the unit value of the catch. /// La captura de langosta en Baha de la Ascensin, una gran baha ubicada en la costa central del Caribe mexicano, est compuesta principalmente de adultos jvenes y juveniles grandes de Panulirus argus. La pesquera en esta baha se basa en refugios artificiales llamados "casitas". Una porcin considerable de las langostas que se encuentran bajo las casitas es de talla sublegal (talla mnima legal  74 mm de longitud cefalotorcica, CL). Se investig la posibilidad de llevar juveniles sublegales a la talla legal en cercos marinos porttiles para maximizar la biomasa aprovechable. Los cercos (3  3  1 m) se instalaron en lugares someros en la baha. Juveniles obtenidos en casitas cercanas fueron introducidos en los cercos y mantenidos por perodos diferentes. Se aliment a las langostas con moluscos vivos y restos de pescado, y se les provey de refugios adecuados. Los experimentos se desarrollaron en dos etapas, en 1992 y 1993. Se examin el crecimiento en talla (CL) y en biomasa aprovechable (peso de las langostas de talla legal). Las mximas tasas de crecimiento, los menores porcentajes de mortalidad, y los mayores incrementos en biomasa aprovechable se obtuvieron alrededor de los 45 das. Perodos de cautiverio mayores de 45 das dieron como resultado un retraso en el crecimiento y una elevada mortalidad. Observaciones sobre el comportamiento de las langostas mostraron un aumento de encuentros agresivos y exhibiciones de dominancia a partir de la tercera semana de confinamiento, lo que podra ser la causa del aumento en la mortalidad. La alternativa de mantener langostas sublegales por perodos cortos (45 das), en conjunto con el sistema de casitas, podra ayudar a incrementar el valor unitario de la captura.
20102429|Mehrere Exemplare von Vanbenedenia kroyeri Malmgren, 1860, von den Fr er und ein Tracheliastes grandis Wilson, 1915, aus der Sammlung des U. S. National Museums, wurden untersucht. Strukturelle hnlichkeiten ihrer Antennulae und Antennae lassen erkennen, dass diese beiden Parasiten zu derselben Gattung gehren. Verschiedenheiten in der Beborstung von Antennae, Antennulae und Maxillulae zeigen jedoch, dass sie zwei verschiedene Arten reprsentieren. Es wird vorgeschlagen, den Namen Tracheliastes grandis Wilson, 1915, umzundern in Vanbenedenia grandis (Wilson, 1915).
27743374|The morphology and systematic affinities of Danielopolina sp. cf. D. kornickeri from Christmas Island, an isolated seamount in the Indian Ocean, are reassessed with the aid of new material including a juvenile male. The species is formally described as Danielopolina (Humphreysella) baltanasi sp. n., which places the species in a separate subgenus to Danielopolina (Danielopolina) kornickeri from northwest Australia, the only other member of the genus in the Indian Ocean. In addition, the only deep-sea member of the genus, D. carolynae from the mid-Atlantic, a putative colonizer of seamounts, belongs to the subgenus Danielopolina. These findings compound theories on the distribution and dispersal of anchialine faunas. A coherent programme of molecular phylogenetic research and historical biogeographical analysis is needed to further enquiry into the enigmatic distribution of the anchialine faunas of both isolated sea mounts and epicontinental waters. Owing to the scarcity of anchialine fauna and the difficulty of access of their habitat, a global effort will be required to assemble the required specimens. /// La morphologie et les affinits systmatiques de Danielopolina sp. cf. D. kornickeri de l'le Christmas, un mont sous-marin isol de l'ocan Indien, sont re-values grce  du matriel nouveau dont un mle juvnile. L'espce est officiellement dcrite comme Danielopolina (Humphreysella) baltanasi sp. n., qui la place dans un sous-genre distinct de Danielopolina (Danielopolina) kornickeri du nord-ouest de l'Australie, le seul autre membre du genre dans l'ocan Indien. De plus, le seul autre membre profond du genre, D. carolynae de la zone mdio-Atlantique, que l'on suppose coloniser les monts-marins, appartient au sous-genre Danielopolina. Ces dcouvertes compliquent les thories sur la rpartition et la dispersion des faunes anchihalines. Un programme cohrent de recherche sur la phylognie molculaire et l'analyse biogographique historique sera ncessaire pour claircir ultrieurement la rpartition nigmatique des faunes anchihalines  la fois des monts sous-marins isols et des eaux picontinentales. En raison de la raret de la faune anchihaline et de la difficult d'accs  son habitat, un effort global sera ncessaire afin de rassembler les spcimens requis.
27822621|The distribution of different species belonging to the freshwater shrimp genus Macrobrachium was studied along an altitudinal gradient in the Huitzilapan River, Veracruz, Mexico. Population surveys of M. heterochirus, M. carcinus and M. acanthurus were conducted along an 80 km long river stretch that started at 1045 m above sea level (asl) and ended at the estuary. In the dry and rainy seasons, sampling was conducted, at eight sampling sites along the river. The animals were collected with traps and casting nets. Five abiotic variables: temperature, salinity, water velocity, pH, and dissolved oxygen (DO) were measured. An altitudinal species segregation was observed: Macrobrachium heterochirus was most widely distributed in the dry season, from 1045 to 105 m asl, and most numerous at altitudes between 500 and 100 m; M. carcinus occurred at altitudes ranging from 280 to 5 m asl in both seasons; and M. acanthurus was restricted to the estuary below 5 m asl. Temperature decreased whereas water velocity increased with altitude, as was registered in both seasons. Our results indicate that seasonal differences shaped the distribution patterns of the three species. During the dry season, the distributions of the shrimp extended along the entire river, whereas in the rainy season their distribution was mainly in the lower area of river, and the main variables measured that have major influence in their abundance, seemed to be DO and water velocity. En este trabajo reportamos la distribucin de diferentes especies de langostinos del gnero Macrobrachium a lo largo de un gradiente latitudinal en el ro Huitzilapan, Veracruz, Mxico. Un anlisis poblacional de M. heterochirus, M. carcinus y M. acanthurus fue realizado a lo largo de un transecto de 80 km que inici a los 1045 metros sobre el nivel del mar (msnm) y finaliz en donde el ro es un estuario. Se realizaron cuatro muestreos en las estaciones de secas (2) y en lluvias (2); ocho lugares fueron muestreados a lo largo del ro. Los animales fueron colectados con trampas y atarrayas, asimismo fueron medidos cinco variables abiticas (temperatura, salinidad, velocidad del agua, pH y oxgeno disuelto). Una segregacin altitudinal fue observada: Macrobrachium heterochirus fue la especie con una distribucin ms amplia en la estacin de secas desde los 1045 a los 105 msnm, prefiriendo reas a altitudes entre los 500 y los 100 m; M. carcinus ocurre a altitudes desde 280 a 5 m en ambas estaciones; y M. acanthurus estuvo restringida a la zona del estuario por debajo de los 5 msnm. La temperatura disminuy donde la velocidad del agua se increment con la altitud, esto fue registrado en ambas estaciones. Nuestros resultados indican que las diferencias estacionales marcan las distribuciones de las tres especies. Durante la poca de secas, las distribuciones se extienden a lo largo de todo el ro. Mientras en la estacin de lluvias sta fue principalmente sobre el rea ms baja del ro, y las principales variables medidas aqu que tienen una mayor influencia en sus abundancias fueron el oxgeno disuelto y la velocidad del agua.
20140983|Jaera nordmanni (Rathke), hitherto regarded as a widely distributed monotypic species, actually includes three distinct forms, each with a precise geographical distribution Because of their genetic isolation these three forms should be given specific rank, but because of their extreme similarity they must be grouped as a super species Within this complex the taxonomic intervals are not equivalents; J n nordmanni is more closely related to J n nordica than is either J n nordmanni or J n nordica to J n massiliensis.
20105430|The heavily armored peduncles of four species of deep-water calanticid scalpellomorphs, from three distant localities across the North Atlantic, are partially overgrown by the branching scleractinian corals on which they had settled. We infer the association and overgrowths benefit the barnacles in isolating them from competitors and predators. These barnacles and their hosts represent relatively old groups (early Mesozoic and Paleogene, respectively) and therefore the relationship could have been established during their early radiation. Because the corals are capable of at least partially if not completely entombing the scaly remains of the peduncles when the barnacles die, recognizable traces of this symbiotic relationship are probably present in the fossil record. /// Les pdoncules fortement cailleux de quatre espces de scalpellomorphes calanticides d'eau profonde, provenant de trois stations de l'Atlantique Nord, sont partiellement recouverts par des coraux sclractiniaires sur lesquels ils se sont fixs. Nous en dduisons que l'association et le recouvrement profite  ces cirripdes en les isolant de leurs comptiteurs et prdateurs. Ces cirripdes et leurs htes font partie de groupes relativement anciens (Msozoque infrieur et Palogne respectivement) et ainsi cette relation a pu tre tablie pendant leur radiation prcoce. Le fait que ces coraux profonds soient capables, au moins en partie, si ce n'est compltement, d'enrober les restes cailleux des pdoncules lorsque le cirripde meurt, laisse  penser que des traces reconnaissables de cette relation symbiotique sont probablement prsentes chez des fossiles.

20105326|The morphology of first stage zoea larvae of four species of grapsoid crabs (viz., Chasmagnathus granulatus Dana, 1851, Cyclograpsus lavauxi H. Milne Edwards, 1853, Hemigrapsus crenulatus (H. Milne Edwards, 1837), and H. sexdentatus (H. Milne Edwards, 1837)) from Argentina and New Zealand was re-examined. Special attention was given to those characters that have been recently recognized to separate larvae of the families Sesarmidae and Varunidae. In all species studied, the setation of several appendages differed from that presented in the original descriptions of the larvae. The new chaetotaxy agrees well with expectations based on a recent taxonomic classification. The shared 2,2 setal pattern on the endopod of the maxilla and the same type of antenna and telson in all of these species, confirm a close phylogenetic relationship among them and their placement within the family Varunidae. /// Die Morphologie des ersten Zoea-Larvalstadiums von vier Arten grapsoider Krabben (viz., Chasmagnathus granulatus Dana, 1851, Cyclograpsus lavauxi H. Milne Edwards, 1853, Hemigrapsus crenulatus (H. Milne Edwards, 1837) und H. sexdentatus (H. Milne Edwards, 1837)) aus Argentinien und Neuseeland wurde erneut untersucht. Besondere Aufmerksamkeit galt dabei den Charakteren, die krzlich als trennende Merkmale fr Larven der Familien Sesarmidae und Varunidae erkannt wurden. In allen untersuchten Arten unterschied sich die Beborstung mehrerer Extremitten von der Originalbeschreibungen der Larven. Die neue Chaetotaxie stimmt mit Erwartungen berein, die auf einer krzlich aufgestellten Taxonomie beruhen. Der 2,2-Beborstungstyp des Endopods der zweiten Maxille und die gleiche Form von Antenne und Telson in allen Arten besttigt eine nahe phylogenetische Verwandtschaft dieser Arten und deren Zuordnung zur Familie Varunidae.
20102874|Description d'une nouvelle espce d'Harpacticoida fouisseur, Arenopontia indica, des plages sableuses de la cte de Waltair (Inde). La biologie de l'espce, avec les stades du dveloppement, est tudie en dtail.
27743327|The crayfish genus Cambarus Erichson, 1846 contains 97 species found in a wide diversity of freshwater aquatic and semi-aquatic habitats in eastern and central regions of North America. The greatest diversity of this genus is found in the south-eastern areas of the United States, particularly in states such as Tennessee, Georgia, North Carolina, and Alabama. About half (47.42%) of all Cambarus species are either endangered, threatened, or vulnerable. Therefore, these species require special attention from a conservation standpoint. Habitat destruction and degradation are the main threats to the species of Cambarus in general. Cambarus spp. living in caves are more likely to be endangered than species of the same genus found in surface waters or semi-terrestrial habitats. For the better part, species of this genus found in more than one type of habitat tend to have a conservation status that is currently stable. Many Cambarus species have relatively small ranges, and 43.30% of all Cambarus spp. are restricted to only one U.S. state. The information available about distribution, habitat, and conservation status of the species of Cambarus is reviewed in order to raise awareness about these very diverse crayfishes, and to assist potential conservation efforts. /// Le genre d'crevisse Cambarus Erichson, 1846 contient 97 espces trouves dans une large diversit d'habitats dulcicoles aquatiques et semi-aquatiques dans les rgions orientale et centrale d'Amrique du Nord. La plus grande diversit de ce genre est trouve dans les rgions sud-orientales des tats-Unis, en particulier dans les tats comme le Tennessee, la Gorgie, la Caroline du Nord, et l'Alabama. Environ la moiti (47,42%) de toutes les espces de Cambarus sont soit en danger, soit menaces ou vulnrables. En consquence, ces espces requirent une attention particulire du point de vue de la conservation. La destruction et la dgradation de l'habitat sont les principales menaces pour les espces de Cambarus en gnral. Les espces de Cambarus vivant dans les grottes sont vraisemblablement plus en danger que les espces du mme genre trouves dans les eaux de surface ou dans les habitats semi-terrestres. Habituellement, les espces de ce genre trouves dans plus d'un type d'habitat tendent  avoir un statut de conservation qui est actuellement stable. Beaucoup d'espces de Cambarus ont des aires de rpartition relativement petites, et 43,30% de tous les Cambarus sont prsents dans seulement un tat des tats-Unis. L'information disponible sur la rpartition, l'habitat et le statut de conservation des espces de Cambarus est passe en revue afin de donner tous les renseignements sur ces diffrentes crevisses, et d'aider les efforts de conservation potentiels.
20104864|Mate guarding in Tisbe bulbisetosa Volkmann-Rocco, 1972 (Harpacticoida, Tisbidae) is described. The sexual dimorphism of antennules and maxillipeds and their function in mate clasping are discussed. Males of T. bulbisetosa are peculiar in their behaviour because: (1) they use their maxillipeds for grasping and (2) they are carried around by the females while clinging in opposite direction and upside down to the ventral side of the females. This type of mate guarding has not been observed in other harpacticoids. As only adult partners are involved it cannot be a case of precopulatory mate guarding. Maxillipeds are shown for the first time to be the main appendages for mate clasping in Harpacticoida. This explains in part the sexual dimorphism of this pair of appendages. /// Die Partnerbewachung bei Tisbe bulbisetosa Volkmann-Rocco, 1972 (Harpacticoida, Tisbidae) wird beschrieben. Der Sexualdimorphismus der Antennen I und der Maxillipeden und deren Funktion beim Festhalten des Partners werden diskutiert. Mnnchen von T. bulbisetosa zeigen Besonderheiten im Verhalten, weil sie ihre Maxillipeden zur Verankerung am Weibchen einsetzen und weil sie von den Weibchen herumgetragen werden, whrend sie mit dem Rcken nach unten und mit dem Kopf in entgegengesetzter Richtung an ihnen hngen. Diese Form der Partnerbewachung ist bei anderen Harpacticoida nicht bekannt. Da nur erwachsene Partner beteiligt sind, kann bei ihnen nicht von einer Prkopula gesprochen werden. Es wird zum ersten Mal fr Harpacticoida gezeigt, da die Maxillipeden das Hauptinstrument zur Befestigung am Weibchen sind. Der Sexualdimorphismus dieser Extremitten findet so eine Erklrung.
20105848|A collection of 13 different crab species of the families Ocypodidae, Grapsidae, Portunidae, Majidae, Xanthidae, and Leucosiidae was made from the mangrove shores of Abu Dhabi. The Grapsidae are represented by one species Metopograpsus messor; the Portunidae by Portunus pelagicus, Portunus arabicus and Thalamita poissonii; the Majidae by Menaethius monoceros; the Xanthidae by Eurycarcinus orientalis and Pilumnopeus convexa; and the Leucosiidae by Ebalia sagittifera. Habitat preferences, distributional information and comments on morphology are given, and the species composition discussed in relation to other mangals of the Arabian region. /// Une collection de 13 espces diffrentes des familles Ocypodidae, Grapsidae, Portunidae, Majidae, Xanthidae, et Leucosiidae a t faite dans la mangrove d'Abu Dhabi. Les crabes sont particulirement bien reprsent par les Ocypodidae avec cinq espces: Macrophthalmus depressus, Serenella leachii, Scopimera crabricauda, Ilyoplax frater et Ocypode rotundata. 23034335|Snow crabs, Chionoecetes spp., are among the commercially most important species of Decapoda in the world, and proper stock assessment and management are required for their sustainable use. In the present study, morphological characteristics of three snow crabs, Chionoecetes japonicus, Chionoecetes opilio and a hybrid form exhibiting characteristics intermediate between those of the parent species, Chionoecetes japonicus/opilio, have been compared. The ratio of carapace length including rostral horn (CL(RL)) to carapace width (CW) in C. japonicus, C. opilio, and the C. japonicus/opilio hybrid was 0.973  0.020, 0.983  0.019, and 0.956  0.019, respectively. The only significant difference in regression slope among the three crabs, was between CW and chela height (CH), indicating that at a given size, the hybrid form is the fastest in the growth of chela height in relation to carapace width. In C. japonicus and C. opilio, the relationship between CW and total weight (TW) was significantly negatively allometric, while in the hybrids, it was significantly positively allometric. This indicates that at a given size, the hybrid form is heavier than the others. Les crabes des neiges Chionoecetes spp., sont parmi les espces les plus importantes commercialement de dcapodes dans le monde, et une valuation et une gestion des stocks correcte sont ncessaires en vue de leur utilisation durable. Dans cette tude, les caractristiques morphologiques de trois crabes des neiges Chionoecetes japonicus, Chionoecetes opilio, et une forme hybride prsentant des caractristiques intermdiaires entre celles des espces parentes Chionoecetes japonicus/opilio, ont t compares. Le ratio de la longueur de la carapace incluant le rostre (CL(RL)) sur la largeur de la carapace (CW) chez C. japonicus, C. opilio, et le C. japonicus/opilio hybride tait de 0,973  0,020, 0,983  0,019 et 0,956  0,019, respectivement. La seule diffrence significative dans la pente de rgression entre les trois crabes a t entre CW et la hauteur de la pince (CH), indiquant que pour une taille donne, la forme hybride est la plus rapide pour la croissance de la pince par rapport  la largeur de la carapace. Chez C. japonicus et C. opilio, la relation entre CW et le poids total (TW) tait une allomtrie significativement ngative, tandis que chez les hybrides c'tait une allomtrie significativement positive. Ceci indique que pour une certaine taille, la forme hydride est plus lourde que les autres.

20107583|Two new species of Synalpheus Bate, 1888 are described for the Gulf of California, Mexico, in the eastern Pacific. 20107750|A total of 1642 individuals of the Chinese mitten crab, Eriocheir sinensis caught in 2001-2002 in the Odra estuary, were measured. The carapace width was found to range from 46.68 to 92.31 mm (mean width 66.61  7.33 mm); the mean carapace widths of females and males were 65.40  6.82 mm (46.68-88.85 mm) and 67.96  7.66 mm (47.04-92.31 mm), respectively. There were distinct differences in the numbers of individuals caught in different months. The highest number of crabs (85.44% of all individuals) was caught in autumn, as a consequence of reproductive migration. In the total number of 1642 specimens examined, males were slightly dominant (51.4%), in particular in October (55.31%) and November (52.01%). Females dominated in spring and summer and contributed 57.2-64.7%. /// Un total de 1642 individus du crabe chinois Eriocheir sinensis capturs en 2001-2002 dans l'estuaire de l'Odra ont t mesurs. 23034254|The reproduction and population dynamics of Portunus trituberculatus were investigated in 5402 specimens caught on the western coast of Korea, Yellow Sea, during three consecutive years between September 2003 and August 2006. The overall ratio of males to females was 1 : 1.08, although the sex ratio varied slightly from month to month and year to year. Over 90% of the females were in the maturing or mature stages in March-May, the gonadosomatic index was highest in April-May, and ovigerous females peaked in July. These results indicate that the main breeding season was between April and July. The frequency of crab larvae was highest in August, which is clearly supported by the breeding season. At sexual maturity, 50% of females had an estimated carapace width (CW) of 13.12 cm. The relationship between the number of eggs per brood (EN) and CW was ln EN = 3.04 ln CW + 6.83 for non-eyed eggs, and ln EN = 3.31 ln CW + 6.03 for eyed eggs. No brood loss occurred during the incubation period. The reproductive output was 0.34. The growth performance index showed that females grew faster and reached a larger size at the same age than males (L  = 22.1 mm CW and K = 0.66 yr -1 for females, and L  = 20.4 mm CW and K = 0.72 yr -1 for males). La reproduction et la dynamique des populations de Portunus trituberculatus ont t tudies chez 5402 spcimens collects sur la cte occidentale de Core, mer Jaune, pendant trois annes conscutives entre septembre 2003 et aot 2006. Le rapport total mles : femelles tait de 1 : 1,08 mme si la sex ratio variait lgrement de mois en mois et d'anne en anne. Plus de 90% des femelles taient au stade de maturation ou matures dans la priode mars-mai, l'index gonadosomatique tait maximal en avril-mai et les femelles ovigres taient les plus nombreuses en juillet. Ces rsultats indiquent que la saison de reproduction se situe en majorit entre avril et juillet. La frquence des larves de crabes tait maximale en aot, ce qui est clairement confirm par la saison de reproduction.  maturit sexuelle, 50% des femelles avaient une largeur de la carapace (CW) estime  13,12 cm. La relation entre le nombre d'ufs par ponte (EN) et CW tait ln EN = 3,04 ln CW + 6,83 pour les ufs non-oeills et ln EN = 3,31 ln CW + 6,03 pour les ufs oeills. Aucune perte de ponte ne s'est produite au cours de la priode d'incubation. Le rendement reproductif tait de 0,34. L'index de performance de la croissance a montr que les femelles croissaient plus vite et atteignaient une taille plus grande que les mles au mme ge (L  = 22,1 mm CW et K = 0,66 yr -1 pour les femelles, et L  = 20,4 mm CW et K = 0,72 yr -1 pour les mles).

20105748|Eight zoeal larval forms and the postlarval form of the prawn, Palaemon floridanus Chace, 1942, are described, based on laboratory reared animals that passed through as few as 8 or as many as 16 larval instars. This "extended" pattern of larval development was found to be consistent over the genus as a whole, regardless of the wide range of salinity occupied by different species. Structural characteristics that are shared by larvae of all Palaemon spp. thus far examined are presented. A more detailed analysis of larval morphology of temperate-tropical American species of Palaemon and Palaemonetes revealed more differences within than between the two genera, suggesting that they are more closely related than previously regarded. /// Se describen ocho fases larvarias (zoeas) y la fase postlarva del camarn Palaemon floridanus Chace, 1942, basadas en ejemplares cultivados en laboratorio y que contenan solamente entre 8 y 16 etapas larvarias. Este patrn "extendido" del desarrollo larvario fue observado en todo el gnero, a pesar del amplio rango de salinidades que habitan las diferentes especies. Se describen, asimismo, las caractersticas estructurales comunes a las larvas de todos los Palaemon spp. Un anlisis ms detallado de la morfologa larvaria de las especies tropicales/templadas americanas de Palaemon y Palaemonetes revel mas diferencias intra que intergenricas, sugiriendo que ambos gneros estn ms relacionados entre s de lo que se crea anteriormente.
20105421|Odontozona foresti, a new deep water species of Stenopodidae is described from the southern Gulf of California, Mexico. The holotype, an ovigerous female, was collected with a benthic sledge at 1240-1270 m depth. The new species, the largest currently known for this genus (total length, 60.6 mm), is distinguished from other species of Odontozona by the lack of dorsal spines on the telson, the presence of long, anteriorly directed horizontal spines on the posterior margin of both cervical and postcervical grooves, and the absence of spines on the carapace behind these grooves. Unlike most species of the genus, the propodus and carpus of the fourth pereiopod are undivided, while these segments are divided into 2 indistinct segments in the fifth pereiopod. The armature of the carapace resembles that of O. spongicola but in O. foresti the carapace is not swollen and the postcervical groove extends to about midheight of the lateral face of the carapace. /// Odontozona foresti, une nouvelle espce de Stenopodidae d'eaux profondes, est dcrite du sud du golfe de Californie, Mexique. L'holotype, une femelle ovigre, a t rcolte  l'aide d'une drague benthique  1240-1270 m de profondeur. L'espce nouvelle, la plus grande connue de ce genre de Stenopodidae (longueur totale: 60,6 mm) se distingue des autres espces de Odontozona par l'absence d'pines dorsales sur le telson, la prsence, sur les bords postrieurs des deux sillons cervicaux, de longues pines horizontales, diriges vers l'avant et par l'absence d'pines sur la carapace  l'arrire de ces sillons. Contrairement  la plupart des espces de Odontozona, le propode et le carpe des quatrimes priopodes ne sont pas diviss tandis qu'ils sont diviss en deux segments indistincts sur le cinquime priopode. L'armature de la carapace ressemble  celle de O. spongicola, mais chez O. foresti, la carapace n'est pas dilate et le sillon postcervical s'tend seulement jusqu' mi-hauteur de la face latrale de la carapace.

20105308|In a two-year study of the family Parastenocarididae in the River Krishna at Vijayawada, South India, five species belonging to the genus Parastenocaris Kessler, 1913, have been met with. Of these, three are new to science: P. gayatri n. sp., P. savita n. sp., and P. sandhya n. sp. The first two of these belong to the brevipes-group, the last one to the sioli-group. This paper gives an illustrated description of these new taxa, and also briefly discusses their affinities and ecology. The other two species, viz., P. curvispinus Enckell, 1970, and Parastenocaris sp., will be dealt with elsewhere. This is the first report on Parastenocarididae from India. Incidentally, it has also been found that parastenocaridids constitute a rather favoured item in the diet of the postlarvae of a commercially important gobioid fish, Glossogobius giuris (Hamilton, 1822). A brief note of this finding has been made. /// Au cours d'une tude de deux ans sur la famille des Parastenocarididae, provenant du fleuve Krishna  Vijayawada, Inde du Sud, cinq espces appartenant au genre Parastenocaris Kessler, 1913, ont t rencontres. Parmi elles, trois sont nouvelles pour la science: P. gayatri n. sp., P. savita n. sp. et P. sandhya n. sp. Les deux premires appartiennent au groupe brevipes, la troisime au groupe sioli. Ce travail donne une description illustre de ces nouveaux taxons, ainsi qu'une brve discussion de leurs affinits et de leur cologie. Les deux autres espces, P. curvispinus Enckell, 1970 et Parastenocaris sp. seront traites par ailleurs. Ceci constitue la premire tude sur les Parastenocarididae de l'Inde. Par ailleurs, il a t mis en vidence que les Parastenocarididae constituent un lment apprci dans l'alimentation de la post-larve d'un poisson d'importance commerciale, Glossogobius giuris (Hamilton, 1822). Une note courte relative  cette trouvaille est fournie.

20106113|Many factors (e.g., food conversion efficiency, stocking density, harvest size, product value and food value) determine the economic profitability of shrimp cultures. Food conversion efficiency (FCE) and body size are negatively related. During ontogenetic development, the efficiency with which animals convert ingested food into body mass gradually declines, either by a less efficient digestion or by a less efficient incorporation of digested material. Food intake increases with increasing body weight, while food conversion efficiency decreases; at intermediate body sizes the conversion of food to biomass reaches a maximum. The optimal size for harvesting depends on the food/product price ratio. Cultivation can only be profitable when FCE is at least higher than the food/product price ratio (

Die Hutungsstadien C und C wurden erreicht innerhalb von 12 bzw. 24 h, bezogen auf das Ausma der Carapaxkalzifizierung.
23034347|Two new species of the genus Aetideopsis (Copepoda, Calanoida, Aetideidae) are described from Scott Reef, Western Australia (14.05S 121.85E). The two species co-occurred in a channel approximately 450 m in depth separating the two adjacent coral atolls of the Scott Reef complex. Aetideopsis rhinoceros n. sp. is remarkable for the development of the right branch of the bifurcate rostrum into a large horn, which is recurved and directed antero-dorsally in the female, but is straighter and directed ventrally in the male. Aetideopsis browsei n. sp. is superficially similar to A. tumorosa Bradford, 1969, but differs in the form of the rostrum, in having shorter pointed processes on Th5, and in having 10 rather than 9 setae on endopod segment 2 of the mandible palp. Zwei neue Arten der Gattung Aetideopsis (Copepoda, Calanoida, Aetideidae) von Scott Reef, Western Australia (14.05S 121.85E) werden beschrieben. Die beiden Arten traten zusammen in einem ca. 450 m tiefen Kanal auf, welcher die beiden benachbarten Korallenatolle des Scott Reef-Komplexes trennt. Bemerkenswert fr Aetideopsis rhinoceros n. sp. ist die Ausbildung des rechten Astes des gabelfrmigen Rostrums zu einem langen Horn, welches bei dem Weibchen umgebogen und antero-dorsal gerichtet ist, bei dem Mnnchen dagegen weniger gebogen und ventral gerichtet. Aetideopsis browsei n. sp. hnelt oberflchlich betrachtet A. tumorosa Bradford, 1969, unterscheidet sich aber in der Form des Rostrums, sowie in krzeren spitzen Fortstzen am Th5 und in der Anzahl der Elemente am zweiten Endopodsegment des Mandibularpalpes, mit 10 anstelle von 9 Fiederborsten.

20787183|Synalpheus tumidomanus africanus (Crosnier & Forest, 1965) was recorded in Italian waters for the first time in September 2006, during a baseline port survey in Milazzo, Sicily, aimed at detecting non-indigenous species in port areas. The distribution range of S. tumidomanus africanus is known to extend throughout the warm-temperature sector of the eastern Atlantic and the western and eastern Mediterranean Sea. Prior to this work, the species had never been recorded from the central basin of the Mediterranean. Although the majority of the individuals sampled were large and well-preserved, we could not assess the presence of a stable and well-acclimated population due to the limited number of samples taken and the relatively short period of time covered by the study. At present, there are no data to ascertain the origin of the Sicilian population, but additional studies on S. tumidomanus africanus in the Mediterranean Sea might shed light on the actual distribution of this species. Synalpheus tumidomanus africanus (Crosnier & Forest, 1965)  stato rinvenuto per la prima volta in acque italiane nel Settembre del 2006 a Milazzo, Sicilia, durante un "baseline port survey" effettuato al fine di individuare specie non indigene in aree portuali. L'areale di S. tumidomanus africanus si estende dal settore caldo-temperato dell'Oceano Atlantico al Mar Mediterraneo orientale e occidentale. Precedentemente a questo studio questa specie non era stata mai registrata nel bacino centrale del Mediterraneo. Sebbene la maggior parte degli individui campionati siano di grandi dimensioni e ben conservati, non  possibile affermare la presenza di un popolamento stabile e ben acclimatato, considerando il numero limitato di campioni prelevati e il periodo di studio relativamente breve che ha interessato la ricerca in questione. Al momento i dati a disposizione non permettono di dare risposte certe riguardo l'origine della popolazione siciliana, ma studi ulteriori su S. tumidomanus africanus nel Mar Mediterraneo potrebbero far luce sull'attuale distribuzione di questa specie.
