20102333|Experimental data are presented on growth, molting frequency, rate of heart beat and incubation time, in Gamamrus salinus exposed to different temperature and salinity conditions. The specimens tested were members of a population living in a brackish water pond (Kleiner Kiel, Kiel, North Germany) or their F-generation. At temperatures between 19.0 and 20.0C and a salinity of 10, females attain sexual maturity (first oviposition) 20 to 30 days after hatching; their average length, measured in a straight line from tip of rostrum to base of telson, is then 7 to 8 mm (fig. 1, table I). Males reach maturity 1 or several weeks later. The molting frequency varies greatly with temperature (fig. 2, table III), the intervals being longer in males than in females. Females kept without a male show a progressive prolongation of the intervals beginning with the 3rd or 4th interval following isolation (table IV). Females kept together with males, in pairs, exhibit under constant conditions practically constant intervals, except for very old or sick individuals. No significant differences were obtained in the three salinity levels: 5, 10 and 30. The rate of heart beat (fig. 3) is roughly the same in adult females and males; no significant differences between individuals exposed to the different salinities were observed. Incubation time (number of days between oviposition and hatching) depends largely on the temperature (fig. 4, table V); the data available do not indicate significant differences at the three salinity levels. Exposed to an identical environment, G. salinus grows faster, molts at shorter intervals and exhibits a higher frequency of heart beat than does G. duebeni. Its eggs also develop in a shorter time.
20696255|The crayfish, Procambarus clarkii exhibits various body colorations, including an albino morph that lacks melanin and red pigments, except in the compound eyes. The albino phenotype segregates in a Mendelian way and is recessive to the wild-type (Nakatani, 1999). In the present study, we have examined the reproductive capacity of albino morphs of P. clarkii. Crosses between albino and wild-type individuals revealed that the number of juveniles produced from a couple of albino individuals was lower than that from a couple of wild-types. Both pleiotropy and inbreeding effects may be concerned in causing the lower fecundity in the albino form. When albino females mated with wild-type and albino males successively, both normal and white coloration appeared in the offspring of those crosses, indicating that both males had taken part in fertilization. This result is different from an earlier study on sperm competition in crayfish, in which paternity could invariably be attributed to the second male. The number of offspring from the multiple-mated females was higher than that of singly mated females. Thus, mating with multiple males may increase the effective fertility in albino females of P. clarkii. L'crevisse Procambarus clarkii prsente diverses colorations, incluant une forme albinos  qui il manque la mlanine et le pigment rouge, except au niveau des yeux composs. Le phnotype albinos sgrge selon les lois de Mendel et est rcessif par rapport au type sauvage (Nakatani, 1999). Des croisements entre des individus albinos et sauvages montrent que le nombre de juvniles produits par un couple d'individus albinos est plus faible que celui d'un couple de type sauvage. Les effets,  la fois de la pliotropie et de l'accouplement consanguin, peuvent tre la cause de la plus faible fcondit des albinos. Lorsque les femelles albinos s'accouplent successivement aux mles sauvages et albinos, les deux colorations normale et blanche apparaissent dans la descendance des ces croisements, indiquant que les deux mles ont pris part  la fcondation. Ce rsultat est diffrent de celui d'tudes prcdentes sur la comptition spermatique chez les crevisses, dans lesquelles la paternit tait invariablement attribue au deuxime mle. Le nombre de descendants de femelles avec partenaires multiples a t plus lev que celui de femelles avec un seul partenaire. Donc, l'accouplement avec des mles multiples peut accroitre la fertilit effective des femelles albinos de P. clarkii.
20102524|The freshwater gammarids described in this paper appear to be nearly related to the subspecies Gammarus pulex pulex but differ from it in the absence of the setose brush on the flagellum of the second antenna in the male. But they must not be mistaken for mere variations of either G. pulex pulex or G. pulex fossarum. For their morphological and biometric individuality is proved by a very definite genetic unity. In no case, during the trials of interbreeding between these amphipods and the two subspecies G. p. pulex and G. p. fossarum, was it possible to obtain young hybrid specimens although egg laying and the beginning of development were sometimes observed.

20107865|We examined feeding by the blue crab, Callinectes sapidus on the softshell clam, Mya arenaria (their shells gape at both ends) and the Atlantic rangia clam, Rangia cuneata (their shell margins shut tightly). The maximum sizes of both species that could be opened by crabs was determined, along with techniques used by crabs to open and eat them. The largest softshell clam eaten was significantly larger than the largest rangia that could be opened. Provided with five softshell clams in each of five size groups at the start of a 14-day experiment, crabs on Day 1 ate proportionately more intermediate-sized (4-5 cm) clams, then larger clams (5-7 cm), smaller clams (3-4 cm), and the largest clams (7+ cm) in that order; this pattern continued throughout the first three days, by which time nearly all clams had been eaten. We provided two or three size classes of softshell clams to four size classes of crabs (small, medium, large, and jumbo) and gave two size classes of rangia to two sizes of blue crabs (small, jumbo) and videotaped the crabs' feeding techniques. Blue crabs used 11 techniques to open softshell clams compared with 5 used to open rangia. When opening softshell clams, small and medium crabs pried, pulled apart, and bored into shells frequently, cracking and crushing next most frequently. Large and jumbo crabs cracked and crushed most frequently, followed by prying and pulling shells apart. Twisting the siphon and clam body was also common. Differences in clam shell morphology and strength imply that softshell clams are more easily fed upon by blue crabs than are rangia clams. Size provides partial protection from blue crab predation in that small blue crabs might not be able to feed easily on large softshell clams and perhaps only the largest blue crabs can open large rangia. /// L'alimentation du crabe bleu Callinectes sapidus  partir de deux espces de clams, Mya arenaria, clam  coquille molle ( coquille bant aux deux extrmits) et le clam rangia Rangia cuneata ( coquille fortement ferme) a t examine. Pour les deux espces, la taille maximum qui peut tre ouverte par des crabes a t dtermine, ainsi que des techniques utilises par les crabes pour les ouvrir et les ingrer. Le plus grand clam  coquille molle mang tait significativement plus grand que le plus grand clam rangia qui a pu tre ouvert. Dans une exprience de 14 jours, on a fourni 5 clams  coquille molle  chacun des cinq groupes de taille. Le jour 1, les crabes mangent dans l'ordre les clams de taille intermdiaire (4-5 cm), puis les grands clams (5-7 cm), les clams les plus petits (3-4 cm) et les plus grands (7+ cm). Ce modle se poursuit pendant les trois premiers jours, temps au bout duquel pratiquement tous les clams ont t mangs. Nous avons donn deux ou trois tailles de clam  coquille molle  quatre classes de taille de crabes (petit, moyen, grand et jumbo) et deux tailles de rangia  deux tailles de crabes (petit et jumbo) et nous avons film les techniques d'alimentation. Les crabes bleus utilisent 11 techniques pour ouvrir les clams  coquille molle et seulement 5 pour ouvrir les rangia. Pour ouvrir les clams  coquille molle, les crabes petits et moyens forcent, dchiqutent et percent les coquilles frquemment, cassant et crasant moins souvent. Les crabes grands et jumbo cassent et crasent plus souvent puis forcent et cartent les coquilles. Tordre le siphon et le corps du clam est aussi assez frquent. Des diffrences dans la morphologie de la coquille et sa solidit impliquent que les clams  coquille molle sont plus aisment consomms que les clams rangia. La taille procure une protection partielle contre la prdation par les crabes bleus, donc les petits crabes bleus ne seraient pas capables de se nourrir facilement de clams  coquille molle et seulement les plus grands crabes peuvent ouvrir les grands clams rangia.

20105166|Fifteen specimens of Ridgewayia marki minorcaensis n. ssp., collected from Calan Porter Cave, Minorca (western Mediterranean) on 18 July, 1988, are compared with closely related species. The presence of a hitherto undescribed structure on the basis of the right fifth leg of the male justifies establishing a new subspecies. This is the second record of this species, next to that from the Bermuda islands, and thus represents an interesting geographic distribution. The presence, in the same cave, of Exumella polyarthra Fosshagen, 1970, until now found only in the Bahamas, might pose the hypothesis of a relict character of these Mediterranean populations. /// Quince individuos de la especie Ridgewayia marki minorcaensis n. ssp., recogidos en la cueva Calan Porter de la Isla de Menorca (Mediterrneo occidental) en Julio de 1988, se comparan con especies prximas. La existencia de una estructura no descrita hasta la fecha en el basipodito de la pata quinta derecha del macho, justifica la creacin de una nueva subespecie. Se trata de la primera cita para el Mediterrneo despus de la nica existente hasta el momento para las Islas Bermudas. sto no slo representa un caso interesante de distribucin geogrfica sino que la existencia en esta misma cueva de individuos de Exumella polyarthra Fosshagen, 1970, especie nicamente conocida en las Bahamas, plantea la hiptesis del posible carcter relicta de estas especies.

20106425|Hyalella azteca from a laboratory culture, were maintained under conditions designed to allow assessment of growth, development and reproduction. Newly born H. azteca were approximately 1 mm in length (0.04 mg wet weight) and reached a maximum of about 7 mm (8 mg) at an approximate age of 120 days. Generally, mean size of males was greater than that of females. Adult male H. azteca had an intermoult period of 20 days (range 8-43 days) and females 11 days (10-13 days). Sex of male H. azteca could be identified at 19-21 days of age and first precopula was found as early as 23 days. The number of neonates produced by a single female ranged from 3-17 (mean 9) and significantly correlates with the length of the female. The mean time spent in precopula ranged from 1-7 days and animals took 4-12 days to re-enter precopula after separating. /// Hyalella azteca aus bestehenden Laborkulturen wurden unter Bedingungen gehalten, die es erlaubten, Wachstum, Entwicklung und Fortpflanzung zu verfolgen. Neu geborene H. azteca wiesen eine Krperlnge von ungefhr 1 mm (0.04 mg Nassgewicht) auf und erreichten nach ungefhr 120 Tagen ihre Maximallnge von etwa 7 mm (8 mg). Die Durchschnittsgre der mnnlichen Tiere war dabei hher als die der weiblichen. Der Zeitraum zwischen den Hutungen betrug bei adulten Mnnchen 20 Tage (8-43 Tage), bei adulten Weibchen 11 Tage (10-13 Tage). Bei mnnlichen H. azteca konnte das Geschlecht nach 19-21 Tagen bestimmt werden, und schon nach 23 Tagen wurden erste Tiere in Prkopula gefunden. Ein einzelnes Weibchen brachte 3-17 Neonaten hervor, wobei die Zahl der Neonaten signifikant mit der Krperlnge des Tieres korrelierte. Die Prkopula dauerte 1-7 Tage und bis zur nchsten Prkopula dauerte es 4-12 Tage nach der vorherigen Trennung.

Das normale Farbmuster der Mani (rote Streifen mit lohfarbenen Seiten) ist wichtig, denn ganz rote Scheren wurden strker, und ganz lohfarbene weniger stark angegriffen als normal gefrbte Modelle. Modelle, deren Scheren (1) grsser oder (2) kleiner waren als die normalen, bewirkten Zurckziehen (1) in strkerem oder (2) in weniger starkem Ausmass als normal.
20105876|During agonistic contests between size-matched Cambarus robustus crayfish males of breeding form, the eventual winners and losers initiated approximately the same number of fights. However, winners and losers differed in the frequencies and types of initiation behaviours used. The losers used almost exclusively the more subtle Ambivalent Contact initiation behaviours, whereas the winners used primarily the aggressive Lunge and Claws Raised initiation behaviours. The eventual losers initiated the vast majority (81.5%) of the very first fights in the overall agonistic contests. The type of initiation behaviours used by these crayfish from the beginning of the agonistic contests allows us to predict the eventual status (dominant or subordinate) of each of the two combatants. Furthermore, the frequency of the Lunge initiation behaviours used by the winners is significantly and negatively correlated with the total time spent fighting. As the dominant-subordinate relationship between the two combatants of each pair becomes established, there is a reduction in both the number and the duration of fights. /// Pendant les affrontements agonistiques entre des mles de mme taille de Cambarus robustus, les ventuels gagnants et perdants entreprennent  peu prs le mme nombre de combats. Cependant, gagnants et perdants diffrent dans les frquences et les types des comportements de dbut. Les perdant utilisent le comportement de dbut, de contact ambivalent le plus subtil, tandis que les gagnants usent avant tout des comportements de bonds en avant et  pinces dresses. Les perdants ventuels ont l'initiative dans la grande majorit (81,5%) des premiers combats dans les affrontements agonistiques. Les types de comportements de dbut au commencement des affrontements nous permettent de prdire le statut ventuel (dominant ou domin) de chacun des deux combattants. De plus, la frquence des comportements de dbut avec bond en avant utiliss par les gagnants est en corrlation ngative, et significative, avec la dure du combat. Quand la relation dominant-domin entre les deux combattants a t tablie, il y a une rduction  la fois du nombre et de la dure des combats.
20104825|Factors influencing shell assessment behaviour were studied in the hermit crab, Calcinus tibicen. Visual and chemical presence of potential competition significantly lengthened the duration of shell assessment. Shell genus occupied by the hermit crab also had a significant effect. Those in Astrea shells examined an offered Cerithium shell significantly longer than hermit crabs occupying Cerithium, Pisania, or Nerita shells. Shell deficit, the difference between optimal shell volume for the hermit crab and actual shell volume, did not have a significant effect on the behavior of the hermit crabs occupying Cerithium shells. For those in Pisania shells there was a negative correlation between shell deficit and shell examination; while crabs in Nerita and Astrea shells demonstrated a positive correlation between shell deficit and shell examination. Neither the sex of the individual crab nor the presence of a predator, Calappa flammea, had a significant effect on shell assessment behaviour. /// Les facteurs influant sur le comportement d'valuation de la coquille ont t tudis chez le pagure Calcinus tibicen. La prsence visuelle et chimique d'une comptition potentielle allongeait de faon significative la dure d'valuation. Le genre de coquille occup par le pagure avait aussi un effet significatif. Les pagures dans des coquilles d'Astrea examinaient plus longuement un coquille de Cerithium que ceux occupant des coquilles de Cerithium, Pisania ou Nerita. Le dficit de coquille, diffrence entre le volume de coquille optimal pour le pagure et le volume rel de la coquille, n'avait pas d'effet significatif sur le comportement des pagures occupant des coquilles de Cerithium. Pour ceux logs dans des Pisania, il y avait une corrlation ngative entre le dficit de coquille et l'examen de la coquille, alors que les pagures dans des Nerita et Astrea montraient une corrlation positive entre le dficit de coquille et l'examen de la coquille. Ni le sexe du pagure, ni la prsence d'un prdateur, Calappa flammea, n'avait d'effet significatif sur le comportement d'valuation de la coquille.
20107866|Phenotypic modifications in the structure of barnacle cirri constitute an adaptive mechanism associated with food availability in wave-exposed and wave-protected areas. Given that crowding during growth provokes density-dependent effects, access to food could also be a factor that generates morphometric and meristic changes in cirri. Length, diameter, and number of segments of the 3rd to 6th cirri were determined in Jehlius cirratus, the dominating species in the upper and middle intertidal zones of the Chilean coastline. Specimens collected in Metri Bay (4136S 7242W), southern Chile, were distinguished according to their growth conditions: isolated, contiguous, or aggregated. Crowding level during growth affected the structural characteristics of the cirri: the cirral appendages of crowded individuals are longer, thicker, and have more segments than those of individuals that grow in isolation. The results obtained indicate that the morphometric and meristic characteristics of morphological structures associated with filtration vary according to the grouping level at which individuals grow, with a possible threshold density level at which cirral morphology is modified. The results hence suggest that intraspecific competition for food at high densities is expressed in cirral morphology. /// Modificaciones estructurales fenotpicas de los cirros de cirripedios son un mecanismo adaptativo asociado a la distinta oferta de alimento en reas expuestas y protegidas al oleaje. Como el grado de agrupamiento durante el crecimiento provoca efectos denso-dependientes, el distinto acceso al alimento podra generar tambin cambios morfomtricos y mersticos en los cirros. Se realizaron mediciones de la longitud, dimetro y nmero de segmentos de los cirros 3 al 6, en el cirripedio Jehlius cirratus, especie que domina la zona intermareal superior y media a lo largo de toda la costa de Chile. Ejemplares recolectados en Baha Metri (4136S 7242W), sur de Chile, fueron separados segn el nivel de agrupamiento en que crecieron: aislados, contiguos y agrupados. El grado de agrupamiento en el que crecieron los ejemplares afect las caractersticas estructurales de los cirros; los individuos agrupados presentaron apndices cirrales ms largos, gruesos y con ms segmentos, que aquellos que crecieron aislados. Los resultados obtenidos indican que las estructuras morfolgicas asociadas a la filtracin varan en sus caractersticas morfomtricas y mersticas en funcin del nivel de agrupamiento en que crecieron los individuos, existiendo posiblemente un valor umbral de densidad a la cual se modifica la morfologa cirral. Los resultados sugieren que la competencia intraespecfica por el alimento a altas densidades se expresa en la morfologa cirral.
20105522|Three new species of Mesocyclops G. O. Sars, 1914 are described: M. acanthoramus sp. nov. and M. pubiventris sp. nov. from northern Queensland, and M. kayi sp. nov. from northern Burma. Mesocyclops papuensis Van de Velde, 1987 and M. woutersi Van de Velde, 1987 are reported from Australia for the first time. Other Australian records include: M. aspericornis (Daday, 1906) from Queensland; M. brooksi Pesce, De Laurentiis & Humphreys, 1996 from Queensland and Western Australia; M. darwini Dussart & Fernando, 1988 from Queensland and Western Australia; and M. notius Kiefer, 1981 from Queensland and Western Australia. A key to all Australian species of Mesocyclops, as well as a short discussion on the composition and distribution of the Australian fauna, are provided. /// Trois espces nouvelles de Mesocyclops G. O. Sars sont dcrites: M. acanthoramus sp. nov. et M. pubiventris sp. nov. du nord de Queensland, et M. kayi sp. nov. du nord de la Birmanie. Mesocyclops papuensis Van de Velde, 1987 et M. woutersi Van de Velde, 1987 ont t trouves en Australie pour la premire fois. D'autres observations pour l'Australie incluent: M. aspericornis (Daday, 1906) du Queensland, M. brooksi Pesce, De Laurentiis & Humphreys, 1996 du Queensland et d'Australie Occidentale, et M. notius Kiefer, 1981 du Queensland et d'Australie Occidentale. Une cl des espces australiennes de Mesocyclops, ainsi qu'une courte discussion sur la composition et la rpartition gographique de la faune australienne, sont fournies.
20105332|Late stages of Lysmata larvae are characterized by having a long, uniramous pereiopod 5, terminating in a flattened, paddle-shaped propodus. Lysmata debelius larvae also have similar long, paddle-shaped endopods for pereiopods 3 and 4. Although these paddles are easily lost, they are regrown at the following moult, and their loss does not appear to have a negative locomotory impact on the larvae, which swim normally even when paddles are lost. A complete ethogram of zoea VIII Lysmata debelius larvae in the presence and absence of food (Artemia nauplii recently hatched) was performed. The frequency of different types of behaviour during 10 min. intervals, was compared between complete larvae, larvae lacking the 5th pereiopods (P) and larvae without endopodites 3 and 4 or P. Two types of behaviour (walking and cleaning) were only performed by complete larvae, and so are dependent upon the presence of P. A third action, characterized by a "looping" centred on the tip of P, was not observed in larvae without paddles. This latter behaviour is significantly more frequent in the presence of food, and appears to be part of a feeding strategy. The potential use of P in predator avoidance or defence is also considered, and supported by observation. Results suggest that the paddles have two main functions, one related to feeding, the other to defence against predation. /// Les derniers stades des larves de Lysmata sont charactrises par un long priopode 5, uniram et se terminant par un propodite aplati, en forme de rame. Les larves de Lysmata debelius ont ainsi galement de longs endopodites analogues, en forme de rame aux priopodes 3 et 4. Bien que ces rames soient facilement perdues, elles sont  nouveau prsentes  la mue suivante, et leur perte n'apparat pas avoir un impact ngatif sur la locomotion des larves, qui nagent normalement quand ces rames sont perdues. Un thogramme complet de la zo VIII de Lysmata debelius en prsence et en absence de nourriture (Artemia rcemment closes) a t ralis. La frquence des diffrents types de comportement  10 minutes d'intervalles a t compare sur des larves compltes, des larves dpourvues de 5me priopode (P) et des larves sans endopodites 3 et 4 ou P. Deux types de comportements (marche et toilette) ont t observs chez les larves compltes et sont dpendants de la prsence de P. Une troisime action, caractrise par une "boucle" centre sur l'extrmit de P, n'a pas t observe chez les larves sans rames. Ce dernier comportement est significativement plus frquent en prsence de nourriture, et semble tre une partie de la stratgie de nutrition. L'usage potentiel de P dans l'vitement des prdateurs ou la dfense est aussi examin, et confort par l'observation. Les rsultats suggrent que les rames ont deux fonctions principales, l'une en relation avec la nutrition, l'autre en relation avec la dfense contre les prdateurs.
27822644|Burrow fidelity of a droving species, Uca vocans was compared with that of its sympatric associate, U. annulipes, a non-droving species. Crab re-emergence rate (RR) and burrow residency duration (BRD) were recorded for four to six consecutive days over six sampling periods from May to July 2006 at a lagoon beach at Pulau Hantu Besar, Singapore. The number of times that U. vocans and U. annulipes were tracked in the field was 327 and 306, respectively. Surface sediment was sampled in areas of high and low incidences of burrow abandonment. Marked crabs were similarly tracked in an ex situ study for 10 consecutive days. RR (field data) was significantly higher (i) in U. annulipes than in U. vocans (69.12.7% > 57.73.1%) and (ii) on sunny days than on overcast days (66.7  2.5% > 55.0  3.4%) in main effects' analyses (Two-way ANOVA). Similarly, BRD (field data) was significantly greater in (i) U. annulipes than in U. vocans (3.92  0.08 days > 3.54  0.09 days) and (ii) males than in females (3.83  0.08 days > 3.59  0.10 days). Both species had the largest frequency of crabs that resided in the same burrow for four days. In both the field and ex situ studies, U. vocans was observed to abandon burrows more frequently than U. annulipes although not on a daily basis. Organic content in high and low crab spatial movement areas did not differ significantly, suggesting that burrow abandonment is likely not related to food availability. Thus, U. vocans, although well-documented as a 'droving' species, exhibits considerable burrow fidelity at Pulau Hantu Besar, Singapore. La fidlit au terrier d'une espce se dplaant en groupe (droving espce), Uca vocans a t compare  celle de son associ sympatrique, U. annulipes, ne prsentant pas ce comportement. Le taux de re-mergence des crabes (RR) et la dure de rsidence dans le terrier (BRD) ont t enregistrs pendant quatre  six jours conscutifs au cours de six priodes d'chantillonnages de mai  juillet 2006 sur une plage de lagon  Pulau Hantu Besar, Singapour. Le nombre de fois o U. vocans et U. annulipes ont t trouvs sur le terrain tait 327 et 306, respectivement. Le sdiment de surface a t chantillonn dans des zones de hautes et basses frquences d'abandon de terriers. Des crabes marqus ont t de la mme faon suivis lors d'une tude ex situ pendant 10 jours conscutifs. RR (donnes de terrain) tait significativement plus lev (i) chez U. annulipes que chez U. vocans (69,1  2,7% > 57,7  3,1%) et (ii) durant les jours ensoleills que durant les jours couverts (66,7  2,5% > 55,0  3,4%), en analyses d'effets principaux (ANOVA  deux facteurs). De la mme faon, la BRD (donnes de terrain) tait significativement plus leve (i) chez U. annulipes que chez U. vocans (3,92  0,08 jours > 3,54  0,09 jours) et (ii) chez les mles que chez les femelles (3,83  0,08 jours > 3,59  0,10 jours). Les deux espces prsentaient la frquence la plus leve de crabes rsidant dans le mme terrier pendant quatre jours. Sur le terrain comme dans les tudes ex situ, U. vocans a t observ abandonnant les terriers plus frquemment que U. annulipes bien que sur une base non journalire. Le contenu organique dans les zones de mouvements spatiaux des crabes, qu'ils soient intenses ou non, ne diffrait pas significativement, suggrant que l'abandon du terriers n'est probablement pas li  la disponibilit en nourriture. Ainsi, l'espce U. vocans, pourtant bien connue comme droving espce, montre une grande fidlit  son terrier  Pulau Hantu Besar, Singapour.
41038629|In order to investigate possible changes in the natural diet of brachyurans during their gradual transition from marine to terrestrial life, the natural diet of five species of Brachyura (Liocarcinus depurator, Portumnus latipes, Portumnus lysianassa, Pachygrapsus marmoratus, and Ocypode cursor), living in different habitats (in Greece and in Cyprus), with a gradation from sea to land, was studied. The circalittoral species, L. depurator mainly feeds on macroinvertebrates (Polychaeta, Crustacea, Mollusca) and Pisces, living in or near muddy bottoms. The diet of the infralittoral crab, P. latipes is mainly based on Polychaeta, Crustacea, and drifting macroalgae, while the same prey groups dominate in the diet of the soft substratum midlittoral crab, P. lysianassa. The diet of the latter is also supplemented with insects of terrestrial origin. The hard substratum midlittoral crab P. marmoratus mainly feeds on Polychaeta, macroalgae, and secondarily on Crustacea and Mollusca. Finally, the semi-terrestrial crab, O. cursor has a diet different from that of the other four species, since it mainly feeds on insects, i. e., terrestrial invertebrates. Multidimensional analysis detected statistically significant differences in the diet composition of the five species studied. These differences should be attributed to the dissimilarity of the available trophic resources in the corresponding habitats of these species, as a result of their gradual trend from sea to land. Dans le but d'tudier les possibles variations du rgime alimentaire naturel de Brachyoures durant la transition graduelle entre espces marines et terrestres, le rgime naturel de cinq espces de Brachyoures (Liocarcinus depurator, Portumnus latipes, Portumnus lysianassa, Pachygrapsus marmoratus et Ocypode cursor), vivant dans diffrents habitats (en Grce et en Chypre), avec une gradation de la mer vers la terre, a t tudi. L'espce circa-littorale L. depurator, se nourrit surtout de macro-invertbrs (Polychtes, Crustacs, Mollusques) et de poissons vivant dans ou prs du sol vaseux. Le rgime du crabe infralittoral P. latipes est surtout bas sur des Polychtes, Crustacs et des macro-algues drivantes, alors que le mme groupe de proies domine dans le rgime du crabe mid-littoral P. lysianassa de substrat mou. Le rgime de ce dernier est aussi complt avec des insectes d'origine terrestre. Le crabe mid-littoral P. marmoratus de substrat dur, s'alimente surtout de Polychtes, macro-algues, et secondairement de Crustacs et Mollusques. Finalement le crabe semi-terrestre, O. cursor a un rgime diffrent de celui des quatre autres espces, puisqu'il se nourrit d'insectes, i. e., d'invertbrs terrestres. Des analyses multidimensionnelles ont dtect des diffrences statistiques dans la composition du rgime des cinq espces tudies. Ces diffrences peuvent tre attribues  la diffrence des ressources trophiques disponibles dans les habitats correspondants de ces espces, un rsultat de leur transition graduelle de la mer vers la terre.

Les stades de dveloppement de E. affinis sont compars  ceux de deux autres espces du mme genre, E. americana Williams, 1906, et E. herdmani Thompson & Scott, 1897. Les stades quivalents des deux premires espces cites, E. affinis et E. americana, sont plus proches l'un de l'autre morphologiquement qu'ils ne le sont de ceux de E. herdmani, ce qui suggre une relation phylognique plus troite entre elles. 20102642|Description et figuration de la nouvelle espce, Cyathura burbancki, qui, cologiquement spare des autres Cyathura, vit au large des ctes de Gorgie. Elle se distingue de C. polita, seule espce du genre connue des ctes atlantiques des U.S.A., par les larges exopodites des uropodes, qui passent au dessus du telson et se recontrent ou se recouvrent dorsalement, et par le bord postrieur libre du sixime plonite, qui n'est pas fusionn avec le telson et prsente une profonde incision mdio-dorsale.
20104977|From 1983 to 1988 over 49,000 three-month-old hatchery-reared lobsters were tagged with a microwire tag and released into the wild in Bridlington Bay on the east coast of England. The area supports a substantial fishery based on a large stock of naturally settled lobsters. Since 1988 approximately 57,000 lobsters have been tested at sea and at the landing place in order to recapture microtagged lobsters and assess their growth, movement, recapture rate and survival. Results to date show that microtagged lobsters have survived in the wild for up to eight years and have been caught in traps (or pots) by commercial fishermen. Lobsters began to reach the minimum legal size of 85 mm carapace length four to five years after release, but showed substantial individual variation in size at age. Most recaptures were recorded within six kilometres of known release sites, and showed strong site fidelity. Some recaptured females carried eggs. Data from additional T-bar tag-recapture experiments are used to estimate the exploitation rate generated by standard pots assuming either zero or a high rate of T-bar tag mortality and tag shedding. The exploitation rate is used to convert spot estimates of the catch rate of microtagged lobsters into estimates of their abundance for comparison with the number of lobsters released at individual sites. Corresponding estimates of survival from release to recapture average 84% and 50% for the two assumptions made about tag mortality and tag shedding in the T-bar tag-recapture experiment. It appears that juvenile hatchery-reared lobsters have survived well to recruitment and we offer this as a first quantitative assessment of pre-recruit survival for Homarus gammarus. The significance of this result for lobster stock enhancement and ecology is discussed. /// De 1983  1988, plus de 49.000 homards ns en levage et gs de trois mois ont t marqus avec un microfil et relchs dans la nature, dans la baie de Bridlington sur la cte est de l'Angleterre. La rgion possde une importante pcherie tablie sur une large population de homards naturellement sdentariss. Depuis 1988, environ 57.000 homards ont t examins tant  la mer qu'au lieu de dbarquement afin de recapturer les homards marqus et tablir leur croissance, leurs mouvements, leur taux de recapture et leur survie. Les rsultats montrent, aujourd'hui, que les homards marqus ont survcu dans la nature jusqu' huit ans et ont t capturs dans des nasses (ou casiers) par les pcheurs professionnels. Les homards ont commenc  atteindre la taille lgale de 85 mm de longueur de carapace 4  5 ans aprs avoir t lchs, mais ont montr  cet ge une variation individuelle de taille considrable. La plupart des recaptures ont t effectues dans une zone de 6 km autour des sites de lchers connus, et prsent une forte fidlit au site. Quelques femelles recaptures portaient des oeufs. Des donnes supplmentaires obtenues  partir des expriences de recapture  l'aide de spcimens portant des marques 'T-bar' ont t utilises pour estimer le taux d'exploitation fourni par les casiers standards, en supposant soit un taux zro, soit un fort taux de mortalit chez les porteurs de 'T-bar' et ceux ayant perdu leur marques. Le taux d'exploitation est utilis pour convertir des estimations ponctuelles du taux de capture des homards marqus en estimations de leur abondance, par comparaison avec le nombre de homards relchs dans des sites particuliers. Les estimations correspondantes de survie entre lcher et recapture sont en moyenne de 84% et 50% pour les deux hypothses faites au sujet du taux de mortalit et de la perte des marques dans l'exprience de recapture des animaux portant la marque 'T-bar'. Il semble que les homards juvniles d'levage aient bien survcu et nous considrons ce rsultat comme une premire valuation quantitative de la survie des pr-recrues chez Homarus gammarus. La signification de ce rsultat pour l'amlioration du stock de homard et son cologie est discute.
20103377|Halicyclops fosteri ist eine planktonische Art, die bisher nur selten in stuarien Nordamerikas gefunden wurde. Sie erweist sich als eine der dominierenden Formen in zwei kleinen Zuflssen am sdwestlichen Ufer der Delaware Bucht. Beide Flsse sind weniger als 20 km lang und haben ein schwaches Geflle; sie entwssern ausgedehnte Sumpfgebiete. Die Populationen von H. fosteri erreichen ihr Maximum bei Temperaturen ber 20 C und bei Salinitten unter 2. Es konnten zwischen 10 000 und 750 000 Individuen pro m gezhlt werden. H. fosteri und Eurytemora affinis (Calanoida) sind in beiden Flssen in den Regionen mit niedrigem Salzgehalt die dominierenden Copepoden.
20787185|Three species of Corophiidae (Amphipoda) were identified in the macrozoobenthos samples of the "Joint Danube Survey 2" (organized by the ICPDR). Chelicorophium sowinskyi (Martynov, 1924) and Chelicorophium robustum (G. O. Sars, 1895) were found for the first time in the Upper Danube. It is likely that C. sowinskyi has been overlooked in this area for decades, while C. robustum is a recent invader probably spreading downstream in the river. Chelicorophium curvispinum (G. O. Sars, 1895) was present in the whole navigable course of the river, whilst the other two species showed a discontinuous distribution with a gap in the Middle Danube. In the case of C. sowinskyi this gap is likely to reflect that this area is not tolerable for it for some reason, while C. robustum has probably not reached this section yet. Drei Arten von Corophiiden (Amphipoda) sind in den Makrobenthosproben des Joint Danube Survey 2 (vom ICPDR organisiert) entdeckt worden. Chelicorophium sowinskyi (Martynov, 1924) und Chelicorophium robustum (G. O. Sars, 1895) wurden erstmals in der oberen Donau gefunden. Es ist nicht auszuschlieen, dass C. sowinskyi in diesem Gebiet jahrzehntelang bersehen worden ist, whrend es sich bei C. robustum um einen Neuankmmling handelt, der dabei zu sein scheint, sich flussabwrts auszubreiten. Chelicorophium curvispinum (G. O. Sars, 1895) tritt im gesamten schiffbaren Flusslauf auf, whrend die beiden anderen Arten diskontinuierlich mit einer Lcke im mittleren Abschnitt des Flusses verbreitet sind. Bei C. sowinskyi scheint diese Lcke mit irgendwie ungnstigen Lebensbedingungen in diesem Flussabschnitt zusammen zu hngen, whrend C. robustum diesen Abschnitt noch nicht erreicht zu haben scheint.

C'est la seconde fois que le genre est signal en Italie, aprs que Fox a attribu la population du Lago Maggiore  une nouvelle espce, Isocypris nocentiniae. L'analyse comparative de ces populations a conduit  la conclusion qu'I. nocentiniae devait tre considr comme un synonyme d'I. beauchampi. A la suite de l'examen d'autres espces du mme genre, on peut galement placer I. arnoldi dans la synonymie d'I. beauchampi.

Einige Probleme werden besprochen und diesbezgliche Lsungen empfohlen. Aus praktischen Grnden wurden diese in vier Phasen des Lebenszyklus aufgeteilt. 1) Schlpfen aus dem Ei bis 1. Copepodit. 2) Infektion durch den 1. Copepodit. 3) Die Entwicklung vom 1. Copepodit zum erwachsenen Tier. 4) Eindringen in den Wirt und die Eisackbildung. Die hier entwickelte Methode drfte fr das ganze Verbreitungsgebiet des Parasiten in Frage kommen.
20104144|Eine pelagische Daphnia aus dem Patzcuarosee (Michoacan, Mexiko) wird beschrieben und abgebildet. In den meisten Merkmalen stimmt diese Form mit Daphnia laevis Birge, 1879, berein, unterscheidet sich aber deutlich von ihr in einigen morphologischen Details und durch ihr Vorkommen in einem anderen Gewssertyp. Sie wird deshalb als eine neue Unterart Daphnia laevis tarasca klassifiziert.
20105523|Gammarus locusta (L.) has a distribution area that spreads for about 35 degrees of latitude, thereby being one of the most common and widely distributed European Atlantic Gammarus spp. Along the southern distribution limit of the species, no genetic studies have been performed yet. We analysed allozyme variation in five G. locusta populations along the Portuguese coast, comprising ten enzymes and thirteen loci. Average heterozygosity was 0.023 and average polymorphism among G. locusta populations was 11.6%. Genetic differentiation among populations was very low and no geographic pattern emerged from these data. The analysed G. locusta populations have low inter- and intra-population variability. These results are consistent with previous allozyme investigations of northern European populations of G. locusta, where very low levels of genetic variability were also recorded, and with recent studies which reported that low genetic variability is a common feature in widespread, continuously distributed amphipod species. Taken together, these findings indicate that the low genetic variability may be generalized all across G. locusta's distributional range. Further research is required to determine how G. locusta and other species of amphipods that show low genetic variability respond to environmental disturbance. /// O anfpode Gammarus locusta (L.) distribui-se por cerca de 35 graus de latitude, constituindo uma das espcies de Gammarus da Europa Atlntica mais comum e amplamente distribuda. Ao longo do limite sul de distribuio desta espcie no foram ainda realizados estudos genticos. Neste estudo analismos a variao aloenzimtica em cinco populaes de G. locusta da costa Portuguesa, compreendendo dez enzimas e treze loci. A heterozigotia mdia foi de 0,023 e o polimorfismo mdio entre populaes de G. locusta foi de 11,6%. A diferenciao gentica entre populaes foi muito baixa, no tendo sido encontrado em funo destes dados nenhum padro geogrfico. As populaes de G. locusta analisadas apresentaram variabilidade inter- e intrapopulacional reduzida. Estes resultados so consistentes quer com estudos anteriores de aloenzimas em populaes de G. locusta do norte da Europa, em que foram registados tambm nveis muito baixos de variabilidade gentica, quer com estudos recentes que referem que a variabilidade gentica reduzida  um facto comum em espcies de anfpodes de distribuio ampla e contnua. No seu conjunto, estas observaes indicam que a variabilidade gentica reduzida poder ocorrer de forma generalizada ao longo de todo o intervalo de distribuio de G. locusta. Assim, torna-se necessria investigao adicional que permita determinar de que modo o anfpode G. locusta, bem como outras espcies de anfipodes com variabilidade gentica reduzida, reagem s perturbaes ambientais.
20107840|The gregarious behaviour of juveniles (16-45 mm CL) of the spiny lobster, Panulirus argus in artificial shelters (concrete blocks), was studied in a nursery area in the southwestern region of Cuba. The average size of the juveniles was significantly different (df = 3; F = 796.60; P &lt 0.001) among the periods analysed (1982-1984, average = 45.90 mm CL; 1986-1988, average = 36.82 mm CL; 1989-1991, average = 37.33 mm CL; and 1992-1994, average = 39.46 mm CL) but it was not between sexes (df = 1; F = 0.3640 ns; P = 0.55). The proportion of males and females did not differ significantly from 1: 1 in sizes between 20 and 50 mm (CL). The sexes could be distinguished at a size of 16-20 mm (CL) and this was also the size-class that emerged from settlement places and adopted gregarious behaviour. As the source of immigrants to the nursery area was from the south, the southern shelters, located approximately 17 km from the barrier reef, were the first to be colonized. The highly significant relationship between the abundance of juveniles and pre-recruits (N = 13, R = 0.8314, P &lt 0.001), suggests that the variations in abundance of the recruitment observed are displayed in all nursery areas. The high densities of lobster juveniles in nursery areas, their gregarious behaviour, their territorial migratory habits, and the evident decrease of recruitment to nursery areas in the Gulf of Bataban from 1988 onwards, suggest that introduction of artificial shelters might help diminish natural mortality of post-pueruli and juveniles in these phases and increase recruitment to fishing areas. /// El comportamiento gregario de los juveniles (16-45 mm LC) de langosta espinosa Panulirus argus en refugios artificiales (bloques de concreto), fueron estudiados en un rea de cra de la regin suroccidental de Cuba. La talla media de los juveniles fue significativamente diferente (gl = 3; F = 796,60; P &lt 0,001) entre los perodos analizados (1982-1984, media = 45,90 mm; 1986-1988, media = 36,82 mm; 1989-1991, media = 37,33 mm; y 1992-1994, media = 39,46 mm, LC) pero entre sexos no lo fue (df = 1; F = 0,3640 ns; P = 0,55). Las proporciones entre machos y hembras no difieren significativamente de 1: 1 entre las tallas 20-50 mm (LC). Entre 16 y 20 mm (LC) se pudieron diferenciar los sexos y a partir de este intervalo se consider que las langostas emergen desde los sitios de asentamiento y comienzan a tener un comportamiento gregario. Como la fuente de los inmigrantes al rea de cra fue desde el sur, los refugios del sur, localizados aproximadamente a 17 km de la barrera arrecifal, fueron los primeros que se colonizaban. La relacin significativa entre al abundancia de los juveniles y los pre-reclutas (N = 13, R = 0,8314, P &lt 0,001), sugiere que las variaciones de la abundancia de los reclutamientos observados se extienden en todas las reas de cra. La elevada densidad de juveniles, su comportamiento gregario, sus hbitos migratorios territoriales y el evidente decrecimiento del reclutamiento en el Golfo de Bataban desde 1988, sugieren la introduccin de refugios artificiales con el objetivo de disminuir la mortalidad natural de post-purulos y juveniles e incrementar el reclutamiento al rea de pesca.
20107476|Research surveys were conducted monthly between July 2002 and June 2003 along the coast of Iskenderun Bay. A total of 1746 crabs were captured at 6 localities in depths of 4 to 50 m. Twenty different species were identified. Among these, Atergatis roseus (Rppell, 1830), Charybdis helleri (A. Milne-Edwards, 1867), Charybdis longicollis Leene, 1938, Ixa monodi Holthuis & Gottlieb, 1956, Myra subgranulata Kossmann, 1877, and Portunus pelagicus (Linnaeus, 1758) are of Indo-Pacific origin. Nine species, Dromia personata (Linnaeus, 1758), Eriphia verrucosa (Forskl, 1775), Ethusa mascarone (Herbst, 1785), Liocarcinus depurator (Linnaeus, 1758), Liocarcinus navigator (Herbst, 1794), Macropodia rostrata (Linnaeus, 1761), Maja squinado (Herbst, 1788), Pachygrapsus marmoratus (Fabricius, 1787), and Portumnus latipes (Pennant, 1777) were recorded for the first time from this bay. The most abundant species found in the bay were Charybdis longicollis, Portunus pelagicus, and Callinectes sapidus Rathbun, 1896. /// Des suivis mensuels ont t raliss entre juillet 2002 et juin 2003 le long de la cte de la baie d'Iskenderun. Un total de 1746 crabes ont t capturs dans 6 localits  des profondeurs de 4  50 m. Parmi ceux-ci, Atergatis roseus (Rppell, 1830), Charybdis helleri (A. Milne-Edwards, 1867), Charybdis longicollis Leene, 1938, Ixa monodi Holthuis & Gottlieb, 1956, Myra subgranulata Kossmann, 1877, et Portunus pelagicus (Linnaeus, 1758) sont d'origine indo-pacifique. Neuf espces, Dromia personata (Linnaeus, 1758), Eriphia verrucosa (Forskl, 1775), Ethusa mascarone (Herbst, 1785), Liocarcinus depurator (Linnaeus, 1758), Liocarcinus navigator (Herbst, 1794), Macropodia rostrata (Linnaeus, 1761), Maja squinado (Herbst, 1788), Pachygrapsus marmoratus (Fabricius, 1787) et Portumnus latipes (Pennant, 1777) ont t identifis pour la premire fois dans cette baie. 27743322|Research has shown that the major chelae of male crayfish, Orconectes rusticus, are important chemosensory appendages and may aid in the perception and discrimination of female odours. However, it is unclear whether the major chelae are important for localization of female odour sources. In this study, we examined the role of sensory information from the major chelae in the localization and discrimination of conspecific female odours. We analysed the behavioural reactions of form I male crayfish to two different odour treatments: reproductive female-conditioned water or water (controls) delivered from one end of a test arena. Also, all male crayfish either had their chelae intact or sensory blocked. We measured locomotory behaviours in response to odours and chelae treatments. In addition, behaviours performed at the source of the odour were quantified. Male crayfish with intact chelae spent more time closer to a reproductive female odour source, whereas crayfish with blocked chelae showed no preference. There was no response to water. Male crayfish demonstrated differences in chelae waving and other local behaviours in response to female odours. These results suggest that the major chelae are important sensory structures, which aid in the localization and discrimination of female odours. /// Des recherches ont montr que la pince principale de l'crevisse mle Orconectes rusticus est un important appendice chmorcepteur et pourrait aider  la perception et la discrimination des odeurs des femelles. Cependant, il n'est pas clair si la pince principale est importante pour la localisation de la source des odeurs femelles. Dans cette tude, nous avons examin le rle de la pince principale dans l'information sensorielle comme la localisation et la discrimination des odeurs femelles con-spcifiques. Nous avons analys le comportement de la forme I des mles d'crevisse  deux diffrents traitements olfactifs: de l'eau de femelles conditionnes  la reproduction ou de l'eau (contrle) provenant de la fin de la zone de test. De plus toutes les crevisses mles avaient soit leur pince intacte ou sensoriellement bloque. Nous avons mesur le comportement de locomotion en rponse aux traitements odorants et de la pince. De plus les comportements effectus  la source de l'odeur ont t quantifis. Les mles avec une pince intacte passent plus de temps prs de la source d'odeur de femelles en reproduction, tandis que les crevisses avec des pinces bloques ne montrent aucune prfrence. Il n'y a eu aucune rponse  l'eau tmoin. Les mles d'crevisse dmontrent des diffrences dans le mouvement des pinces et d'autres comportements locaux en rponse  l'odeur des femelles. Ces rsultats suggrent que les pinces principales sont des structures sensorielles importantes, qui pourraient aider  la localisation et la discrimination des odeurs des femelles.

20107837|In the present paper, six Glyphocrangon species are reported from the South and East China seas including five species newly recorded for the Chinese seas, viz., G. caeca Wood-Mason & Alcock, 1891, G. fimbriata Komai & Takeuchi, 1994, G. juxtaculeata Chace, 1984, G. megalophthalma De Man, 1918, and G. robusta Komai, 2004. /// Dans cette note, six espces de Glyphocrangon sont rpertories dans le sud et l'est de la mer de Chine, incluant cinq espces nouvellement trouves en mer de Chine: G. caeca Wood-Mason & Alcock, 1891, G. fimbriata Komai & Takeuchi, 1994, G. juxtaculeata Chace, 1984, G. megalophthalma De Man, 1918, and G. robusta Komai, 2004.
23034287|Delavalia qingdaoensis, a new species of harpacticoid copepod of the family Miraciidae is described based on specimens sorted from sediment samples collected in Jiaozhou Bay, Qingdao, Shandong Peninsula, Yellow Sea, in May 2008. The new species is easily distinguished from its congeners by the combined characters of the antennulary segments, an apomorphic setal formula of the swimming legs, and the shape of P5 in both sexes. It is remarkably similar to D. bocqueti (Soyer, 1971) and D. latioperculata (It, 1981), but it differs from D. bocqueti by features of the caudal rami, antennule, antennary endopod, mandibular exopod, maxillipedal basis, and P5 endopodal lobe; from D. latioperculata by the caudal rami, the inner setae of P1-P4 enp-1, P2 enp-2, and P4 exp-3, and the shape of P5 in both sexes. Delavalia qingdaoensis, une nouvelle espce de coppode harpacticode de la famille des Miraciidae est dcrite  partir de spcimens provenant d'chantillons de sdiments collects dans la Baie de Jiaozhou, Qingdao, Pninsule de Shandong, Mer Jaune, en mai 2008. La nouvelle espce se distingue aisment de ses congnres par une combinaison de caractres sur les segments de l'antennule, une formule stale apomorphe des pattes natatoires ainsi que sur la forme de la P5 dans les deux sexes. Elle ressemble de faon remarquable  D. bocqueti (Soyer, 1971) et  D. latioperculata (It, 1981), mais diffre de D. bocqueti par des caractristiques des rames furcales, de l'antennule, de l'endopodite de l'antenne, de l'exopodite de la mandibule, du basis du maxillipde et du lobe de l'endopodite de P5; elle se diffrencie de D. latioperculata par les rames furcales, les soies internes de l'endopodite 1 de P1-P4, de l'endopodite 2 de P2, de l'exopodite 3 de P4, et par la forme de la P5 dans les deux sexes.
20105710|A new species of Porcellanid crab from the western Pacific, Petrolisthes bifidus, is described. The species is similar to the species of Borradaile's Petrolisthes lamarckii complex, but is distinguishable from all comparable species by the unusual form of the dactyli of the walking legs, a character so far unique for a Petrolisthes species. /// Eine neue Porcellanidenart aus dem Westpazifik, Petrolisthes bifidus wird beschrieben. Die Art hnelt den Angehrigen von Borradaile's Petrolisthes lamarckii Komplexes, unterscheidet sich aber von allen vergleichbaren Arten durch die auergewhnliche Form der Dactyli der Laufbeine, die bisher einzigartig fr eine Petrolisthes-Art ist.
20107913|The objective of this study was to determine the length-length and length-weight relationships in Parapenaeus longirostris as a basis for conversions. Specimens were collected with hauls from the commercial trawler "Hapulolu" between 9 and 12 December 2006 in Sack Bay and Kuadas Bay in the Aegean Sea. Morphometric equations for the conversions of length and weight were constructed for females, males, and combined sexes. The equations for carapace length (CL), total length (TL), and body width (BW) for combined sexes were found as CL = 0.2296  TL - 2.272, r = 0.97, BW = 0.3708  CL + 0.7694, r = 0.91, and BW = 0.0861  TL - 0.169, r = 0.90, respectively. The length-weight relationship was determined as W = 0.0031  $\text{TL}^{3.108}$ , r = 0.98 for total length and W = 0.546  $\text{CL}^{2.743}$ , r = 0.97 for carapace length. Males were generally smaller than females (K-S test; p &lt 0.05) and size-frequency distributions (TL, CL, and BW) revealed differences between females and males (K-S test; p &lt 0.05). Various length-length and length-weight regressions were also found to differ with sex (F test; p &lt 0.05), except TL-CL (F = 0.40; p &gt 0.05). /// L'objectif de cette tude a t de dterminer les relations longueur-longueur et longueur-poids chez Parapenaeus longirostris pour servir de base de conversion. Les spcimens ont t collects  l'aide des traits de filet par le chalutier commercial "Hapulolu" entre le 9 et le 12 dcembre 2006 dans les baies de Sack et Kuadas, en mer Ege. Les quations morphomtriques pour les conversions de la longueur et du poids ont t tablies pour les femelles, les mles et les sexes combins. Les quations pour la longueur de la carapace (CL), la longueur totale (TL) et la largeur du corps (BW) pour les sexes combins sont respectivement de: CL = 0.2296  TL - 2.272, r = 0.97; BW = 0.3708  CL + 0.7694, r = 0.91; et BW = 0.0861  TL - 0.169, r = 0.90. La relation longueur-poids a t dtermine comme W = 0.0031  $\text{TL}^{3.108}$ , r = 0.98 pour la longueur totale et W = 0.546  $\text{CL}^{2.743}$ , r = 0.97 pour la longueur de la carapace. Les males sont en gnral plus petits que les femelles (K-S test; p &lt 0.05) et la frquence de distribution des tailles (TL, CL et BW) rvle des diffrences entre les femelles et les mles (K-S test; p &lt 0.05). Diffrentes rgressions longueur -longueur et longueur -poids montrent aussi une diffrence entre les sexes (F test; p &lt 0.05), sauf pour TL-CL (F = 0.40; p &gt 0.05).
20102109|Eine Assoziation zwischen dem bopyriden Parasiten Hemiarthrus abdominalis und seinem Krebswirt wird aus Gebieten des nordstlichen und nordwestlichen Atlantischen Ozeans berichtet. Es werden Daten vorgelegt ber die Gegenwart parasitierter Wirte in Populationen von Pandalus montagui vor der Ostkste Englands und in einer Population von Pandalus borealis vor Nova Scotia, Kanada. In beiden Fllen ist der Grad der Parasitierung gering. Im stlichen England waren Parasiten in P. montagui-Proben oft nicht vorhanden; die hchste Befallsrate im Verlauf von 6 Jahren war 3,9% (1966). Ein Survey vor Cape Canso, Nova Scotia, ergab einen Parasitenbefall bei P. borealis von 0,6% (1967). In beiden Gebieten traten parasitierte Wirtstiere nur in einem beschrnkten Bereich der Population auf. Im Osten Englands waren Parasiten hauptschlich assoziiert mit "O"-Gruppen-Weibchen von P. montagui; demwegen ergaben sich vor Nova Scotia Hinweise fr einen erhhten Parasitenbefall bei transitionalen P. borealis. Eine gewichtsmige Beziehung zwischen Wirtstier und Parasit wurde fr P. montagui im Osten Englands erhoben.
20104703|Prsentation d'un systme relativement simple pour maintenir en vie un crustac d'eau douce, Hyalella azteca (Amphipode), sous des conditions statiques et confines. Des colonies viables ont t obtenues en introduisant dans des rcipients de verre d'un litre une seule femelle fconde ou un seul couple mle-femelle. Des cultures viables de H. azteca dans l'cosystme ferm ont t maintenues jusqu' 15 mois, la seule entre de l'extrieur tant celle de la photoradiation. 29779479|A study of the cladoceran community in three rice fields at Nakhon Si Thammarat was carried out from June to September 2007. A total of 21 taxa of Cladocera was recorded. Of these, nine belong to the family Chydoridae, three are from the Macrothricidae, two each from the families Bosminidae, Daphniidae, Moinidae, and Sididae, and one species from the family Ilyocryptidae. The primary species of these three areas were Moinodaphnia macleayi, Diaphanosoma excisum, and Bosminopsis deitersi, and these were also the most frequently found taxa. The dominant species changed throughout a crop cycle: during the seedling stage, B. deitersi (27.91%); during the growing period, Macrothrix triserialis (30.05%); and in the harvesting period, D. excism (35.40%). Nitrogen, nitrite, and phosphate were shown to play a major role in establishing the distribution of the cladoceran community over a crop cycle. Une tude de la communaut des Cladocres dans trois rizires  Nakhon Si Thammarat a t mene de juin  septembre 2007. Au total, 21 taxons de Cladocres ont t identifi. Parmi ceux-ci, neuf appartiennent  la famille des Chydoridae, trois  la famille des Macrothricidae, deux  chacune des familles Bosminidae, Daphniidae, Moinidae et Sididae et une espce  la famille des Ilyocryptidae. Les espces typiques de ces trois rgions sont Moinodaphnia macleayi, Diaphanosoma excisum et Bosminopsis deitersi, et ce sont aussi les taxons les plus frquemment trouvs. Les espces dominantes changeaient au cours d'un cycle de rcolte: au cours du repiquage, l'espce dominante tait B. deitersi (27,91%); pendant la phase de croissance, Macrothrix triserialis (30,05%); et dans la priode de rcolte D. excisum (35,40%). L'azote, les nitrites et les phosphates sont dmontrs comme jouant un rle majeur en dterminant la rpartition de la communaut des Cladocres au cours du cycle de culture.

20088746|Tisbe holothuriae was collected from the Saronicos Gulf (Greece) and cultured in the laboratory at various conditions. Growth of females reared under 12 combinations of temperature (14-24C) and salinity (26-44) and 7 different diets was evaluated. Adult female body length increased slightly with salinity and decreased greatly with temperature, with a maximum value (1.096 mm) at 14C and 38. There were no apparent interactions between these factors. Length is related to temperature and salinity by the following equation, L = 1.39 + 0.025S - 0.0003S - 0.071T + 0.0009T + 0.00005ST. There were no significant differences in length of adult females as a result of testing 7 different diets. Significant differences in length were found between the instars on successive days of development, except between the 4th and 5th day, when nauplii were transformed to copepodites. /// Tisbe holothuriae a t recueilli dans le golfe de Saronikos (Grce) et lev en laboratoire sous des conditions varies. La longueur du corps de la femelle adulte s'est lgrement accrue avec la salinit et a fortement dcru avec la temprature, avec une valeur maximale (1,096 mm)  14C et 38. Il n'y avait pas d'interactions apparentes entre ces facteurs. La longueur est lie  la temprature et  la salinit par l'quation suivante: L = 1,39 + 0,025S - 0,0003S - 0,071T + 0,0009T + 0,00005ST. L'essai des 7 rgimes alimentaires n'a pas montr de diffrences significantives dans la longueur des femelles adultes. Des diffrences significatives dans cette longueur ont t trouves entre les stades au cours des jours successifs du dveloppement, sauf entre les 4me et 5me jours, quand les nauplii se transformaient en coppodites.
20104995|A new species of the genus Holobomolochus is described. It is not only new to science taxonomically, but is the first species to be described from African coastal waters and the southern hemisphere. Holobomolochus maleus sp.n. is recorded for the first time from the gills and inner operculum of Malacocephalus laevis off the west coast of South Africa. It differs from the thirteen known species by virtue of its unique leg-armature, which serves as a distinguishing feature. /// Une nouvelle espce du genre Holobomolochus est dcrite. Elle n'est pas seulement nouvelle taxonomiquement, mais c'est la premire espce  tre dcrite des eaux ctires africaines et de l'hmisphre sud. Holobomolochus maleus sp.n. est signal pour la premire fois des branchies et de l'opercule interne de Malacocephalus laevis au large de la cte occidentale d'Afrique du Sud. II diffre des treize autres espces connues par le caractre unique de l'armature des pattes, qui sert comme un trait distinctif.
20105287|An inventory of the chonotrich species (Protozoa, Ciliophora) epibiont on crustaceans has been carried out. This work, which focused on the most exclusive ciliate group epibiontic on crustaceans, presents data concerning 112 chonotrich species, their taxonomic position, and their basibiont species. This overview may be used in further studies on protozoan-crustacean epibiosis. /// Se ha realizado un inventario de las especies de conotrquidos (Protozoa, Ciliophora) epibiontes en crustceos. Este trabajo, centrado en el grupo de ciliados epibiontes ms exclusivo de los crustceos, presenta datos de 112 especies de conotrquidos, su posicin taxonmica y sus especies basibiontes. Este estudio puede ser usado en posteriores investigaciones sobre la epibiosis protozoos-crustceos.
20102865|Eine neue Ostracodenfamilie wird beschrieben. Sie kommt fossil im Karibischen Meer, Europa und Australien vor und wird lebend gefunden im Indopazifik und auf pazifischen Inseln. Die Familie basiert auf Saipanella n. gen. und schliesst Cardobairdia Van den Bild -- mglicherweise auch Sigillium Kuznetsova -- ein. Ihre kologischen Assoziationen und phylogenetischen Beziehungen werden kurz errtert.

Le dveloppement est abrg avec un seul stade zo nageur d'un dure d'environ trois ou quatre jours. La larve est compare  celle de M. andamanicus (Wood-Mason) avec laquelle il y a de proches affinits, et aux larves de Nephrops norvegicus (Linn). 20102210|Description of a new species of isopod, Paramunna foliacea sp. n., collected from an abyssal station in the Guinea basin.
20105658|The influence of methyl farnesoate in the regulation of gonad development in the prawn, Macrobrachium malcolmsonii was investigated. Injection of methyl farnesoate into female and male prawns significantly increased mean oocyte diameter and testicular follicle diameter as well as mean ovarian indices and testicular indices, respectively. These results provide strong evidence that methyl farnesoate is involved in the control of reproduction in prawns. /// L'influence du methyl-farnesoate dans la rgulation du dveloppement de la gonade chez la crevette Macrobrachium malcolmsonii a t tudie. L'injection de methyl-farnesoate chez les mles et les femelles ont accru de faon significative, respectivement, le diamtre moyen des ovocytes et le diamtre des follicules testiculaires ainsi que les indices ovarien et testiculaire moyens. Ces rsultats mettent en vidence le fait que le methyl-farnesoate intervient dans le contrle de la reproduction chez ces crevettes.
20105790|The taxonomy of the African gecarcinucid fresh-water crabs in the Globonautinae Bott, 1969, is reviewed. The subfamily is recognised by a mandibular palp with a terminal segment with two large, subequal-sized lobes, by a third maxilliped which lacks a flagellum on the exopod, by a straight-sided triangular male abdomen, and by a West African origin. The Globonautinae are compared with the other subfamilies of the Gecarcinucidae Rathbun, 1904. Gecarcinautes brincki Bott, 1960, is removed from the Gecarcinucidae and reassigned to the Potamonautidae. Keys to distinguish the families of African fresh-water crabs and the subfamilies of the Gecarcinucidae are included, and the biogeographical implications of the taxonomic revision are discussed. /// Rvision de la taxonomie des crabes d'eau douce Gecarcinucidae ouest-africains appartenant  la sous-famille des Globonautinae. Cette sous-famille est caractrise par le palpe mandibulaire dont l'article terminal est pourvu de deux grands lobes subgaux, par l'absence de flagelle sur l'exopodite du troisime maxillipde, par l'abdomen du mle triangulaire  cts rectilignes, et par l'origine ouest-africaine. Les Globonautinae sont compars aux autres sous-familles de Gecarcinucidae Rathbun, 1904. Gecarcinautes brincki Bott, 1960, est enlev des Gecarcinucidae et rattribu aux Potamonautidae. Sont incluses des clefs pour distinguer les familles de crabes d'eau douce africains, et les implications biogographiques dcoulant de la rvision taxonomiques sont discutes.
20105970|The feeding chronology of Procambarus clarkii has never been described. Consequently, the author (1) presents data on seasonal and circadian foraging activity of this species, (2) tests statistically the observed patterns, and (3) attempts to determine if the foraging periodicity registered here coincides with other rhythms reported elsewhere for this species. Results suggest the existence of seasonal and bimodal circadian foraging patterns. Seasonally, feeding intensity increased over the spring and summer and declined during autumn and winter. Diurnal patterns revealed increased foraging at night and a decrease in the day time. The differences were not significant. Foraging periodicity of P. clarkii is coincident with locomotor rhythms and it seems to result from the interaction between specific endogenous and exogenous factors. /// La chronologie de l'alimentation de Procambarus clarkii n'a jamais t dcrite. Par consquent, l'auteur: (1) prsente des informations sur l'activit alimentaire saisonnire er circadienne de l'espce, (2) teste statistiquement les modles observs, et (3) tente de dterminer si la priodicit alimentaire enregistre concide avec d'autres rythmes signals pour cette espce. Les rsultats suggrent l'existence de modles saisonniers et circadiens bimodaux. En ce qui concerne les saisons, l'intensit d'alimentation a augment pendant le printemps et l't, et diminu pendant l'automne et l'hiver. Les modles diurnes font apparatre une activit alimentaire accrue  la nuit et diminue de jour, les diffrences n'tant pas significatives. La priodicit alimentaire de P. clarkii concide avec les rythmes locomoteurs et semble rsulter de l'interaction spcifique de facteurs endognes et exognes.
20102661|Au cours du dveloppement de Thysanoessa raschii les stades suivants ont t mis en vidence: 2 nauplii, 1 metanauplius, 3 calyptopis et 11 furciliae. La morphologie des stades larvaires diffre d'une rgion  l'autre et, dans une mme rgion, suivant l'poque.
20102405|The authors follow the progress of Elminius modestus in the two regions of Europe in which it has become established. In the first, along the coast of France, the species has gained 95 kilometres towards the south from Etel in Brittany -- the furthest limit previously recorded. In the second, along the Iberian coast, the gain is 175 kilometres towards the east from Jubia, near Ferrol, in Spain and 135 kilometres towards the south from Aveiro in Portugal. Between these two sectors there is, in spite of this progress, a considerable gap which extends from the estuary of the Loire to the neighbourhood of Gijon.
20107562|Six populations of Porcellionides pruinosus from different geographical localities, belonging to five bioclimatic areas in Tunisia, showed a variable reproductive behaviour. Some populations presented seasonal reproduction while other ones exhibited continuous reproduction. Populations with seasonal reproduction showed two distinct breeding peaks. The first peak in spring was characterized by large gravid females with the greatest fecundity and fertility, the second one, in autumn by small females, exhibiting low fecundity and fertility. Females are able to produce two or three broods per reproductive cycle in populations showing seasonal reproduction, and between four and five in continuously breeding populations. Although oscillating throughout the year, the sex ratio was female-biased in most populations, and differences were highly significant in populations with continuous reproduction. Analysis with the scanning electron microscope showed important phenotypic variation between the populations studied in the form of the pleotelson and its lateral borders that seem to exhibit reliable differences between the specimens examined. These features can be used as discriminating characters between populations of Porcellionides pruinosus. /// Un suivi de six populations de Porcellionides pruinosus, en provenance des stations appartenant  des tages bioclimatiques et  des localits gographiques diffrentes en Tunisie, a montr des variations de leur comportement reproducteur; certaines sont caractrises par une reproduction saisonnire, alors que les autres ont montr une activit reproductrice continue tout au long de l'anne. Les populations  reproduction saisonnire ont montr deux pics de reproduction distincts, correspondant  deux pousses, l'une printanire caractrise par des femelles de grande taille ayant une fcondit et une fertilit leves et l'autre automnale reprsente par des femelles de petite taille  fcondit et fertilit faibles. Les femelles sont capables d'effectuer deux  trois portes par cycle de reproduction chez les populations  reproduction saisonnire et quatre  cinq portes chez les populations  activit reproductrice continue. Le sex ratio montre des fluctuations le long de l'anne mais reste toujours en faveur des femelles, avec des diffrences hautement significatives dans les populations  reproduction continue. L'examen microscopique de certains individus de ces 6 populations a permis de dceler des variations phnotypiques importantes au niveau de la forme du plotelson et ses bords latraux qui montrent a priori des diffrences apprciables entre les reprsentants des populations examines, pouvant ainsi constituer des caractres discriminants des populations de Porcellionides pruinosus.
20105597|Teratocyclops cubensis Plea, 1981 (Copepoda, Cyclopidae) is redescribed on the basis of specimens deposited in the collection of the Speleological Institute "Emil Racovitza", Cluj, Romania. The genus Teratocyclops Plea, 1981 is redefined, mainly characterized by the following characters of the female: the general habitus of the body, the 11-segmented antennule, the presence of the vestigial exopodite on the antenna, the segmentation of the swimming legs, the structure of the distal segment of the endopodite of leg P4 with 1 spine and 3 setae, and the proximal segment of leg 5 fused to the somite. The relationship to the closely related genera Metacyclops Kiefer, 1927, Apocyclops Lindberg, 1942, and Goniocyclops Kiefer, 1955 are discussed. /// Teratocyclops cubensis Plea, 1981 (Copepoda, Cyclopidae) est redcrit  partir des spcimens dposs dans les collections de l'Institutul de Speologie "Emil Racovitza", de Cluj, Roumanie. Le genre Teratocyclops Plea, 1981 est redfini. Il est principalement caractris par les traits suivants de la femelle: la forme gnrale du corps, l'antennule  11 segments, la prsence de l'exopodite vestigial sur l'antenne, la segmentation des pattes natatoires et l'ornementation du dernier segment de l'endopodite de P4 comprenant 1 soie et 3 pines, le segment proximal de P5 soud au somite. Les affinits avec les genres voisins, notamment Metacyclops Kiefer, 1927, Apocyclops Lindberg, 1942 et Goniocyclops Kiefer, 1955 sont discutes.
20103070|A description of the type specimen of Porcellana digitalis Heller, 1862, is provided, and its identity with Petrolisthes armatus (Gibbes, 1850) established. The type locality of Heller's species, "Gibraltar", like those of many other new species collected by the 1857-1859 "Novara" Expedition, is unreliable, and should be disregarded, unless supported by new material.
20103340|Esterases and acid phosphatases were studied of 6 species of ostracod genera Cyprinotus Br. and Notodromas Lillj. from Poland, using method of electrophoretic separation of isoenzymes on polyacrylamide gel (no zymograms could be obtained of the peroxidase and dehydrogenase isoenzymes). For separations a plate device was applied, which enabled to perform accurate comparisons of the pictures obtained. There were about 20 specimens of given species in a sample, thus zymograms of mentioned proteins "resultant" of studied population were examined. Dependence of the esterase and acid phosphatase zymograms on ontogenetic development, sex, species and morphological variation within the species was analysed. Esterases appear to be more "inert" than the acid phosphatases (they are markedly less strongly differentiated than acid phosphatases; the conclusions on similarity between the species as determined by the former coincide with the conclusions from the morphological studies, otherwise than in the case of the latter). Usefulness of results obtained is discussed, and necessity of further studies is proved.

Der Ursprung dieses Gebildes wird vermutet entweder in der Zwischenfussplatte der einfachen Maxillipeden, in der Cuticula der Brustregion des Cephalothorax oder in einem Paar zusammengewachsener Anhnge. Fnf Arten der Caligoiden, die auf Hawaiischen Fischen gesammelt wurden, bringen etwas Licht in zwei von den drei angenommenen Entstehungsarten. 23034321|This study provides information concerning the feeding behaviour of Goniopsis cruentata (Latreille, 1803), through analysis of stomach contents according to demographic categories. Collections were carried out monthly from May 2005 through April 2006 in a subtropical estuary on the southeastern Brazilian coast (232924S 451012W). The crabs were collected by hand, with a 2-hour sampling effort by three people. In the laboratory, the crabs were sexed and measured for greatest carapace width, and grouped into demographic categories: adult males, juvenile males, adult females, juvenile females, and ovigerous females. For the fullness analysis, the stomachs were grouped into two categories: (1) E = Empty, with no food; and (2) F = Full, whether partially filled or totally. The frequency-of-occurrence method was used to characterize feeding behaviour, and the demographic categories recognired were compared. We obtained stomachs from 171 adult males, 69 juvenile males, 136 adult females, 72 juvenile females, and 41 ovigerous females, of which 85.6% were full. Of the eight food items recorded, sediment was the most frequent, and "unidentified material" was the least. Goniopsis cruentata can be characterized as a generalist feeder, exploiting most of the food items available in the mangrove swamps. In spite of this generalist behaviour, the dominant presence of sediment suggests that G. cruentata is primarily a detritivore that exploits particulate organic matter from microbial biodegradation, one of the most important mangrove functions. The trophic role of this crab in the ecosystem showed no significant differences among the demographic categories, and seems to be wider than those observed for sesarmid and ocypodid mangrove crabs. These ecosystem engineers may occupy different positions in the trophic chains of estuarine environments. Este estudo providencia informaes sobre a composio da dieta do caranguejo Goniopsis cruentata (Latreille, 1803) por meio de anlise do contedo estomacal, caracterizando os hbitos alimentares nas diferentes categorias demogrficas bem como a dinmica temporal da alimentao desses animais. O estudo foi realizado em um esturio em Ubatuba, Estado de So Paulo, litoral sudeste do Brasil, no perodo de maio de 2005 a maio de 2006. Os estmagos foram retirados e conservados em lcool 70%. Foi utilizado o mtodo de Freqncia de Ocorrncia e as categorias demogrficas foram comparadas. Foram analisados 489 estmagos, sendo 171 de machos adultos com tamanho mdio de 33,14  6,4 mm LC, 69 de machos jovens de tamanho mdio 21,16  4,9 mm LC, 136 de fmeas adultas, com tamanho mdio de 32,9  5,1 mm LC, 72 de fmeas jovens, com tamanho mdio de 24,0  3,3 mm LC e 41 estmagos de fmeas ovgeras, com tamanho mdio de 35,4  4,4 mm LC. Foram identificados oito itens alimentares, sendo Sedimento o mais representativo. No foi verificada diferena significativa entre as categorias alimentares entre as diferentes fases de desenvolvimento nem em relao aos sexos, com exceo do item mollusca, mais freqente nos estmagos de fmeas. Houve diferena significativa entre fmeas adultas e fmeas ovgeras para os itens alimentares: algas, mollusca, vegetal e sedimento. No foram observadas alteraes significativas na dieta nas diferentes estaes do ano. Apesar do predomnio do sedimento da composio da dieta de G. cruentata, a espcie demonstrou explorar vrios outros itens alimentares. A maior importncia do sedimento sugere que a espcie adote a detritivoria como seu principal mtodo para a obteno de alimento, entretanto, a variedade de itens alimentares encontrados no trato digestivo tambm aponta G. cruentata como oportunista e generalista.

Dadurch kommt es auch zu einem mglichen Transport des aufgewirbelten Sediments.
