20106212|Phylogenetic relationships between the known genera of the order Misophrioida permit the identification of two lineages: one consisting of the family Misophriidae Brady, 1878 which comprises seven genera, and a new, monotypic family, the Palpophriidae Boxshall & Jaume, 1999; the other consisting of another new family, the Speleophriidae Boxshall & Jaume, 1999, comprising eight genera. Habitat exploitation by these families is discussed: members of the Misophriidae are primarily hyperbenthic, those of the Palpophriidae and Speleophriidae are primarily cavernicolous in anchialine habitats. The occurrence of misophriids in littoral and submarine caves is interpreted as evidence of a relatively recent landward extension of the habitat range in this family, from a shallow-water hyperbenthic ancestor. The distribution of speleophriids in anchialine caves is interpreted as resulting from a colonization episode prior to the closure of the Tethys Sea. The analysis also indicates that deep-water forms may represent a secondary colonization rather than an indication of deep-water ancestry for the entire order. /// El estudio de las relaciones filogenticas entre los distintos gneros pertenecientes al orden Misophrioida ha permitido la identificacin de dos linajes principales: uno compuesto por la familia Misophriidae Brady, 1878, integrada por siete gneros, y una familia nueva, Palpophriidae Boxshall & Jaume, 1999; el otro, integrado por otra nueva familia, Speleophriidae Boxshall & Jaume, 1999, compuesta por ocho gneros. Se discute la explotacin que del hbitat hacen estas familias: los Misophriidae son primariamente hiperbnticos, mientras que Palpophriidae y Speleophriidae son caverncolas en medio anquialino. La presencia de misofridos en cuevas litorales y submarinas es interpretado como evidencia de una relativamente reciente extensin tierra adentro del hbitat ordinario de esta familia, a partir de un ancestro hiperbntico propio de aguas someras. La distribucin de los espeleofridos en cuevas anquialinas es interpretada como resultado de un episodio de colonizacin anterior a la oclusin del mar de Tetis. El anlisis indica tambin que las formas de aguas profundas representan una colonizacin secundaria mas que indicacin de un ancestro de aguas profundas para el orden entero.
20102089|Balanus variegatus Darwin est une espce trs commune qui se fixe sur les navires et qui se rencontre tout le long de la cte de l'Inde et de ses les subocaniques. Le dveloppement complet du premier nauplius au stade cypris est dcrit. Le dveloppement larvaire en laboratoire comprend un premier stade nauplius qui ne dure qu'une heure, suivi de cinq autres stades naupliens, dont chacun dure gnralement un jour et demi. Le stade cypris peut durer deux jours, avant la transformation en un jeune adulte. La mtamorphose complte, dans de bonnes conditions, s'tend ainsi sur neuf ou dix jours. Les stades naupliens de B. variegatus prsentent des caractristiques, en particulier la spinulation de la carapace et le processus abdominal, qui permettent de les sparer facilement des nauplii de Balanus amphitrite amphitrite et des autres espces de Balanes. Le stade cypris mesure environ 615  de longueur, c'est  dire environ 100  de plus que celui de B. a. amphitrite et environ 200  de plus que celui de Ch. withersi lev dans ce laboratoire.

20104588|La relation d'allomtrie est utilise pour analyser et comparer 48 populations du complexe Jaera albifrons (Isopode). Les 8879 individus analyss comprennent des mles des cinq espces, des femelles de trois espces, et des hybrides interspcifiques des deux sexes. Dans chaque population, une variable synthtique de taille, calcule pour chaque individu, est utilise comme rfrence au lieu de la longueur du corps utilise prcdemment. Cette valeur est obtenue par projection des points individuels sur la premire composante d'une analyse en composantes principales. Dans la moiti des populations la premire composante absorbe plus de 99% de la variabilit totale. Par cette mthode, le gain en homognit des gradients de croissance est considrable. Les gradients de croissance tablis pour les mles des diffrentes populations montrent une grande homognit intra-spcifique et des diffrences faibles mais significatives entre les espces. Les gradients de croissance sont identiques pour les femelles, quelle que soit l'espce, mais diffrents de ceux des mles. Une tentative pour reconstituer l'volution des gradients de croissance a t faite.
20102532|The genus Actaecia (Isopoda, Oniscoidea) has usually been referred to the subfamily Scyphacinae of the Oniscidae. The author shows that, since pseudotracheae are present in the five pairs of pleopods, this genus must be placed in the superfamily Pseudotracheata. It seems necessary to establish for this genus a special family, the Actaeciidae.

20107420|Gerulusosacculus commutabilis, a new genus and species of the family Asterocheridae Giesbrecht, 1899 (Copepoda: Siphonostomatoida) is described, based on specimens collected with a bottom trawl from the continental margin off equatorial Africa (Angola) at a depth of 1288-1289 m. The new genus is added to a group of 9 genera of asterocherids (Australomyzon Nicholls, 1944; Bythocheres Humes, 1988; Cheramomyzon Humes, 1989; Collocheres Canu, 1893; Collocherides Stock, 1971; Dermatomyzon Claus, 1889; Glyptocheres Humes, 1987; Ophiurocheres Humes, 1998; Rhynchomyzon Giesbrecht, 1895), which is distinguished by the 5-segmented urosome in the female and the 6-segmented urosome in the male. Gerulusosacculus differs from all other genera in this group in having an elongate body, a dorso-ventrally flattened prosome, the genital somite of female and male 2.3 times as wide as long, the rostrum with a broad edge, the terminal claw of the antenna and of the maxilliped divided into two parts by a transverse suture, the swimming legs 1-4 with slender setae bearing short setules, the lobe-like leg 5, and the elongate caudal rami. The variability and the asymmetry of the armature of the swimming legs 2-4 are additional remarkable features of G. commutabilis. /// Gerulusosacculus commutabilis, une espce nouvelle d'un genre nouveau, de la famille des Asterocheridae Giesbrecht, 1899 (Copepoda, Siphonostomatoida) est dcrite,  partir de femelles et mles rcolts  l'aide d'un chalut, au large de l'Afrique quatoriale (Angola)  la profondeur de 1288-1289 m. Le nouveau genre s'ajoute  un groupe de 9 genres (Australomyzon Nicholls, 1944; Bythocheres Humes, 1988; Cheramomyzon Humes, 1989; Collocheres Canu, 1893; Collocherides Stock, 1971; Dermatomyzon Claus, 1889; Glyptocheres Humes, 1987; Ophiurocheres Humes, 1998; Rhynchomyzon Giesbrecht, 1895) qui se distinguent par l'urosome de la femelle  5 somites et l'urosome du mle  6 somites. Gerulusosacculus diffre de tous les genres de ce groupe en possdant un corps allong, un prosome aplati dorso-ventralement, le somite gnital chez la femelle et le mle 2,3 fois plus large que long, un rostre  bord large, la griffe terminale de l'antenne et du maxillipde divis en deux parties, les pattes 1-4 pourvues de soies grles portant de courtes stules, une P5 en forme de lobe et de longues rames furcales. La variabilit notable et l'asymtrie de l'armature des pattes natatoires 2-4 constituent un caractre remarquable de G. commutabilis.

20106084|To investigate the reproductive biology of Callinectes ornatus gonadal and moulting cycles were studied over two consecutive years in the Ubatuba region. Six stages of gonadal development were detected in females and four in males. Observations on the number of ovigerous females, on the moulting stages of males and females, and on the percentage of individuals exhibiting mature gonads reveal a continuous reproductive cycle, the stages of which progress at different rates. These data support the hypothesis that C. ornatus shows staggered spawning, with possibly more than one annual reproductive period. A pause in growth before the terminal moult may occur in this species. /// L'volution des gonades et des cycles de mues a t tudie chez Callinectes ornatus, pendant deux ans, dans la rgion de Ubatuba, Brsil, afin de mieux connatre la biologie de la reproduction de cette espce. Six stades dans le dveloppement des gonades ont t observs chez les femelles et quatre chez les mles. L'observation du nombre de femelles ovigres, des stades de mue des mles et des femelles et du pourcentage d'individus sexuellement mrs, montre que la reproduction a lieu toute l'anne. Ceci appuie l'hypothse selon laquelle les Portunidae femelles ont une ponte chelonne, avec probablement plus d'une priode reproductive dans l'anne. Une pause de croissance avant la mue terminale peut exister.
20105651|Population dynamics and production of the amphipod, Orchestia gammarellus were studied for two years in a Ria Formosa saltmarsh (southern Portugal). The animals were sampled every 6th week using pitfall traps and core samples. The highest densities were recorded in the organic matter deposits during spring 1999 (core samples) and most intense activity (pitfall traps) during autumn 1998. Females lived for 8-11 months and reached up to 14 mm body length while males lived for 8-12 months and reached 17 mm body length. Reproduction was continuous and started when females were 6-7 months old. Females produced, on an average, 17 eggs each and fecundity increased with size. Sex ratio was 58% on an annual average. Daily mortality was generally high (0.9%) with higher values in spring/summer (1.8%) and lower in autumn/winter (0.5%). Significant differences in the Von Bertalanffy growth curves were found with males growing faster than females. Annual production has been calculated by the increment summation method as 1.4 g AFDW/m with a corresponding P/B ratio of 3.9. Production rate was highest in spring and summer 1999. It is pointed out that O. gammarellus has adopted an r-strategy to exploit this saltmarsh. /// A dinmica de populaes e a produo do anfpode Orchestia gammarellus foram estudadas durante dois anos num sapal da Ria Formosa (Sul de Portugal). Os animais foram capturados a cada 6 semanas utilizando armadilhas e "cores". As densidades mais elevadas foram registadas nas zonas com depsitos de matria orgnica durante a Primavera de 1999 (cores) e a actividade mais intensa (armadilhas) ocorreu durante o Outono de 1998. As fmeas viveram cerca de 8-11 meses e atingiram um comprimento total de 14 mm enquanto que os machos viveram cerca de 8-12 meses e atingiram 17 mm de comprimento total. A reproduo foi contnua e comeou quando as fmeas tinham 6-7 meses de idade. As fmeas produziram, em mdia, 17 ovos cada uma e a fecundidade aumentou com o tamanho. A mdia anual da proporo de sexos foi de 58%. A mortalidade diria foi geralmente alta (0.9%) com valores mais elevados na Primavera/Vero (1.8%) e mais baixa no Outono/Inverno (0.5%). Foram detectadas diferenas significativas na curva de Von Bertalanffy, crescendo os machos mais rpido que as fmeas. A produo anual foi calculada pelo mtodo da soma de incrementos como 1.4 g PSLC/m com a correspondente razo P/B de 3.9. A taxa de produo foi mais elevada na Primavera e no Vero de 1999. Pensa-se que O. gammarellus adoptou uma estratgia-r para explorar este sapal.
20102508|Limnoria japonica, hitherto known only from the Sea of Japan, is abundant under the thermocline in the arctic waters of the Gulf of St. Lawrence (t. -1 to +7 C). In both these regions arctic waters come close to richly forested coasts. This suggests a present or past arctic distribution of L. japonica, the first example of an arctic gribble. Pachyfolliculina gunneri (Ciliophora, Heterotricha) infests both gribble species. A broad lobate form of Mirofolliculina limnoriae infests L. lignorum; a sharply distinct, narrow, entire form probably belonging to the same species infests L. japonica. Taxonomic notes are given on the commensals Aspidoconcha limnoriae and Redekea sp. (Ostracoda) and Donsiella limnoriae (Copepoda, Harpacticoida), all new to the western Atlantic.
20105987|Eighteen specimens of Portunus hastatus with chromatic characters previously undescribed in the literature, have been caught in the same fishing-area in the course of one year. The characteristics of the crabs and their behaviour were studied in laboratory aquariums. From our data, it appears that the number of crabs with the particular colouration on the dactylus of pereiopod V, as described in our paper, is increasing. /// Diciotto esemplari di Portunus hastatus con caratteristiche cromatiche mai descritte in letteratura, sono stati catturati nella stessa zona di pesca nel corso di un anno. Le caratteristiche ed il comportamento dei granchi sono stati studiati in acquari in laboratorio. Dai dati in nostro possesso sembra che il numero dei granchi con la colorazione particolare del dattilo del V pereiopode descritta in questo lavoro sia in aumento.
20103508|The food of Penaeus monodon Fabricius collected from Makato River, Aklan, consisted mainly of Crustacea (small crabs and shrimps) and molluscs, making up 85% of ingested food. The remaining 15% consisted of fish, polychaetes, ophiuroids, debris, sand, and silt. Results indicate that P. monodon is more of a predator of slow-moving benthic macroinvertebrates rather than a scavenger or detritus feeder. Feeding activity (determined from stomach fullness) of female prawns is significantly higher than that of males. Preliminary experiments on foregut clearance revealed that clearance rate is rapid with 95% of food transported from the foregut 4 hours after feeding. Feeding behavior of P. monodon appears to be associated with the tidal phase. A significantly higher mean gut fullness index indicative of increased feeding activity, was noted when the tide is on the ebb.

Acrenhydrosoma maccalli n.sp. was present in low densities at the 0 m tidal level from March to July 1992. It is distinguished from A. perplexum (T. Scott) by the number of setae on the terminal endopod segment of swimming leg 1 and from A. karlingi Lang by the ornamentation of swimming leg 5 and the length to width ratio of the caudal rami. /// Eine neue Art der Gattung Acrenhydrosoma (Cletodidae) wird beschrieben. A. maccalli kam von Mrz bis Juli 1992 in geringer Dichte am 0 m Gezeitenhorizont vor. Von A. perplexum (T. Scott) unterscheidet sich die neue Art durch die Zahl der Borsten am Terminalglied des Enp. P1 und von A. karlingi Lang durch die Bewehrung des P5 und durch das Lngen-Breiten-Verhltnis der Furkalste.
20103110|Les syntypes de Paralicella tenuipes Chevreux comprenant deux espces mlanges, un lectotype est choisi. La deuxime espce est P. caperesca Shulenberger & Barnard. 20104923|Many podophthalmous Crustacea present a more or less salient external structure near and in proximal position to the compound eyes. It is called sensory pore, eye papilla or eye tubercle, according to shape and author. Some SEM and TEM ultrastructural studies on several Caridea and Penaeidae have revealed a complex structure with at least two chemoreceptor-like organs: the main sensory pore (MSP) and the lateral sensory pore (LSP). MSP is a thin discoidal cuticular zone perforated by micropores. Beneath it there is a layer of sensory-like cells, each with two ciliary outer segments branching into a sub-cuticular cavity. The dendrite parts of the sensory cells are surrounded by supporting cells. The tissue organisation reminds of that of a Vertebrate olfactive mucosa. The LSP consists of a cluster of bipolar sensory cells often ending in a pit similar to an invaginated chemoreceptive seta, found in Arthropoda. The present study deals with the common shrimp Crangon crangon (Linnaeus, 1758), which displays a highly salient conical papilla. This differs in shape from the sensory pores anatomically studied so far. Ultrastructural observations show an important LSP which ends at the tip of the cone rather than in a pit. The equivalent of the MSP is sunken into the base of the cone. This pattern is original and closer to that found in the Penaeidae than to that of the Caridea observed. Therefore, the MSP-LSP complex of Decapoda, in spite of a similar basic structure, presents very different external aspects in different species. It is also confirmed that this complex is very close to, but separate from, the internal organ of Bellonci. /// De nombreux crustacs aux yeux pdonculs prsentent, en retrait des ommatidies, une structure externe nomme pore sensoriel, papille oculaire ou tubercule oculaire, selon la forme et les auteurs. Quelques observations en microscopie lectronique  balayage et  transmission, chez plusieurs familles de Caridea et chez des Penaeidae, ont rvl une structure complexe avec au moins deux organes juxtaposs d'allure chmorceptrice: un pore sensoriel principal (PSP) et un pore sensoriel latral (PSL). Le PSP est limit par une zone amincie de la cuticule sub-circulaire et perce de micropores. Dessous, il y a une assise de cellules bipolaires d'allure sensorielle, dont les dendrites se prolongent par deux segments externes ciliaires qui se ramifient dans une cavit sous-cuticulaire. Ces dendrites sont entours par des cellules de soutien. Cette disposition rappelle plus une muqueuse olfactive de vertbr, qu'un organe sensoriel d'arthropode. Le PSL, lui, a des cellules sensorielles bipolaires aboutissant souvent dans une fossette cuticulaire et rappelle une soie chmorceptrice invagine d'arthropode. Le prsent travail porte sur un Caridea, la crevette grise Crangon crangon (Linnaeus, 1758) qui a une papille oculaire conique trs saillante et diffrente, par sa forme, des pores sensoriels dj dcrits anatomiquement. Les observations ultrastructurales rvlent en effet un PSL important aboutissant  la pointe du cne et non dans une fossette. L'quivalent d'un PSP est en retrait. Cette disposition est originale et plus proche de pneides que des autres carids observs. Le complexe PSP-PSL des dcapodes prsente donc des aspects externes trs diffrents selon les espces, bien que la structure de base soit la mme. De plus, il est confirm que ce complexe est juxtapos avec l'organe interne de Bellonci, mais distinct de celui-ci.
20111436|Four known species of kroyeriids infecting two species of Japanese sharks are redescribed and illustrated, based on both sexes. These are Kroyeria sublineata Yamaguti & Yamasu, 1959 and K. elongata Pillai, 1967 obtained separately from branchial lamellae of the white smoothhound, Mustelus griseus Pietschmann, 1908; and K. carchariaeglauci Hesse, 1879 and Kroeyerina elongata Wilson, 1932 obtained from branchial and olfactory lamellae, respectively, of the blue shark, Prionace glauca (Linnaeus, 1758). The male and the fifth copepodid (male) of K. sublineata, and the fourth copepodid (female) of Kroeyerina elongata are described for the first time. Two of the forms here described, i.e., Kroyeria sublineata and Kroyeria elongata, are now considered valid species, although they had earlier been relegated to the synonymy of K. lineata Van Beneden, 1853 and K. spatulata Pearse, 1948, respectively. The records of Kroyeria elongata and Kroeyerina elongata are new for Japan. Mustelus griseus represents a new host record for Kroyeria elongata and K. sublineata. The presence of postantennal processes was verified in both sexes of all species dealt with here. The process is papilliform, with an orifice of a duct at the tip, and presumably functions as some exocrine gland. A plesiomorphic feature found in the eudactylinid-kroyeriid complex is discussed. /// Quatre espces connues de coppodes Kroyeriidae infectant deux espces de requins japonais sont redcrites et illustres,  partir des deux sexes. Ce sont Kroyeria sublineata Yamaguti & Yamasu, 1959 et K. elongata Pillai, 1967, obtenus sparment sur des lamelles branchiales de l'missole ctire Mustelus griseus Pietschmann, 1908; et K. carchariaeglauci Hesse, 1879 et Kroeyerina elongata Wilson, 1932 prleves sur les lamelles branchiales et olfactives, respectivement, du requin bleu Prionace glauca (Linnaeus, 1758). Le mle et le cinquime coppodite (mle) de K. sublineata, ainsi que le quatrime coppodite (femelle) de Kroeyerina elongata sont dcrits pour la premire fois. Deux des formes ici dcrites, Kroyeria sublineata et Kroyeria elongata, sont maintenant reconnues comme espces valides, bien que elles aient t auparavant considres comme synonymes de K. lineata Van Beneden, 1853 et de K. spatulata Pearse, 1948, respectivement. Les mentions de Kroyeria elongata et Kroeyerina elongata sont nouvelles pour le Japon. Mustelus griseus constitue un nouvel hte pour Kroyeria elongata et K. sublineata. La prsence de processus post-antennaires a t vrifie chez les deux sexes de toutes les espces tudies ici. Le processus est papilliforme, prsentant un dbouch de canal  l'extrmit, et prsum fonctionnant comme une glande exocrine. Un caractre plsiomorphe, mis en vidence dans le complexe Eudactylinidae-Kroyeriidae est discut.
20104830|Crangon crangon (L.) and C. allmanni Kinahan were screened at 11 enzyme loci for electrophoretically detectable variation. The mean observed heterozygosity was 0.1346 + 0.06295 in C. crangon and 0.0567 + 0.0352 in C. allmanni. The possible causes of these rather low levels of genetic variation are considered in relation to the physical factors and feeding behaviour. The results also suggest that C. crangon and C. allmanni are two separate species that differ genetically although morphologically similar. /// Crangon crangon (L.) et C. allmanni Kinahan ont t tudis en vue de la dtection de la variation electrophortique par examen de 11 loci enzymatiques. La moyenne d'htrozygotie tait de 0,1346 + 0,06295 chez C. crangon et de 0,0567 + 0,0352 chez C. allmanni. Les causes possibles de ces niveaux assez bas de variation gntique sont considres comme en relation avec les facteurs physiques et le comportement d'alimentation. Les rsultats suggrent galement que C. crangon et C. allmanni sont deux espces spares, gntiquement distinctes mais morphologiquement similaires.
20105695|The paper is an annotated check list of the Decapoda Brachyura hitherto found in the Tyrrhenian Sea, off Monte Argentario at the southern end of the Tuscan Archipelago (Italy). The data were collected in the period 1998-2002 in the framework of a long-term programme to compile a checklist of all decapod taxa. Samples were collected on different substrates, at different depths (0-300 m) and with different collecting methods. Some of the species found are of biogeographical or ecological interest. These include Maja goltziana Oliveira, 1888, Paractea monodi Guinot, 1969, and Paragalene longicrura (Nardo, 1869). Moreover, the record of a specimen of Calappa sp. is discussed. /// Viene qui riportata la lista e relative osservazioni dei decapodi brachiuri finora rinvenuti nelle acque del Monte Argentario, al confine meridionale dell'Arcipelago Toscano (Italia). I dati sono stati raccolti dal 1998 al 2002 nell'ambito di un programma il cui obiettivo  quello di redigere una check-list dei crostacei decapodi. I campioni sono stati raccolti su substrati di varia natura, a diverse profondit (0-300 m) e utilizzando differenti tecniche di pesca. Alcune specie raccolte sono risultate molto interessanti dal punto di vista biogeografico o ecologico. Fra queste Maja goltziana Oliveira, 1888, Paractea monodi Guinot, 1969 e Paragalene longicrura (Nardo, 1869). Viene inoltre discusso il ritrovamento di un individuo di Calappa sp.

20105435|The genus Planes Bowdich, 1825 is represented in Brazilian waters by two species, Planes cyaneus Dana, 1851 and P. marinus Rathbun, 1914. P. marinus, known until now from several localities in both the Atlantic and eastern Pacific, is reported by the first time from the Brazilian coast. Both species are pelagic, with a wide distribution in tropical and temperate seas. In view of the great similarity of the species of the genus Planes, the Brazilian material is described, illustrated, and compared to specimens from other regions. /// Le genre Planes Bowdich, 1825, se trouve reprsent dans les eaux brsiliennes par deux espces, Planes cyaneus Dana, 1851 et P. marinus Rathbun, 1914. P. cyaneus ainsi que P. marinus sont plagiques avec une rpartition gographique assez vaste dans les mers tropicales et tempres. En raison des ressemblances morphologiques existantes entre les espces du genre, nous avons trouv utile de comparer les individus en provenance du Brsil avec ceux d'autres rgions. Chacune des deux espces traites ici est dcrite et illustre.

20107785|The decapod crustacean community of the Sado estuary was sampled monthly, between May 2001 and April 2002, using a 4 m beam trawl with 10 mm mesh size. The assemblage was composed of 33 species (9 Natantia and 24 species of Reptantia). Only 5 species (Crangon crangon, Macropodia rostrata, Pilumnus hirtellus, Carcinus maenas, and Liocarcinus navigator) were present in more than 40% of the samples. Few species dominated the community: C. crangon and C. maenas were the most important species in numbers (accounting for 63% and 17% of the total number of individuals, respectively), while C. maenas, Maja brachydactyla, and C. crangon dominated in biomass (73%, 9%, and 8%, respectively). A marked spatial and seasonal pattern was noticed: the inner areas, with shallower depth, less water transparency, and lower salinity, presented a high abundance of C. crangon, while in the outer areas a more diverse assemblage was found. In spring and summer, species richness increased, mainly in the lower estuary. The dominant species Crangon crangon and Carcinus maenas were more abundant in winter. /// A comunidade de crustceos do esturio do sado foi amostrada mensalmente, entre Maio de 2001 e Abril de 2002, com recurso a um arrasto de vara com 4 m de largura e com uma malha da rede de 10 mm. Foram identificadas 33 espcies (9 espcies de Natantia e 24 de Reptantia). Apenas 5 espcies (Crangon crangon, Macropodia rostrata, Pilumnus hirtellus, Carcinus maenas e Liocarcinus navigator) estiveram presentes em mais de 40% das amostras. Poucas espcies dominaram a comunidade: C. crangon e C. maenas foram as mais importantes em nmero de indivduos (representando 63% e 17% do total de indivduos capturados, respectivamente), enquanto C. maenas, Maja brachydactyla e C. crangon dominaram em biomassa (73%, 9% e 8%, respectivamente). Foi registado um padro espacio-temporal bem marcado: as reas mais a montante, com menor profundidade, transparncia da gua e salinidade, apresentaram uma abundncia elevada de C. crangon, enquanto nas reas mais prximas da embocadura foi encontrada uma comunidade mais diversificada. Na Primavera e no Vero verificou-se um aumento da riqueza especfica, especialmente no esturio inferior. As espcies dominantes Crangon crangon e Carcinus maenas foram mais abundantes no Inverno.
20104941|An examination of fresh material of Clarencia chelata K. H. Barnard, 1931, collected from the Prydz Bay region, Antarctica, has revealed a number of characters not recognised previously or diagnosed incorrectly. New morphological information is provided and the systematic position of Clarenciidae is re-evaluated and a new superfamily Clarencioidea is proposed. A new diagnosis for Clarenciidae is also provided. The species seems to be associated with the white sponge Asbestopluma belgicae (Topsent, 1901) (Cladorhizidae). /// Un examen de matriel frais de Clarencia chelata K. H. Barnard, 1931, recueilli dans la rgion de la baie de Prydz, Antarctique, a fait apparatre un certain nombre de caractres non reconnus prc-demment ou incorrectement placs dans la diagnose. Une nouvelle information morphologique est fournie et la position systmatique des Clarenciidae est rvalue, en mme temps qu'une nouvelle super-famille des Clarencioidea est propose. 20104351|The larval development of Diaptomus (Aglaodiaptomus) leptopus S. A. Forbes, 1882, through copepodites to the adult stage has been described and illustrated, using specimens of a single population taken in September 1979 from a small acidic lake located to the north of Montreal, Quebec, in the downhill of the Canadian precambrian shield. For each of the copepodite stages and for the adults, in addition to a dorsal view of body, drawings of antennules, leg P to P and fifth legs are presented. Thirteen tables listing the numbers of segments of all appendages, as well as their setation, position and instar in which they appear, are included. The length of the copepodite instars varies from 0,380 mm (C1) to 1,187 mm (C6). Comparative analysis of instar development of Diaptomus spp. from North America was carried out in an attempt to provide useful taxonomic characters to identify immature diaptomids.

Die Mnnchen zeigten Paarungsverhalten nur gegenber konspezifischen, reifen Vorhutungsweibchen. Die wahrscheinlichste Basis fr Geschlechtserkennung ist eine physiko-chemische Eigenschaft attraktiver Weibchen. Eine Serie von Experimenten erbrachte keinen Nachweis darfr, da wasser-eigene entfernungswirksame Pheromone von den Weibchen produziert werden. Kontakterkennung wird als wahrscheinlich angenommen.

20105000|A new species of deep-sea crab, Chaceon manningi (Brachyura, Geryonidae), is described from depths of 438 to 636 m in the Tung-Sa Islands, South China Sea. The dorsal carapace surface of C. manningi resembles C. granulatus from Japan but in the form of the anterolateral margin and ambulatory dactylus, C. manningi is closer to C. bicolor from New Caledonia, Australia, and New Zealand. Seven species of Chaceon are now known from the Pacific Ocean. Chaceon manningi is the largest member of the genus known so far. /// Une nouvelle espce de crabe d'eau profonde, Chaceon manningi (Brachyura, Geryonidae), est dcrite de 438  636 m, aux les Tung-Sa, mer de Chine mridionale. La surface dorsale de la carapace de la nouvelle espce ressemble  celle de C. granulatus, du Japon, mais par la forme du bord antro-latral et le dactyle des pattes ambulatoires, elle est plus proche de C. bicolor de Nouvelle-Caldonie, Australie et Nouvelle-Zlande. Sept espces de Chaceon sont maintenant connues du Pacifique. Chaceon manningi est le plus grand reprsentant du genre connu jusqu' prsent.
20107780|This study describes the morphology of the megalopa stage of Pachygrapsus gracilis in detail and compares it with that of other species collected in the Camaronera Lagoon inlet of the Alvarado Lagoon system, Veracruz, Mexico. The biological material was collected with a conical net (1.0 m length, 0.75 m width, 243 m mesh opening). Rearing was conducted in a vertical re-circulating system. We find that the numbers and types of setae to differentiate the megalopa of P. gracilis are on the following structures: antennula, basal and coxal endite of the maxillule, basal endite and scaphognathite of the maxilla, protopodite and epipodite of the first maxilliped, fifth segment of the endopod of the second maxilliped, fourth and fifth segment of the endopod and the epipodite of the third maxilliped, and the number of setae of the pleopods. The P. gracilis megalopa has the largest-sized carapace of all the megalopae of the crab species of the Camaronera lagoon inlet. /// En este estudio se realiz la descripcin morfolgica de la megalopa de Pachygrapsus gracilis y se compar con otras especies colectadas en la boca de la laguna Camaronera del Sistema Lagunar de Alvarado, Veracruz, Mxico. El material biolgico fue colectado con una red cnica (1.0 m de longitud, 0.75 m de ancho y 243 m de abertura de malla). El cultivo se realiz en un sistema de re-circulacin vertical. Nosotros encontramos que el nmero y tipo de setas para diferenciar a la megalopa de P. gracilis estn sobre las siguientes estructuras: antnula, endito basal y endito coxal de la maxlula, endito basal y escafognatito de la maxila, protopodito y epipodito del primer maxilpedo, quinto segmento del endpodo del segundo maxilpedo, cuarto y quinto segmento del endpodo y el epipodito del tercer maxilpedo y el nmero de setas de los plepodos. P. gracilis present la talla ms grande respecto a otras especies colectadas en la boca de la laguna Camaronera.

20103184|The eighth pereiopod of the male of Iberobathynella cf. fagei from Mallorca, Baleares, Spain, is described. Data are presented concerning the morphological details of the different parts of the leg and of the cuticular sclerites. The relation between the external lobe and the basipodite is discussed. 20787201|The growth and mortality of the Caramote shrimp, Melicertus kerathurus (Forskl, 1775), in the shallow waters off southwest Sicily (central Mediterranean Sea) were estimated based on length-frequency data using the FISAT II software. The carapace length (CL) of the 1504 sampled shrimps ranged from 16.2 to 63.3 mm. Based on the CL frequency distribution, the shrimp population off the south-western Sicilian coast is composed of two dominant modes, representing shrimps of one and two years old, respectively, plus a few specimens up to three years old. The overall population growth parameters obtained from the seasonalized Von Bertalanffy growth function were: CL = 72.00 mm, k = 0.78 yr, C = 0.29, and WP = 0.55. Total mortality, Z, based on the mean CL of shrimp in the catch, was 1.49 yr using the Beverton & Holt equation and 1.28 yr using the Ault & Ehrhardt equation. The instantaneous natural mortality M was 0.94 yr and the exploitation ratio E was estimated between 26% and 37%. Based on the present data, it can be concluded that off the south-western coast of Sicily the Caramote prawn stock is currently experiencing an underfishing condition. La crescita e la mortalit della Mazzancolla Melicertus kerathurus (Forskl, 1775), sono state stimate dalla distribuzione della frequenza di taglia con l'ausilio del programma FISAT II. La lunghezza del carapace (CL) dei 1504 gamberi oscillava tra 16,2 e 63,3 mm. Nella costa sud-occidentale della Sicilia, la distribuzione della frequenza di taglia della popolazione di gamberi  composta da due mode dominanti che rappresentano gamberi di uno e due anni oltre a pochi esemplari di tre anni. I parametri di crescita di tutta la popolazione, ottenuti dalla funzione di crescita stagionalizzata di von Bertalanffy, furono: CL = 72,00 mm, k = 0,78 anno, C = 0,29 and WP = 0,55. La mortalit totale Z, stimata sul valore medio della CL del gambero nella cattura,  stata pari a 1,49 anno usando l'equazione di Beverton & Holt e 1,28 anno usando l'equazione di Ault & Ehrhardt. La mortalit naturale M  stata pari a 0,94 anno e il tasso di sfruttamento E  stato stimato tra il 26% e il 37%. I risultati ottenuti permettono di concludere che nella costa sud-occidentale della Sicilia lo stock della Mazzancolla  in condizioni di sotto-sfruttamento.

20104898|The use of protein electrophoretic data for determining species boundaries in amphipods is addressed. Analysis of published literature on genetic differentiation in amphipods showed that pairs of allopatric populations which have genetic identities (I) above a value of 0.85 probably represent intraspecific populations, whereas pairs of populations which have genetic identities below about 0.45 probably represent different species. It was recommended that if I values fall between 0.45 and 0.85, additional factors such as evidence of a lack of gene flow between the populations, and concordant morphological variation should be considered. /// L'utilisation de l'lectrophorse des protines pour dterminer les limites spcifiques chez les Amphipodes a t en oeuvre. L'analyse de la littrature relative  la diffrenciation gntique dans ce groupe a montr que les paires de populations allopatriques qui ont des identits gntiques (I) au-dessus d'une valeur de 0,85 reprsentent probablement des populations intraspcifiques, tandis que les paires de populations dont l'identit gntique est infrieure  0,45 repsentent probablement des espces diffrentes. Il a t recommand que, si les valeurs de I sont comprises entre 0,45 et 0,85, des facteurs additionnels, tels que la preuve d'un manque de flux gnique, et la variation morphologique concordante, soient pris en considration.

20102028|Gecarcinus quadratus Saussure, 1853 (Gecarcinidae) und Potamocarcinus richmondi (Rathbun 1893) (Pseudothelphusidae) produzieren jeweils zwei verschiedene Typen von Geruschen. Der erste Geruschtyp ist ein sprudelnder ("bubbling") Ton, der hervorgerufen wird durch Flssigkeit, welche aus und ber den 3. Maxillipeden hervorgebracht wird; der zweite Geruschtyp ist ein zirpender Ton. Der zirpende Ton von G. quadratus wird ausgelst durch Friktionen von Merus und Cheliped gegen die subhepatische Region des Karapax. Das zirpende Gerusch von P. richmondi entsteht durch Friktionen zwischen dem Propodus des zweiten Maxillipeden und dem Merus des dritten Maxillipeden.

20696239|Abbreviated larval development is described and illustrated for Macrobrachium totonacum Meja, Alvarez & Hartnoll, 2003, a recently described freshwater prawn with three larval stages. The study is based on laboratory-reared material. Females carry 18 eggs on average, with a maximum of 28. The average egg diameter is 2.1 mm. The first larval stage has sessile eyes, and all appendages are developed except the uropods; however, the chelae on pereiopods 1 and 2, and the pleopods, are nonfunctional. In stage 2 the eyes are articulated, and the chelae and pleopods are functional. In stage 3 the uropods are developed. The larvae are lecithotrophic in the first two stages, and start feeding in stage 3. The larval development of this species is compared with other Mexican and South American species of Macrobrachium with abbreviated development: it has the same number of stages as M. vicconi Romn, Ortega & Meja, 2000, another Mexican species. El desarrollo larval abreviado es descrito e ilustrado para Macrobrachium totonacum Meja, Alvarez & Hartnoll, 2003, una especie de langostino recientemente descrita con tres estados larvales. Este estudio esta basado en material obtenido en laboratorio. Las hembras llevan en promedio 18 huevos y un mximo de 28. El dimetro promedio del huevo es de 2,1 mm. El primer estadio larval tiene ojos ssiles y todos los apndices estn desarrollados excepto los urpodos; sin embargo, la quela de los pereipodos 1 y 2 y los plepodos no son funcionales. En el estado dos, los ojos estn articulados y la quela y plepodos son funcionales. En el estado tres los urpodos estn desarrollados. Las larvas son lecitotroficas en los primeros dos estadios e inician su alimentacin en el estado tres. El desarrollo larval de esta especie es comparada con otras especies de Macrobrachium de Mxico y Sudamrica con desarrollo abreviado, esta especie tiene el mismo nmero de estados que otra especie mexicana: M. vicconi Romn, Ortega & Meja, 2000.

(1999). /// Vengono descritti i sei stadi naupliari ed i cinque stadi di copepodite di Pseudocyclops umbraticus allevato in laboratorio. (1999).

20102864|Der Populationszyklus von Cyclops bicuspidatus thomasi vollzieht sich in Leavenworth County State Lake, Kansas, im Winter and Frhling. 20107834|Most studies of the reproductive period of shrimps are based on the percentage of mature females (PMF). The objective of this work was to determine the reproductive period of penaeid shrimp by applying an egg production index (EPI), combining fecundity, size structure, and density of mature females. We also intended to make a comparison with the PMF method. The months of maximum maturity obtained with PMF did not match those of the actual maximum egg production period. This is because PMF does not take into account the abundance, but rather the proportion of mature females. It is concluded that, in order to define the period of maturity of penaeid shrimp, we need at least three indices (fecundity, size structure, and density of mature females) as proposed here, and as comprised in the EPI. /// La mayora de los estudios sobre el periodo reproductivo de las especies de camarones peneidos estn basados en el porcentaje de hembras maduras (PHM). El objetivo de este estudio fue determinar el periodo reproductivo de camarones peneidos mediante la aplicacin de un ndice de produccin de huevos (IPH) que combina la fecundidad, estructura de tallas y la densidad de las hembras maduras. As como la comparacin con el PHM. Los meses de mxima madurez obtenida con el PHM no concuerdan con el periodo de mxima produccin de huevos. Esto debido a que el PHM no toma en cuenta la abundancia de las hembras maduras sino solamente la proporcin de estas. La conclusin es que para poder determinar el periodo de madurez de los camarones peneidos se necesita contar con un ndice como al aqu propuesto de produccin de huevos.
20104347|La femelle du Crabe Portunus pelagicus (L.) a un seul cycle de reproduction par an, qui s'tend sur environ huit mois. Il commence par l'accouplement qui a lieu au cours du mois de mars, juste aprs la mue. Les ovaires ont deux cycles spars mais successifs, chacun se terminant par une ponte. Les spermathques (qui sont des agrandissements des parties proximales des oviductes), font un seul cycle, comme le montre les changements dus  l'imprgnation de la production mle,  la formation du tampon, et  la dhiscence successive des spermatophores. La spermathque est ainsi un facteur significatif de la division du cycle en tapes dfinies.

23065218|Game theoretical models have been developed to understand the decisions of individuals to continue or stop fighting. These can be split into self assessment models (cumulative assessment model (CAM), war of attrition without assessment (WOA-WA), energetic WOA), where contestants only have information on their own fighting persistence, and mutual assessment models (sequential assessment game: SAM), where contestants exchange information on each other's competitive ability. Here, we assess if self or mutual assessment occurs in fights between male mangrove treedwelling crabs, Selatium brockii (De Man, 1887). Contests were staged in the presence of a female between focal crabs belonging to either of two different absolute size classes against a smaller, size-matched, and larger opponent. In line with mutual assessment models and CAM, contest duration increased when contestants were more matched in competitive ability (i.e., size) but was not significantly different between focal crab sizes. However, this pattern differed between focal crab size classes when competitors were smaller, with contests lasting longer for the larger size class. Different behaviours with different levels of aggression were employed during contests, suggesting that mutual assessment occurs. However, unlike current model predictions, the different behaviours were not used in increasing order of aggressiveness. Instead, the sequence of behaviours used during a contest both increased and decreased in aggressiveness. These observations suggest that contests are a form of unbalanced partial assessment, corroborating other recent empirical findings, and challenging theoreticians to formalize such contest dynamics. Des modles thoriques de jeu ont t dvelopps pour comprendre les dcisions des individus pour continuer ou arrter de se battre. Ils peuvent tre partags en modles d'auto-valuation (modle d'valuation cumulative, CAM), guerre d'usure sans valuation (WOA-WA), WOA nergique, o les adversaires ont seulement des informations sur leur propre persistance  se battre et modles d'valuation cumulatifs (jeux d'valuation squentielle: SAM), o les adversaires changent des informations sur la capacit de comptition de chacun. Nous tudions ici l'valuation auto et mutuelle qui intervient dans les combats entre crabes mles arboricoles de la mangrove, Selatium brockii (De Man, 1887). Des combats ont t organiss en prsence de femelles entre mles appartenant soit  deux classes de taille diffrentes (plus petits ou plus grands) soit entre mles de mme taille. En accord avec les modles d'valuation mutuelle et CAM, la dure du combat augmente quand les combattants prsentent une mme capacit de comptition (i.e., taille), mais sans diffrence significative entre les tailles de crabe examins. Cependant ce modle diffre entre crabes expriments quand les concurrents sont plus petits, avec des combats plus longs pour la classe de plus grande taille. Diffrents comportements avec diffrents niveaux d'agression ont t employs au cours des luttes, suggrant que l'valuation mutuelle existe. Cependant, contrairement aux prdictions du modle actuel, les diffrents comportements n'ont pas t utiliss dans un ordre croissant d'agressivit. Au contraire, la squence de comportements utiliss au cours d'un combat  la fois augmente et dcroit en agressivit. Ces observations suggrent que ces combats sont une forme d'valuation en partie dsquilibre, corroborant d'autres dcouvertes empiriques rcentes, et posant un dfi aux thoriciens qui formalisent ces combats dynamiques.
20696241|Males of several species of fiddler crabs construct sand structures at the entrance of their burrows, to which they attract females for mating. Although sand structures are able to attract females, males do not always construct structures, and there is a considerable variation in the frequency of structure construction per day. To determine what factors cause the variation in the frequency of structure construction, I conducted a field observation on the structure construction of Uca lactea and examined the effects of air and soil temperatures, tidal amplitude, male and female densities, and the interaction between male and female densities. The frequency of structure construction was related to tidal amplitude. This may be a male response to the changing levels of female receptivity associated with the tidal cycle. The frequency of structure construction was also correlated positively with air temperature. Although courtship investment is expected to be influenced by the number of mates and rivals, neither male nor female density were significantly correlated with the frequency of structure construction. Les mles de plusieurs espces de crabes violonistes construisent des structures de sable  l'entre de leur terrier, vers lesquels ils attirent les femelles pour l'accouplement. Bien que ces structures de sable sont capables d'attirer les femelles, les mles ne construisent pas toujours ces structures, et il y a une grande variation journalire de la frquence des constructions. Une observation sur le terrain de la construction de ces structures par Uva lactea a t mene. Ont aussi t examins, les effets de la temprature de l'air et du sol, de l'amplitude des mares, de la densit des mles et des femelles, et les interactions entre ces densits. La frquence des constructions a t relie  l'amplitude des mares. Ce qui pourrait tre la rponse du mle au changement du niveau de rceptivit de la femelle associ au cycle des mares. La frquence des constructions a aussi t positivement corrle avec la temprature de l'air. Bien que l'on attende que l'investissement dans la recherche du partenaire soit influenc par le nombre de partenaires et de rivaux, ni la densit des mles ou des femelles n'a t significativement corrle avec la frquence des constructions.
20105874|Size at sexual maturity was determined by the allometric equation in three populations of Austropotamobius pallipes pallipes from the Poitou-Charentes region, France. Seven morphological characters were measured and POL (post orbital length) was used as a reference parameter. The puberal moult was identified by changes in the relative growth of CW (claw width) and CL (claw length) in both sexes. Males have shown variation of the relative growth of CW and CL at 19.15 mm of POL for the Gatineau (Gat) stream, 20.1 mm of POL for the Magnerolle (Mag) and 20.3 mm for the Fontaine Saint-Pierre (Fsp) populations, respectively. Sexual maturity of females occurred at 16.17 mm POL for the Fsp, 18.2 mm for the Mag and for the Gat. Geographic variation in A. pallipes was investigated using multivariate analysis of five morphometric characters on mature specimens. By canonical discriminant analysis, the Mag population was distinct from the other two populations. Results are discussed with regard to restocking strategy. /// La taille de la maturit sexuelle a t dtermine par les droites d'allomtrie pour trois populations d'Austropotamobius pallipes pallipes de la rgion Poitou-Charentes. Sept variables morphomtriques ont t mesures et la POL (post-orbital length = longueur post-orbitale) a t utilise comme valeur de rfrence. La mue de pubert est identifie par les changements dans la croissance relative des variables CW (claw width = largeur de la pince) et CL (claw length = longueur de la pince). Les mles montrent une variation dans la croissance relative des variables CW et CL  19,15 mm de POL pour le Gatineau (Gat), 20,1 mm de POL pour le Magnerolle (Mag) et 20,3 mm pour la Fontaine Saint-Pierre (Fsp). La maturit sexuelle chez les femelles est atteinte  16,17 mm de POL pour Fsp, 18,2 pour Gat et 18,17 pour Mag. La variabilit gographique chez A. pallipes a t apprhende en utilisant une analyse multivarie  partir de quatre variables morphomtriques. L'analyse discriminante canonique spare trs nettement la population du Mag des deux autres populations. Les rsultats sont discuts en vue d'une stratgie de repeuplement.
20104567|La structure des populations, l'activit de reproduction et la biologie de l'amphipode Talitridae supralittoral, Traskorchestia traskiana (Stimpson, 1857) ont t tudis. Les individus ns pendant l't et l'automne passent l'hiver comme adultes non reproductifs ou comme juvniles; ils commencent  se reproduire  la mi-fvrier de l'anne suivante. La reproduction prsente un maximum en mai, avec 68% de femelles ovigres. Le premier jeune de l'anne clot en avril. La majorit des femelles qui ont pass l'hiver cessent de se reproduire en juillet, lorsque les femelles nes au dbut du printempts deviennent ovigres. Ces femelles se reproduisent jusqu' la mi-octobre. L'closion des jeunes est continue d'avril au milieu ou  la fin d'octobre et les juvniles prdominent dans les populations de mai  aot. Le cycle biologique de T. traskiana comprend une gnration de printemps (qui ne passe pas l'hiver) et une autre qui passe l'hiver; ces deux gnrations compltent leurs cycles respectivement en 7 et 11 mois environ. Les individus ns entre avril et la mi-juin croissent et arrivent  maturit rapidement, se reproduisent entre la fin de juillet et octobre, et meurent tard dans l'anne ou au dbut de la suivante. Leurs prognitures constituent la gnration qui passe l'hiver, se reproduit entre fvrier et juillet, et commence  mourir pendant l't. Le rapport annuel femelles/mles dans la population est d'environ 1.7/1. Bien que le sex ratio varie mensuellement, les femelles prdominent dans la population adulte pendant la plus grande partie de l'anne, particulirement au moment o la reproduction est maximale, au printemps. La taille moyenne d'une ponte (nombre moyen d'oeufs ports par les ovigres) varie mensuellement et est en relation avec la taille moyenne des ovigres. Dans une classe donne de femelles, la taille moyenne de la ponte est minimale au dbut du printemps, maximale  la fin du printemps et au dbut de l't. En gnral, le nombre d'oeufs dans une ponte crot linairement en mme temps que la longueur du corps de la femelle. Les oeufs croissent en taille, et certains sont perdus hors du marsupium, au cours de leur dveloppement. Les grandes femelles produisent de plus grands oeufs et en pondent davantage que les petites. L'accouplement chez T. traskiana implique un appariement slectif fond sur la longueur du corps. La longueur moyenne des mles dpasse celle de leurs partenaires femelles de 3,8 mm (SD  0,7 mm). L'appariement slectif selon la taille semble ncessit par les particularits mcaniques du processus d'embrassement et de transport au cours de l'accouplement. La densit moyenne de T. traskiana dans quatre chantillons d'algues d'pave en aot tait de 54 (SD  16) individus par gramme d'algues sches, avec une biomasse en poids sec moyen de 45 mg ( 12). De nombreuses observations sur une priode de deux ans laissent supposer que T. traskiana est l'un des dtritivores dominants,  la fois par le nombre et par la biomasse, dans les communauts d'algues d'pave o il se trouve.

20103455|Paguristes perspicax wird erstmals aus dem nrdlichen Arabisch See (bei Karachi) gemeldet und ausfhrlich beschrieben. Die Variationsbreite wird diskutiert.
20106217|Decreasing deep-sea floor temperatures during the mid Cainozoic, and a presumed widespread disoxia in the deep sea prior to this era has lead many authors to suggest that the deep-sea fauna has accumulated during the last 30-40 mybp only. This hypothesis argues for extinction and replacement of earlier faunas. Some taxa, such as the Ostracoda, show extensive taxonomic replacement during the Miocene that is correlated with declining sea floor temperatures. A recent evaluation of the deep Atlantic distribution of major isopod clades, however, demonstrated that two different historical patterns are present. One pattern ("Flabellifera") conforms to a relatively recent Cainozoic and ongoing colonization of the deep sea, with relative impoverishment of species with depth. The other pattern (Asellota) is one that is rich in deep-sea species, and has a high level of endemic morphological diversity, suggesting a long period of evolution in isolation. Glaciation during the late Palaeozoic and an early phylogenetic origination of the Asellota support the hypothesis that these isopods colonized the deep sea prior to the disoxia events during the Mesozoic and the early Cainozoic. The Mesozoic deep sea is unlikely to have become completely anoxic globally owing to vertical halothermal circulation at low latitudes, allowing the possibility of oxygenated refuges in deep water. Elements of the Palaeozoic fauna, therefore, may have persisted through the Mesozoic without representation in marine shallow waters. Within the isopods, these Palaeozoic relicts have taken two adaptive directions. In freshwater, the Phreatoicidea show morphological stasis, with modern taxa resembling fossils from Carboniferous and Triassic eras. The Asellota, on the other hand, have evolved into a many different morphological types and a huge number of species globally. /// La diminution de la temprature dans l'ocan profond pendant le Cnozoque ainsi qu'un prsum appauvrissement en oxygne apparu avant cette re a conduit beaucoup d'auteurs  suggrer que la faune profonde ne s'est accumule que pendant les derniers 30-40 mybp seulement. Cette hypothse plaide pour l'extinction et le remplacement des faunes antrieures. Quelques taxa, tels les Ostracoda, montrent un remplacement taxonomique important pendant le Miocne qui est corrl avec les tempratures en baisse de l'ocan profond. Une valuation rcente de la distribution atlantique profonde des clades principaux d'Isopodes montre cependant que deux configurations historiques diffrentes sont prsentes. Une configuration ("Flabellifera") se conforme  une colonisation Cnozoque rcente et continue de la mer profonde, avec un appauvrissement relatif des espces avec la profondeurs. L'autre configuration (Asellota) traduit une grande richesse des espces profondes, et un niveau lev de diversit morphologique endmique, suggrant une longue priode d'volution en isolement. Les Glaciations  la fin du Palozoque et une origine phylogntique plus ancienne des Asellota supportent l'hypothse que ces Isopodes ont coloniss la mer profonde avant les vnements d'appauvrissement en oxygne pendant le Msozoque et le Cnozoque ancien. La mer profonde du Msozoque est peu susceptible d'tre devenue compltement anoxique en raison, globalement, de la circulation verticale halothermique sous les basses latitudes, ce qui avait permis la possibilit de refuges oxygns dans l'eau profonde. les lments de la faune du Palozoque ont pu donc persister lors du Msozoque sans reprsentants dans les eaux peu profondes marines. Chez les Isopodes, ces relictes du Palozoque ont pris deux directions adaptatives. Dans les eaux douces, les Phreatoicidea montrent une stase morphologique avec des taxa modernes ressemblant  des fossiles du Carbonifre et/ou du Trias. Les Asellota d'autre part, ont volu en beaucoup de types morphologiques diffrents et, globalement, en un nombre norme d'espces.

20106383|Arenaeus cribrarius females were collected over a 12-month period with otter-trawl nets in the Ubatuba littoral zone, Brazil. Ovigerous individuals were measured (CW = carapace width excluding lateral spines) and weighed (WW = wet weight). Each egg brood was weighed (WE = wet weight), dried, and the number of eggs (EN) counted. Scatterplots from EN/CW, EN/WW, and EN/WE were submitted to regression analyses. Mean relative fecundity (F) was calculated in each month/season to assess seasonal variation of reproductive intensity. The number of eggs showed a positive correlation with CW, WW, and WE. Fecundity of A. cribrarius ranged from 135,210 to 682,156 eggs, intermediate in comparison with other portunids. Fecundity in Portunidae is typically high; lower values are found in Polybiinae and higher ones in Portuninae. Mean fecundity did not reveal significant differences over months and seasons, but reproductive activity tended to be more intense in summer and winter, a phenomenon related to reduced temperature oscillations as found in subtropical regions. /// Fmeas de Arenaeus cribrarius foram coletadas mensalmente durante um perodo de 12 meses com redes "otter-trawl" na zona litornea de Ubatuba, Brasil. Os indivduos ovgeros foram mensurados (CW = largura da carapaa sem os espinhos laterais) e pesados (WW = peso mido). Cada massa ovgera foi pesada (WE = peso mido), seca e o nmero de ovos (EN) contado. Os grficos de disperso resultantes das relaes EN/CW, EN/WW e EN/WE foram submetidas a anlise de regresso. A fecundidade mdia relativa (F) foi calculada para cada ms/estao do ano, e comparada para verificar a variao sazonal da intensidade reprodutiva. O nmero de ovos mostrou uma correlao positiva com todas as variveis independentes (CW, WW, WE). A fecundidade de A. cribrarius variou de 135.210 a 682.156 ovos, sendo intermediria em comparao com a de outros portundeos. A fecundidade nos Portunidae  tipicamente alta, porm valores mais reduzidos so encontrados nos Polybiinae e mais altos nos Portuninae. A anlise da fecundidade mdia relativa no revelou diferenas significativas entre os meses e estaes do ano, mas a atividade reprodutiva foi mais intensa no vero e inverno, um fenmeno relacionado  reduzida oscilao trmica verificada nas regies subtropicais.

20107880|The differentiation of numerous populations of Porcellio lamellatus Budde-Lund, 1885 (Isopoda, Oniscidea) in Sicily, Sicily-surrounding islands, Tunisia, and Portugal was studied from a morphological point of view as well as by using two molecular approaches: Multi-Locus Enzyme Electrophoresis (MLEE) and Random Amplified Polymorphic DNA (RAPD) analysis, in order to assess the status of some taxa attributed to Porcellio lamellatus. The morphological study showed that the characters used to define the various taxa in the literature are often found within the same population, which also appeared to include intermediate forms. The analysis of both the DNA polymorphisms and the electrophoretic mobility of the proteins did not produce genetically significant distances between the various populations studied, not even among those that have extreme variations in morphological characters. /// E' stato studiato il differenziamento di numerose popolazioni di Porcellio lamellatus Budde-Lund, 1885 (Isopoda, Oniscidea) di Sicilia, isole circum-siciliane, Tunisia e Portogallo, dal punto di vista morfologico ed utilizzando due approcci molecolari: Multi-Locus Enzyme Electrophoresis (MLEE) e Random Amplified Polymorphic DNA (RAPD), per verificare il significato di alcuni taxa attribuiti a Porcellio lamellatus. Lo studio della morfologia ha mostrato che i caratteri utilizzati per definire i numerosi taxa sono spesso rinvenuti all'interno della medesima popolazione che inoltre sembra includere forme intermedie. L'analisi dei polimorfismi del DNA e della mobilit elettroforetica delle proteine non ha prodotto distanze geneticamente rilevanti tra le varie popolazioni studiate, neanche tra quelle che presentano variazioni estreme a livello dei caratteri morfologici.
20107684|Some biological aspects of Melicertus kerathurus, a shrimp of high commercial value, were studied in zmir Bay from April 2004 to December 2004. A seasonal reproduction pattern was observed from April to September with a high percentage of mature females occurring between May and July, when water temperature was relatively high. During the study, a total of 1050 specimens was captured: 612 (58.3%) females and 438 (41.7%) males. The largest female and male were 22.7 cm and 17.0 cm, respectively. The minimum size attained at first maturity was estimated to be 3.9 cm carapace length (CL) and 14.1 cm total length (TL). Sexual differences related to the length-weight relationship were noted. The onset of sexual maturity for females was estimated to be
20104117|An experiment is conducted in artificial streams to determine hydrodynamic sensitivity of the troglobitic crustacean Antromysis juberthiei; A. juberthiei shows a rheotactic behaviour at the fastest current flows; antennectomy does not suppress this behaviour.
20103285|Halocaridina rubra Holthuis est une crevette caridienne endmique des les Hawaii. Sa distribution est habituellement restreinte aux mares littorales, dans les laves rcentes. Le dveloppement larvaire est abrg. Une femelle ovigre porte gnralement une douzaine de gros oeufs dont closent des zos lecithotrophiques, nageant librement, avec trois paires de maxillipdes natatoires et cinq paires de bourgeons de pattes. Le dveloppement passe par quatre stades zo et un stade mysis avant d'arriver au premier stade juvnile. Des observations dans la nature permettent de supposer que H. rubra a des moeurs souterraines et que l'obscurit est sans doute une condition ncessaire  sa reproduction.
23034232|The authors describe two new species of Colobomatus Hesse, 1873. The first, Colobomatus tenuis n. sp. is parasitic on Scartichthys viridis in waters off Antofagasta and Valparaso and on Scartichthys gigas and Auchenionchus variolosus from Antofagasta. C. tenuis lives in the preopercular canals of its fish host. This new species has three simple cephalic processes, a characteristic shared with only three of its congeners (C. mylionus, C. sewelli, and C. sciaenae). However, C. tenuis can be differentiated from these other species by the shape of the head and of the trunk processes, especially the bifid thoracic posterior processes that are simple in the other species. The male can be easily differentiated from all species of the genus based on the shape and size of the uropods, which in the other species are longer than the last abdominal somite. Some females were observed with a pair of egg masses attached to the genital pore and another pair free in the preopercular canal with nauplii inside, implying that the oldest egg masses are released before the nauplii hatch from the eggs. The second new species, Colobomatus miniprocessus n. sp., inhabits the mandibular canals of Anisotremus scapularis. C. miniprocessus is characterized by a combination of characters, such as the abdominal processes that are large and blunt, the reduced bifid cephalic process, and the length of the thoracic anterior processes, all of which differentiate it from its closest congener, Colobomatus quadrifarius, which has been reported off the coast of Per on the same host. The present report raises the known number of species of Colobomatus to 63. Se describen dos nuevas species de Colobomatus Hesse, 1873. La primera Colobomatus tenuis n. sp. parasita a Scartichthys viridis en aguas de Antofagasta y Valparaso, y a Scartichthys gigas y Auchenionchus variolosus en Antofagasta. C. tenuis vive en los canales preoperculares de su pez hospedador. Esta nueva especie tiene tres procesos ceflicos simples, una caracterstica compartida slo con tres de sus congneres (C. mylionus, C. sewelli, and C. sciaenae); sin embargo C. tenuis se diferencia de stas tres, especialmente por cuanto sus procesos torcicos posteriores son bfidos, los cuales son simples en las otras tres especie. El macho puede ser fcilmente diferenciado de todas las especies del gnero basndose en la forma y talla de los urpodos, los cuales en las otras especies son ms largos que el ltimo segmento abdominal. Algunas hembras fueron observadas con un par de masas de huevos adheridas al poro genital y otro par suelto en el canal preopercular, con nauplius en su interior. Esto implica que las masas de huevos ms antiguas son liberadas antes de que los nauplius eclosionen. La segunda especie Colobomatus miniprocessus n. sp. habita los canales mandibulares de Anisotremus scapularis. C. miniprocessus se caracteriza por una combinacin de caracteres, tales como los procesos abdominales que son grandes y romos, los procesos ceflicos reducidos, y la longitud de los procesos torcicos anteriores, lo anterior la diferencia de su ms cercano congnere Colobomatus quadrifarius, el cual ha sido reportado desde la costa de Per, parasitando el mismo hospedador. El presente reporte eleva el nmero de especies de Colobomatus a 63.
20102730|Emerita analoga lebt in der Brandungszone exponierter Sandstrnde und ernhrt sich von organischen Partikeln. Die Gattung Emerita benutzt eine passive Filtriermethode, welche einmalig unter den Crustaceen ist: Wenn das Wasser am Strand abfliesst, werden die Futterpartikel mit dem feinen Haarnetz der Antenne abgefiltert und diese dann "abgelutscht" (Futteraufnahmebewegung). Zumindest zwei Faktoren steuern die Geschwindigkeit der Futteraufnahmebewegung: die Anwesenheit von Futter und die Fliessgeschwindigkeit des Wassers. Bei Zunahme der Fliessgeschwindigkeit des Wassers zieht sich das Tier in den Sand zurck; die Antennenkrmmung wird verringert und die Futteraufnahmebewegungen intensiviert. ber einen Teil des Bereichs der Fliessgeschwindigkeit des Wassers besteht ein gradliniger Zusammenhang zwischen der Intensitt der Nahrungsaufnahmebewegungen und dem Logarithmus der Fliessgeschwindigkeit oder -Kraft. Dieser Sachverhalt steht im Einklang mit dem Weber-Fechnerschen Gesetz. Es wird angenommen, dass eine Schwelle besteht (zwischen 0,02 und 0,03 m/sek) unterhalb derer der Geschwindigkeitswechsel ohne Einfluss ist. Alles deutet darauf hin, das die rheotaktischen Sinnesorgane auf den dorsalen Rami der Antennulae liegen. Die Anwesenheit von Nahrung erhht die Frequenz der Futteraufnahmebewegungen; eine solche Vernderung ist jedoch nicht feststellbar, wenn gefiltertes Wasser aus Futterkulturen benutzt wird. Werden anstatt Futter inerte Partikel vergleichbarer Grsse verabreicht, so nimmt die Nahrungsaufnahme erheblich ab. Die Sinnesorgane, welche die Anwesenheit von Futter wahrnehmen, scheinen in der Mundregion zu liegen, nicht auf den Antennulae oder Antennen. Der Hauptreiz ist chemisch, aber auch taktile Reize spielen eine Rolle. Partikel unter 4 bis 5 microns oder 2 bis 3 mm im Durchmesser vermgen die Antennen nicht wirksam abzufiltern.
20103578|Chez l'crevisse Procambarus clarkii une srie de comportements ont t observs entre le mle et la femelle avant la copulation. Cette succession de manifestations peut tre considre comme une "cour". Quoique le mle joue le rle actif en ces circonstances, il semble que la femelle soit assez active et non passive, comme elle l'est gnralement. C'est sans succs que des mles essaient de copuler par la force. La cour chez cette espce, comme chez les autres animaux, parat rduire l'agression et/ou augmenter l'impulsion sexuelle en vue de l'appariement.
20102650|Das Ausschlpfen aus dem Ei von Palaemonetes vulgaris wurde untersucht. Die ussere Membran des Eies wird durch osmotische Schwellung einer inneren Membran gebrochen. Die Prolarve innerhalb der zweiten Membran bleibt mit der usseren Membran und mit dem Schwimmfuss der Mutter durch den gewhnlichen Eistamm der Decapoda verbunden. Dann quillt die Prolarve auf, bis sie die innere Membran ganz anfllt. Diese Membran bricht ber einem "Eischalensprenger" an der dorsalen Seite des ersten abdominalen Gliedes wenn die Bewegungen des Abdomens der Larve die Spannung der Membran erhht. Der endgltige Ausbruch aus der inneren Membran ist normalerweise abhngig von Wasserstrmungen welche durch die ventilierende Aktion der Schwimmfsse der Mutter erzeugt werden.
20104705|The reproduction strategy of the Palaemonid shrimp, Macrobrachium amazonicum, has been studied on Careiro Island in a floodplain lake in Central Amazonia. Ovigerous females have been observed all year round. However, three periods of the hydrological cycle were significantly more favourable to gonad ripening: the middle of the rising and of the falling of the water level, as well as the low level. This suggests the direct effect of two factors: the current velocity and the phytoplancton production. At the population level, the maximum reproduction intensity has been observed during low water, and during rising water. This strategy increases the survival of planctonic larvae during the highest phytoplancton production period, and reduces the intraspecific competition, increasing the larval dispersal in the floodplain. In the lake, the percentage of ovigerous females was always higher regardless of size class of the adult prawns and of season, than in the channels or in the river, suggesting that the lacustrine environment is the more favourable to M. amazonicum reproduction. In eastern Amazonia, M. amazonicum shows a typical reproduction pattern of littoral Palaemonids: mass spawning occurs during the falling water, increasing the larval dispersion towards the estuary. The reproduction flexibility of M. amazonicum explains its success in colonizing a variety of environments in a wide geographical range in South America.
20105973|A new freshwater crab, Sesarma dolphinum sp. n., is described from Jamaica. The number of known Jamaican endemic Sesarminae increases thereby to eight. Half of the American species of Sesarma known at present are endemic to Jamaica. The new species is locally restricted to the slopes of the Dolphin Head Mountain in western Jamaica. It probably evolved when sea-level fluctuations during the Pliocene isolated this mountain from Central Jamaica. Sesarma dolphinum is closely related to Sesarma fossarum Schubart, Reimer, Diesel & Trkay, 1997, but differs in the morphology of the chelipeds, in the degree of pubescence, and in morphometric relationships. /// Eine neue Swasserkrabbenart, Sesarma dolphinum sp. n. von Jamaica wird beschrieben. Die Zahl der bekannten endemischen jamaikanischen Sesarminae erhht sich auf acht. Die Hlfte der beschriebenen amerikanischen Sesarma-Arten kommen endemisch auf Jamaika vor. Die Verbreitung der beschriebenen Art ist auf die Hnge des Dolphin Head in Westjamaika begrenzt. Wahrscheinlich ist sie aufgrund von Meeresspiegelschwankungen whrend des Pliozns, die diesen Berg von Zentraljamaika isolierten, entstanden. Sesarma dolphinum ist mit Sesarma fossarum Schubart, Reimer, Diesel & Trkay, 1997 nah verwandt, unterscheidet sich aber in der Morphologie der Schere, im Beborstungsgrad und morphometrischen Beziehungen.
20107911|The naupliar stages of the Asian copepod, Mesocyclops thermocyclopoides Harada, 1931 are described from laboratory-reared specimens collected near the type locality, in Taiwan. The morphology of the Taiwanese nauplii differs from a previous description of nauplii assigned to Mesocyclops cf. thermocyclopoides from Sri Lanka. The morphology of M. thermocyclopoides also differs in several respects from that of its congeners for which nauplii are known, thus supporting previous statements about the identity of the Sri Lankan specimens as related to M. thermocyclopoides but in reality belonging to a different species. It is speculated that several species, even those with morphologically close forms as adults, have recognizable differences at the earliest developmental stages; our findings in M. thermocyclopoides support the hypothesis that naupliar characters are complementary tools in distinguishing closely related species. The maturation time of M. thermocyclopoides is the shortest known in the genus. This species has the smallest genome size reported for Mesocyclops, a feature presumably related to both their small body size and their short maturation time. These features seem to be most relevant when considering this species for culturing, i.e., as a potential control for vector mosquito larvae. /// Se describen los estadios naupliares del coppodo asitico Mesocyclops thermocyclopoides Harada, 1931 a partir de especmenes cultivados en laboratorio y recolectados cerca de la localidad tipo de esta especie, en Taiwn. La morfologa de los nauplios taiwanenses difiere de una descripcin previa asignada a Mesocyclops cf. thermocyclopoides de Sri Lanka. La morfologa de M. thermocyclopoides tambin es diferente en varios aspectos respecto a la de los nauplios de los congneres cuyas larvas nauplio se conocen. Estas diferencias apoyan aserciones previas acerca de la identidad de los especmenes de Sri Lanka como una entidad cercana a M. thermocyclopoides pero asignable a otra especie. Se especula que varias especies, an aquellas cuyas formas adultas sean similares, tienen diferencias reconocibles en los estadios tempranos de desarrollo. Las variaciones encontradas respecto a M. thermocyclopoides apoyan el concepto de que los caracteres naupliares pueden ser herramientas complementarias para distinguir especies cercanas. El tiempo de maduracin de M. thermocyclopoides es el ms reducido que se conoce en el gnero y tiene el genoma ms pequeo hasta ahora conocido en Mesocyclops, lo que presumiblemente est relacionado con su talla reducida y su corto tiempo de maduracin. Ambas caractersticas se consideran relevantes al considerar el cultivo de esta especie, por ejemplo como control de larvas de mosquitos vectores.
27822634|Cymbasoma janetae n. sp. is described from three adult females collected from the Gulf of Aqaba (Red Sea, Egypt). The new species is closely similar to C. longispinosum (Bourne, 1890), C. morii Sekiguchi, 1982, C. chelemense Surez-Morales & Escamilla, 1997, and C. californiense Surez-Morales & Palomares-Garca, 1999. The new species can be distinguished by the body proportions, the absence of the seta on the first segment of the P1-P4 exopods, the structure of the fifth legs, the relative length of the ovigerous spines, and the presence of eight shallow cuticular wrinkles on the lateral margin and dorsal surface of the genital double somite. Cymbasoma janetae n. sp. est dcrite  partir de trois femelles adultes collects dans le golfe d'Aqaba (mer Rouge, Egypte). La nouvelle espce est trs proche de C. longispinosum (Bourne, 1890), de C. morii Sekiguchi, 1982, de C. chelemense Surez-Morales & Escamilla, 1997, et de C. californiense Surez-Morales & Palomares-Garca, 1999. Elle se distingue par les proportions du corps, l'absence de la soie sur le premier segment des exopodites de P1-P4, la structure des cinquimes pattes, la longueur relative des pines ovigres et la prsence de huit replis superficiels sur le bord latral et la surface dorsale du double somite gnital.
20102592|Nous avons vu que les jeunes stades de Naesa bidentata (Adams) se rencontraient le plus habituellement sur les algues, tandis que les adultes sont le plus souvent dans les anfractuosits des rochers, sous les pierres et dans les loges vides de balanes. 20107958|The vertical distribution of penaeoid shrimp larvae along a 24 hr cycle was analysed from two samplings carried out in distinct periods, i.e., summer and autumn 1993 in the southern Gulf of Mexico. A total of 7238 larvae belonging to the genera Solenocera and Sicyonia, and to the family Penaeidae was collected. In summer, the abundance of shrimp larvae was comparatively lower, with a total of 1062 individuals. The very low number (33 individuals) of Sicyonia larvae collected during this period did not allow detecting a clear vertical migration pattern. In the larvae of the genus Solenocera (837 specimens) and of the family Penaeidae (192 specimens), a typical vertical migration pattern was observed, in which larvae concentrated in shallow strata at dusk, while at dawn they moved toward deeper areas. During autumn, the highest abundance of larvae was obtained, with 6176 individuals captured. Larvae of the family Penaeidae adjusted to the typical vertical distribution pattern of meroplanktonic larvae, with a higher abundance near the surface during the day, and toward deeper strata at night. The Solenocera mysis (1685 individuals) showed a reverse behaviour, with high concentrations between 10 and 45 m depth. The Sicyonia mysis larvae (2465 specimens) increased their dispersion pattern along the water column at night. The distribution of the various penaeid larvae suggests a different vertical distribution behaviour for each group, with some overlap. The Solenocera's tend to remain mainly in the middle of the water column sampled, while Sicyonia larvae show a larger dispersion in that column, and the Penaeidae tend to concentrate near to the surface between 0 and 10 m depth. /// Se analiza la distribucin vertical de las larvas de camarones Penaeoideos capturados en dos muestreos efectuados en verano y otoo de 1993, durante un ciclo nictimeral en el Sur del Golfo de Mxico. Se colect un total de 7238 larvas correspondientes a los gneros Solenocera, Sicyonia y a la familia Penaeidae. El verano fue la poca de menor abundancia con un total de 1062 organismos. El escaso nmero (33 individuos) de larvas colectadas del gnero Sicyonia en este periodo no permiti visualizar un patrn de migracin vertical. En el gnero Solenocera (837 individuos) y en las larvas de la familia Penaeidae (192), se observ el tpico patrn de migracin vertical en el cual las larvas se distribuyeron en los estratos de menor profundidad durante la fase de oscuridad, mientras que en la fase luminosa realizaron movimientos hacia zonas de mayor profundidad. Durante el otoo se obtuvo la mayor abundancia de larvas con 6176 organismos capturados. Las larvas de la familia Penaeidae se ajustaron al patrn tpico de distribucin vertical de larvas meroplanctnicas con una mayor concentracin cerca de la superficie en el da y mas profundos en la noche. Las mysis del gnero Solenocera (1685 individuos) presentaron un comportamiento inverso, con concentraciones altas entre 10 y 45 m de profundidad. Las mysis de Sicyonia (2465 individuos) incrementaron su patrn de dispersin en la columna de agua durante la noche. La distribucin de las diferentes larvas de peneidos sugiere un comportamiento de distribucin vertical diferente para cada grupo con algunos sobrelapamientos. Los organismos del gnero Solenocera tienden a permanecer principalmente a la mitad de la columna de agua muestreada, las larvas del gnero Sicyonia muestran una mayor dispersin en la columna y los organismos de la familia Penaeidae tienden a concentrarse cerca de la superficie entre los 0 y 10 m de profundidad.
