20102717|Description of a fifth species in the ostracod genus Cytherois: C. pontica n. sp., from a depth of 10 to 15 m in the northwestern Black Sea.
20105273|The San Blas archipelago along the Atlantic coast of Panama is inhabited exclusively by Kuna Indians, who maintain the rights to exploit fishery resources in the area. Exportation of the spiny lobster, Panulirus argus, to Panama City constitutes one of the major sources of income for the Kuna economy. No published data exist on either the magnitude of the fishery or the life history and population dynamics of P. argus anywhere in Panama. We monitored P. argus export in two areas of Kuna Yala over a period spanning 16 months. We gathered data on weight, length, sex, and reproductive state of all lobsters comprising the catch of each day. Overall, the sex ratio of P. argus in the San Blas was not significantly different from unity. However, there was a significant excess of females among smaller size classes (&lt105 mm carapace length, CL), and of males among larger ones. The size of first reproduction for female P. argus in Kuna Yala is 67 mm CL as defined by the smallest size class including females with eggs or spermatophores, and 73 mm CL as defined by the smallest size class in which &gt20% of females carried eggs. Reproductive females were present during all 9 months covered by our monitoring, with no clear peak in their proportion, indicating year-round reproduction. Average measured daily export of P. argus to Panama City was 11.7 kg at one locality and 20.1 kg (in one of three outlets) at the other. Total estimated annual export was 18 t from these two localities and 92.48 t from the entire San Blas region. At 1998 prices, the total income to the Kuna nation from lobster export was estimated as US$ 620,388.00. Median carapace length of exported lobsters (83 mm in one locality, 77 mm in the other) was only slightly larger than the size at first sexual maturity. Thus, slightly less than half of the export consists of pre-reproductive individuals. However, because Kunas only fish for lobster by free-diving during the day, there is a sanctuary for lobster in depths &gt20 m. Removal of small P. argus individuals and harvesting of shallow coral for the construction of sea walls are the greatest threats to the resource. As of 1998, the estimated yield per km (67 kg) was relatively high compared with other areas of the Caribbean, considering that no traps, nets, or SCUBA diving are employed in the fishery. /// El Archipilago de Kuna Yala, en la costa caribea de Panam, est habitado exclusivamente por los Kunas, quienes mantienen el derecho exclusivo de explotar los recursos pesqueros del rea. La exportacin de la langosta espinosa Panulirus argus a la ciudad de Panam constituye una de las mayores fuentes de ingresos para la economa Kuna. Existe poca informacin publicada sobre la magnitud de la pesca, ni de la historia de vida y dinmica de la poblacin de P. argus en ningn lugar en Panam. Monitoreamos la exportacin de P. argus en dos reas de Kuna Yala durante 16 meses. Recopilamos datos acerca del peso, la longitud (talla), sexo, y estado de reproduccin de todas las langostas capturadas cada da. Por lo general, la proporcin macho/hembra de P. argus en Kuna Yala no era diferente de la unidad. No obstante, hubo un exceso de hembras entre las clases pequeas [&lt105 mm en longitud del cefalotrax (CL)], y de machos entre las clases ms grandes. La talla de la primera reproduccin de la hembra de P. argus en Kuna Yala, definida como por la clase de tamao ms pequea que incluye hembras con huevos o con espermatforos, era de 67 mm CL, y 73 mm CL definida como la clase de tamao ms pequea en la cual mayor que el 20% de las hembras llevaban huevos. Estuvieron presentes hembras reproductoras durante todos los 9 meses cubiertos por nuestro monitoreo, sin demostrar ninguna temporada ms activa, lo que indica que la reproduccin ocurre durante todo el ao. La exportacin promedia de P. argus a la ciudad de Panam fue 11,7 kg en una localidad, y 20,1 kg (en uno de los tres vendedores) en la otra. La exportacin anual estimada fue de 18 t de estas dos localidades, y 92,48 t de la regin entera del Archipilago de Kuna Yala. A los precios de 1998, se estim que el ingreso total a la nacin Kuna de la exportacin de langostas fue de $US 620.388,00. La longitud media del cefalotrax (83 mm en una localidad, 77 mm en la otra) fue ligeramente ms grande que el tamao de la primera madurez sexual. De esta manera, casi la mitad de la exportacin est compuesto por individuos en estado pre-reproductor. Sin embargo, los Kunas slo pescan langostas buceando a pulmn sin equipo de buceo (SCUBA) y solo durante el da, por lo tanto, podemos afirmar que existe un santuario natural para las langostas a profundidades mayores de 20 m. La captura de individuos pequeos de P. argus y la colecta de los corales vivos y muertos que se encuentra en agua poca profunda, para el relleno y construccin de murallas de mar frente a las islas son las amenazas ms grandes al recurso. A partir de 1998, la produccin estimada por kilometro cuadrado (67,0 kg) fue relativamente alta comparado con otras reas del Caribe, al considerar que en la pesca de la langosta en la regin Kuna, no se usa ninguna trampa, ni red, ni equipo de buceo (SCUBA).
20101892|Die Gewebe und Organe von neun Flusskrebs-Arten -- Cambarus bartoni, C. diogenes, C. fodiens, C. robustus, Orconectes immunis, O. obscurus, O. propinquus, O. rusticus und O. virilis -- aus Zentral- und Sd-Ontario (Kanada), wurden (Dnnschichtchromatographie auf Zellulose Platten) auf Pteridinen untersucht. Zwlf Pteridinen und vier Purinen wurden gefunden; alle Organe und Gewebe enthielten mindestens eine Pteridine. Augen und Hypodermis enthielten die grsste Anzahl, die Cuticula die wenigste Anzahl dieser Stoffe.
23034312|Tidal cycles had no significant effect on the abundance or community structure of plankton at AFMED (Aquaculture, Fisheries and Marine Environment Department) Marina, nor had any physicochemical factor, except salinity, on the density of copepods (p < 0.05), although variation in the physichochemical data measured was small. The major components of the plankton community throughout the study were copepods, Noctiluca spp. (mostly N. scintillans (Macartney) Kofoid & Swezy), and cirripede nauplii. Their abundance differed between high and low tides throughout the study. Variation between high and low tides was also observed among the various groups and species of copepods. MDPs (Mean Density Percentages) of calanoids, copepod nauplii, and poecilostomatoids were higher at high tide (45%, 20.09%, and 2.81%, respectively), while cyclopoid and harpacticoid MDPs were higher at low tide (30.63% and 9.95%, respectively). The most dominant copepods were Parvocalanus crassirostris (F. Dahl, 1894), Paracalanus spp., Oithona simplex Farran, 1913, Euterpina acutifrons (Dana, 1847), Oncaea spp., and Corycaeus spp. The copepods with the highest MDPs at high tide were Parvocalanus crassirostris (14.19%), Paracalanus spp. (10.79%), Oncaea spp. (1.75%) and Corycaeus spp. (1.06%), respectively, while Oithona simplex and Euterpina acutifrons had a higher MDP at low tide (14.97% and 9.12%, respectively). The highest MDP at low tide was that of Oithona simplex. Neither tide nor any other factor measured had a significant effect on any of the copepods. Other, related factors (mainly biological and anthropogenic) may thus have accounted for the differences in abundance and biodiversity observed. Weder Tidezyklus noch physikochemische Faktoren hatten einen signifikanten Effekt auf Zahl und Zusammensetzung von Plankton im AFMED (ist die englische Abkrzung fr Aqualkultur, Fischerei- und Meeresforschung der Abteilung Umwelt) Hafen, nur Salinitt wirkte sich auf die Copepodendichte aus (p < 0,05), die Variationsbreite der gemessenen physikochemischen Daten war dabei insgesamt klein. Es wurde in der Studie festgestellt, dass Copepoden, Noctiluca spp. (hauptschlich N. scintillans (Macartney) Kofoid & Swezy) und Cirripedier-Nauplien die Hauptbestandteile der Planktongemeinschaft bildeten. Ihre Abundanzen vernderten sich die ganze Studie ber zwischen Hoch- und Niedrigwasser. Diese Variabilitt zwischen Hoch- und Niedrigwasser wurde auch fr andere Copepodengruppen und -arten beobachtet. Der mittlere Dichteanteil von Calanoida, Copepoden-Nauplien und Poecilostomatoiden war hher bei Hochwasser (45%, 20,09% und 2,81%), whrend er fr Cyclopoiden und Harpacticoiden bei Niedrigwasser hher war (30,63% und 9,95%). Die dominantesten Copepodenarten waren Parvocalanus crassirostris (F. Dahl, 1894), Paracalanus spp., Oithona simplex Farran, 1913, Euterpina acutifrons (Dana, 1847), Oncaea spp. und Corycaeus spp. Die Copepoden mit den hchsten mittleren Dichteanteilen bei Hochwasser waren Parvocalanus crassirostris (14,19%), Paracalanus spp. (10,79%), Oncaea spp. (1,75%) und Corycaeus spp. (1,06%), whrend Oithona simplex und Euterpina acutifrons hhere mittlere Dichteanteile bei Niedrigwasser zeigten (14,97% und 9,12%). Die Art mit dem hchsten mittleren Dichteanteil bei Niedrigwasser war Oithona simplex. Weder die Tide noch andere Faktoren hatten einen signifikanten Einfluss auf die Copepoden. Auch andere verwandte Parameter (besonders biologische und anthropogene Faktoren) knnten also die beobachtete Unterschiede in Abundanz und Biodiversitt erklren.

20105942|Monocheres cagarrensis sp. nov., a second species of the genus Monocheres, has been discovered in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, associated with sponges. It shows the reduction of the fifth leg to a seta, which characterizes the genus. M. cagarrensis differs from its congener by the length of the siphon which reaches the insertion of P2, and by the presence of a group of denticles on the postero-lateral corners of the genital double-somite, a denticle on the postero-lateral corners of the postgenital somite, and 2 setae on the second endopodal segment of the antenna. /// Monocheres cagarrensis sp. nov., seconde espce du genre Monocheres, a t dcouvert  Rio de Janeiro, Brsil, associ  des ponges. 23065222|This paper discusses the osmotic capacity of the non-native Pontogammarus robustoides (G. O. Sars, 1894) in the context of the current occurrence of individuals of this species in the brackich waters of northern Poland, and its potential colonization of new localities. P. robustoides inhabits numerous water bodies with a wide range of salinities and is continuously expanding its range of distribution. During these studies, the osmoregulatory curve of P. robustoides was determined for the first time. This curve, ranging from 0 to 23 PSU, indicates the hyperosmotic nature of osmoregulation in this species and its considerable ability to adapt to different environmental salinities. The investigated parameters define the response of an organism to the salinity stress of its external environment. Cet article discute la capacit d'osmorgulation de Pontogammarus robustoides (G. O. Sars, 1894) espce non native, dans le cadre de la prsence actuelle d'individus de cette espce dans les eaux saumtres du nord de la Pologne, et de sa colonisation potentielle de nouveaux lieux. P. robustoides habite de nombreux cours d'eau avec une gamme tendue de salinits et l'tendu de sa distribution est en augmentation continuelle. Au cours de cette tude, la courbe d'osmorgulation de P. robustoides a t dtermine pour la premire fois. Cette courbe, allant de 0  23 PSU, montre la nature hypergulatrice de l'osmorgulation chez cette espce et sa considrable facult d'adaptation  diffrentes salinits de l'environnement. Les paramtres examins dfinissent la rponse d'un organisme  un stress de salinit dans son environnement externe.
20105225|Diacyclops humphreysi n. sp. is described from the Cape Range karst area, North-west Cape Peninsula, Western Australia. The new species fits the Diacyclops crassicaudis-complex (Reid, 1992), being close to D. longifurcus Shen & Sung, 1963, from China and D. alticola Kiefer, 1935, from India. Jusqu' prsent le groupe crassicaudis n'avait pas t signale en Australie.
20102780|Careful examination of the enveloping membranous folds (expansions of the basal disc) of the actinian Adamsia palliata (Bohadsch), associated with the pagurid Pagurus prideauxi Leach, has revealed the presence of an inquilinous harpacticid copepod, Laophonte adamsiae n. sp. The systematic position of this harpacticid within the genus Laophonte is discussed. L. adamsiae belongs to the setosa-group of that genus; the main characters separating it from the related species of the group are: the flattened body, the three-segmented exopod of the first leg, and the structure of the fifth leg.
20105988|Changes in ovarian weight and volume of Crangon crangon during ovarian development are subjected to mathematical treatment. The relationship between ovarian wet weight and ovarian stage is exponential, and indicates that the developmental stages (oogenesis, previtellogenesis, vitellogenesis) are approximately equal in duration. The exponential relation allows, although to a limited extent, the prediction of ovarian stage from values of percentage of body weight occupied by the ovary. Derived increase in ovary wet weight is related more to increase in ova volume than to increase in the number of ova, particularly during later stages of development. At stage 6 virtually all the supporting tissue has disappeared, while the weight of the ovary is still about half its maximal weight as attained at stage 7. /// Les changements dans le poids et le volume des ovaires de Crangon crangon pendant le dveloppement ovarien sont soumis  un traitement mathmatique. La relation entre le poids ovarien humide et le stade ovarien est exponentiel, et indique que les stades de dveloppement (ovogense, prvitellogense, vitellogense) sont approximativement gaux en dure. La relation exponentielle permet, quoique dans de certaines limites, la prdiction du stade ovarien d'aprs les valeurs du pourcentage du poids du corps occup par l'ovaire. L'accroissement driv dans le poids ovarien humide est davantage en relation avec l'accroissement du volume des oeufs que de leur nombre, particulirement pendant les derniers stades du dveloppement. Au stade 6, tous les tissus de support ont virtuellement disparu, alors que le poids de l'ovaire est encore  la moiti du poids maximal atteint au stade 7.

20107699|The present work reviews the previous reproductive studies on red shrimp, Aristeus antennatus, and is initially based on those. Subsequently, we propose a reduction in the number of stages distinguished in macroscopic gonadal classification, in an attempt to correlate the microscopic characteristics observed with each macroscopic stage recognized. Macroscopic and microscopic characteristics of the stages of ovarian maturity of the red shrimp are reported, with special attention to the relationship between the general appearance of the ovary and the histology of ovarian tissues. Six different stages of ovarian development can be defined according to the relationship between the general appearance of the ovary, the histology of the ovarian tissues, and the gonadosomatic index. They constitute a reliable guide for judging maturation stages. Previtellogenic oocytes correspond to nucleolar and perinuclear chromatin oocytes. Endogenous vitellogenesis starts on perinuclear oocytes, in cysts located at the periphery of the ovarian lobe. Exogenous vitellogenesis starts just after the onset of folliculogenesis, the coloration appearing when follicle cells surround the oocytes. Following initial oocyte growth, follicle cells move from the germinal epithelium into the growth zone, attach to the periphery of each oocyte, and surround it. The final stage of the ripe ovary shows that developing oocytes mature synchronously, with only one spawning event for each individual shrimp taking place in each reproductive season. The exogenous vitellogenesis process of ovarian maturation seems to be induced by spermatophore attachment, since gonad weight increases after a spermatophore is attached. Only a few individuals with spent ovaries were detected and this may indicate that females move to other zones or even to deeper waters just before spawning. Variability in the onset and the duration of the reproductive cycle has been recorded between reproductive years, to account for environmental variability. /// El presente estudio revisa los estudios reproductivos realizados anteriormente sobre la gamba rosada, Aristeus antennatus, y se basa inicialmente en ellos. Se propone una reduccin en el nmero de estadios de maduracin de la clasificacin macroscpica gonadal, intentando sintetizar las caractersticas microscpicas de cada etapa macroscpica. Las caractersticas macroscpicas y microscpicas de los estadios de maduracin ovrica se analizan poniendo especial atencin en la relacin entre el aspecto general del ovario y la histologa de los tejidos ovricos. Seis etapas de desarrollo ovrico se pueden definir segn la relacin entre el aspecto general del ovario, la histologa de los tejidos ovricos y el ndice gonadosomtico. Estos estadios de maduracin son una gua til para determinar la maduracin ovrica. Los oocitos previtelognicos corresponden a oocitos cromatin nuclear y cromatin perinuclear. La vitelognesis endgena comienza en oocitos perinucleares, en lbulos situados en la periferia del ovario. La vitelognesis exgena comienza inmediatamente despus del inicio de la foliculognesis y la coloracin aparece cuando las clulas foliculares rodean los oocitos. Despus del crecimiento inicial del oocito, las clulas del folculo se mueven desde el epitelio germinal en la zona de crecimiento hacia la periferia del oocito y lo rodean. En la etapa final de maduracin los oocitos que maduran sincrnicamente producen un nico acontecimiento de puesta para cada individuo por periodo reproductivo. El proceso de vitelognesis exgena parece ser inducido por la deposicin del espermatforo, observndose un aumento del peso de la gnada despus de que tenga lugar la colocacin del espermatforo. Solamente se detectaron algunos individuos con los ovarios en estado de postpuesta indicando que las hembras se trasladan a otras zonas ms profundas momentos antes de la puesta. Se dio variabilidad del inicio y duracin del ciclo reproductivo entre los aos debido a variabilidad ambiental.

20088747|Populations of Triopsidae (Notostraca) exhibit a wide variation in sex ratio and, therefore, have received enormous interest. However, investigations focusing on this subject are often suffering from problems in discriminating males and females phenotypically. In the present study 29 individuals of Triops cancriformis found in two locations in Germany were characterized ethologically, morphologically, and histologically in order to investigate the reliability of the sex ratio of populations north of 50N. Among ten distinct morphological characteristics the structure of the eleventh pair of legs turned out to be the only suitable one for discriminating the gender of (fixed) Triops material. This was confirmed by histological examination of the respective gonads. In total, three sexual males were found. Their sperms were round and non-flagellar, contained large nuclei, and showed no signs of degeneration. Histologically, there was no evidence for the occurrence of hermaphroditic individuals. These findings suggest that Triops cancriformis populations in Germany north of 50N are not clonal and at best facultatively hermaphroditic. In conclusion, the results of the present study provide evidence for the occurrence of sexual Triops cancriformis males and females in European populations at latitudes beyond 50N for the first time. Generally, this is the northernmost find of male Triops cancriformis in Europe and the first report of recent males in Middle Europe since 1955. /// Das Geschlechterverhltnis in Populationen der Triopsidae (Notostraca) variiert sehr stark und ist daher oft untersucht worden. Ein prinzipielles Problem solcher Studien besteht allerdings in der oft schwierigen Unterscheidung von Mnnchen und Weibchen anhand phnotypischer Merkmale. Im Rahmen der vorliegenden Arbeit wurden 29 Individuen von Triops cancriformis ethologisch, morphologisch und histologisch untersucht, um das Geschlechterverhltnis von Populationen in Deutschland nrdlich 50N zuverlssig zu analysieren. Von zehn verschiedenen morphologischen Charakteristika korrelierte nur die Struktur des elften Beinpaares der (fixierten) Tiere eindeutig mit den Ergebnissen der histologischen Kontrolle der jeweiligen Gonaden. Unter den untersuchten Tieren befanden sich drei geschlechtliche Mnnchen. Ihre Spermien waren rund, unbegeielt, besaen groe Nuclei und wiesen keinerlei Anzeichen einer Degeneration auf. Die histologische Analyse der Gonaden der Mnnchen und ausgewhlter Weibchen von Triops cancriformis erbrachte keine Hinweise auf Hermaphroditismus. Die Ergebnisse zeigen, da Populationen von Triops cancriformis in Deutschland nrdlich 50N nicht klonal und hchstens fakultativ hermaphroditisch sind. Insgesamt beweist die vorliegende Arbeit erstmalig das Vorkommen von geschlechtlichen Triops cancriformis-Mnnchen und -Weibchen in europischen Populationen nrdlich 50N. Die Funde stellen die nrdlichsten Vorkommen berhaupt und den ersten Beleg von rezenten Mnnchen in ganz Mitteleuropa seit 1955 dar.

L'espce est annuelle et prsente deux centres de reproduction, l'un en t, l'autre au printemps. Les reproducteurs du printemps sont deux fois plus longs que les reproducteurs de l't et se reproduisent pour la deuxime et dernire fois. Leurs jeunes, s'unissant  une population de jeunes de l't prcdent, se dveloppent pour former les reproducteurs de petite taille de l't. 41038644|The present study was carried out to evaluate the effects of selectivity of fyke-nets of different mesh size on Astacus leptodactylus (Eschscholtz, 1823), in lake Eirdir in Turkey. Crayfish were sampled monthly using fyke-nets of 26 mm (control), 34 mm (traditional), and 42 mm (increased) mesh size from July to December 2007. Differences in the mean size, weight, and number of crayfish caught with each mesh size were determined. The average length and weight were found to increase proportionally to mesh size. The highest mean weight (g) ( SD) (41.07  4.61) was achieved at 42 mm mesh size compared with mean weights of 32.76  4.53 and 29.29  4.37 at sizes of 34 and 26 mm, respectively. The same trend was observed in mean TL of crayfish caught at 42, 34, and 26 mm size, but no significant difference was detected in mean length and weight for male and female crayfish. The weight of crayfish caught in 42 mm mesh was 8.3% higher than that in 34 mm mesh size. The lowest number of crayfish was caught with the 42 mm mesh size, while the highest number was captured with 34 mm mesh. This study shows that increasing mesh size has a positive effect on selectivity, because the mean total length L in the catch approximates the minimum landing size for this species in Turkey. L values (total length) for female, male, and combined sexes were 9.93  0.41 cm, 9.73  0.34, and 9.93  0.34 cm for 42 mm, and 6.54  0.60 cm, 7.28  0.30, and 7.09  0.3 cm for 34 mm, respectively. It was presumed that 34 mm mesh size, which is commercially used, has poor selectivity. On the other hand, 34 mm mesh size caused a loss in marketable crayfish among the three tested mesh sizes. The 42 mm mesh size provided the most appropriate selection of the crayfish, compared with sizes of crayfish at 34, and 26 mm mesh, respectively. Meanwhile, as mesh size increases, the female escape ratio becomes higher than the male escape ratio. Thus, increase in mesh size of nets will have a positive impact not only on preserving a sustainable stock, but also sparing labour and time to be spent on fishing operations. La prsente tude a t ralise afin d'valuer les effets de la slectivit de verveux (fyke-nets) de diffrentes tailles de maille sur Astacus leptodactylus (Eschscholtz, 1823), dans le lac Egirdir en Turquie. Les crevisses ont t chantillonnes mensuellement en utilisant des verveux  mailles de 26 mm (contrle), 34 mm (traditionnel), et 42 mm (augmente) de juillet  dcembre 2007. Des diffrences de taille moyenne, de poids et de nombre d'crevisses captures avec chaque taille de maille ont t dtermines. La longueur et le poids moyens ont t trouvs augmentant proportionnellement  la taille de la maille. Le poids moyen le plus lev ( SD) (g) (41,07  4,61) a t obtenu avec la taille de maille de 42 mm, comparativement aux poids moyens de 32,76  4,53 et 29,29  4,37 obtenus avec les mailles de 34 et 26 mm, respectivement. La mme tendance a t observe pour la longueur moyenne (TL) des crevisses collectes  l'aide des mailles de 42, 34, et 26 mm, mais aucune diffrence significative n'a t dtecte sur la longueur moyenne et le poids chez les mles et les femelles. Le poids des crevisses captures avec des mailles de 42 mm tait 8,3% plus lev qu'avec des mailles de 34 mm. Le nombre le plus faible d'crevisses a t obtenu avec la taille de maille de 42 mm, tandis que le plus grand nombre a t captur avec la maille de 34 mm. Cette tude montre que l'augmentation de la taille de la maille a un effet positif sur la slectivit, parce que la longueur totale moyenne L dans la capture approche la taille lgale de pche pour cette espce en Turquie. Les valeurs de L (longueur totale) pour les femelles, mles et sexes combins taient 9,93  0,41, 9,73  0,34, et 9,93  0,34 cm pour 42 mm; 6,54  0,60, 7,28  0,30, et 7,09  0,3 cm pour 34 mm, respectivement. Il a t suppos que la taille de maille de 34 mm, qui est utilise commercialement, a une faible slectivit. D'autre part, une taille de maille de 34 mm a provoqu une perte d'crevisses commercialisables parmi les trois tailles de mailles testes. La taille 42 mm a fourni la slection la plus approprie d'crevisses, compar aux tailles d'crevisses aux mailles 34 et 26 mm, respectivement. Pendant ce temps, comme la taille de maille augmente, le taux d'chappement de la femelle devient suprieur  celui du mle. Ainsi, l'augmentation de la taille de maille des filets aura un impact positif non seulement en prservant un stock durable, mais aussi en pargnant le travail et le temps passs sur les oprations de pche.

20107638|Digging is not a well-understood form of locomotion, and it poses different mechanical problems than other forms of locomotion (e.g., walking). The spanner crab (Ranina ranina) digs into sand, primarily using its pereiopods. Above sand, pereiopod movement is variable, with four different movement patterns revealed by tip trajectories. The most common pattern of pereiopod movement above sand is the pattern apparently used for digging: pereiopods 2 and 3 shovel sand forward from underneath the animal, while pereiopod 4 shovels in the opposite direction, pushing the posterior end down into the sand. When above sand, each pair of pereiopods moves in bilateral alternation, but R. ranina switches gait to bilateral synchrony as it descends into sand. The abdomen is also rhythmically active during digging, despite being small and relatively stiff. Ranina ranina can also locomote forward on top of the substrate by punting with pereiopods 2 and 3. Although many aspects of digging in R. ranina are similar to those of digging by other crustaceans, particularly anomuran sand crabs, R. ranina has retained a wider behavioural repertoire. /// S'enfoncer dans le substrat n'est pas une forme de locomotion bien comprise, et pose des problmes mcaniques diffrents des autres modes de locomotion (comme par exemple la marche). Le crabe Ranina ranina s'enfonce dans le sable, utilisant en premier ses priopodes. Au-dessus du sable, le mouvement des priopodes est variable, avec quatre modles de mouvement diffrents, rvls par les trajectoires des extrmits. Le modle le plus commun du mouvement du priopode au-dessus du sable est celui apparemment utilis pour s'enfoncer: les priopodes 2 et 3 rejettent le sable de dessous l'animal vers l'extrieur, tandis que le priopode 4 opre en sens inverse, poussant la partie postrieure de l'animal dans le sable. Quand l'animal est sur le sable, chaque paire de priopodes se dplace latralement dans un sens et dans l'autre alternativement, mais R. ranina change de mouvement, suivant une synchronie bilatrale quand il descend dans le sable. L'abdomen est aussi actif en rythme, quand l'animal s'enfonce, en dpit de sa petite taille et de sa relative raideur. Ranina ranina peut aussi se dplacer vers la surface du substrat en ramant avec ses priopodes 2 et 3. Bien que de nombreux aspects de l'enfoncement chez R. ranina soient analogues  ceux d'autres crustacs, en particulier des crabes de sables anomoures, R. ranina a dvelopp un rpertoire comportemental plus tendu.
20102318|Der neue, hier beschriebene parasitische Copepode wurde in der Kiemenkammer eines Lumpenus macrops Matsubara und Ochiai gefunden, der vor der Kste der Sado Insel im Japanischen Meer gefangen worden war. Die erbeuteten Exemplare zeigten in beiden Geschlechtern eine grosse hnlichkeit mit der Gattung Pharodes Illg, dem einzigen Reprsentanten der Unterfamilie Pharodinae, Familie Chondracanthidae. Andererseits unterscheiden sie sich aber von dieser Gattung in einer Anzahl von Charakteren, was die Errichtung einer neuen Gattung innerhalf der genannten Unterfamilie zu rechtfertigen scheint: Parapharodes n. gen., mit P. sadoensis n. sp.
20101656|1. Der Einflu verschiedener Ernhrungsarten auf Wachstum, Fruchtbarkeit und Lebenslnge von Acanthocyclops viridis (Jurine) wurde studiert, und zwar unter Laboratoriumsbedingungen bei Temperaturen zwischen 16 und 18 C. 2. Mnnchen wuchsen bei einer aus gemischten Algen bestehenden Dit ebenso schnell wie bei einer Dit aus mehreren tierischen Komponenten. Weibchen, die nur Algen erhielten, wuchsen ebenso gut wie solche, die tierische Nahrung vorgesetzt bekamen bis zum letzten Larvalstadium; aber dann huteten sie sich entweder berhaupt nicht oder erreichten das adulte Stadium erst nach einer Verzgerung von mehreren Wochen. Von den tierischen Nahrungsquellen verursachten Stadium I-Nauplien des Salinenkrebses Artemia salina das schnellste Wachstum, des Wasserflohs Chydorus sphaericus das langsamste. Protozoennahrung gestattete schnelleres Wachstum als die getesteten Cladoceren. 3. Die Zeit bis zur ersten Brutablage war doppelt so lang bei Weibchen, die mit Algen gefttert worden waren, als bei Weibchen, die tierische Nahrung erhielten. 4. Mit Protozoen geftterte Weibchen hatten -- unter den mit tierischer Nahrung versorgten Individuen -- die geringsten Eizahlen. Das bedeutet: Obgleich A. viridis gut mit Protozoennahrung gedeiht, legen die Weibchen nur wenige Eier, es sei denn, sie fressen auch grere Nahrungsorganismen. 5. Die Lebensdauer schwankte zwischen 70 und 100 Tagen. Die Unterschiede in beiden Geschlechtern waren niemals gro. In drei Fllen lebten Mnnchen lnger als Weibchen. Die krzesten Lebensspannen wurden in beiden Geschlechtern bei Individuen registriert, welche Nauplien von Artemia salina gefressen hatten. 6. Adulte Weibchen von A. viridis fraen whrend ihres ganzen Lebens als Adulti mehr kleine als groe Simocephalus vetulus. 20104370|A new species, the second known at present in the primitive family of the Gelyellidae, has been collected in Switzerland by continuous filtering a karstic spring in the Neuchtel Jura. The morphological characteristics of this new species, Gelyella monardi, confirm the peculiar place that the Gelyellidae occupy in the Harpacticoida, and even in the Copepoda. The freshwater or marine origin of the two stygobiont species of this family is discussed, particulary in function with Miocene marine transgressions.

Es wurde in geringer Entfernung nrdlich der Juan Fernandez Inseln gesammelt; dort kommen auch die Erwachsenen dieser Art vor. Bisher ist keine andere Scyllarus Art von der Westkste Amerikas bekannt.
20787187|The morphology of the mandible and stomach lateralia in some Lake Baikal amphipods has been investigated in regard to their food preference. Six species of endemic amphipods with different life styles (so-called "life forms") have been studied by means of light and scanning electron microscopy. The modifications of the mandible are attributed to the food resources used. The position of the incisor and lacinia mobilis, their width and length, the structure of the triturative area of the molar, the wearing of incisor and lacinia mobilis between two moults, and the relative length of the stomach depend on the type of food. None of the species studied revealed complete reduction of any part of the mandible. The most specialized species are the oophage Pachyschesis bazikalovae G. Karaman, 1976, the necrophage Ommatogammarus albinus (Dybowsky, 1874), and a species biting holes in sponges with a siliceous skeleton, Eulimnogammarus violaceus (Dybowsky, 1874). The morphology of the lateralia seems not to be connected with the food type, but is probably important from a phylogenetic point of view. La morphologie de la mandibule et des pices latrales de l'estomac de certains amphipodes du lac Bakal a t tudie en relation avec leurs prfrences alimentaires. Six espces d'amphipodes endmiques ayant des modes de vie diffrents (dsigns par le terme "life forms") ont t examines au microscope lectronique  balayage et au microscope optique. On a montr que les modifications de la mandibule sont dtermines par le type d'aliments utiliss. La position du processus incisif et de la lacinia mobilis, la largeur et la longueur de ces pices, la structure de la surface broyeuse du processus molaire, l'usure subie par le processus incisif et la lacinia mobilis pendant l'intermue, ainsi que la longueur relative de l'estomac dpendent du type de nourriture. Parmi les espces examines, aucune n'a subi la rduction totale d'une partie ou d'une autre de la mandibule. Les espces les plus spcialises sont l'oophage Pachyschesis bazikalovae G. Karaman, 1976, le ncrophage Ommatogammarus albinus (Dybowsky, 1874) et une espce inquiline Eulimnogammarus violaceus (Dybowsky, 1874) qui vit dans des cavits qu'elle creuse dans des ponges  squelette siliceux. La morphologie des pices latrales de l'estomac ne semble pas lie au type de nourriture, mais est probablement importante du point de vue phylogntique.
20102356|La microscopie lectronique a rvl un type unique de flagelle caudal chez les spermatozodes des Isopodes Cyathura sp., Idotea balthica et Oniscus asellus. Ce flagelle consiste en un long cylindre flexible (ou lastique), de 300-350 m de diamtre, transversalement stri  travers toute son paisseur avec une alternance rgulire de bandes denses et de bandes moins denses. Il y a une partie axiale segmente, mais aucune preuve d'une structure fibrillaire analogue  celle que l'on a trouve dans toutes les queues de spermatozodes examines jusqu'ici avec le microscope lectronique. Les implications phylogntiques de cette structure inhabituelle sont discutes.
20106268|Artificial habitat is often created to augment populations of commercially valuable species. The complex structure of the habitat provides refuge from predation. In Grays Harbor, Washington, this concept is being applied by constructing intertidal oyster shell plots for megalopae settlement of Dungeness crab (Cancer magister). Previous monitoring of these plots revealed a negative relationship between shore crab, Hemigrapsus oregonensis, densities and C. magister juveniles within the shell plots. The present study investigated the settlement of C. magister in the presence of Hemigrapsus. We also explored the ability of Hemigrapsus to prey on juvenile C. magister instars. C. magister megalopae avoided Hemigrapsus, whose presence was detected chemically, not visually. Results support the hypothesis that C. magister megalopae avoid Hemigrapsus when selecting areas to settle. Hemigrapsus predation upon juvenile C. magister, with carapace width of approximately 8 mm, begins to occur when the Hemigrapsus are approximately 1.5 times the size of the C. magister. Predation on C. magister early instars increases as the size ratio (C. magister: Hemigrapsus) decreases. /// Un habitat artificiel est souvent cr pour augmenter les populations d'espces  valeur commerciale. La structure complexe de l'habitat fournit des abris contre la prdation.  Grays Harbor, Washington, E.U.A., ce concept est appliqu en construisant des amas intertidaux de coquilles d'huitres pour l'tablissement des mgalopes du crabe de Dungeness (Cancer magister). Un suivi pralable de ces amas a rvl une relation ngative entre les densits du crabe Hemigrapsus oregonensis et des juvniles de C. magister  l'intrieur des constructions de coquilles. Cette tude a port sur l'tablissement de C. magister en prsence d'Hemigrapsus. Nous avons aussi explor la capacit de Hemigrapsus  se nourrir des stades juvniles de C. magister. Les mgalopes de C. magister vitaient Hemigrapsus, dont la prsence tait dtecte chimiquement, et non visuellement. Les rsultats appuient l'hypothse que les mgalopes de C. magister vitent Hemigrapsus quand elles slectionnent les zones pour s'y tablir. La prdation d'Hemigrapsus sur les juvniles de C. magister, d'une largeur de carapace de 8 mm environ, commence  se produire quand les Hemigrapsus ont environ 1,5 fois la taille de C. magister. La prdation sur les premiers stades de C. magister augmente quand le rapport de taille (Hemigrapsus: C. magister) augmente.
20102811|Les auteurs prsentent une revue critique de la littrature relative aux espces et aux groupes d'espces inclus dans les sous-genres Solidobalanus et Hesperibalanus, et la compltent par l'examen de nombreux spcimens des espces disponibles dans le sous-genre. Les rsultats de cette tude indiquent clairement que Hesperibalanus n'est pas un sous-genre valide et doit tre considr comme un synonyme de Solidobalanus. En outre, une nouvelle espce de Solidobalanus est dcrite du Pacifique oriental. Elle est particulirement remarquable car elle est, parmi les Balanomorpha, la premire espce connue comme ayant des mles complmentaires.
20111407|During a study on the ecology and biology of the fan mussel, Pinna nobilis along the northern and eastern coasts of Tunisia, the presence of the shrimp, Pontonia pinnophylax and the crab, Nepinnotheres pinnotheres (Decapoda) associated with this bivalve, was recorded. The shrimp was collected only in the lagoon of Bizerte, whereas the crab was found exclusively at Stah Jaber (close to the fishing port of Monastir). P. nobilis was occupied by Pontonia pinnophylax in 23.3% of the samples and the associated shrimp population was dominated by males (63.6%). Shrimp couples were generally encountered inside the large pinnids, and the size of the shrimps increased with that of the host. P. nobilis was occupied by Nepinnotheres pinnotheres in 56.7% of the cases. The highest numbers of crabs were recorded in the oldest pinnids. The sex-ratio of the associated crab population was male-biased, 62.5% of the population being males. A morphological study of the two associated species revealed some features worth noting. In the female shrimp, distinguished by the right chela in the second pair of pereiopods being definitely larger than the left, the length of this appendage (both right and left) increased with individual size, but these two variables were found independent in the male shrimp. Concerning Nepinnotheres pinnotheres, the length of the two chelae of the first pair of pereiopods increased with that of the animal's body in both sexes. /// Dans le cadre d'une tude sur l'cologie et la biologie de la grande nacre, Pinna nobilis, le long des ctes septentrionale et orientale de la Tunisie, nous avons observ la prsence de la crevette Pontonia pinnophylax et du crabe Nepinnotheres pinnotheres (Decapoda) associs  ce bivalve. La crevette a t rcolte uniquement dans la lagune de Bizerte, tandis que le crabe a t trouv exclusivement  Stah Jaber (prs du port de pche de Monastir). P. nobilis tait occupe par Pontonia pinnophylax dans 23,3% des chantillons et la population tait domine par les mles (63,6%). Des couples de crevettes se rencontraient gnralement dans les grandes nacres et la taille des crevettes augmentait avec celle de l'hte. P. nobilis tait occupe par Nepinnotheres pinnotheres dans 56,7% des cas. Les nombres les plus levs de crabes ont t relevs dans les nacres les plus ges. La sex-ratio de la population de crabe associe tait en faveur des mles avec 62,5% de la population constitue de mles. Une tude morphologique des deux espces associes a rvl quelques faits qui valent la peine d'tre nots. Chez la crevette femelle, que l'on distingue par la pince droite de la deuxime paire de priopodes nettement plus grande que la gauche, la longueur de cet appendice ( droite comme  gauche), augmente avec la taille de l'individu, mais ces deux variables sont indpendantes chez la crevette mle. Chez Nepinnotheres pinnotheres, la longueur des deux pinces de la premire paire de priopodes augmente avec celle du corps de l'animal dans les deux sexes.
20104082|Cordioniscus antiparosi n. sp. is described from a cave on the island of Antiparos. This is the fourth species of the genus in Greece. The new species is similar to C. beroni Vandel from Crete.

23034290|In this second report based on material collected by Prof. N. Zarenkov during the cruise of the R/V "Orlik" to the Gulf of Tonkin, Vietnam, in 1960, and on the cruise of the R/V "Akademik Kovalvsky" to the Red Sea, both in 1960 and 1966, 11 species of the families Callianassidae and Upogebiidae are examined. It was found that the material includes two species, Cheramus malaccaensis (Sakai, 2002) and Trypaea tonkinae (Grebenjuk, 1975) from the Callianassidae, and Neogebicula alaini (Sakai, 1982), Paragebicula orlik sp. nov., P. vietnamensis sp. nov., Gebicula irawadyensis Sakai, 2006, Mantisgebia tuerkayi sp. nov., Upogebia acutispina De Saint Laurent & Ngoc-Ho, 1979, U. monoceros De Man, 1905, U. plantae Sakai, 1982, and U. variana sp. nov., i.e., a total of 9 species of which four are new, from the family Upogebiidae. Zarenkov 1960 bei Meeresexpeditionen mit FS "Orlik" im Golf von Tonking (Vietnam) und 1960 sowie 1966 mit FS "Kovalvsky" im Roten Meer gesammelt hat, geht es um elf Arten der Familien Callianassidae und Upogebiidae. Zwei Arten, Cheramus malaccaensis (Sakai, 2002) und Trypaea tonkinae (Grebenjuk, 1975), gehren zu den Callianassidae und neun Arten, von denen vier neu fr die Wissenschaft sind, zu den Upogebiidae: Neogebicula alaini (Sakai, 1982), Paragebicula orlik sp. nov., P. vietnamensis sp. nov., Gebicula irawadyensis Sakai, 2006, Mantisgebia tuerkayi sp. nov., Upogebia acutispina De Saint Laurent & Ngoc-Ho, 1979, U. monoceros De Man, 1905, U. plantae Sakai, 1982, und U. variana sp. nov.
20105428|Species of the hermit crab genus Catapaguroides A. Milne-Edwards & Bouvier, 1892, are principally inhabitants of the Indo-Pacific, but with two representatives in the Atlantic, one in the Red Sea, and one species that reportedly is cosmopolitan. All are quite small, and most species have been described on the basis of one or only a few specimens. The majority also have been collected only in depths in excess of 50 meters. In contrast, Catapaguroides foresti n. sp. is described from 22 specimens collected from 8-10 m in Agat Bay, Guam. In general morphology, the new species most closely resembles the cosmopolitan C. microps A. Milne-Edwards & Bouvier, 1892, but is readily distinguished from that species by the armature of the right cheliped. A key to the currently recognized species of the genus is provided. /// Les espces de pagures du genre Catapaguroides A. Milne-Edwards & Bouvier, 1892, sont essentiellement localises dans l'Indopacifique; cependant, deux espces se rencontrent dans l'Atlantique, une en Mer Rouge, et une espce est cosmopolite. Toutes sont de petite taille et la plupart ont t dcrites d'aprs quelques spcimens seulement, voire un seul. Les spcimens ont t rcolts en majorit  des profondeurs excdant 50 m. Par contre, Catapaguroides foresti n. sp. est dcrite d'aprs 22 spcimens rcolts  8-10 m  Agat Bay, Guam. La morphologie gnrale de cette nouvelle espce ressemble  celle de l'espce cosmopolite C. microps A. Milne-Edwards & Bouvier, 1892; elle s'en distingue immdiatement par l'armature de la pince droite. Une cl d'identification des espces du genre est donne.
20103422|The life-cycle of Sphaeroma serratum is studied in a population occurring in Arcachon, by means of samples collected monthly from January 1973 to September 1976. The following categories were distinguished: the sexually undifferentiated larvae, the juvenile and adult males, the females at sexual repose (stage 1), the ovigerous females (stage 2), the females with full brood pouches (stage 3), the females with empty brood pouches (stage 4). The sexual activity of females lasts from December (first advent of stage 2 females) until September (disappearance of stage 3 females; predominance of stage 1 females). Numerous juvenile males are observed from August to March. Puberty moults are very frequent from November to March and a great number of adult males is found during the breeding season. The larvae, present in the samples during the whole year, are more numerous from June to October. At the end of this period, the sex of the young born at the beginning of the summer can be determined. The females produce only one brood per year. It seems that the life span of males and females is about two years. The Arcachon population shows a typical annual variation in the sex-ratio: the males generally remain predominant. Comparison of the results obtained during different years shows that a temperature increase has an accelerating effect on the ovary in vitellogenesis but does not act on the ovary in previtellogenesis, while it influences the duration of embryonic development. In the area of geographical distribution of S. serratum, the region of Arcachon appears like a transitional zone between northern regions with a short breeding period and southern regions in which the rise in temperature leads to a reduction of the winter sexual repose.
20107859|The European brown shrimp, Crangon crangon (L., 1758) has colonized the intertidal zones of Iceland and spread rapidly to many coastal areas. The first confirmed record dates from 2003, and by 2006 the species had colonized the west and south coasts, while not being recorded on the north and east coasts. Densities as high as 6700 animals 100 $\text{m}^{-2}$ were measured. The absence of the brown shrimp from Iceland until recently is interesting in the light of its occurrence in Arctic waters, especially off northern Norway and Russia. It seems most likely that it was brought to Iceland by ballast water. The present records substantially extend the known geographical range of this species. /// La crevette grise europenne Crangon crangon (L., 1758) a colonis les zones intertidales d'Islande et s'est tendue rapidement  de nombreuses zones ctires. Les premires donnes fiables datent de 2003; Depuis 2006, l'espce a colonis les ctes ouest et sud alors qu'elle est encore absente sur les ctes nord et est. Des densits de 6700 animaux 100 $\text{m}^{-2}$ ont t mesures. L'absence de la crevette grise en Irlande jusqu'en des temps rcents est intressante  la lumire de sa prsence dans les eaux arctiques, en particulier au large des ctes nord de la Norvge et de la Russie. Il est probable qu'elle a t apporte en Islande par les eaux de ballast. Les donnes prsentes tendent substantiellement la zone de distribution gographique connue de cette espce.
20103864|La dure de vie et les caractristiques de la reproduction ont t observes chez deux populations d'Artemia franciscana, l'une leve en laboratoire pendant 25 ans (WH), l'autre tant sa contrepartie dans le milieu naturel (SFB). 20106424|The physiological capacities of the chthamaloid cirripede Jehlius cirratus were evaluated under hypoxic and anoxic conditions. J. cirratus is the dominant species in the upper intertidal zone (3-6.5 m above the lowest tidal level) in southern Chile; local tidal amplitudes of 7 m on the average produce cyclic periods of food scarcity and long periods of hypoxia and anoxia, involving survival risk. J. cirratus demonstrated a high capacity for aerial respiration, with no difference between periods of emersion of 1 h and 3 h, but differing at different temperatures: it was higher at 20C than at 10C. Aerial respiration capacity ranged between 74.5% and 89.5% of total respiration in submersion. No significant oxygen debt was observed after maintaining the specimens in emersion for 3 h and 6 h. J. cirratus had a high survival rate in emersion at 16C (
20696242|Efficient sampling of amphipod crustaceans associated with Posidonia oceanica (L.) Delile meadows is difficult, due to their complex community structure and to the heterogeneity of the meadows. Here we compare three sampling techniques: the hand-towed net, the air-lift, and light traps. Each of the methods shows specific advantages and disadvantages, hence the most important feature to consider in the choice of the method would be its adequacy with regard to the study purpose. Moreover, the most accurate way to sample amphipods from P. oceanica meadows could be to combine several methods, keeping in mind their respective strengths and weaknesses, and to adapt the sampling protocol to the aims of the study at issue. Il est difficile d'chantillonner les crustacs amphipodes associs aux herbiers  Posidonia oceanica (L.) Delile de manire efficace, en raison de la structure complexe de leur communaut et l'htrognit des herbiers. Dans le cadre de cet article, nous comparons trois mthodes de prlvement: le filet fauchoir, la suceuse  air comprim et les piges  lumire. Chaque mthode montre des avantages et des inconvnients spcifiques, ce qui implique que l'lment le plus important  prendre en compte dans le choix d'une mthode est l'adquation avec le but de l'tude. De plus, la manire la plus prcise d'chantillonner les amphipodes des herbiers  P. oceanica pourrait tre de combiner plusieurs mthodes, en gardant  l'esprit leurs forces et leurs faiblesses respectives, et d'adapter l'chantillonnage aux buts de l'tude.
20103126|Van Name (1940) described concisely a sphaeromatid isopod from streams on San Nicolas Island, off California, under the name of Sphaeroma insulare (= Gnorimosphaeroma insulare) comparing it to a previously known species, G. oregonense (Dana, 1853). Menzies (1954) differentiated 2 subspecies of G. oregonense, subsequently raised to the rank of species (Hoestlandt, 1968), G. oregonense s. str. and G. luteum. In 1969, Hoestlandt described a new species as G. rayi. A re-examination of the type series of G. insulare compels us, now, to consider G. luteum Menzies, 1954 a junior synonym of G. insulare (Van Name, 1940).

La nouvelle espce est apparente  M. grandimanus (Randall, 1840), M. joppae Holthuis, 1950 et M. therezieni Holthuis, 1965, mais s'en distingue aisment par diffrents caractres du second pripode mle.

20105831|The complete zoeal development of the coral reef actaeine crab, Novactaea bella, is reported. Only two zoeal stages are present. The larvae are compared with those from the closely related N. pulchella; the zoeae of the two species differing in the structure of the tips of the antennal protopod, the proportions of the antennal exopod, the tips of the forks of the telson, as well as the setation of the antennal exopod, basal endite of the maxillule, dorsal surfaces of abdominal somites 2 to 5, and lateral margins of the forks of the telson. /// Le dveloppement complet des stades zo du crabe Acteinae corallien Novactaea bella, est dcrit. Il n'y a que deux stades zo. Les larves sont compares  celles l'espce troitement apparente, N. pulchella, les zos diffrant par la structure des extrmtis du protopodite antennaire, par les proportions de l'exopodite antennaire, les extrmits des fourches du telson, ainsi que par la station de l'exopodite antennaire, de l'endite basal de la maxillule, des surfaces dorsales des somites abdominaux 2  5, et des bords latraux des fourches du telson.
20104739|Cette tude porte sur les diffrences morphologiques et gntiques existant entre les populations d'amphipodes d'eau douce appartenant aux groupes Paramelita auricularius et P. crassicornis. Les seize populations tudies ont t divise en sept formes phnotypiques distinctes, dont une est indubitablement une nouvelle espce n'ayant pas encore t dcrite. Quant aux autres formes phnotypiques, les variations portant sur les isozymes ont t tudies au moyen de gels lectrophortiques. Il en a t dduit que trois des formes phnotypiques du groupe P. auricularius ne sont en fait que des variations morphologiques d'une seule espce. Les trois formes pralablement identifies sous le nom de P. crassicornis sont suffisamment diffrentes pour tre reconnues comme formant deux nouvelles espces. La description de trois nouvelles espces mentionnes plus haut est inclues dans cette tude.
20103786|Four types of sensory hairs have been identified on the antennules of Carcinus maenas: aesthetascs, guard hairs, short and long mechanoreceptors. Furthermore sensory areas are located in small cuticular cavities. The aesthetascs are implanted on most of the antennular segments; they do not display any sexual dimorphism during growth. Each is innervated by a particular ganglion, the axons of which join the antennular nerve. Although cuticular permeability is very striking, no pores could be observed. The aesthetascs seem well adapted for chemoreception; the other hairs for mechanoreception.
20105815|Tadpole shrimp, Triops longicaudatus live at the bottom of small ephemeral pools where the supply of oxygen is extremely variable. When oxygen tensions in the lower water layers are low, shrimp make numerous trips to the surface in order to obtain oxygen to satisfy metabolic demand. These trips to the surface are disruptive to the normal growth and development of the shrimp because they are energetically costly and they require time away from the benthic feeding zone. This study investigated the negative impact of time spent at the surface on growth and the extent to which hemolymph hemoglobin concentration, [Hb], increase the capacity of animals to remain submerged in hypoxic waters. Hemolymph [Hb] were found to be inversely related to the oxygen tension in which animals were raised and positively correlated with the amount of time spent in the benthic feeding zone during hypoxia. Individuals that spent more time in the benthic feeding zone had higher growth rates than those which spent more time at the surface during hypoxia. We conclude that extracellular [Hb] is an important adaptation in T. longicaudatus by facilitating oxygen uptake during hypoxia, allowing animals to spend more time in benthic habitats where they feed thereby increasing growth and possibly reproductive success. /// Le Branchiopode Notostrac, Triops longicaudatus, vit au fond de petites mares temporaires o la teneur en oxygne est trs variable. Quand les tensions en oxygne dans les couches d'eau infrieure est basse, le crustac fait de frquentes incursions vers la surface afin d'obtenir l'oxygne rpondant aux demandes mtaboliques. Ces dplacements vers la surface perturbe sa croissance et son dveloppement normaux, car ils sont nergtiquement coteux et ncessitent du temps pour s'loigner de la zone benthique d'alimentation. Cette tude a recherch l'impact ngatif du temps pass  la surface sur la croissance et le degr auquel la concentration en hmoglobine de l'hmolymphe [Hb] accrot la capacit de l'animal  rester submerg dans les eaux hypoxiques. L'hmolymphe [Hb] a t trouve en relation inverse avec la tension d'oxygne dans laquelle l'animal a t lev et en relation positive avec la quantit de temps passe dans la zone benthique d'alimentation durant l'hypoxie. Les individus qui ont pass le plus de temps dans la zone benthique d'alimentation ont des taux de croissance plus levs que ceux qui ont pass le plus de temps  la surface pendant l'hypoxie. Nous concluons que l'extracellulaire [Hb] reprsente une importante adaption chez T. longicaudatus, en facilitant la prise d'oxygne pendant l'hypoxie, permettant  l'animal de passer plus de temps dans les habitats benthiques o il s'alimente, augmentant de ce fait la croissance et peuttre le succs dans la reproduction.
20107489|The genus Plesionika has a widespread occurrence all over the world and consists mainly of deep-water shrimps. The species of this genus are nektobenthic, feeding on pelagic and benthic resources. Many studies have been made on the Plesionika species of the Mediterranean and European Atlantic region, mainly concerning their biogeography and ecology, but less their biology. In this region, there are eight species of the genus: Plesionika antigai, P. gigliolii, P. heterocarpus, P. martia, P. narval, P. acanthonotus, P. edwardsii, and P. ensis, all of small or no economic importance. /// El genero Plesionika se distribuye por todo el mundo y principalmente ests especies de gambas viven en fondos batiales. Las especies de este gnero son nectobentnicas y principalmente se alimentan de recursos pelgicos y bentnicos. Se han realizado diversos estudios sobre la biogeografa y ecologa de las especies de Plesionika que se distribuyen en el Mediterrneo y en las regiones europeas del ocano Atlntico, aunque en general su biologa es poco conocida. En estas regiones se distribuyen 8 especies de este gnero: Plesionika antigai, P. gigliolii, P. heterocarpus, P. martia, P. narval, P. acanthonotus, P. edwardsii, and P. ensis, todas ellas de escasa, o nula, importancia econmica.
20106133|The abundance and distribution of 21 species of euphausids collected in surface waters (0-200 m) at 69 stations of the Gulf of Mexico and the Yucatan Shelf was analyzed. Zooplankton samples were taken during the JS8601 cruise on board the R/V "Justo Sierra" of the UNAM, in April-May, 1986. During this survey mesoscale hydrographic features such as anticyclonic and cyclonic gyres, and upwelling, were detected in the area. The most abundant species was Stylocheiron carinatum (29.86%), followed by Euphausia tenera (19.97%) and S. suhmi (15.18%). Species richness increased at night: densities were 3.07 times higher then. Apparently, the migratory behaviour, of euphausids buffered the expected effect of the mesoscale features in the local euphausid community. The Bray-Curtis Index revealed three clusters of stations. The first one represented the influence of coastal and shelf waters on the euphausid community. The second group is a mixed oceanic-shelf community, and the third one was related to the Gulf oligotrophic oceanic waters. A fourth group included shallow areas in which no euphausids occurred. The relatively poor anticyclonic eddies did not influence the local euphausid community although low euphausid densities were expected. The relatively richer features, the cyclones, showed higher average densities. Euphausid densities related to the influence of upwelling areas showed density values similar to those recorded in the anticyclones. Two species (S. suhmi and S. carinatum) occurred in all the Gulf of Mexico regardless of the mesoscale environments or the time of day. /// L'abondance et la rpartition de 21 espces d'Euphausiacs rcolts dans les eaux de surface (0-200 m) sur 69 stations du Golfe du Mexique et du plateau du Yucatan ont t analyses. Les chantillons de zooplancton ont t prlevs au cours de la campagne JS8601  bord du R/V "Justo Sierra" de l'UNAM, en avril-mai 1986. Au cours de cette mission, de variations hydrographiques d'amplitude moyenne comme les phnomnes cycloniques et anticycloniques, ainsi que l'upwelling, ont t dtectes dans la rgion. Les espces les plus abondantes taient Stylocheiron carinatum (29,86%) suivie de Euphausia tenera (19,97%) et S. suhmi (15,18%). La richesse spcifique augmentait dans les chantillons nocturnes; les densits taient 3,07 fois plus leves la nuit. Apparemment le comportement migratoire des Euphausiacs compensait l'effet attendu des particularits hydrographiques dans la communaut locale d'Euphausiacs. L'indice de Bray-Curtis a rvl trois groupes de stations. Le premier reprsentait l'influence des eaux ctires et de la plate-forme continentale sur la communaut des Euphausiacs. Le second groupe tait une communaut mixte ocanique-plate-forme et le troisime se rapportait aux eaux ocaniques oligotrophes du Golfe. Un quatrime groupe incluait les zones peu profondes sans Euphausiacs. Les phnomnes anticycloniques relativement faibles n'avaient pas d'influence sur la communaut locale des Euphausiacs, bien que l'on se soit attendu  des densits d'Euphausiacs basses. Les phnomnes relativement plus marqus, les cyclones, ont montr des densits moyennes plus leves. Les densits d'Euphausiacs lies  l'influence des zones d'upwelling ont indiqu des valeurs similaires  celles releves pour les anticyclones. Deux espces (S. suhmi and S. carinatum) sont prsentes dans tout le Golfe du Mexique indpendamment des environnements considrs et du moment de la journe.
20103434|Macrobrachium amazonicum was reared in the laboratory to gather information on the life history of this species. One day old eggs were slightly elliptical (0.6  0.7 mm) and light green; fully matured embryos were 0.63  0.85 mm and dark grey. Incubation was 12-15 days at 301 C and 19-24 days at 242 C. An average of 565238 larvae were produced by females of 76.54.4 mm TL and weighing 3.60.6 g. Larvae went through 8-9 stages in 23-26 days at 240.25 C before metamorphosis to postlarvae. Postlarval growth was rapid with M. amazonicum reaching sexual maturity in 1682 days after hatching. Females which produced eggs the first time averaged 59.41.8 mm (TL), weighed 1.70.1 g, and produced 230102 larvae. The length-weight relationship of M. amazonicum was similar to that reported for other Macrobrachium species.

La population inclt plus de mles que de femelles, ce qui est une exception par rapport aux autres espces d'atyides tudis. La reproduction s'observe tout au long de l'anne, avec un maximum pendant la saison des pluies. Les mles ont d'abord une croissance plus rapide que les femelles. Les tailles maximales atteintes par les mles et les femelles sont respectivement de 23 et 22 mm. Les plus petites femelles ovigres mesurent 15 mm. Les oeufs sont relativement plus grands (1,56  0,009 mm de long et 1,05  008 mm de large, n = 35) et relativement moins nombreux (7-17). Le dveloppement larvaire est abrg.

Das Grabverhalten schliet sowohl aufbauen als auch ausgraben ein. 20107456|A new species, Moina dumonti sp. nov. (Branchiopoda, Anomopoda, Moinidae) is found in southern Mexico and Cuba. This species is closely similar to Moina reticulata, because of (1) body rather laterally compressed; (2) brood pouch in large adults slightly inflated, as a result dorsum of valves only slightly convex; (3) presence of an ocellus; (4) no hairs on head and valves; (5) a single egg in the ephippium; (6) gonopores in male positioned dorso-distally. Differences of M. dumonti sp. nov. with other members of the M. reticulata-group, and some other closely similar species, are listed. Comments are given on the morphology of the limbs in moinids. /// Una nueva especie, Moina dumonti sp. nov. (Branchiopoda, Anomopoda, Moinidae) se encuentra en el sureste de Mxico y Cuba. Esta especie est relacionada con Moina reticulata por las siguientes caractersticas: (1) cuerpo relativamente comprimido lateralmente; (2) la cmara embrionaria de los adultos grandes se encuentra ligeramente inflada, como resultado el dorso de las valvas es ligeramente convexo; (3) la presencia de un ocelo; (4) no presenta pelos en la cabeza y las valvas; (5) tiene un solo huevo en el efipio; (6) los gonoporos se encuentran en posicin dorso-distal en el macho. Se enlistan las diferencias de M. dumonti sp. nov. con respecto a otros miembros del grupo M. reticulata y algunas especies cercanas. Finalmente, se incorporan una serie de comentarios sobre la morfologa de los apndices torcicos de los moinidos.

27743217|The association of Bopyrinella thorii (Richardson, 1904) with Thor floridanus Kingsley, 1878 in seagrass beds of the Mexican Caribbean has been previously reported upon, although without mention of other data relative to the parasitic species'biology. The purpose of this study was to provide information on reproductive aspects of B. thorii from Baha de la Ascensin, Caribbean coast of Mexico. We estimated that B. thorii females initiate reproduction at 1.75 mm total length (TL) and that the size at sexual maturity is 2.1 mm  0.95 TL. The fecundity of B. thorii varied from 83 eggs in smaller females to 1,036 eggs in larger ones. The relationship between the number of eggs and the total length of the females was significant (r = 0.769). This relationship, however, was not progressive, as females of one same size presented a variable number of eggs, particularly in the larger specimens. The size of B. thorii eggs varies from 0.113 to 0.175 mm in the egg to embryo II phases, and the size of the epicaridium larvae varies from 0.176 to 0.213 mm. No differences were observed in the size and developmental phase of the eggs within a single brood. /// La asociacin de Bopyrinella thorii (Richardson, 1904) con Thor floridanus Kingsley, 1878 en praderas de pastos marinos del Caribe mexicano, se ha reportado previamente sin aportar mayor informacin sobre la biologa del parsito involucrado. El presente trabajo tiene como objetivo propocionar informacin sobre aspectos reproductivos de B. thorii en la Baha de la Ascensin, costa del Caribe Mexicano. Se estim que las hembras de B. thorii inician su reproduccin cuando alcanzan 1,75 mm de longitud total (LT) y que la talla de madurez sexual de la especie es de 2,1 mm  0,95 (LT). La fecundidad de B. thorii vari de 83 huevos en las hembras ms pequeas a 1036 huevos en las de mayor tamao. La relacin entre el nmero de huevos y la longitud total de la hembra es significativa (r = 0,769) aunque no progresiva, pues se observ variacin en el nmero de huevos entre hembras de la misma talla, la cual fue ms marcada en las hembras ms grandes. El tamano de los huevos de B. thorii fue de 0,113 a 0,175 mm el las fases huevo a embrin II; y el tamao de las larvas epicaridium vari de 0,176 a 0,213 mm. No se observ variacin en el tamao y fase de desarrollo de los huevos de una misma masa ovgera.
20105433|The structure and ultrastructure of cuticular photophores in the antennal scale and the limbs of Sergia grandis (Sund, 1920) are described. The photophores consist of rows of columnar cells that serve as conductive guides for the light produced by the photogenic cells surrounding their inner ends. These latter cells are filled with highly-organized cytoplasmic material arranged in a three-dimensional lattice which we presume contains the light generating materials. A thin layer of cells containing a reflecting pigment serves as a tapetum. The photophore is well supplied with blood vessels, and there are a large number of haemocytes within the photophore. The columnar and photogenic cells rest on an epithelium. Growth in diameter of the photophore occurs at the periphery, where young columnar cells are short and narrow. In addition, senescent columnar cells are replaced by cells generated from the underlying epithelium. These photophores are compared with regions in the dendrobranchiate shrimp, Gennadas valens (Smith, 1884) which have similarities in their gross appearance and have previously been suggested as putative photophores. /// La structure et l'ultrastructure des photophores cuticulaires de l'caille antennaire et des appendices de Sergia grandis (Sund, 1920) sont dcrites. Les photophores consistent en ranges de cellules columnaires qui servent de guide pour la lumire produite par les cellules photognes entourant leurs extrmit interne. Ces dernires cellules sont remplies de matriel cytoplasmique hautement organis dispos en structure tridimensionelle, qui contient, pensons nous, le matriel producteur de lumire. Une fine couche de cellules contenant un pigment rflchissant sert de tapetum. Le photophore est richement vascularis et contient un grand nombre d'hmocytes. Les cellules columnaires et photognes reposent sur un pithlium. La croissance en diamtre du photophore intervient sur sa priphrie o les jeunes cellules columnaires sont courtes et troites. De plus, les cellules columnaires snescentes sont remplaces par des cellules issues de l'pithlium sous-jacent. Chez la crevette Gennadas valens (Smith, 1884), ces photophores sont compars  des rgions qui prsentent des similitudes et qui auraient tre considres comme des photophores hypothtiques.
23034308|Abnormal swimming and major mortalities of fish were observed by a fish farmer in his pond in which he was rearing common carp (Cyprinus carpio) in Samsun, Turkey. A total of 118 common carps of different size and weight were transferred to the laboratory and examined for ecto- and endoparasites. Thus, a heavy infestation with the fish louse, Argulus foliaceus, was found, with the ectoparasites firmly attached to the skin and fins of all the (118) carps, during this parasitological examination (100% prevalence). Up to 800-1000 lice were counted on a single fish and most of these were detected as microscopic juvenile stages. Major fish mortalities or large numbers of moribund fishes due to this parasite were seen throughout the pond. Furthermore, no endoparasites were found in the carps examined. In the pathological investigation, hyperaemia, especially on the pectoral and pelvic fin bases and in the abdominal area, was macroscopically observed. Une nage anormale et des mortalits importantes chez les poissons ont t observes par un aquaculteur dans son tang dans lequel il levait la carpe commune (Cyprinus carpio)  Samsun, la Turquie. Un total de 118 carpes communes de diffrentes tailles et poids ont t transfres au laboratoire et examines en vue d'y observer d'ventuels ecto- et endoparasites. C'est ainsi qu'au cours de cet examen parasitologique, une forte infestation par Argulus foliaceus a t mise en vidence, les ectoparasites tant fermement fixs sur la peau et les nageoires de toutes les (118) carpes (prvalence de 100%). Jusqu' 800-1000 parasites ont t compts sur un seul poisson et la plupart d'entre eux ont t dtects aux stades juvniles  l'chelle microscopique. Des mortalits considrables de poissons ou bien de grands nombres de poissons moribonds ont t observs dans tout l'tang. En outre, aucun endoparasite n'a t trouv chez les carpes examines. Lors de l'examen pathologique, une hypermie, en particulier  la base des nageoires pectorales et pelviennes a t observe  l'chelle macroscopique.

20106072|Pairs of male and female snow crabs, Chionoecetes opilio, in mating courtship embrace were collected by SCUBA diving between 1984 and 1991, and with tangle nets between 1987 and 1993 in the Bonne Bay fjord, Newfoundland. A Nephrops trawl was also used to study the snow crab population size structure between 1988 and 1993. Males in mating courtship embrace were all identified as hard-shell morphometrically mature. Although large hard-shell juvenile males were present in the population, they did not participate in the reproduction. Comparison of the size structure of males in mating pairs and in the population also show that small mature male crabs can be excluded from mating by larger dominant mature males. The size structure between females in mating pairs and in the population was not significantly different. A depth segregation by size on the very steep slope of the fjord was observed for male snow crabs in mating pairs, as smaller males were found above 50 m. There was no correlation between male and female size in mating couples, but males were always larger than females. We conclude that there is a strong intra-specific competition between males during mating in nature. /// Des crabe des neiges, Chionoecetes opilio, mles et femelles en treinte prnuptiale ont t rcolts en plonge SCUBA entre 1984 et 1991, et avec des filets maillants entre 1987 et 1993 dans le fjord de Bonne Bay, Terre-Neuve. Un chalut  panneaux de type Nephrops a aussi t utilis afin d'tudier la structure de population du crabe des neiges entre 1988 et 1993. Les mles en treinte prnuptiale ont tous t identifis comme tant des mles morphomtriquement matures  carapace dure. Bien que des mles juvniles de grande taille avec carapace dure taient prsents dans la population, ceux-ci n'ont pas particip  la reproduction. La comparaison de la structure de taille des mles en couples et dans la population dmontre aussi que les petits mles morphomtriquement matures peuvent tre exclus de la reproduction par les mles matures de grande taille. Par contre, la structure de taille entre les femelles en treinte prnuptiale et celles de la population n'est pas significativement diffrente. Une sgrgation de profondeur par rapport  la taille a t observe sur la pente abrupte du fjord pour les mles en treinte prnuptiale, puisque les plus petits mles ne se trouvaient qu'essentiellement au-dessus de 50 m. On note aucune corrlation entre la taille des mles et des femelles pour les individus en treinte prnuptiale, mais les mles sont toujours plus grands que les femelles. Nous concluons qu'il y a une forte comptition intra-spcifique entre les mles lors des accouplements en nature.
20105551|Two species of Pilumnus, P. orbitospinis Rathbun, 1911, and P. spinulus Shen, 1932, are newly recorded from Taiwan. Two new species, Pilumnus chani and Typhlocarcinops yui, are also described. Pilumnus chani is similar to P. ikedai Takeda & Miyake, 1968, from Japan, but can easily be distinguished by its frontal margin being lined with rounded granules, blunter anterolateral teeth and relatively longer ambulatory legs. Typhlocarcinops yui is allied to T. canaliculata Rathbun, 1909, from Thailand, but can be separated by the cleft anterolateral margin of its carapace and the distinctive form of its male first pleopod. /// Deux espces de Pilumnus, P. orbitospinis Rathbun, 1911, et P. spinulus Shen, 1932, sont cites comme nouvelles pour Taiwan. Deux nouvelles espces, Pilumnus chani et Typhlocarcinops yui, sont galement dcrites. Pilumnus chani ressemble  P. ikedai Takeda & Miyake, 1968 du Japon, mais peut facilement tre distingue par son bord frontal marqu par une ligne de granules arrondis, des dents antrolatrales plus mousses et des pattes ambulatoires relativement plus longues. Typhlocarcinops yui est apparent  T. canaliculata Rathbun, 1909, de Thalande, mais peut en tre spar par le bord antrolatral incis de la carapace et la forme distinctive de son premier plopode mle.

20104784|En prparation pour l'exploitation du modle de perforation tgumentaire dans une analyse phylogentique du genre Euchirella, le modle de perforation d'Euchirella messinensi, tel que donn par Von Vaupel Klein (1982c), est critiquement valu. Les 392 sites sont montrs sur les illustration et mentionns sur une liste commente. Le concept de paires associes et les mcanismes possibles  l'origine des sites variables sont discuts. La variation intraspcifique semble limite: la plupart des spcimens montrent quelques aberrations par rapport au modle rgulier de perforations, mais seulement en un petit nombre de sites (moyenne: 1,85; maximum: 4). 23034236|This study describes the population structure of the crab Planes cyaneus Dana, 1851 associated with loggerhead sea turtles, Caretta caretta (Linnaeus, 1758), and inanimate flotsam in the southwestern Atlantic Ocean. Samples were collected by scientific observers onboard fishing vessels of the Uruguayan tuna fleet operating between 29-38S and 30-56W, from May 2002 to July 2005. A total of 140 crabs were sampled, with cephalothorax lengths ranging from 5.6 to 22.9 mm. Eighty-eight percent of the crabs found on loggerhead turtles were adult. However, adults represented only 50% of the crabs found on buoys. We detected no relation between the turtles' carapace size and the number of crabs on each turtle. Over 50% of the sampled turtles presented a single crab; the rest presented two to five crabs. Some characteristics observed for P. cyaneus in the southwestern Atlantic Ocean were similar to those found by other authors for its congener, Planes minutus, in the North Atlantic. Results from the present study, also, extend the known geographic distribution of P. cyaneus in the southwestern Atlantic Ocean into offshore waters and suggest that these crabs opportunistically colonize whatever substrates are available in pelagic environments where substrates are scarce. Este estudio describe la estructura poblacional del cangrejo Planes cyaneus Dana, 1851 en asociacin con la tortuga cabezona, Caretta caretta (Linnaeus, 1758), y boyas en el Ocano Atlntico Sur oeste. Las muestras fueron recolectadas por observadores cientficos a bordo de barcos pesqueros de la flota atunera Uruguaya que operaron entre los 29-38S y 30-56W entre Mayo de 2002 y Julio de 2005. Un total de 140 cangrejos fueron muestreados, con un largo de cefalotrax que vari entre 5,6 y 22,9 mm. Ochenta y ocho por ciento de los cangrejos encontrados en las tortugas cabezonas eran adultos. Sin embargo los adultos slo representaron el 50% de los cangrejos encontrados en boyas. No se detect relacin entre el tamao del caparazn de las tortugas y el nmero de cangrejos presentes en las mismas. Ms del 50% de las tortugas muestreadas presentaron un nico cangrejo; el resto present una alta heterogeneidad de grupos de dos a cinco individuos. Algunas caractersticas observadas para P. cyaneus en el Ocano Atlntico Sur oeste fueron similares a las encontradas por otros autores para su congnere, Planes minutus, en el Atlntico Norte. Los resultados del presente estudio, adems, amplan la distribucin geogrfica conocida de P. cyaneus en el Ocano Atlntico Sur oeste hacia aguas ms alejadas de la costa y sugieren que este cangrejo tiene hbitos oportunistas colonizando diferentes sustratos disponibles, particularmente en el ambiente pelgico donde los mismos son escasos.

20102294|Die Art Chydorus pigroides, welche Lilljeborg der Gattung Chydorus zugeordnet hatte, wird hier in die Gattung Pleuroxus eingeordnet, weil die gefiederten Borsten des Unterrandes der Schale und auch die winzigen Brstchen am unteren-hinteren Winkel und an dem hinteren Rand der Schale entlang nur randstndig vorkommen, und das Tier im Querschnitt ziemlich zusammengedrckt aber nicht nach oben verbreitert ist.
